original: yang dag par spong ba la sogs pa sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba la sogs pa sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The special states of generating the mind are the four right efforts and so on.

original: gang gi tshe gul bya'i ngor ji skad bshad pa'i ldog pa tha dad pa las stong pa nyid rnam pa nyi shu sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnams la rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe de yang thun mong ma yin pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gul bya'i ngor ji skad bshad pa'i ldog pa tha dad pa las stong pa nyid rnam pa nyi shu sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnams la rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe de yang thun mong ma yin pa yin pa ste /
translated: When, in the manner explained above, the twenty kinds of emptiness are established in the special states of generating the mind from the different aspects, then that is also uncommon.

original: de ltar ni nang dang phyi dang phyi nang stong pa nyid ni sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams te mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni nang dang phyi dang phyi nang stong pa nyid ni sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams te mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, and the emptiness of the inner and outer begin with the generation of the mind and continue on the stage of action in faith.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni sa de'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par bar chad med pa sbyor ba'i lam la'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni sa de'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par bar chad med pa sbyor ba'i lam la'o //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is in the special state of the uninterrupted path of that stage.

original: chen po stong pa nyid ni kun du 'gro ba'i don gyis sa dang po la'o //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid ni kun du 'gro ba'i don gyis sa dang po la'o //
translated: The emptiness of the great is on the first stage because of its all-pervading meaning.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid mchog gi don gyis gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid mchog gi don gyis gnyis pa la'o //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is on the second stage because of its supreme meaning.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni rgyu mthun pa'i don gyis gsum pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni rgyu mthun pa'i don gyis gsum pa la'o //
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned is in the third, in the sense of being the natural outcome.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i don gyis bzhi pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i don gyis bzhi pa la'o //
translated: The emptiness of the unconditioned is in the fourth, in the sense of being without grasping.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ni rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i don gyis lnga pa la'o //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ni rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i don gyis lnga pa la'o //
translated: The emptiness of what transcends limits is in the fifth, in the sense of there being no difference in cause.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa'i don gyis drug pa la'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa'i don gyis drug pa la'o //
translated: The emptiness of what is beginningless and endless is in the sixth, in the sense of there being no defilement and purification.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i don gyis bdun pa la'o //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i don gyis bdun pa la'o //
translated: The emptiness of what is not to be discarded is in the seventh, in the sense of there being no variety.

original: yongs su dag pa la dbang ba nyid gnyis kyi rten nyid kyis ni 'bras bu'i sa nyid kyi phyir so sor rtog pa dang yongs su sbyong ba'i dbye bas brgyad pa la'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa la dbang ba nyid gnyis kyi rten nyid kyis ni 'bras bu'i sa nyid kyi phyir so sor rtog pa dang yongs su sbyong ba'i dbye bas brgyad pa la'o //
translated: The eighth stage is due to the differentiation of discernment and purification, because it is the stage of result.

original: mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dag ni ye shes la dbang ba'i rten nyid kyis de bzhin kho nar dgu pa la'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dag ni ye shes la dbang ba'i rten nyid kyis de bzhin kho nar dgu pa la'o //
translated: The ninth stage is due to the reality of the emptiness of characteristics and the emptiness of nonapprehension, because it is the reality of mastery of intuition.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang dngos po stong pa nyid dag las la dbang ba'i rten nyid kyis de bzhin kho nar bcug pa la ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang dngos po stong pa nyid dag las la dbang ba'i rten nyid kyis de bzhin kho nar bcug pa la ste /
translated: The tenth stage is due to the reality of the emptiness of nonthings and the emptiness of things, because it is the reality of mastery of action.

original: bcu bzhi pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bdun gyi rang gi ngo bo la'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bdun gyi rang gi ngo bo la'o //
translated: The seventh stage is due to the reality of the emptiness of all things, because it is the reality of the mastery of the bodhisattvas.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang pha rol gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid ni go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spong ba'i rten nyid kyis dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang pha rol gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid ni go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spong ba'i rten nyid kyis dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang
translated: The emptiness of the nonexistence of things is the emptiness of its own entity and the emptiness of the entity of others.🔽

original: bcas pa spong ba'i rten nyid kyis dang rang byung nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi sa la ste sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin nyid la'o //
analyzed: bcas pa spong ba'i rten nyid kyis dang rang byung nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi sa la ste sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin nyid la'o //
translated: The emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities and the emptiness of the essential nature of others are, respectively, the nature of the two arousals of the mind of enlightenment on the Buddha stage, i.e., the stage of a buddha, because they are the basis for the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions together with their instincts and the basis for the abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience together with their instincts, and because they are self-originated.

original: de la sems bskyed pa dang po ni phyi ma rnams kyi rgyu kho na'o //
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa dang po ni phyi ma rnams kyi rgyu kho na'o //
translated: The first arousal of the mind of enlightenment is the cause of the subsequent ones.

original: tha ma gnyis ni snga ma rnams kyi 'bras bu kho na'o //
analyzed: tha ma gnyis ni snga ma rnams kyi 'bras bu kho na'o //
translated: The last two are the results of the former ones.

original: gnyis pa ni phyi ma rnams kyi rgyu dang snga ma'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phyi ma rnams kyi rgyu dang snga ma'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The second is the cause of the subsequent ones and the result of the former ones.

original: de bzhin du bsam pa la sogs pa bcu dgu ni phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam pa la sogs pa bcu dgu ni phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
translated: Similarly, the nineteen beginning with intention are the entities of mutual cause and effect.

original: 'dun pa'i snga rol gyi sems srid pa thog ma med pa nas byung ba na nye bar len pa dang nye bar blang bya nyid kyis rgyun du yang gyur pa rnams ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no zhes pa mu
analyzed: 'dun pa'i snga rol gyi sems srid pa thog ma med pa nas byung ba na nye bar len pa dang nye bar blang bya nyid kyis rgyun du yang gyur pa rnams ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no zhes pa mu
translated: The mind prior to intention, which has arisen since beginningless time, is not the entity of cause and effect in this way, since it is both appropriated and that which is appropriated.🔽This is the fourfold🔽consequence.🔽Therefore, even in the stage of potential, the bodhisattvas, out of🔽compassion for those beings, accumulate all the collections of merit and

original: bzhi'o // de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams rigs kyi gnas skabs na yang de rnams la thugs brtse bas de'i don du ched du bya ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i bdag nyid kho na'i tshogs thams cad sogs par byed pa la
analyzed: bzhi'o // de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams rigs kyi gnas skabs na yang de rnams la thugs brtse bas de'i don du ched du bya ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i bdag nyid kho na'i tshogs thams cad sogs par byed pa la
translated: knowledge for the sake of those beings, in order to generate the mind of🔽enlightenment, which is characterized by the object of the aspiration.

original: 'jug go // rigs 'di ni ci /🔽dmigs pa ni ci /
analyzed: 'jug go // rigs 'di ni ci / dmigs pa ni ci /
translated: What is this potential?🔽What is its object?

original: ched du bya ba ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: ched du bya ba ni ci zhe na /
translated: What is its aspiration?

original: brjod par bya ste chos kyi dbyings chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can kho na 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs dang gzhi dang ston pa dang rgyu dang rten dang nye bar gnas pa dang sngon
analyzed: brjod par bya ste chos kyi dbyings chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can kho na 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs dang gzhi dang ston pa dang rgyu dang rten dang nye bar gnas pa dang sngon
translated: It is to be stated: The dharmadhatu, which has the characteristic of the intrinsic realitylessness of all things, is the cause of the Dharma of the noble ones.

original: du 'gro ba dang gnas dang sa bon dang khams dang rang bzhin zhes pa'i rnam grangs kyis brjod do //
analyzed: du 'gro ba dang gnas dang sa bon dang khams dang rang bzhin zhes pa'i rnam grangs kyis brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is described by the synonyms “naturally existing lineage,” “basis,” “teacher,” “cause,” “support,” “abiding near,” “preceding,” “place,” “seed,” “element,” and “nature.”

original: de ltar ni gang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa glo bur gyi dri ma rnams kyis mi snang bar byas pa'i rigs de nyid phyis dri ma ma lus pa dang @170a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni gang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa glo bur gyi dri ma rnams kyis mi snang bar byas pa'i rigs de nyid phyis dri ma ma lus pa dang @170a * //
translated: In this way, the lineage, which is naturally pure but is obscured by adventitious defilements so that it does not appear, later becomes clear when it is free from all defilements.

original: bral ba las gsal bar gyur pa nyid de ni rdo rnams la lcags dang zangs dang dngul dang gser gyi rigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bral ba las gsal bar gyur pa nyid de ni rdo rnams la lcags dang zangs dang dngul dang gser gyi rigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is like the fact that the lineages of iron, copper, silver, and gold exist in ore.

original: chos nyid bdag nyid kyi rigs 'di kho na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes par gsungs so //
analyzed: chos nyid bdag nyid kyi rigs 'di kho na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes par gsungs so //
translated: This very lineage, whose nature is reality, is said to be the essence of the Tathagata.

original: rang bzhin gyi rigs de yod pa nyid na yang srog chags rnams ma rig pa la sogs pa'i glo bur gyi dri mas g-yogs par gyur pa ji srid par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rigs de yod pa nyid na yang srog chags rnams ma rig pa la sogs pa'i glo bur gyi dri mas g-yogs par gyur pa ji srid par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin no //
translated: Even though the natural lineage exists, as long as living beings are covered by the adventitious defilements of nescience, etc., they are not perfect buddhas.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba las ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings gsal bar gyur pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'grub po //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba las ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings gsal bar gyur pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'grub po //
translated: From the complete freedom from all the defilements of conceptualization, there is the perfect establishment of enlightenment, the clear manifestation of the extremely pure dharmadhatu.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par du 'phags pa ni rigs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par du 'phags pa ni rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is the lineage that is superior.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po rnams dang de'i khyad par 'dun pa nas brtsams pa'i go cha'i sgrub pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po rnams dang de'i khyad par 'dun pa nas brtsams pa'i go cha'i sgrub pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gzhi'o //
translated: It is the basis of the twenty-two types of generation of the Thought, which are the reasons for applying the term bodhisattva, and of the armor practice, etc., which are its special aspirations.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
analyzed: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
translated: the disciples' uniqueness,🔽the sequence of others' goals,🔽and the effortless engagement of wisdom

original: 'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes bya //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes bya //
translated: are the basis for engaging the lineage.

original: zhes pa tshig le'ur byas pa dag gis dang stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i gzhung rnam par bshad pa 'phags pa rnam grol sde'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa tshig le'ur byas pa dag gis dang stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i gzhung rnam par bshad pa 'phags pa rnam grol sde'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: These verses and the explanation of the text of the Twenty-five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom Sutra by the noble Vimuktisena state:

original: gang gi phyir sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa bzhi rnams la dang / mthong ba'i lam la dang bsgom pa'i lam la de dang der byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod pa bcom ldan 'das brjod par bgyi ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa bzhi rnams la dang / mthong ba'i lam la dang bsgom pa'i lam la de dang der byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod pa bcom ldan 'das brjod par bgyi ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because from the generation of the mind of awakening up to the four aspects of the factors conducive to penetrative insight, on the path of seeing, and on the path of meditation, the bodhisattva is to be called a bodhisattva at that and that stage, the Blessed One is to be called the Blessed One.

original: gnyen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The antidote is the perfection of wisdom.

original: spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyi ste /
translated: Abandonment is of the resistant tendencies.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the pure realm of reality is

original: gnyen po dang spong ba dag yongs su gtugs pa ni mthar thug par 'gro ba ste gnyen po mchog tu byung ba'i mthar thug pa kho na dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad pa'i mthar thug pa'o ;
analyzed: gnyen po dang spong ba dag yongs su gtugs pa ni mthar thug par 'gro ba ste gnyen po mchog tu byung ba'i mthar thug pa kho na dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad pa'i mthar thug pa'o ;
translated: The culmination of the antidote and abandonment is the ultimate, for the antidote reaches its culmination in its perfection and the resistant tendencies reach their culmination in their extinction.

original: / seng ge bzang pos yongs su gtugs pa ni de dag skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: / seng ge bzang pos yongs su gtugs pa ni de dag skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'o zhes so //
translated: Haribhadra says that the culmination is the abandonment of the concepts of their origination and cessation.

original: 'o na 'di ni rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'ongs pa chos nyid kyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na 'di ni rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'ongs pa chos nyid kyis thob pa'o //
translated: The naturally existing gene is obtained through reality itself from time without beginning.

original: 'di ni yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba goms pas @170b thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba goms pas @170b thob pa'o //
translated: The adopted gene is obtained through the cultivation of former roots of virtue.

original: 'di ni dus re zhig nges pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni dus re zhig nges pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
translated: This is the temporary definite lineage of the sravaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: 'di ni rtag tu nges pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rtag tu nges pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
translated: This is the permanent definite lineage of the tathiigata.

original: 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ma nges pa ste rkyen gyis 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro zhes rigs tha dad mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ma nges pa ste rkyen gyis 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro zhes rigs tha dad mi rigs te /
translated: This is the lineage of the sravaka, pratyekabuddha and tathagata that is indefinite because it is carried away by conditions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord also said:

original: 'jam dpal gal te chos kyi dbyings gcig dang de bzhin nyid gcig dang yang dag pa'i mtha' gcig po de ji ltar snod dang snod ma yin par gdags zhes so zhe na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gal te chos kyi dbyings gcig dang de bzhin nyid gcig dang yang dag pa'i mtha' gcig po de ji ltar snod dang snod ma yin par gdags zhes so zhe na /
translated: Manjusri, if the single dharmadhatu, the single suchness and the single reality limit are imputed as vessels and nonvessels, how is that?

original: de lta bu 'di ni bden te de lta na yang brten pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams tha dad pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad du tha snyad du bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu 'di ni bden te de lta na yang brten pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams tha dad pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad du tha snyad du bya ste /
translated: This is true, but even so, the conventional designations of the lineages of sravakas and so on are differentiated because the supported phenomena of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and perfect buddhas are differentiated.

original: dper na nam mkha' la tha dad pa med kyang /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la tha dad pa med kyang /
translated: For example, in the sky there is no difference.

original: lam tha dad pa la chag pa'i lam dang bya'i lam dang nyi ma'i lam zhes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: lam tha dad pa la chag pa'i lam dang bya'i lam dang nyi ma'i lam zhes pa bzhin te /
translated: But there are different paths, such as the path of birds, the path of the sun, and the path of the wind.

original: gang gi phyir gang nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub rtogs pa sngon ma can byang chub chen po rtogs pa de rnams re zhig pa'i dus can du bstan pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can du bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub rtogs pa sngon ma can byang chub chen po rtogs pa de rnams re zhig pa'i dus can du bstan pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can du bstan to //
translated: Because those who previously realized the enlightenment of śrāvakas and so on realize the great enlightenment, they are taught to be of the śrāvaka type and so on.🔽Those who realize the grounds such as Perfect Joy from the beginning and gradually attain unsurpassed enlightenment are called those of the Mahāyāna type.

original: dang po nas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rtogs nas rim gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub bsten pa rnams ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can no zhes tha snyad las rigs tha dad pa mi 'gal la de kho na nyid du ni ma yin
analyzed: dang po nas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rtogs nas rim gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub bsten pa rnams ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can no zhes tha snyad las rigs tha dad pa mi 'gal la de kho na nyid du ni ma yin
translated: There is no contradiction in positing different types from the conventional perspective, but not from the perspective of suchness.

original: no // ji skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: no // ji skad gsungs pa /
translated: As it has been said:

original: gang du 'du byed cung zad kyang med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa ste de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs su mtshungs la rigs de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: gang du 'du byed cung zad kyang med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa ste de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs su mtshungs la rigs de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'o //
translated: Where there is not even the slightest conditioned thing, that is the unconditioned, which is the same for all noble beings. That family is without distinction, since it is the same as space.

original: rigs de ni chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid kyis rtag pa ste /
analyzed: rigs de ni chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid kyis rtag pa ste /
translated: That family is permanent, since all phenomena are of one taste in it.

original: rigs de ni thams cad kyi tshe chos nyid yin pas shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs de ni thams cad kyi tshe chos nyid yin pas shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That family is knowledge, etc., since it is the reality of all times.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni 'di las yon tan rnams gong du sgrol bar byed kun nas skye bar byed pas rigs so //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni 'di las yon tan rnams gong du sgrol bar byed kun nas skye bar byed pas rigs so //
translated: The etymology: since the qualities are liberated and generated from it, it is the family.

original: yang na 'gro bas na sems can rnams ni go'o //
analyzed: yang na 'gro bas na sems can rnams ni go'o //
translated: Or, since beings go, they are gone.

original: de rnams skyob pas rigs so //
analyzed: de rnams skyob pas rigs so //
translated: Since it protects them, it is the family.

original: yang na 'dir ga mi ni gnas pa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dir ga mi ni gnas pa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Or, here, gati means to abide.

original: dper na nam mkha' thams cad du song ba'o zhes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' thams cad du song ba'o zhes pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, “space pervades all” is used.

original: 'gro'o gnas so zhes pa go ste /
analyzed: 'gro'o gnas so zhes pa go ste /
translated: “It goes, it abides” is understood.

original: rten pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rten pa'i chos so //
translated: It is the supported phenomenon.

original: de skyob par byed mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir rigs zhes pa ste rten no //
analyzed: de skyob par byed mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir rigs zhes pa ste rten no //
translated: The lineage is the support, because it is the support for the generation of the spirit of enlightenment, since it holds the spirit through its unchangeableness.

original: 'o na rang bzhin med pa'i chos kyi dbyings ci ltar sems bskyed rnams kyi rten yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin med pa'i chos kyi dbyings ci ltar sems bskyed rnams kyi rten yin zhe na /
translated: But how can the ultimate realm, which is essenceless, be the support for the generations of the spirit?

original: dper na rang bzhin med pa'i nam mkha' zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od rnams kyi dang mun pa sel ba'i bzhin no //🔽dmigs pa ni spang bar bya ba nyid dang blang bar @171a * //
analyzed: dper na rang bzhin med pa'i nam mkha' zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od rnams kyi dang mun pa sel ba'i bzhin no // dmigs pa ni spang bar bya ba nyid dang blang bar @171a * //
translated: It is like the essenceless sky, which is the support for the light of the sun and moon and for the removal of darkness.

original: bya ba nyid dag gis dmigs par bya ba'o zhes pas sgrub pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: bya ba nyid dag gis dmigs par bya ba'o zhes pas sgrub pa'i yul lo //
translated: The objective is that which is to be taken up and that which is to be avoided, as objects of observation.

original: ci zhe na chos rnams thams cad do //
analyzed: ci zhe na chos rnams thams cad do //
translated: What is it? It is all phenomena.

original: de la mi dge ba srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa lus kyi las la sogs pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa lus kyi las la sogs pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, the nonvirtuous, such as killing, and the ethically neutral, such as physical actions, are to be avoided.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams ni blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams ni blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The virtuous, mundane and supramundane, such as generosity, are to be taken up.

original: de ltar byas na rang bzhin gtso bo yin la rnam 'gyur gtso bo dmigs pa ste gnyi gar yang gnyi ga ma bgag go zhes pas rten dang dmigs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba dang dmigs pa dag par 'gro ba yang 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na rang bzhin gtso bo yin la rnam 'gyur gtso bo dmigs pa ste gnyi gar yang gnyi ga ma bgag go zhes pas rten dang dmigs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba dang dmigs pa dag par 'gro ba yang 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the nature is the primary, and the modifications are the object of observation. Both are not negated in both ways. Thus, the division of the characteristics of the basis and the object of observation and the going of the object of observation to purity are tenable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad chags pa nyid dang yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad chags pa nyid dang yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattvas should train in the nonattachment and nonexistence of all phenomena.

original: zhes so // rang bzhin dang 'brel pa'i rnam 'gyur dmigs pa ste rnam 'gyur tsam ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes so // rang bzhin dang 'brel pa'i rnam 'gyur dmigs pa ste rnam 'gyur tsam ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the modifications that are related to the nature are the object of observation, but mere modifications are not.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gtso bo dgos pa dmigs par dgongs nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gtso bo dgos pa dmigs par dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore, intending that the nature is the primary, the purpose, and the object of observation,

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Subhūti, the object of observation of the knowledge of all aspects is nonentity.”

original: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
analyzed: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
translated: Its object of observation is nonentity.

original: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
analyzed: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
translated: The master is mindfulness.

original: rnam pa bzhi nyid ces kyang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi nyid ces kyang ngo //
translated: The four aspects are also so.

original: 'dir dngos po med pa ni chos thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po med pa ni chos thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Here, the non-existence of things is the non-existence of the intrinsic reality of all things.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni dran pa ste de 'di'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni dran pa ste de 'di'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dominant condition is mindfulness, because it is the basis of this.

original: zhi ba nyid ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba ste dngos po la 'gag pa'i zhi ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba nyid ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba ste dngos po la 'gag pa'i zhi ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Peace is natural peace, not the peace of cessation in things.

original: ci ltar rang bzhin dgos pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar rang bzhin dgos pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the intrinsic reality a purpose?

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid gsal por 'gyur ba bsten pa sgom pa'i don du nye bar sbyor bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid gsal por 'gyur ba bsten pa sgom pa'i don du nye bar sbyor bas so //
translated: Because the non-existence of the intrinsic reality of the reality of all things is clearly seen, it is applied for the purpose of cultivating that reliance.🔽But if there is no intrinsic reality, it is not perceived.

original: 'o na rang bzhin med pa zhes pa ni dngos po cung zad med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin med pa zhes pa ni dngos po cung zad med pa yin la /
translated: It is true that the so-called non-existence of intrinsic reality is the non-existence of any thing.

original: dngos po med pa nyid na'ang dmigs su med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid na'ang dmigs su med pa'o zhe na /
translated: But even in the absence of things, it is not perceived.

original: bden te dngos po med pa zhes pa ni dngos por dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bden te dngos po med pa zhes pa ni dngos por dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is intended that the so-called non-existence of things is not perceived as a thing.

original: dngos po med pa ni gnyis med dgag go //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni gnyis med dgag go //
translated: The non-existence of an entity is a non-affirming negative.

original: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po'o //
translated: Subhūti, the two are entities.

original: gnyis med pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis med pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-two is a non-entity.

original: de dbu mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dbu mar gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the Madhyamaka.🔽Those who see a self-entity and an other-entity,

original: gang rnams rang dngos gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //🔽de rnams sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: gang rnams rang dngos gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba // de rnams sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: An entity and a non-entity,🔽They do not see

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba min //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba min //
translated: The Buddha’s teaching.🔽And,

original: zhes pa dang / dngos dang dngos med mchog 'dzin pa //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / dngos dang dngos med mchog 'dzin pa //
translated: The grasping of the highest entity and non-entity

original: zad pa mya ngan 'das par brjod //
analyzed: zad pa mya ngan 'das par brjod //
translated: Is said to be the extinction of nirvana.

original: ces so // don dam par ni dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa dang @171b dmigs pa'i spros pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: ces so // don dam par ni dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa dang @171b dmigs pa'i spros pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: In the ultimate, there is no proliferation of the object of observation, the observer, or the observation.🔽For that very reason, the profound path of complete enlightenment is only the non-observation that has the nature of wisdom and method.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa med pa kho na rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam zab mor sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa med pa kho na rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam zab mor sngar brjod zin to //
translated: This was stated previously.

original: 'phags pa byams pas kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The noble Maitreya also says,

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
translated: The path of meditation is profound.

original: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
analyzed: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
translated: The profound is emptiness and so forth.

original: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang ; / skur ba'i mtha' las grol ba nyid //
analyzed: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang ; / skur ba'i mtha' las grol ba nyid //
translated: That profundity is the freedom from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: ces so // 'phags pa zhi ba lhas kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces so // 'phags pa zhi ba lhas kyang gsungs pa /
translated: Āryasanti also says:

original: stong nyid bag chags goms pa las //
analyzed: stong nyid bag chags goms pa las //
translated: Through familiarization with the imprints of emptiness,

original: dngos po'i bag chags spong bar byed //
analyzed: dngos po'i bag chags spong bar byed //
translated: you abandon the imprints of entities.

original: ci yang med ces goms pa las //
analyzed: ci yang med ces goms pa las //
translated: Through familiarization with “nothing at all,”

original: de yang phyi nas spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang phyi nas spong bar 'gyur //
translated: even that is later abandoned.

original: gang tshe dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: gang tshe dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: When entities and nonentities

original: blo yi mdun na mi gnas pa ;
analyzed: blo yi mdun na mi gnas pa ;
translated: do not remain before the mind,

original: / de tshe rnam pa gzhan med pas //
analyzed: / de tshe rnam pa gzhan med pas //
translated: since there is no other form,

original: dmigs pa med pa rab tu zhi //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa rab tu zhi //
translated: the absence of appearances is peace.

original: zhes so // 'phags pa rnam grol sdes kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ci dmigs she na /
analyzed: zhes so // 'phags pa rnam grol sdes kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ci dmigs she na /
translated: Āryavimuktisena also says: What is the object of nonconceptual wisdom?

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du'o //
translated: It is the emptiness that is the nature of all phenomena.

original: 'o na dmigs par bya ba stong pa nyid 'di ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: 'o na dmigs par bya ba stong pa nyid 'di ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: Well, since this emptiness that is the object of observation does not exist, like the son of a barren woman,

original: chos thams cad yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: all phenomena would become nonexistent.

original: ma yin te gang gi phyir gsod pa po bsad na lhas byin slar 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: ma yin te gang gi phyir gsod pa po bsad na lhas byin slar 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes so //
translated: No, because if the killer is killed, then Devadatta would not return.

original: de ltar na ci ltar dmigs par brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar na ci ltar dmigs par brjod ce na /
translated: Thus, how can it be said to be an object?

original: kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: It is said to be an object conventionally.

original: de ltar na stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i tshogs rnams stong pa kho na ste gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i khyad par /
analyzed: de ltar na stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i tshogs rnams stong pa kho na ste gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i khyad par /
translated: Thus, emptiness is the mere emptiness of the collection of things, nothing else.

original: khyad par gzhan gsal bas brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan gsal bas brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: It is a special object that is expressed by the exclusion of other.

original: de bzhin du yang stong pa nyid sgom pa zhes pa yang dngos po'i tshogs stong par sgom pa zhes pa kho na'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang stong pa nyid sgom pa zhes pa yang dngos po'i tshogs stong par sgom pa zhes pa kho na'i don to //
translated: Similarly, the meditation on emptiness is the meditation on the emptiness of the collection of things.

original: 'o na de ltar na bsgom par bya ba'i chos thams cad dmigs par 'gyur la dngos po med pa'i dmigs pa'o zhes pa de nyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na bsgom par bya ba'i chos thams cad dmigs par 'gyur la dngos po med pa'i dmigs pa'o zhes pa de nyes pa'o //
translated: If that is so, then all phenomena that are to be meditated on would be objects, and that would contradict the statement that the object is not a thing.

original: ci ste chos nyid dang tha dad pa med kyang tha dad pa bzhin re zhig snang ba de lta na yang lhag par zhen pa las chos su gyur pa kho na bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni nyes pa de las mi grol te ma 'brel par gnas pa
analyzed: ci ste chos nyid dang tha dad pa med kyang tha dad pa bzhin re zhig snang ba de lta na yang lhag par zhen pa las chos su gyur pa kho na bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni nyes pa de las mi grol te ma 'brel par gnas pa
translated: But if you say that although it is not different from reality, it appears as if it were different, and that even so, you should meditate only on reality, not on the object, because of excessive attachment, then you are not free from the fault, because

original: nyid kyis sgom par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid kyis sgom par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: you cannot meditate on reality alone, since it is not related to the object.

original: de ltar yang dngos po skyes pa 'di rang bzhin med pa'o zhes pa'i rnam pa 'di kho na sgom pa las de ci ltar chos kyi de kho na nyid sgom pa'i phyogs la chos kyi 'dus te reg pa yongs su spong /
analyzed: de ltar yang dngos po skyes pa 'di rang bzhin med pa'o zhes pa'i rnam pa 'di kho na sgom pa las de ci ltar chos kyi de kho na nyid sgom pa'i phyogs la chos kyi 'dus te reg pa yongs su spong /
translated: In that case, you meditate only on the aspect “This arisen thing is essenceless,” and how is that on the side of meditating on the reality of things? You completely abandon the contact of the object with the mind.

original: yongs su spong na yang chos gzhan sgom pa kho nar 'gyur gyi chos nyid sgom pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su spong na yang chos gzhan sgom pa kho nar 'gyur gyi chos nyid sgom pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you completely abandon it, then you meditate on something other than reality.

original: bden te gal te yang chos kyi de kho na nyid bsgoms pas kyang chos spyir 'phangs pa de lta de lta na yang de kho na nyid tsam la ched du @172a * //
analyzed: bden te gal te yang chos kyi de kho na nyid bsgoms pas kyang chos spyir 'phangs pa de lta de lta na yang de kho na nyid tsam la ched du @172a * //
translated: It is true that if you meditate on the reality of things, you also meditate on the object in general, but even so, you should not meditate on the object, since you meditate on reality alone.

original: gtad nas gnas te de kho na nyid sgom pa kho na gsal bar gyur pas 'khor ba'i ngan 'gro 'byin pas so //
analyzed: gtad nas gnas te de kho na nyid sgom pa kho na gsal bar gyur pas 'khor ba'i ngan 'gro 'byin pas so //
translated: Since only the meditation on reality is clear when one focuses on it, it eliminates the lower realms of cyclic existence.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod ldan ma lus mchog tu bsgoms pas mngon du byas na 'dod chags zum par 'gyur ba'am dgra bo'i lus kyis zhe sdang 'dzums pa'am gnyis kar sems pa med pas gti mug 'bri ba med de 'on kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid kho nar ro
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod ldan ma lus mchog tu bsgoms pas mngon du byas na 'dod chags zum par 'gyur ba'am dgra bo'i lus kyis zhe sdang 'dzums pa'am gnyis kar sems pa med pas gti mug 'bri ba med de 'on kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid kho nar ro
translated: Because when one realizes the supreme meditation on the body of a lover, desire is extinguished, or when one realizes the body of an enemy, hatred is extinguished, or when one realizes the body of a neutral person, ignorance is extinguished. But they are extinguished only by the absence of intrinsic existence.

original: // de nyid kyi phyir de kho na la ched du gtad pas de kho na gsal ba nyid sman du 'gyur gyi chos rnams bsgoms pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: // de nyid kyi phyir de kho na la ched du gtad pas de kho na gsal ba nyid sman du 'gyur gyi chos rnams bsgoms pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only the meditation on reality is the medicine, not the meditation on phenomena.

original: 'o na de la ched du gtad na 'ang chos nyid kho na gsal bar 'gyur gyi chos ma yin zhes pa'i 'thad pa ci ste /
analyzed: 'o na de la ched du gtad na 'ang chos nyid kho na gsal bar 'gyur gyi chos ma yin zhes pa'i 'thad pa ci ste /
translated: But if one focuses on reality, why is it that only reality is clear and not phenomena?

original: bsgoms pas gnyis ka yang dbang du byed pa'i phyir te chos la ma reg par chos nyid tsam gsal bar 'gyur ba ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pas gnyis ka yang dbang du byed pa'i phyir te chos la ma reg par chos nyid tsam gsal bar 'gyur ba ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the clarity of just the reality of the object without contacting the object?

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: chos gsal bar 'gyur ba la ma reg par yang chos nyid tsam gsal bar 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos gsal bar 'gyur ba la ma reg par yang chos nyid tsam gsal bar 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is seen that just the reality of the object becomes clear without contacting the clarity of the object.

original: chos nye ba la ma ltos par gsal ba dang gsal byed ces mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: chos nye ba la ma ltos par gsal ba dang gsal byed ces mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is not that clarity and the clear object do not exist without depending on the object.

original: gsal bar gyur kyang de de'i yul 'dus pa na rtsol ba la ma ltos par yud tsam gyis de'i shes pa la de'i rnam pa gsal du zin kyang chos nye ba la ltos pa ni ma nyams te /
analyzed: gsal bar gyur kyang de de'i yul 'dus pa na rtsol ba la ma ltos par yud tsam gyis de'i shes pa la de'i rnam pa gsal du zin kyang chos nye ba la ltos pa ni ma nyams te /
translated: Even though the object becomes clear, when it is combined with the object, the aspect of that object is clearly manifest in the consciousness of that object in an instant without depending on exertion.

original: chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo kho na'i phyir dga' ba nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo kho na'i phyir dga' ba nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: However, the dependence on the object is not impaired because it is the intrinsic reality of reality itself, like pleasure and so on.

original: de ltar nim pa'i ro la sogs pa la dga' ba nyid du goms pa ni gsal bar gyur pa mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar nim pa'i ro la sogs pa la dga' ba nyid du goms pa ni gsal bar gyur pa mthong ste /
translated: Thus it is seen that the cultivation of pleasure and so on with regard to the taste of neem and so on becomes clear.

original: nim pa la sogs pa'i chos can gyi de chos so zhes de bsgoms pas /
analyzed: nim pa la sogs pa'i chos can gyi de chos so zhes de bsgoms pas /
translated: The object of the subject, nimba, etc., is its property.

original: nim pa la sogs pa rang skye ba'i yul na gnas pa'am lce'i rtse mor son pa la yang ji srid phyin ci log tu sgom pa la mngon par sbyor ba phul byung med pa'i bar du gsal zhing gsal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nim pa la sogs pa rang skye ba'i yul na gnas pa'am lce'i rtse mor son pa la yang ji srid phyin ci log tu sgom pa la mngon par sbyor ba phul byung med pa'i bar du gsal zhing gsal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: As long as one does not apply oneself to the cultivation of the nonerroneous, there is no clear and clear appearance of nimba, etc., whether it is in the place of its origin or has reached the tip of the tongue.

original: gsal bar gyur pa'i dga' ba nyid kyang nim pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba la ma ltos par 'brel med du gnas pa na mi dmigs kyi /
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa'i dga' ba nyid kyang nim pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba la ma ltos par 'brel med du gnas pa na mi dmigs kyi /
translated: The appearance of the taste of nimba, etc., does not occur without depending on the experience of nimba, etc.

original: 'on kyang gang dang gang gi tshe nim pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba de'i tshe yud kyis dga' ba nyid nyams su myong ba'i yul sngar bzhin du yid 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang dang gang gi tshe nim pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba de'i tshe yud kyis dga' ba nyid nyams su myong ba'i yul sngar bzhin du yid 'byung ba'am /
translated: But when one experiences nimba, etc., the appearance of the taste of nimba, etc., arises in the mind as before.

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa med na'o zhes pa 'di kho na chos nyid gsal bar 'gyur pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa med na'o zhes pa 'di kho na chos nyid gsal bar 'gyur pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, It is not the case that there is no appearance of the taste of nimba, etc., when one does not experience nimba, etc., but it is not the case that there is appearance when one does experience it.

original: ji ltar bzang mo la sogs pa'i chos gsal bar gyur na yang de'i chos nyid gsal bar 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du gnyis ka phan tshun mi 'khrul na yang de kho na nyid bsgoms pas kyang chos gsal bar 'gyur ba med do zhes pas skyon ci
analyzed: ji ltar bzang mo la sogs pa'i chos gsal bar gyur na yang de'i chos nyid gsal bar 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du gnyis ka phan tshun mi 'khrul na yang de kho na nyid bsgoms pas kyang chos gsal bar 'gyur ba med do zhes pas skyon ci
translated: Just as when a good woman and so on is made clear, her reality is not made clear, in the same way, even though the two are not confused with each other, by meditating on reality, the phenomena are not made clear.

original: 'dra zhig yod /
analyzed: 'dra zhig yod /
translated: What is the fault?

original: ji ltar yang dga' @172b ba nyid ces pa ni bde bar byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dga' @172b ba nyid ces pa ni bde bar byed pa nyid de /
translated: What is called “delight” is the very thing that makes one happy.

original: de la yul gang la gang dga' ba nyid du sgom pa de'i sems kyi rgyun bsgoms pas 'dus byas pa rgyur byas nas yul de lhan cig byed pa can gyi bde ba goms pa kho na las skyes pa de bzhin du snying rje la sogs pa'i yid las
analyzed: de la yul gang la gang dga' ba nyid du sgom pa de'i sems kyi rgyun bsgoms pas 'dus byas pa rgyur byas nas yul de lhan cig byed pa can gyi bde ba goms pa kho na las skyes pa de bzhin du snying rje la sogs pa'i yid las
translated: In that regard, by meditating on the continuum of the mind that is the very thing that delights in an object, the object arises from the mere cultivation of happiness that is a coemergent cause, having been conditioned.

original: byung ba rnams la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: byung ba rnams la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, compassion and so on should be applied to mental factors.

original: sdug bsngal can gdon no zhes pha rol sdug bsngal can gdon par bsgoms pa las gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal can gdon no zhes pha rol sdug bsngal can gdon par bsgoms pa las gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: By meditating on the thought “I will save those who are suffering,” the mind becomes clear.

original: de'i yul dang nye ba na yud tsam gyis de'i shes pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgrub pa rab tu bskyed pa'i rgyu ste 'brel pa can kho na dang ngam nye bar cig shos dang lhan cig gsal ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul dang nye ba na yud tsam gyis de'i shes pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgrub pa rab tu bskyed pa'i rgyu ste 'brel pa can kho na dang ngam nye bar cig shos dang lhan cig gsal ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: In the vicinity of that object, there is only the cause, which is the related cause of the sudden generation of the practice that is consistent with that cognition, but it is not the case that the other is manifest together with it.

original: ji skad du thams cad mkhyen pa grub par gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du thams cad mkhyen pa grub par gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Sāṃkhya-siddhi:

original: brtse ba la sogs rtogs pa phul byung thob pa rnams ni de yi spyod yul nyer gnas na //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs rtogs pa phul byung thob pa rnams ni de yi spyod yul nyer gnas na //
translated: Those who have attained the highest realization of love and so on, when they are in the vicinity of the object,

original: 'di ltar rtsol la ltos pa med par de rnams rang gi rang gis so sor bdag nyid gsal //🔽zhes so // de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'i chos nyid goms pa phul du byung bar 'gro na yang ji srid rnal 'byor pas nyams su myong bar bya ba de srid du rang bzhin med pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni so so skye bo la sogs pas mthong ba'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsol la ltos pa med par de rnams rang gi rang gis so sor bdag nyid gsal // zhes so // de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'i chos nyid goms pa phul du byung bar 'gro na yang ji srid rnal 'byor pas nyams su myong bar bya ba de srid du rang bzhin med pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni so so skye bo la sogs pas mthong ba'i mtshan nyid
translated: they are self-manifest without depending on effort.

original: dang bral ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dang bral ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, even when the cultivation of the reality of essencelessness has reached a high level, as long as it is to be experienced by the yogi, the essence of essencelessness is only free from the characteristic of being perceived by ordinary beings and so on.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par 'khrul pa las byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas 'di'i sems mtshan ma med pa'o zhes pa 'di tsam de'i gsal bar snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par 'khrul pa las byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas 'di'i sems mtshan ma med pa'o zhes pa 'di tsam de'i gsal bar snang ba nyid do //
translated: The mind of this one is signless, in that it is free from the stains of attachment, etc., which arise from error in regard to entities and non-entities, etc.

original: 'di phyin ci log tu sgom pa mi srid de /
analyzed: 'di phyin ci log tu sgom pa mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible to meditate on this in a distorted manner.

original: gang gi phyir rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rang gi don nam gzhan gyi don du sgom pa mngon par brtson pa de de tsam kho na nyid du don byas par gyur pas ngal ba gzhan la cis na 'jug ces pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rang gi don nam gzhan gyi don du sgom pa mngon par brtson pa de de tsam kho na nyid du don byas par gyur pas ngal ba gzhan la cis na 'jug ces pa ste /
translated: For, when one is intent on meditation for one’s own benefit or for the benefit of others, having first taken up the conceptualization, then, since one has accomplished the aim just in that, why would one engage in another kind of exertion?

original: don med pa nyid kyi phyir dang don byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa nyid kyi phyir dang don byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is meaningless and because it is not productive of benefit.

original: dper na bza' ba dang sman la sogs pa rnams la mngon par 'dod pa dang smin pa thob pa na bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na bza' ba dang sman la sogs pa rnams la mngon par 'dod pa dang smin pa thob pa na bzhin te /
translated: For example, when one has obtained the desired ripening from food, medicine, etc.

original: ji ltar yang 'dir smin pa gzhan mngon par mi 'dod pa srid kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'dir smin pa gzhan mngon par mi 'dod pa srid kyang /
translated: Just as it is not possible here that one would desire another ripening,

original: de tsam kho na smin pa phul du byung ba mthar thug par tha snyad byed pa de bzhin du skabs su yang ngo zhes pas skyon ci yang med do //
analyzed: de tsam kho na smin pa phul du byung ba mthar thug par tha snyad byed pa de bzhin du skabs su yang ngo zhes pas skyon ci yang med do //
translated: Just as one uses the term “perfected” to refer to the mere completion of something, in the same way, there is no fault in using the term “perfected” to refer to the mere completion of the two truths.

original: gzhan yang / 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //🔽rang bzhin la ni phyin log gis //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don // rang bzhin la ni phyin log gis //
translated: Moreover, the Commentary states:🔽Even though one strives with the misconception🔽of nonviolence and the correct object

original: 'bad pa ldan yang mi gnod de //
analyzed: 'bad pa ldan yang mi gnod de //
translated: toward the nature, one is not harmed,

original: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
translated: because the mind grasps that aspect.

original: zhes rnam 'grel du gsungs pa nyid kyis slar yang dpyod par 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden @173a * //
analyzed: zhes rnam 'grel du gsungs pa nyid kyis slar yang dpyod par 'gyur ro // de ltar mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden @173a * //
translated: This statement itself indicates that there is further analysis to be done.

original: pa'i bdag nyid kho na'i chos rnams dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i bdag nyid kho na'i chos rnams dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, when one is not in meditative equipoise, one observes phenomena that have the nature of conventional and ultimate reality.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa mtha' dag ldog pa na dmigs pa la sogs pa ci yang med do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa mtha' dag ldog pa na dmigs pa la sogs pa ci yang med do zhes gnas so //
translated: When one is in meditative equipoise, one abides in the cessation of all conceptual elaborations, and so there is no observation of anything at all.

original: ched du bya ba ni bsgrub pa rnams kyi ched du bya ba'o zhes las su sgrub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis rnams lam chags pa nyid kyis ji srid du rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad rtogs pa'i bar te /
analyzed: ched du bya ba ni bsgrub pa rnams kyi ched du bya ba'o zhes las su sgrub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis rnams lam chags pa nyid kyis ji srid du rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad rtogs pa'i bar te /
translated: Since it is established as the object, it is the abandonment of the afflictions and the obscurations to omniscience together with their traces, and the twenty two arousals of mind are the path.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das ma'i rnam par bshad pa 'phags pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das ma'i rnam par bshad pa 'phags pas gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavatī has been explained by the noble one.

original: de la sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste zhes pa brda las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste zhes pa brda las byung ba'o //
translated: There, beginning with the first generation of mind,🔽there is no arising or cessation of any phenomena.

original: chos gang gi yang skye ba'am 'gag pa med ces pa ni dran gyi dus su snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dag la 'gag pa dang skye ba'i tshul gyis shes pa la sogs pa dang 'khor ba pa dang zhugs pa dang 'bras bu la gnas pa la
analyzed: chos gang gi yang skye ba'am 'gag pa med ces pa ni dran gyi dus su snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dag la 'gag pa dang skye ba'i tshul gyis shes pa la sogs pa dang 'khor ba pa dang zhugs pa dang 'bras bu la gnas pa la
translated: At the time of memory, in the prior and subsequent states, through the mode of cessation and arising, consciousness and so on, samsara, entry, and abiding in the result

original: sogs pa sems can gyi phung po ma lus pa'i mchog nyid kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid ces pa gsum mo //
analyzed: sogs pa sems can gyi phung po ma lus pa'i mchog nyid kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid ces pa gsum mo //
translated: The three are the supreme of all sentient beings, the mind, and the characteristic of the mind.

original: de bzhin du bstan bcos las kyang /🔽sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spangs dang rtogs pa gsum po la //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan bcos las kyang / sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spangs dang rtogs pa gsum po la //
translated: Likewise, the treatise declares:🔽The three greatnesses of the three:🔽the mind of the supreme of all sentient beings,

original: chen po gsum gyi rang 'byung gi //
analyzed: chen po gsum gyi rang 'byung gi //
translated: abandonment, and realization.

original: ched du bya ba 'di zhes bya //
analyzed: ched du bya ba 'di zhes bya //
translated: This is called the aim.

original: zhes so // rang nyid sangs rgyas su 'byung bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //🔽dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: zhes so // rang nyid sangs rgyas su 'byung bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o // dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba'i khyad par ni /
translated: The aim of the bodhisattvas is the occurrence of their own buddhahood.

original: mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'ben la phog pa dang chos mtshungs par shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'ben la phog pa dang chos mtshungs par shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The difference in the object and aim is to be understood as analogous to the fitting of an arrow to a bow and the hitting of a target.

original: de'i tshe bdag nyid ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag nyid ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: At that time, the self is the object,

original: sgrub pa dang dus mnyam pa nyid kyis de'i yul gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dus mnyam pa nyid kyis de'i yul gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the object of the practice, since it is simultaneous with the practice.

original: ched du bya ba ni che ge mo pa thag ring ba ste de ni 'byung ba de'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ched du bya ba ni che ge mo pa thag ring ba ste de ni 'byung ba de'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The aim is the welfare of others, because it is the nature of the result of that element.

original: de ltar rigs dang dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba dang ldan pa'i sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rigs dang dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba dang ldan pa'i sems skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, one generates the Thought which is endowed with the family, the objective, and the aim.

original: sems bskyed pa de'i mtshan nyid ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga par gsungs pa /🔽byang chub sems dpa' ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de'i mtshan nyid ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga par gsungs pa / byang chub sems dpa' ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgyas par bya'o //
translated: The definition of that generation of the Thought is stated in the Twenty-Five Thousand:🔽“The Bodhisattva should think, ‘I will become a Buddha, a fully accomplished, supreme enlightenment, and I will accomplish the welfare of others.’

original: gzhan gyi don bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar don du gnyer ro zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar don du gnyer ro zhes so //
translated: Thus, he strives in that way.”

original: bstan bcos su yang /
analyzed: bstan bcos su yang /
translated: And in the treatise,

original: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
translated: The generation of the Thought is for the sake of others

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
translated: To desire the perfect, full enlightenment.

original: ces so // de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid ni @173b de don du gnyer ba dge ba'i chos 'dun pa sems las byung ba yin mod /
analyzed: ces so // de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid ni @173b de don du gnyer ba dge ba'i chos 'dun pa sems las byung ba yin mod /
translated: Here, the desire for perfect enlightenment is the mental factor of aspiration for virtue that seeks that enlightenment.🔽But when it exists, one generates the thought of enlightenment.

original: de yod na byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do zhes bya bas rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa ste /
analyzed: de yod na byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do zhes bya bas rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa ste /
translated: Thus, the cause is designated by the effect.

original: de ltar don du gnyer ba'i dge ba'i chos thams cad 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de ltar don du gnyer ba'i dge ba'i chos thams cad 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: This is stated in order to show that all the virtues that seek that enlightenment increase.

original: yang de don du gnyer ba dang lhan cig spyod pa sems bskyed pa la de'i sgras btags pa ste de ltar don du gnyer ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sems skyed par byed do zhes shes pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: yang de don du gnyer ba dang lhan cig spyod pa sems bskyed pa la de'i sgras btags pa ste de ltar don du gnyer ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sems skyed par byed do zhes shes pa'i ched du'o //
translated: Moreover, the generation of the thought that accompanies the desire is designated by the word for the desire. Thus, the generation of the thought that accompanies the desire is the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: yang na sems ni mngon par 'dod pa ste de ltar ni 'gro bar 'dod zer ba ni bdag gi sems 'gro bar zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sems ni mngon par 'dod pa ste de ltar ni 'gro bar 'dod zer ba ni bdag gi sems 'gro bar zhes pa'o //
translated: Or else, thought is the will, and thus the one who has the will to go is said to have the thought to go.

original: de bskyed pa ni sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bskyed pa ni sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The generation of that is the generation of the thought.

original: mngon par 'dod pa ni bskyed pa las mi 'khrul pa las bskyed pa smos pa ni khyad par yongs su gzung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa ni bskyed pa las mi 'khrul pa las bskyed pa smos pa ni khyad par yongs su gzung ba'i don du'o //
translated: The desire is the desire to generate the non-erroneous generation. The mention of generation is for the purpose of including the special.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ste mngon par 'dod pa gang gi yin pa ste de'i ngo bo ni de nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ste mngon par 'dod pa gang gi yin pa ste de'i ngo bo ni de nyid do //
translated: The desire for perfect enlightenment is the desire to attain perfect enlightenment. That which has that as its nature is that itself.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi ched du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i sems bskyed pa ni sems bskyed pa'o zhes pa 'di'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi ched du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i sems bskyed pa ni sems bskyed pa'o zhes pa 'di'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the definition of the generation of the Thought is: the generation of the Thought is the generation of the Thought which has as its object perfect enlightenment for the sake of others.

original: 'o na don du gnyer ba ni rtog pa ste de dang lhan cig gyur pa'i sems ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi yin zhe na bden te don du gnyer ba'i don du gnyer ba po nyid de byed pa po'i chos sngon gyi sems so so dang /
analyzed: 'o na don du gnyer ba ni rtog pa ste de dang lhan cig gyur pa'i sems ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi yin zhe na bden te don du gnyer ba'i don du gnyer ba po nyid de byed pa po'i chos sngon gyi sems so so dang /
translated: But if the desire is a conception, how can it be the mind which is accompanied by it? It is true, but the desire is the desirer itself. It is the dharma of the agent, the prior mind.

original: don du gnyer byas zin pa nyid de las kyi chos phyi ma'i sems so so yang ngo //
analyzed: don du gnyer byas zin pa nyid de las kyi chos phyi ma'i sems so so yang ngo //
translated: The desired is the desired itself. It is the dharma of the object, the subsequent mind.

original: de'i phyir don du gnyer bas byas zin pa'i sems rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir don du gnyer bas byas zin pa'i sems rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ste /
translated: Therefore, the mind of one who is engaged in the aim of others is nonconceptual, and is the mind of the Lord.

original: de ltar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the one who is engaged in the aim of others who is the one who is truly engaged in the aim of self and other.

original: yang na ji ltar sngar gyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i snying rje chen po rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin kyang /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar sngar gyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i snying rje chen po rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin kyang /
translated: Or else, just as the great compassion that wishes to remove the former suffering has the nature of conceptualization,🔽in the same way, the great compassion that wishes to bestow benefit has the nature of conceptualization.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam rtog med pa yin pa de bzhin du /🔽yang dag rdzogs byang chub 'dod nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam rtog med pa yin pa de bzhin du / yang dag rdzogs byang chub 'dod nyid //
translated: But the Tathāgata’s compassion is nonconceptual.

original: ces pa kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: ces pa kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no fault in saying that the Tathāgata’s compassion is nonconceptual.

original: sems bskyed pa de yang dbye na nyi shu rtsa gnyis su bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa dang 'bum par yang gsungs so //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de yang dbye na nyi shu rtsa gnyis su bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa dang 'bum par yang gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, this generation of the thought is divided into twenty-two types in the Twenty-five Thousand and the Hundred Thousand.

original: de la thun mong du stong pa nyid kyi ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par brjod la /
analyzed: de la thun mong du stong pa nyid kyi ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par brjod la /
translated: In general, the intuition of emptiness is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: dbye na ni /🔽rnam kun mkhyen nyid lam shes nyid //
analyzed: dbye na ni / rnam kun mkhyen nyid lam shes nyid //
translated: If it is divided,

original: de nas thams cad shes pa nyid //
analyzed: de nas thams cad shes pa nyid //
translated: it is the intuition of the knower of all aspects, the intuition of the knower of paths,🔽and the intuition of the knower of all.

original: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa dang // rtse mor phyin dang mthar gyis pa //
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa dang // rtse mor phyin dang mthar gyis pa //
translated: Realization of all aspects, culmination, and serial;

original: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
translated: Realization in a single moment.

original: chos kyi sku dang de rnam brgyad //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang de rnam brgyad //
translated: The Dharma Body has these eight aspects.

original: ces pa de kho na mngon par rtogs pa brgyad rnams so //🔽de la rgyu dang 'bras bu ma lus @174a * //
analyzed: ces pa de kho na mngon par rtogs pa brgyad rnams so // de la rgyu dang 'bras bu ma lus @174a * //
translated: These are the eight realizations of thatness.

original: pa rtogs pa las ltos pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes mngon par brjod pa'i phyir der bshad pa'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsal ba'i don du 'bras bu'i gnas
analyzed: pa rtogs pa las ltos pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes mngon par brjod pa'i phyir der bshad pa'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsal ba'i don du 'bras bu'i gnas
translated: Since the knowledge of all aspects is dependent on the realization of all causes and effects without exception, the path explained there is not for the bodhisattvas, lest it be thought that the knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of all aspects of the tathagatas.

original: skabs mtha'i sems bskyed pa gnyis gzhag pa'i rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi sems bskyed pa nyi shu ni lam shes pa nyid de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: skabs mtha'i sems bskyed pa gnyis gzhag pa'i rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi sems bskyed pa nyi shu ni lam shes pa nyid de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In order to dispel this doubt, the two aspects of the result, the final generation of the mind, are set forth. The twenty aspects of the cause, the generation of the mind, are the knowledge of the path, which is posited as belonging to the bodhisattvas.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces kyang ngo //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces kyang ngo //
translated: It is also called the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: 'dir lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su rang gi mthar thug par son pa bsgrubs nas theg pa gzhan gyis gdul ba'i sems can gyi don du mngon du mi byed par rgyu dang bcas pa'i lam nye bar ston pa la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams
analyzed: 'dir lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su rang gi mthar thug par son pa bsgrubs nas theg pa gzhan gyis gdul ba'i sems can gyi don du mngon du mi byed par rgyu dang bcas pa'i lam nye bar ston pa la mkhas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams
translated: Because they are skilled in teaching the path together with its cause, the bodhisattvas

original: kyis lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba de'i phyir thams cad shes pa nyid ni sems bskyed pa lnga pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: kyis lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba de'i phyir thams cad shes pa nyid ni sems bskyed pa lnga pa'i bar ro //
translated: complete all the paths. Therefore, the knowledge of all aspects is up to the fifth generation of bodhichitta.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: Thus,

original: shes pas srid la mi gnas dang // snying rjes zhi la mi gnas pa //
analyzed: shes pas srid la mi gnas dang // snying rjes zhi la mi gnas pa //
translated: through knowledge one does not abide in existence, and through compassion one does not abide in peace.

original: zhes pas srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus, one does not abide in existence or peace.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma dang bcas par dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma dang bcas par dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The observation of the aggregates such as form and generosity and so on together with their signs is the counteragent.

original: mtshan ma med par dmigs pa chags pa mi 'jug pa thabs la mkhas pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par dmigs pa chags pa mi 'jug pa thabs la mkhas pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: The observation without signs, where attachment does not engage, is the antidote.

original: chags pa spong ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyis na shes pa dang shes bya mnyam pa nyid du gcig par yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: chags pa spong ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyis na shes pa dang shes bya mnyam pa nyid du gcig par yongs su shes pas so //
translated: The abandonment of attachment is by fully understanding the sameness of knower and knowable, through the sameness of nature of all phenomena in their lack of intrinsic nature.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni spros pa thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni spros pa thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Sameness is the non-apprehension of all conceptual elaborations.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin rtogs par dka' ba nyid de bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyang ngo ;🔽/ dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba'i lam yang chos kyi bdag med pa rjes su rtogs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin rtogs par dka' ba nyid de bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyang ngo ; / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba'i lam yang chos kyi bdag med pa rjes su rtogs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to realize the nature of phenomena, and it is inconceivable.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba'i lam gyi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba'i lam gyi nang du 'dus so //
translated: The factors conducive to liberation, the factors conducive to penetrative insight, and the path of seeing, which have the nature of the applications of mindfulness and so on, are included within the bodhisattvas’ factors conducive to liberation, factors conducive to penetrative insight and path of seeing, from the point of view of their realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de ltar ni nyan thos rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams su dmigs la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa kho na'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams stong pa nyid🔽du'o // de la gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa @174b rnams rtag pa med par rtogs pa de'i tshe 'di rnams nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa rtogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar ni nyan thos rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams su dmigs la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa kho na'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams stong pa nyid du'o // de la gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa @174b rnams rtag pa med par rtogs pa de'i tshe 'di rnams nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa rtogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, śrāvakas focus on forms and so on as impermanent and so forth, but bodhisattvas focus on forms and so on as empty, qualified by impermanence and so forth.🔽When they realize that forms and so on are not permanent, at that time they realize the aspects of definite discernment and so on of śrāvakas and so on.

original: gang gi tshe 'di rnams de ltar gyur pa 'di rnams la mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa bskyed pa de'i tshe rang gi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa rtogs par ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di rnams de ltar gyur pa 'di rnams la mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa bskyed pa de'i tshe rang gi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa rtogs par ro zhes pa'o //
translated: When they generate nonattachment and so on to those that have become like that, at that time they realize their own aspects of definite discernment and so on.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi thams cad shes pa nyid ni chos kyi bdag med pa dang bral ba'i sgo nas srid pa dang zhi ba la gnas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi thams cad shes pa nyid ni chos kyi bdag med pa dang bral ba'i sgo nas srid pa dang zhi ba la gnas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The knowledge of all things of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas is the nature of abiding in existence and peace, etc., by being devoid of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das ma bar mar gsungs pa thams cad shes pa nyid shes pa dang mthong bas bltas nas 'da' par 'dod pa dang lam shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das ma bar mar gsungs pa thams cad shes pa nyid shes pa dang mthong bas bltas nas 'da' par 'dod pa dang lam shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems
translated: The knowledge of all things that the Lord has taught is the knowledge and vision of the desire to transcend, the desire to perfect the knowledge of the path, and the desire to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dpas shes so //
analyzed: dpas shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva should know this.

original: de la shes pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa sa dang po la mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de la shes pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa sa dang po la mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Therein, knowledge is that which is included in the path of seeing on the first stage of the bodhisattva's realization.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam kho nar nyan thos la sogs pa'i rtogs pa mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs pas so //
