analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam kho nar nyan thos la sogs pa'i rtogs pa mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs pas so //
translated: Because the entire realization of the sravakas, etc. is perfected just on the bodhisattva's path of seeing.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bsal ba'i don du mthong ba gsungs la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bsal ba'i don du mthong ba gsungs la /
translated: He speaks of seeing in order to eliminate the cognition of inference.

original: 'khrul pa'i mthong ba bsal ba'i don du shes pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mthong ba bsal ba'i don du shes pa gsungs so //
translated: He speaks of cognition in order to eliminate mistaken seeing.

original: shes pa dang mthong ba gsungs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dag la byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam med par shes pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong ba gsungs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dag la byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam med par shes pa'i don du'o //
translated: He speaks of cognition and seeing in order to show that the Bodhisattva's path of cultivation is not absent on the levels of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'da' ba ni yang rnam pa kun mngon par rtogs pa la 'jug pa'o zhes 'phags pa'o //🔽slar yang 'phags pas sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'da' ba ni yang rnam pa kun mngon par rtogs pa la 'jug pa'o zhes 'phags pa'o // slar yang 'phags pas sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Transcending means entering into the realization of all aspects.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba dag gis dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pas rnam pa brgyad las 'da' ba zhes so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba dag gis dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pas rnam pa brgyad las 'da' ba zhes so //
translated: Again, the noble one, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment, by means of cognition and seeing in the practice of the perfections, transcends the eight such as the stage of bright insight.

original: gang nyan thos kyi lam gyis thob par bya ba rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams dang gang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis thob par bya ba rang sangs rgyas nyid de rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang nyan thos kyi lam gyis thob par bya ba rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams dang gang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis thob par bya ba rang sangs rgyas nyid de rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' thob par mi byed do //
translated: The results of Stream Enterer and so on, which are to be attained by the path of the Hearers, and the state of a Solitary Buddha, which is to be attained by the path of the Solitary Buddhas, are not attained by the Bodhisattva.

original: 'on kyang sems can rnams rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas rang byang chub kyi bar la so sor 'jog go //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can rnams rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas rang byang chub kyi bar la so sor 'jog go //
translated: However, he establishes sentient beings in the results of Stream Enterer and so on up to Solitary Buddhahood.

original: ji ltar rang gis ma thob pa'i chos gzhan so sor 'god par byed ce na 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gis ma thob pa'i chos gzhan so sor 'god par byed ce na 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: How does he establish others in dharmas that he himself has not attained? The Lord has said this:

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes pa dang spong ba de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bzod @175a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes pa dang spong ba de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bzod @175a * //
translated: “ Sariputra, the knowledge and abandonment of the Hearers and Solitary Buddhas is the forbearance of the Bodhisattva who has attained the forbearance of the non-production of dharmas.

original: pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: pa'o zhes so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: de yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: And that is the forbearance of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: de ci las she na /
analyzed: de ci las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir lam gzhan la khyad par yod pa na rigs dang dbang po dang tshogs khyad par can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lam gzhan la khyad par yod pa na rigs dang dbang po dang tshogs khyad par can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because when there is a difference in other paths, there is a difference in lineage, faculties, and the collection of merit and knowledge.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i byed par cig shos rnams kyis rtogs pa'i byed pa ma lus pa bsdus pas gang de rnams kyi shes pa dang spong ba de mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yin te rtogs pa dang spangs pa 'di tsam nyid kyis ma yin
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i byed par cig shos rnams kyis rtogs pa'i byed pa ma lus pa bsdus pas gang de rnams kyi shes pa dang spong ba de mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yin te rtogs pa dang spangs pa 'di tsam nyid kyis ma yin
translated: The patience of nonarising of those is the knowledge and abandonment of those, but not just that much knowledge and abandonment.

original: no // gang gi phyir de rnams kyi bsgom pa'i lam la rtogs pa dang spangs lhag na de dag bzod pa 'di nang du 'dus pa las min gyi gtso bo ni nang du 'dus pa las so //
analyzed: no // gang gi phyir de rnams kyi bsgom pa'i lam la rtogs pa dang spangs lhag na de dag bzod pa 'di nang du 'dus pa las min gyi gtso bo ni nang du 'dus pa las so //
translated: Because if their path of meditation has more knowledge and abandonment, it is not included in this patience, but the main part is included.

original: 'o na de lta na bcom ldan 'das mar /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na bcom ldan 'das mar /
translated: Well, in that case, in the sutra Requested by the Bodhisattva,

original: mthong ba'i lam kho nar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa las 'das par gsungs la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam kho nar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa las 'das par gsungs la /
translated: it is said that on the path of seeing alone, sravakas and pratyekabuddhas surpass the realizations of bodhisattvas.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa'i mdor yang /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa'i mdor yang /
translated: And in the sutra Liberation of Maitreya,

original: dper na rigs chen po'i dbang gis rgyal po'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon pas blon po rgan po rnams zil gyis gnon pa de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems dang snying rje'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa las
analyzed: dper na rigs chen po'i dbang gis rgyal po'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon pas blon po rgan po rnams zil gyis gnon pa de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems dang snying rje'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa las
translated: Just as a prince born into a great family, because he is the son of a king, outshines the old ministers, in the same way, because of the power of the thought of awakening and compassion, a bodhisattva born into the family of the Tathāgata, the king of the Dharma,

original: dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: a beginner bodhisattva, not long after generating the thought of awakening,

original: ring po ma lon pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams zil gyis gnon no //
analyzed: ring po ma lon pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams zil gyis gnon no //
translated: outshines the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽In the same way, the example of the son of the king of birds, Garuḍa, not long after being born, immediately outshines all the other birds, shows that a bodhisattva, not long after generating the thought of awakening,

original: de bzhin du bya khyung dbang po'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon ba'i dpes de ma thag tu gang sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i stobs dang pha rol gnon pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa'i mig
analyzed: de bzhin du bya khyung dbang po'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon ba'i dpes de ma thag tu gang sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i stobs dang pha rol gnon pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa'i mig
translated: with the power of generating the thought of omniscience, with the strength of his own higher intention, with the eye of wisdom,

original: yongs su dag pa'i yon tan te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la yod pa ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i yon tan te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la yod pa ma yin no zhes so //
translated: These are the qualities of complete purity, which do not exist for any of the Disciples and Solitary Sages.

original: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdor yang /
analyzed: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdor yang /
translated: And in the Ratnamegha-sutra:

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sar byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thams cad las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sar byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thams cad las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: “On the stage of action through devoted interest, the bodhisattva surpasses all the Disciples and Solitary Sages.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa don dam pa ma thob par yang 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa don dam pa ma thob par yang 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: And he has not yet attained the ultimate stage of the bodhisattva.”

original: 'phags pas bcu par yang /
analyzed: 'phags pas bcu par yang /
translated: And in the noble Sutra of the Ten Stages:

original: sems bskyed pa tsam gyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad lhag pa'i bsam pa'i bdag nyid chen pos zil gyis non gyi rang gi blo'i rnam par dpyod pa'i stobs kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa tsam gyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad lhag pa'i bsam pa'i bdag nyid chen pos zil gyis non gyi rang gi blo'i rnam par dpyod pa'i stobs kyis ma yin no //
translated: “By merely generating the Thought, the bodhisattva surpasses all the Disciples and Solitary Sages through the greatness of his superior intention, not by the power of his own intellectual analysis.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi yul gyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid chen po la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs @175b rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi yul gyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid chen po la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs @175b rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes
translated: Because the bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage has great exalted wisdom that is his object, he surpasses the activities of all sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gsungs so // 'dir mdo dang por thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su zil gyis mnan par gsungs la /
analyzed: gsungs so // 'dir mdo dang por thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su zil gyis mnan par gsungs la /
translated: Here, in the first sutra it is said that he surpasses them in the state of the factors conducive to liberation.

original: gnyis par ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su ste /
analyzed: gnyis par ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su ste /
translated: In the second sutra it is said that he surpasses them in the state of the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: gsum par nis dang po dang bdun pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gsum par nis dang po dang bdun pa la yang ngo //
translated: In the third sutra it is said that he surpasses them on the first and seventh stages.

original: zhes pa ci ltar mi 'gal zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ci ltar mi 'gal zhe na ma yin te /
translated: How is this not contradictory?

original: dang po dang gnyis pa'i gnas skabs dag na rtogs pa'i bdag nyid chen po zil gyis mi non gyi /
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa'i gnas skabs dag na rtogs pa'i bdag nyid chen po zil gyis mi non gyi /
translated: It is not contradictory because in the first and second states he does not surpass them in terms of his great realization.

original: 'on kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: However, he surpasses them in terms of his generation of the enlightenment mind and so on.

original: rab tu dga' bar ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mthong ba ste nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam bsgom pas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mthong ba ste nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam bsgom pas ni ma yin la /
translated: They are very joyful because they see the paths of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, but they do not cultivate the paths of sravakas and so on,

original: de med kyang de'i lam rtogs pa'i phyir ring du song ba la byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang de'i lam rtogs pa'i phyir ring du song ba la byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and even though they do not have those paths, they realize those paths.

original: de ltar yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis sa bcu pa'i 'grel par sa bdun pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis sa bcu pa'i 'grel par sa bdun pa la gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, Master Vasubandhu, in his commentary on the Ten Grounds, says that on the seventh ground,

original: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las rgyu gnyis kyis 'da' bar yongs su gsal bar byas te thabs dang shes rab sgom pa'i stobs dang snying rje'i stobs kyis so zhes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i rab tu sbyor ba mthar thug par 'gro ba'i don dang /
analyzed: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las rgyu gnyis kyis 'da' bar yongs su gsal bar byas te thabs dang shes rab sgom pa'i stobs dang snying rje'i stobs kyis so zhes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i rab tu sbyor ba mthar thug par 'gro ba'i don dang /
translated: it is stated that they surpass the grounds of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas through two causes, the power of cultivating method and wisdom and the power of compassion, and that they surpass the grounds of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas through two causes, the power of cultivating method and wisdom and the power of compassion.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / dman pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam las 'das pa'i don gyis ring du song ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / dman pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam las 'das pa'i don gyis ring du song ba'o zhes so //
translated: It is called Gone Far because it is far removed from the mundane and the lower supramundane paths.

original: slob dpon zla ba grags pas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba grags pas kyang /
translated: The Acarya Candrakirti also says:

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams thub dbang dbyangs skyes bcas //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams thub dbang dbyangs skyes bcas //
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas, together with the Lord of Sages,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang sems dang po la gnas pas //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang sems dang po la gnas pas //
translated: The Bodhisattvas who abide in the first stage,

original: bsod nams dbang gis thul zhing rnam par 'phel //
analyzed: bsod nams dbang gis thul zhing rnam par 'phel //
translated: By the power of their merit, are subdued and increase,

original: ring du song bar de ni blos kyang lhag / ces so //🔽de nyid kyi phyir sa bcu par gsungs pa las /
analyzed: ring du song bar de ni blos kyang lhag / ces so // de nyid kyi phyir sa bcu par gsungs pa las /
translated: And on Gone Far, they surpass them in intellect.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyi du shes pa yod do zhes gsal bar nges par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyi du shes pa yod do zhes gsal bar nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is clearly ascertained that the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas also have the knowledge that all phenomena are essenceless, as is stated in the Dasabhumika:

original: gzhan du na dngos po rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dngos po rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would be devoid of the knowledge that things are essenceless.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams bzhin du de rnams kyang sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang rang gi blo'i rnam par dpyod pas kyang zil gyis gnon par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams bzhin du de rnams kyang sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang rang gi blo'i rnam par dpyod pas kyang zil gyis gnon par 'gyur la /
translated: And like those who are free from worldly attachment, they are also outshone by the first-ground bodhisattvas, who analyze with their own minds.

original: phyi rol pa bzhin kho nar 'di rnams kyi khams gsum na spyod pa'i bag la nyal thams cad spangs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa bzhin kho nar 'di rnams kyi khams gsum na spyod pa'i bag la nyal thams cad spangs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And like non-Buddhists, they do not abandon all the latent propensities for activity in the three realms.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bor dmigs pas phyin ci log pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽bdag nyid la bdag @176a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bor dmigs pas phyin ci log pa nyid kyi phyir ro // bdag nyid la bdag @176a * //
translated: Because they are mistaken, since they observe the intrinsic reality of form and so on.

original: med pa rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not realize selflessness in regard to themselves.

original: bdag tu btags pa'i nye bar len pa phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu btags pa'i nye bar len pa phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they observe the aggregates, which are the appropriated aggregates designated as the self.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyal po'i rin po che'i phreng bar yang /
analyzed: rgyal po'i rin po che'i phreng bar yang /
translated: In the Jewel Garland,

original: ji srid phung por 'dzin byed pa //🔽de srid de las bzhes su'ang //
analyzed: ji srid phung por 'dzin byed pa // de srid de las bzhes su'ang //
translated: As long as one apprehends the aggregates,🔽One is said to possess the view of self.

original: nga ru byed pa yod na slar //
analyzed: nga ru byed pa yod na slar //
translated: If one has the view of self,

original: de las las dang skye ba yang //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de las las dang skye ba yang //🔽zhes pa nas /
translated: One will have karma and birth.

original: bde bar mngon par nga rgyal ba //
analyzed: bde bar mngon par nga rgyal ba //
translated: And the conceit of happiness.🔽And the desire to remove suffering,

original: sdug bsngal sel don la ji bzhin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sel don la ji bzhin //
translated: Just as it is,

original: de bzhin sdug bsngal sngon rlom pa'ang //
analyzed: de bzhin sdug bsngal sngon rlom pa'ang //
translated: So too, the anticipation of suffering

original: bde ba 'joms par byed pa skye //
analyzed: bde ba 'joms par byed pa skye //
translated: Gives rise to the destruction of happiness.

original: bde bar phrad pa'i sred pa nyid //
analyzed: bde bar phrad pa'i sred pa nyid //
translated: The craving for contact with happiness🔽Is completely abandoned

original: rang bzhin med pas rab tu spong //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pas rab tu spong //
translated: Because it is essenceless.

original: sdug bsngal bral bar sred pa yang //🔽de phyir de ltar mthong bas grol //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bral bar sred pa yang // de phyir de ltar mthong bas grol //
translated: The craving for separation from suffering🔽Is also abandoned in the same way.🔽Thus, through seeing things in this way, one is liberated.

original: gang gis mthong ba yin zhe na //
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba yin zhe na //
translated: By what means is one liberated?

original: tha snyad du ni sems brjod bya //
analyzed: tha snyad du ni sems brjod bya //
translated: The mind is conventionally expressed.

original: sems byung med pa'i sems med de //
analyzed: sems byung med pa'i sems med de //
translated: There is no mind without mental states,

original: don med nyid phyir 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: don med nyid phyir 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: Because it would be meaningless.

original: de ltar 'gro ba don med pa //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba don med pa //
translated: Thus, the world is meaningless.

original: ji bzhin rtogs nas rten med do //
analyzed: ji bzhin rtogs nas rten med do //
translated: Having realized things as they are, there is no basis.

original: nyer len med pas mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: nyer len med pas mya ngan 'da' //
translated: Without appropriation, there is nirvana,

original: me yi nyer len med pa bzhin //🔽zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: me yi nyer len med pa bzhin //🔽zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Just as there is no fuel without fire.

original: gal te yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med par shes pa de lta na yang de rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su rdzogs par sgom pa med la /
analyzed: gal te yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med par shes pa de lta na yang de rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su rdzogs par sgom pa med la /
translated: Even though one understands that all phenomena are essenceless, one does not meditate on the complete selflessness of phenomena with respect to them.

original: khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs tsam ni yod do //
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs tsam ni yod do //
translated: There is a mere method for abandoning the afflictions that occur in the three realms.

original: de rnams kyi gang zag gi bdag med pa ma lus par sgom par ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gang zag gi bdag med pa ma lus par sgom par ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The complete selflessness of persons with respect to them is presented in the perfection of wisdom and so on.

original: gzhan rnams na re nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la gang zag gi bdag med pa shes pa kho na yod kyi chos kyi bdag med pa shes pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams su mang du gsal por gsungs
analyzed: gzhan rnams na re nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la gang zag gi bdag med pa shes pa kho na yod kyi chos kyi bdag med pa shes pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams su mang du gsal por gsungs
translated: Others say that śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have only the knowledge of the selflessness of persons and not the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena, because it is clearly stated many times in the perfection of wisdom and so on that

original: pa'i phyir / sa bcu par gsungs pa ni rnam pa gzhan du yang 'thad cing /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / sa bcu par gsungs pa ni rnam pa gzhan du yang 'thad cing /
translated: the statement in the tenth level is also tenable in another way.

original: skad cig tsam bdag med par shes pa yang 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / phyi rol pa rnams las kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang / bag la nyal spong ba ni bdag gi bdag med par rtogs pas kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig tsam bdag med par shes pa yang 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / phyi rol pa rnams las kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang / bag la nyal spong ba ni bdag gi bdag med par rtogs pas kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the knowledge of selflessness for just an instant is superior to the mundane beings who are free from attachment and to the heterodox, and the elimination of the latent proclivity is due to the realization of the selflessness of the self.

original: rin chen phreng bar gsungs pa rnams kyang kha cig skad cig ma'i bdag med du sbyar te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs rnams kyi thun mong du gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rin chen phreng bar gsungs pa rnams kyang kha cig skad cig ma'i bdag med du sbyar te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs rnams kyi thun mong du gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Also, the statements in the Precious Garland are to be applied to the selflessness of momentariness, because they are stated in common for the lineages of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: zhes pa ste re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes pa ste re zhig gzhag go //
translated: This is for the time being.

original: dkyus ma rjes su sbrel bar bya ste /
analyzed: dkyus ma rjes su sbrel bar bya ste /
translated: The main point is to be connected.

original: de ltar na lam shes pa nyid kyi nang @176b du thams cad shes pa nyid 'dus na mngon par rtogs pa log pa nyid du gsungs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na lam shes pa nyid kyi nang @176b du thams cad shes pa nyid 'dus na mngon par rtogs pa log pa nyid du gsungs pa ci zhe na /
translated: If in that case everything is included in the knowledge of the path, why is manifest realization stated to be mistaken?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ldog pa'i sgo nas 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'i don du thams cad shes pa nyid legs par brjod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ldog pa'i sgo nas 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'i don du thams cad shes pa nyid legs par brjod do //
translated: The bodhisattvas have well proclaimed the state of all-knowledge for the sake of the noble ones' complete knowledge of all things by way of the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: de ltar ni chos kyi bdag med dang bral ba'i sgo nas srid pa dang zhi ba la gnas pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang zag gi bdag med pa rtogs pa tsam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid ni nyan thos rnams kyi thams🔽cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar ni chos kyi bdag med dang bral ba'i sgo nas srid pa dang zhi ba la gnas pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang zag gi bdag med pa rtogs pa tsam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid ni nyan thos rnams kyi thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the state of all-knowledge of the sravakas is the perfection of wisdom, the nature of which is the realization of the selflessness of the person, free from the selflessness of phenomena, and which abides in existence and peace, etc.

original: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste 'on kyang gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / gzung bya'i don gyi rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir chos kyi bdag med pa'i phyogs kyang rtogs pa tsam gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid ni thams cad shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste 'on kyang gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / gzung bya'i don gyi rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir chos kyi bdag med pa'i phyogs kyang rtogs pa tsam gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid ni thams cad shes pa nyid de /
translated: The state of all-knowledge of the pratyekabuddhas is also like that, but the perfection of wisdom, the nature of which is the state of all-knowledge, is the realization of the mere selflessness of the person and the mere realization of the aspect of the selflessness of phenomena that abandons the conception of the object of apprehension.

original: byang chub sems dpas shes par bya ba'i mngon du bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas shes par bya ba'i mngon du bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the clear comprehension that is to be known by the bodhisattva.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams kyi bsgom pa'i lam bcom ldan 'das mar ma bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams kyi bsgom pa'i lam bcom ldan 'das mar ma bstan to //
translated: For this very reason, the path of cultivation is not taught in the Bhagavati.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gzhan gyi don du ni ji ltar mthong ba kho na'i don yang dang yang du mngon du phyogs par bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gzhan gyi don du ni ji ltar mthong ba kho na'i don yang dang yang du mngon du phyogs par bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes nye bar bstan to //
translated: For the bodhisattvas, the path of cultivation is the repeated clear comprehension of the meaning just as it is seen, for the sake of others.

original: de lta na yang bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa ni rtogs par sla ba nyid kyi phyir ro//
analyzed: de lta na yang bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa ni rtogs par sla ba nyid kyi phyir ro//
translated: Even so, what is taught in the Bhagavati is easier to understand.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bzhin du sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bzhin du sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The clear comprehension of the complete and perfect realization of all aspects is like the knowledge of all aspects, consisting of twenty-two types of generation of the resolve.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsum dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug dang bsgom pa'i lam brgyad cu'i rnam pa rnams so zhes pa bcu gcig lhag pa'i brgyar so sor phye ba rnams las rang gi mtha' spros pa thams cad
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsum dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug dang bsgom pa'i lam brgyad cu'i rnam pa rnams so zhes pa bcu gcig lhag pa'i brgyar so sor phye ba rnams las rang gi mtha' spros pa thams cad
translated: The three aspects of the liberation that is omniscience, the twelve aspects that are conducive to penetration, the sixteen moments of the path of seeing and the eighty aspects of the path of meditation are distinguished as one hundred and eleven.🔽The three aspects of omniscience are the object of expression that is all objects of knowledge, the subject that is the wisdom of omniscience and the time of omniscience, which is the present.🔽The three aspects of liberation are the object of expression that is the elimination of all elaborations, the subject that is the wisdom of liberation and the time of liberation, which is the present.🔽The twelve aspects that are conducive to penetration are the object of expression that is the elimination of all elaborations, the subject that is the wisdom of the path of preparation and the time of the path of preparation, which is the present.🔽The sixteen moments of the path of seeing are the object of expression that is the elimination of all elaborations, the subject that is the wisdom of the path of seeing and the time of the path of seeing, which is the present.

original: las ldog pas cig car nyid du mtshon par bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rnam pa'i khyad par gyi gnas skabs bcu gcig lhag pa'i brgya'i grangs rnams la thar pa dang nges 'byed cha la phan pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam bcu gcig🔽lhag pa'i brgya'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag cing /
analyzed: las ldog pas cig car nyid du mtshon par bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rnam pa'i khyad par gyi gnas skabs bcu gcig lhag pa'i brgya'i grangs rnams la thar pa dang nges 'byed cha la phan pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam bcu gcig🔽lhag pa'i brgya'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag cing /
translated: The eighty aspects of the path of meditation are the object of expression that is the elimination of all elaborations, the subject that is the wisdom of the path of meditation and the time of the path of meditation, which is the present.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha'i rnam pa gcig ni bsgoms pas btsal bar bya ba nyid kyis na bsgom pa'i lam shin du ba'i ngo bo sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi @177a * //🔽bdag nyid de /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha'i rnam pa gcig ni bsgoms pas btsal bar bya ba nyid kyis na bsgom pa'i lam shin du ba'i ngo bo sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi @177a * // bdag nyid de /
translated: It has the nature of the two kinds of generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid dang / zhing dag pa bla na med par rim pa ji lta bar rnam par gzhag go zhes pa bcu gsum lhag pa'i brgyar rab tu dbye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid dang / zhing dag pa bla na med par rim pa ji lta bar rnam par gzhag go zhes pa bcu gsum lhag pa'i brgyar rab tu dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, they are established in the order of the equality of samsara and nirvana and the unsurpassed purity of the realm, and they are divided into one hundred and thirteen.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa btags pa pa ni sbyor ba ste ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa btags pa pa ni sbyor ba ste ;
translated: Therefore, the nominal realization of all aspects is the training,🔽and the actual realization of all aspects is the result alone, included within the Dharma body of omniscience, having the nature of the equality of existence and peace.

original: dngos ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chos kyi sku'i nang du 'dus pa srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam pa nyid kyi bdag nyid 'bras bu kho na'o zhes mtshan nyid de'i sbyor ba dang / zhes pa la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chos kyi sku'i nang du 'dus pa srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam pa nyid kyi bdag nyid 'bras bu kho na'o zhes mtshan nyid de'i sbyor ba dang / zhes pa la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the two verses beginning with “The characteristics of the training and the result…” and so on.

original: de ltar ni 'phags pas /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'phags pas /
translated: Thus, the Holy Ones say:🔽Existence, peace, and equality,

original: srid dang zhi dang mnyam nyid dang// zhes pa'i 'grel par gsungs pa /
analyzed: srid dang zhi dang mnyam nyid dang// zhes pa'i 'grel par gsungs pa /
translated: In the commentary on that,

original: nga ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nga ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: I will express the equality of cyclic life and nirvana.

original: mi slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi mtshan nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi mtshan nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du ste /
translated: The meaning of the characteristics of the Sangha of those beyond training is clarified.

original: de gnyis mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa las ni mi slob par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de gnyis mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa las ni mi slob par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: From the realization of the equality of those two, one becomes one beyond training.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdor yang /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdor yang /
translated: In the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning,🔽it says:

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo spangs pa las shes bya ba la ma chags ma thogs pa rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa nye bar bzung nas bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sar brjod do zhes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo spangs pa las shes bya ba la ma chags ma thogs pa rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa nye bar bzung nas bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sar brjod do zhes so //
translated: Having taken up the knowledge of all things, without attachment and without obstruction, through abandoning the subtle defilements of afflictions and the obscurations to knowledge, the eleventh stage, the stage of Buddha, is described.

original: thar pa'i cha la phan pa la sogs pa 'di rnams su ji ltar rigs par bsgom par bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rnam pa dang sbyor ba ni yon tan mthong ba dang skyon spong ba dang mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa sngon ma can
analyzed: thar pa'i cha la phan pa la sogs pa 'di rnams su ji ltar rigs par bsgom par bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rnam pa dang sbyor ba ni yon tan mthong ba dang skyon spong ba dang mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa sngon ma can
translated: One should cultivate all these as appropriate, such as the aids to liberation, etc.,

original: goms par bya'o //
analyzed: goms par bya'o //
translated: and one should become familiar with them, having seen their good qualities, abandoned their faults, and previously understood their characteristics.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag pa rdzogs pa dang thabs la mkhas pas skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi phrin las byed do //
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag pa rdzogs pa dang thabs la mkhas pas skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi phrin las byed do //
translated: Having perfected one's own pure buddha field, one performs the deeds of a buddha according to the fortune of beings through skill in means.

original: de la / dngos po shes pa'i bye brag rnams //
analyzed: de la / dngos po shes pa'i bye brag rnams //
translated: Among them, the specific knowledges of things

original: rnam pa zhes pa mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes pa mtshan nyid do //
translated: are called aspects, which are characteristics.

original: dngos po ni dmigs pa ste bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni dmigs pa ste bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Things are objects, such as the four truths, etc.

original: de'i shes pa dang de'i ched du bye brag gang rnams kyis de yongs su shes par bya bar sgro 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i shes pa dang de'i ched du bye brag gang rnams kyis de yongs su shes par bya bar sgro 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The specific knowledges of them are the superimpositions that fully understand them.

original: rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin de rnams kyi rnam pa zhes pa ni mtshan nyid ces bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin de rnams kyi rnam pa zhes pa ni mtshan nyid ces bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The nature of reality, which is the antidote to the discordant class of grasping at permanence, etc., is posited as their aspect, which is to say, their characteristic.

original: de rnams kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i spros par sgro 'dogs pa mtha' dag las log pa'i byang chub kyi sems kho na'i rang gi ngo bo rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i spros par sgro 'dogs pa mtha' dag las log pa'i byang chub kyi sems kho na'i rang gi ngo bo rnams te /
translated: And they are the very essence of the Awakening Mind itself, which is the negation of all the fabrications of permanence, impermanence, etc.

original: gdul bya'i bsam pa tha dad pa'i ngor de dang de las ldog pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa bzhin du @177b bcom ldan 'das mar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gdul bya'i bsam pa tha dad pa'i ngor de dang de las ldog pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa bzhin du @177b bcom ldan 'das mar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The Blessed Mother is posited in accordance with the different inclinations of those to be trained, as if it were different due to the different negations.

original: 'dir yang gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin 'ga' zhig rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin 'ga' zhig rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, too, it is posited in some way or other, in accordance with the circumstances.

original: sbyor ba ni mdor bsdu na ji skad bshad pa'i byang chub kyi sems sgom pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni mdor bsdu na ji skad bshad pa'i byang chub kyi sems sgom pa kho na'o //
translated: The practice, in brief, is just the cultivation of the Awakening Mind as it has been explained.

original: rgyas par ni bstan bcos su'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni bstan bcos su'o //
translated: In detail, it is as taught in the treatises.

original: sbyor ba'i phan yon bdud kyi mthu bcom pa la sogs pa rnams ni yon tan te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i phan yon bdud kyi mthu bcom pa la sogs pa rnams ni yon tan te /
translated: The benefits of application are the qualities, such as the destruction of the power of Mara.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be explained in the chapters on aspiration and so forth.

original: skyon rnams ni sbyor ba'i bar chad do //
analyzed: skyon rnams ni sbyor ba'i bar chad do //
translated: The faults are the obstacles to application.

original: mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste 'dis mtshon par bya ba zhes pa la sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa la sogs pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste 'dis mtshon par bya ba zhes pa la sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa la sogs pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: The characteristics are fourfold: the object characterized is the mind of sentient beings, which is to be known.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid la sogs pa khyad par ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid la sogs pa khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctive attributes are the inconceivable attributes and so forth.

original: rang dang gzhan la phan pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la phan pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: The function is to benefit oneself and others and so forth.

original: de'ang phan pa ni 'gro ba lnga las rnam par bkrol nas mya ngan las 'das pa la so sor 'god pa'o //
analyzed: de'ang phan pa ni 'gro ba lnga las rnam par bkrol nas mya ngan las 'das pa la so sor 'god pa'o //
translated: Moreover, benefit is to liberate beings from the five realms and establish them in nirvana.

original: bde ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad las bkrol nas mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad las bkrol nas mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'o //
translated: Happiness is to liberate them from all suffering and establish them in nirvana.

original: skyob pa ni 'khor ba pa'i sdug bsngal rnams spang ba'i ched du chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: skyob pa ni 'khor ba pa'i sdug bsngal rnams spang ba'i ched du chos ston pa'o //
translated: Protection is to teach the Dharma for the sake of eliminating the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: skyabs ni skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i chos can gyi sems can rnams de las yongs su grol ba'o //
analyzed: skyabs ni skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i chos can gyi sems can rnams de las yongs su grol ba'o //
translated: Refuge is the complete liberation of sentient beings who are subject to the phenomena of birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: gnas ni chos thams cad dang 'brel pa med pa'i ched du chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ni chos thams cad dang 'brel pa med pa'i ched du chos ston pa'o //
translated: Abiding is the teaching of the Dharma for the sake of being unattached to all phenomena.

original: dpung gnyen ni mchog thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpung gnyen ni mchog thob par byed pa'o //
translated: A protector is one who causes the attainment of the supreme.

original: gling ni rgya mtsho dang chu bo dag la chus yongs su bcad pa'i phyogs yin pa de bzhin du sngon gyi mtha' 'khor ba dang phyi ma'i mtha' mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su bcad pa'i chos thams cad de 'di lta ste de rnams kyi stong pa nyid
analyzed: gling ni rgya mtsho dang chu bo dag la chus yongs su bcad pa'i phyogs yin pa de bzhin du sngon gyi mtha' 'khor ba dang phyi ma'i mtha' mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su bcad pa'i chos thams cad de 'di lta ste de rnams kyi stong pa nyid
translated: An island is a place that is surrounded by water in the ocean or a river. In the same way, all phenomena are surrounded by saṃsāra in the past and nirvāṇa in the future. That is to say, they are empty,

original: dang mi dmigs pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar yin zhing de thob par byed pa ni gling ngo //
analyzed: dang mi dmigs pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar yin zhing de thob par byed pa ni gling ngo //
translated: and they are not observed up to nirvāṇa. The attainment of that is an island.

original: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs su yongs su bcings pa rnams gang snang bar byed pa de yang gling ste sgron ma dang chos mtshungs pa'i phyir wa yig phyis pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs su yongs su bcings pa rnams gang snang bar byed pa de yang gling ste sgron ma dang chos mtshungs pa'i phyir wa yig phyis pa'o //
translated: The “island” is that which illuminates those who are completely bound up in the egg of ignorance. It is an “island” because it is similar to a lamp, and so the letter va is added.

original: gzhan yang gling thob par byed du 'jug pas na gling ste ded dpon no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gling thob par byed du 'jug pas na gling ste ded dpon no //
translated: Moreover, it is an “island” because it causes one to reach the island, that is, the captain.

original: de'i las kyang gling ste /
analyzed: de'i las kyang gling ste /
translated: Its function is also an “island.”

original: 'di lta ste mya ngan las 'das pa rin po che'i gling du khrid par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mya ngan las 'das pa rin po che'i gling du khrid par byed pa'o //
translated: That is to say, it is that which leads to the island of the jewel of nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir gling ni rnam pa gsum mo //🔽yongs su 'dren pa ni snying rje chen po bskyed de gzugs nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar gyi skye ba med pa'i ched dang 'gag pa med pa'i ched dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ched dang rnam par byang ba med pa'i ched du chos ston
analyzed: de'i phyir gling ni rnam pa gsum mo // yongs su 'dren pa ni snying rje chen po bskyed de gzugs nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar gyi skye ba med pa'i ched dang 'gag pa med pa'i ched dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ched dang rnam par byang ba med pa'i ched du chos ston
translated: Therefore, the “island” is threefold.🔽The “guide” is the one who, having generated great compassion, teaches the Dharma for the sake of the non-arising of form up to the non-arising of arhatship, for the sake of the non-ceasing of form up to the non-ceasing of arhatship, for the sake of the non-affliction of form up to the non-affliction of arhatship, and for the sake of the non-purification of form up to the non-purification of arhatship.

original: pa'o // lhun gyis grub pa ni lhun gyis ma grub pa 'bad rtsol dang g-yo 'gul @178a * //
analyzed: pa'o // lhun gyis grub pa ni lhun gyis ma grub pa 'bad rtsol dang g-yo 'gul @178a * //
translated: “Spontaneously present” means without spontaneity, without effort, without wavering, without movement, without mental fabrication, and without discrimination.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong bdag ste de bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong bdag ste de bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cessation of coming and going.

original: theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung zhing de'i 'bras bu mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung zhing de'i 'bras bu mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is the going forth by means of the three vehicles, and the non-actualization of their fruits.

original: rten ni 'bras bu thob pa'o zhes pa rnam pa bcu gcig go //
analyzed: rten ni 'bras bu thob pa'o zhes pa rnam pa bcu gcig go //
translated: The basis is the attainment of the fruits.

original: gang mtshon par bya ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang mtshon par bya ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: The essence is that which is to be revealed, such as the non-revealing mental activity, passion, etc., and emptiness, etc.

original: yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum las rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum las rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: Again, what is the difference between the complete clear realization of all aspects and the three knowledges?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa so sor nges pa nyid kyis rnam pa so sor nges pa'i yul can rnams te //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa so sor nges pa nyid kyis rnam pa so sor nges pa'i yul can rnams te //
translated: The three knowledges are the subjects that have a definite aspect, because they have a definite aspect as previously explained.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni rnam pa mtha' dag gi yul can no zhes pa 'di ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni rnam pa mtha' dag gi yul can no zhes pa 'di ni khyad par ro //
translated: The complete clear realization of all aspects has all aspects as its object. This is the difference.

original: yang na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum mtshan nyid par rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: yang na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum mtshan nyid par rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: or else, the three knowledges are established as authentic.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba pa'o //
translated: The realization of all aspects is the path of preparation.

original: yang na rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pas rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pas rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: Or else, the realization of all aspects is distinguished by the classification of the counteragents and their antidotes.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de lta ma yin te rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa 'di ni khyad par gzhan no zhes 'phags pas gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de lta ma yin te rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa 'di ni khyad par gzhan no zhes 'phags pas gsungs so //
translated: But the knowledge of all aspects is not like that because its aspect is naturally peaceful. This is another difference.

original: gang 'dod pa yang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa gsum la ni sgom pa gong nas gong gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi rnam pa thams cad du khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa'i ye shes
analyzed: gang 'dod pa yang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa gsum la ni sgom pa gong nas gong gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi rnam pa thams cad du khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa'i ye shes
translated: The knowledge that is included in the path of distinction in the three realizations of the realization of all aspects and so on is the path of meditation that is distinguished by the state of higher and higher states.

original: zag pa med pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rim gyis skye'o zhes pas lan cig la skye ba dgag pa'i ched du nges par 'byed pa'i cha la phan pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad du gsungs so //🔽zhes kha cig go zhes rgya cher 'grel du seng ge bzang pos bshad de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rim gyis skye'o zhes pas lan cig la skye ba dgag pa'i ched du nges par 'byed pa'i cha la phan pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad du gsungs so // zhes kha cig go zhes rgya cher 'grel du seng ge bzang pos bshad de /
translated: The small, medium and great uncontaminated faculties arise in sequence.🔽This is explained in the Subcommentary, which says,

original: gnas skabs gzhan rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs pa las 'di'i yang 'dod pa'o zhes mtshon no //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs pa las 'di'i yang 'dod pa'o zhes mtshon no //
translated: “Some say that the term conducive to penetrative insight and so on is stated to refute the arising of these faculties in one session.”

original: de yang 'phags pa'i bzhed pa dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa'i bzhed pa dang 'gal te /
translated: This also contradicts the assertion of the Arya.

original: de ltar ni 'phags pas /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'phags pas /
translated: The Arya says:

original: mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
translated: The unconditioned, generosity and so on,

original: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //
translated: skill in the means of perfect accomplishment,

original: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
translated: the realization of all aspects

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be conducive to liberation.

original: ces pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par bshad par stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i gzhung bris pa /
analyzed: ces pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par bshad par stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i gzhung bris pa /
translated: This is written in the commentary to the verses of the Twenty Five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom Sutra.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste thabs la mkhas pa dang ma bral bar sbyin pa sbyin zhing mtshan mar yang mi byed ces pa nas brtsams te ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @178b pa nyid sgom zhing /🔽mtshan mar yang mi byed do zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste thabs la mkhas pa dang ma bral bar sbyin pa sbyin zhing mtshan mar yang mi byed ces pa nas brtsams te ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @178b pa nyid sgom zhing / mtshan mar yang mi byed do zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: From the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, the bodhisattva gives gifts without being separated from skill in means, and does not make signs, and so on, up to the point where he cultivates the knowledge of all modes, and does not make signs.

original: slar yang rang nyid kyis dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin rnam pa lnga po thar pa'i cha la phan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bar rnam par bshad nas /
analyzed: slar yang rang nyid kyis dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin rnam pa lnga po thar pa'i cha la phan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bar rnam par bshad nas /
translated: Again, faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom, which are of the nature of the five limbs, are explained as the roots of the wholesome which are favorable to the part of liberation.

original: dad pa la sogs pa 'di rnams dbang por brjod par bya ba ma yin te dbang po'i don med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa 'di rnams dbang por brjod par bya ba ma yin te dbang po'i don med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that these, faith, etc., are not to be called faculties, because the meaning of faculty is absent.

original: 'di rnams drod la sogs pa la dbang po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams drod la sogs pa la dbang po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The idea is that these become faculties in the heat, etc.

original: 'di rnams khyad par gyi lam la dbang po ma yin pa nyid na chos kyi sku la dbang po ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di rnams khyad par gyi lam la dbang po ma yin pa nyid na chos kyi sku la dbang po ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: If these are not faculties in the special path, then it follows that they are not faculties in the Dharma body.

original: sngar gyi rtogs pa'i rnam pa rnams 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa med na phyi mar rjes su 'jug pa kho na'o zhes pa ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi rtogs pa'i rnam pa rnams 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa med na phyi mar rjes su 'jug pa kho na'o zhes pa ni rigs pa'o //
translated: It is reasonable to say that the aspects of realization previously attained are only subsequently engaged if there is no proximate condition that is incompatible with them.

original: slar yang dad pa la sogs pa rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs nas /
analyzed: slar yang dad pa la sogs pa rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs nas /
translated: Having again taught the classification of faith, etc., as small, middling, and great,

original: 'di thams cad thos pa dang bsams pa las byung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di thams cad thos pa dang bsams pa las byung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that all of these are produced from hearing and reflection,

original: de las dang por bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de las dang por bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause for first entering the teaching.

original: 'dir thar pa ni bral ba'i khyad par te de'i cha la phan pa nyid kyi phyir thar pa'i cha la phan pa'o zhes te /
analyzed: 'dir thar pa ni bral ba'i khyad par te de'i cha la phan pa nyid kyi phyir thar pa'i cha la phan pa'o zhes te /
translated: Here, liberation is a special separation, and since it is beneficial for a portion of that, it is beneficial for a portion of liberation.

original: de ma thag rgyud yongs su smin par 'gro ba'i phyir yongs su smin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha la phan pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ma thag rgyud yongs su smin par 'gro ba'i phyir yongs su smin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha la phan pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it immediately becomes fully matured, it should be called the 'factor of ascertainment conducive to penetration'.

original: slar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs su bshad pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha la phan pa ni mngon par rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs su bshad pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha la phan pa ni mngon par rtogs pa yin la /
translated: The factor of ascertainment explained in the context of omniscience is realization.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba pa'o zhes so //
translated: This is the one who practices.

original: de la sbyor ba ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: There, the practice is the complete realization of all aspects.

original: de'i 'di lta ste sems can thams cad la mnyam pa dang byams pa'i sems la sogs pa'i khyad par can no //
analyzed: de'i 'di lta ste sems can thams cad la mnyam pa dang byams pa'i sems la sogs pa'i khyad par can no //
translated: This is its distinction, namely the attitude of equality and loving kindness towards all sentient beings.

original: de lta na byang chub sems dpa' dro bar gyur pa la gnas phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags bag la nyal thams cad spangs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la ci ltar 'thad ce na /
analyzed: de lta na byang chub sems dpa' dro bar gyur pa la gnas phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags bag la nyal thams cad spangs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la ci ltar 'thad ce na /
translated: In that case, how could the signs of irreversibility, the abandonment of all latent states, the factors conducive to penetrative insight derived from contaminated meditation, be tenable for a bodhisattva abiding in heat?

original: de'ang 'phags pas gsungs te bag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad med pa ma rig pa dang lta pa'i zag pas bsdus pa'i bag la nyal rnams yin gyi 'dod pa dang srid pa'i zag pas bsdus pa rnams ni ma yin te byang chub sems dpa' bsams bzhin
analyzed: de'ang 'phags pas gsungs te bag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad med pa ma rig pa dang lta pa'i zag pas bsdus pa'i bag la nyal rnams yin gyi 'dod pa dang srid pa'i zag pas bsdus pa rnams ni ma yin te byang chub sems dpa' bsams bzhin
translated: This is also stated by the Ārya. The nonexistence of all latent states is the nonexistence of all latent states subsumed by the contaminants of ignorance and view, but it is not the nonexistence of those subsumed by the contaminants of desire and existence, because bodhisattvas intentionally

original: du srid pa len pa'i phyir ro zhes pa 'dis te 'dir bag la nyal gyi rgyun la mngon par dgongs pas so //
analyzed: du srid pa len pa'i phyir ro zhes pa 'dis te 'dir bag la nyal gyi rgyun la mngon par dgongs pas so //
translated: take existence. This is stated here, because the continuum of latent states is intended.

original: de ltar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs su /
analyzed: de ltar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs su /
translated: In this way, in the context of omniscience,

original: bzod pa @179a * //
analyzed: bzod pa @179a * //
translated: it is said:🔽“The bodhisattva who has attained the acceptance that phenomena are not produced does not regress from the acceptance that phenomena are not produced.”

original: 'bring la de'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do zhes pha la sogs pa 'phags pas rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: 'bring la de'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do zhes pha la sogs pa 'phags pas rnam par bshad pa /
translated: “One does not generate a mind possessing attachment to one’s father and so on.”

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa yongs su dag pa thob pa dang zhes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa yongs su dag pa thob pa dang zhes so //
translated: “One attains a completely pure body and so on because one does not generate a mind possessing any affliction.”

original: gang rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas thams cad ji ltar 'gyur de lta bu'i bag la nyal zhe sdang gi rgyun spangs pa ni bag la nyal thams cad spangs pa'o zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: gang rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas thams cad ji ltar 'gyur de lta bu'i bag la nyal zhe sdang gi rgyun spangs pa ni bag la nyal thams cad spangs pa'o zhes bshad pa /
translated: Ratnākaraśānti explains that “all latent states” are the continuum of latent hatred, which is the cause of anger.

original: de yang bag la nyal med par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs las dang / 'phags pa'i gsungs las gzhan du'o zhes pas mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang bag la nyal med par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs las dang / 'phags pa'i gsungs las gzhan du'o zhes pas mi rigs so //
translated: He says that it is illogical to say that the absence of latent states is taught in the scriptures of the Bhagavān and in the scriptures of the āryas.

original: yang 'phags pas gsungs pa rtse mor gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags sems gya gyu med pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa las sems 'khyog po dang bral bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das pa las gong nas gong
analyzed: yang 'phags pas gsungs pa rtse mor gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags sems gya gyu med pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa las sems 'khyog po dang bral bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das pa las gong nas gong
translated: Again, the noble Asanga says that the sign of irreversibility in the stage of the summit is the absence of crookedness of mind, because the mind is free from crookedness due to the purity of the roots of virtue.

original: du lus dang ngag dang sems yongs su dag pa sems yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so zhes so //
analyzed: du lus dang ngag dang sems yongs su dag pa sems yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so zhes so //
translated: He says that it is due to the cause of holding the mind, which is the complete purity of body, speech, and mind, that one passes beyond the stage of the śrāvaka and so on, and that one progresses higher and higher.

original: 'dir 'das pa ni mos pa par mngon par dgongs la /
analyzed: 'dir 'das pa ni mos pa par mngon par dgongs la /
translated: Here, Asanga clearly intends “passed beyond” to mean “passed beyond the stage of the śrāvaka and so on.”

original: rtogs pa pa ni mthong ba'i lam kho nar gsungs so //
analyzed: rtogs pa pa ni mthong ba'i lam kho nar gsungs so //
translated: And he says that the stage of the path of seeing is the stage of the sign of irreversibility.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par gyi lam du dgongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par gyi lam du dgongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he does not intend the path of seeing to be the path of preparation.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags rgyas par bshad par /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags rgyas par bshad par /
translated: Similarly, in the extensive explanation of the sign of irreversibility in the stage of the path of seeing,

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig la ni rjes su shes pa dang 'brel pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba srid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig la ni rjes su shes pa dang 'brel pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba srid de /
translated: On the occasion of perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, one falls to the śrāvaka level and so on, because it is related to subsequent knowledge.

original: de ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen por 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen por 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises as the antidote to the three realms.

original: sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid thob pa yongs su spong ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid thob pa yongs su spong ste /
translated: On the occasion of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, bodhisattvas obtain freedom from attachment and abandon it.

original: sems can gyi don dang rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don dang rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because they take up a state that is in accord with the purpose of sentient beings.

original: khyad par gyi lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos sa gzhan du ltung ba yang ci ltar srid de /
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos sa gzhan du ltung ba yang ci ltar srid de /
translated: How could a great bodhisattva abiding on the path of preparation fall to other levels?

original: tshu rol gyis rnams su'ang ma yin pa de ci ltar gong ma rnams su 'gyur /
analyzed: tshu rol gyis rnams su'ang ma yin pa de ci ltar gong ma rnams su 'gyur /
translated: If it is not on this side, how could it be on the higher side?

original: gang yang ring du song ba'i sa la mtshan ma med par gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ni 'bad pa yod pa kho na las 'byung gi cig shos ltar ni ma yin no zhes dgongs par 'phags pa dpa' bos gsungs pa //
analyzed: gang yang ring du song ba'i sa la mtshan ma med par gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ni 'bad pa yod pa kho na las 'byung gi cig shos ltar ni ma yin no zhes dgongs par 'phags pa dpa' bos gsungs pa //
translated: The Āryaśūra says this:

original: yid ni mchog tu g-yo bas log / de phyir de la dbugs ma phyung //
analyzed: yid ni mchog tu g-yo bas log / de phyir de la dbugs ma phyung //
translated: The mind is extremely fickle, so do not breathe a sigh of relief.

original: sa bzhin @179b g-yo med ma thob par //
analyzed: sa bzhin @179b g-yo med ma thob par //
translated: Until you attain the unshakable like the earth,

original: brtan med mi g-yo'i sa rtogs dka' //
analyzed: brtan med mi g-yo'i sa rtogs dka' //
translated: the unshakable stage is difficult to realize.

original: zhes so // gang yang 'phags pa sa bcu par sa brgyad pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // gang yang 'phags pa sa bcu par sa brgyad pa las gsungs pa /
translated: And in the Ārya Daśabhūmika, it says about the eighth stage:

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams byang chub sems dpa' de mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo rnams la 'jug par mi mdzad na de'i tshe nyid 'di'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams byang chub sems dpa' de mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo rnams la 'jug par mi mdzad na de'i tshe nyid 'di'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: If the Bhagavat Buddhas do not cause the bodhisattva to enter the doors of accomplishment, then at that time he would attain nirvāṇa.

original: de la ldog pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
analyzed: de la ldog pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
translated: There, the reversal and complete nirvāṇa

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ltar /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ltar /
translated: are like the śrāvakas, etc.

original: mar me bzhin du mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: mar me bzhin du mya ngan 'das //
translated: Like a lamp, he attains nirvāṇa.

original: de yi sems ni rnam par grol //
analyzed: de yi sems ni rnam par grol //
translated: His mind is liberated.

original: zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not nirvana,

original: sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la spro ba'i yid la byed pa rnams ring du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la spro ba'i yid la byed pa rnams ring du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because from the time of generating the resolve, he has abandoned attention that delights in the vehicle of the sravakas, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not the nirvana of the Buddha, because he has not abandoned the obstructions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'on kyang 'dir dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo tshad mar byas nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo tshad mar byas nas /
translated: However, here, taking the Saddharmapundarika-sutra as authoritative,

original: ji ltar 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das par rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa de gzhin du dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das par rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa de gzhin du dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das par rig par bya ste /
translated: the nirvana of the bodhisattvas, which is like the nirvana of the sravakas, such as the noble Sariputra, etc., should be understood as a provisional nirvana.

original: dus re zhig sems can gyi don rgyun du chad pa gzugs nas so //
analyzed: dus re zhig sems can gyi don rgyun du chad pa gzugs nas so //
translated: For a time, the benefit of sentient beings is interrupted, from the form realm on down.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de nyid 'di'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
translated: That itself would be his nirvana,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba rgyun 'chad do zhes so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba rgyun 'chad do zhes so //
translated: and the activity for all sentient beings would cease.

original: de bzhin du der brgyad pa kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la byang chub sems dpa' la tshad med pa rnams dgos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du der brgyad pa kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la byang chub sems dpa' la tshad med pa rnams dgos te /
translated: Similarly, in that context, on the moment of subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin, a bodhisattva needs the immeasurables,

original: gzhan du na skad cig dgu pa la sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med pas 'gog par ltung ngo zhes pa 'dir yang dus re zhig sems can gyi don rgyun 'chad pa 'gog par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na skad cig dgu pa la sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med pas 'gog par ltung ngo zhes pa 'dir yang dus re zhig sems can gyi don rgyun 'chad pa 'gog par shes par bya'o //
translated: otherwise, on the ninth moment, he would fall into cessation, since he would not be concerned with the realm of sentient beings.

original: gang yang brtan pa'i sems can gyi don no yongs su mi gtong bar 'phags pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang yang brtan pa'i sems can gyi don no yongs su mi gtong bar 'phags pas gsungs pa /
translated: Also, the noble ones say that a bodhisattva does not give up the welfare of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba spang ba'i don du snying rje chen po la mngon par phyogs par byed pa'i sems pas shes pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba spang ba'i don du snying rje chen po la mngon par phyogs par byed pa'i sems pas shes pa /
translated: In this context, in order to abandon falling into nirvana, he is inclined toward great compassion.

original: der yang mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba ni dus re zhig gzhan gyi don rgyun 'chad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: der yang mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba ni dus re zhig gzhan gyi don rgyun 'chad pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, falling into nirvana means that for a while, the continuum of benefit for others is interrupted.

original: sar ltung ba yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sar ltung ba yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And falling to the level of the śrāvakas and so on would be the same.

original: de lta ma yin te /🔽nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba ni rtog pa ste gzhan gyi don la dga' ba dang bral ba'i ngo bo'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bdag @180a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te / nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba ni rtog pa ste gzhan gyi don la dga' ba dang bral ba'i ngo bo'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bdag @180a * //
translated: That is not so.

original: nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Falling to the level of the śrāvakas and so on is conceptual, but nirvana is not by nature the cessation of delight in the welfare of others.

original: 'gyur du chug na yang de'i tshe ni brjod pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur du chug na yang de'i tshe ni brjod pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: Even if it were possible, at that time, one should understand the reasonings that will be explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: For that very reason, Ārya Maitreya says:

original: de ltar yongs su shes pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang lags zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su shes pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang lags zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “What is the nirvana of the bodhisattva who possesses complete knowledge and so on?”

original: 'di rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zab ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zab ste /
translated: The Bhagavat said, “The nirvana of these is profound.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because this is neither nirvana nor not nirvana.

original: de ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba ni 'di rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba ni 'di rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The non-abandonment of cyclic existence, which is undertaken for the sake of others, is not nirvana for them.

original: bdag gi don las brtsams te mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong pa ni 'di rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don las brtsams te mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong pa ni 'di rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The non-abandonment of nirvana, which is undertaken for the sake of themselves, is nirvana for them.

original: gcig ma btang na cig shos gtong ba'i phyir gnyis ka dag mi gtong ba mi rigs she na /
analyzed: gcig ma btang na cig shos gtong ba'i phyir gnyis ka dag mi gtong ba mi rigs she na /
translated: If one is not abandoned, the other is not abandoned. Therefore, it is not reasonable that both are not abandoned.

original: gnyis kar rnam par mi rtog pa ste der de dag gis yid 'byung ba med pas de'i phyir gnyis ka mi gtong ba rigs so //
analyzed: gnyis kar rnam par mi rtog pa ste der de dag gis yid 'byung ba med pas de'i phyir gnyis ka mi gtong ba rigs so //
translated: Both are non-conceptual, because they are not disgusted with either. Therefore, it is reasonable that both are not abandoned.

original: de'i tshe de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las kyang 'da'o zhes mi rigs so zhe na sems la dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas gang 'khor ba kun du ston pa de ni 'di'i 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las kyang 'da'o zhes mi rigs so zhe na sems la dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas gang 'khor ba kun du ston pa de ni 'di'i 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained mastery over mind, through his skill in means, displays saṃsāra, and that is his not forsaking saṃsāra.

original: gang stong pa nyid kyang yin la dmigs pa med pa la gnas pa yang yin pa de 'di'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid kyang yin la dmigs pa med pa la gnas pa yang yin pa de 'di'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong ba'o zhes so //
translated: That which is emptiness and also abides in the absence of reference points is his not forsaking nirvāṇa.

original: 'di lta bu kho na la dgongs nas slob dpon zla ba grags pas /
analyzed: 'di lta bu kho na la dgongs nas slob dpon zla ba grags pas /
translated: Thinking precisely of this, the master Candrakīrti says:

original: sa brgyad pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi nyi ma shar bas nyon mongs pa thams cad mun pa bzhin spong ngo zhes khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'byung bar gsungs pa ni de nyid 'di'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro🔽zhes pa ste /
