analyzed: sa brgyad pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi nyi ma shar bas nyon mongs pa thams cad mun pa bzhin spong ngo zhes khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'byung bar gsungs pa ni de nyid 'di'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro🔽zhes pa ste /
translated: “On the eighth ground, the sun of nonconceptual wisdom rises, and all afflictions are eliminated like darkness.” The arising of freedom from attachment to the three realms is precisely his nirvāṇa.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no fear that one who is not free from attachment will attain nirvana.

original: 'khor ba 'gags kyang dbang bcu thob pa las de rnams yid kyis rang bzhin gyi lus sna tshogs pas srid pa'i 'khor bar sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa mi 'gal lo zhes rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'gags kyang dbang bcu thob pa las de rnams yid kyis rang bzhin gyi lus sna tshogs pas srid pa'i 'khor bar sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa mi 'gal lo zhes rnam par bshad do //
translated: Even though samsara is stopped, it is not contradictory that one who has attained the ten masteries creates various mental bodies in samsara and perfects the qualities of a buddha.

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes kyang /
translated: Arya Vimuktisena also says:

original: sa 'di las yang dag par 'da' ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag par bskul ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba lhag ma mngon @180b par 'du byed pa bzung nas so //
analyzed: sa 'di las yang dag par 'da' ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag par bskul ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba lhag ma mngon @180b par 'du byed pa bzung nas so //
translated: One who passes beyond this stage does so by being urged by the buddhas to take up the remaining deeds of a bodhisattva.

original: 'da' ba ni rnam pa gnyis te mthong bas 'da' ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis dag la ste /
analyzed: 'da' ba ni rnam pa gnyis te mthong bas 'da' ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis dag la ste /
translated: Passing beyond is of two types: passing beyond by seeing is for sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva path of meditation does not exist for them.

original: gnas pas 'da' ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'i bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes nges par dpyad do //
analyzed: gnas pas 'da' ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'i bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes nges par dpyad do //
translated: One should definitely analyze the meaning of the sutra statement, “One passes beyond by abiding,” because it has the characteristic of the uninterrupted path of the stage of nonregression.

original: slar yang 'phags pas /
analyzed: slar yang 'phags pas /
translated: Again, the Ārya states:

original: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //🔽chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir // chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
translated: Because it is continuous,🔽the small, medium, and great

original: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: are divided into small of the small and so on.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam dgur 'dod //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam dgur 'dod //
translated: It is asserted that there are nine divisions.

original: ces pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pas nas dgu pa la de'i gnyen por lam chen po'i chen po'i rnam par 'gyur bzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ces pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pas nas dgu pa la de'i gnyen por lam chen po'i chen po'i rnam par 'gyur bzhes gsungs so //
translated: The explanation of this verse is that the small of the small is from the perspective of the path of meditation, up to the ninth stage, where its antidote is the great of the great path.

original: lam gyi rnam pa 'di ni sa bcu pa ste 'dod khams su tha ma yin na de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis khyad par gyi lam la ci ltar rigs /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa 'di ni sa bcu pa ste 'dod khams su tha ma yin na de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis khyad par gyi lam la ci ltar rigs /
translated: This aspect of the path is the tenth stage, and if it is the final stage of the desire realm, then how could it be the special path, as will be explained?

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'di'i 'grel par 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas dgu rnams su rnam pa dgu rgyun chags su 'byung ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes seng ge bzang pos bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'di'i 'grel par 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas dgu rnams su rnam pa dgu rgyun chags su 'byung ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes seng ge bzang pos bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, Haribhadra explains in his commentary on this verse that the nine uninterrupted and liberated paths that occur in the nine stages of the desire realm and so on are the path of meditation.🔽This is tenable if it follows the intention of the Arya but not otherwise.

original: po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i gang zag gi gdams ngag gi yul rnams te /🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i rang bzhin go cha'i sgrub pa zhes par yang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i gang zag gi gdams ngag gi yul rnams te / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i rang bzhin go cha'i sgrub pa zhes par yang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The objects of the instructions for the persons of great, medium, and small capacities.🔽The armor practice is also presented as having the nature of the applications of mindfulness, the correct exertions, and the bases of supernatural power.

original: shes rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three kinds of wisdom are:

original: de la gang la la gcig pu gcig dben par song ste lung gi don dpyad pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de thos pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang la la gcig pu gcig dben par song ste lung gi don dpyad pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de thos pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom that arises from listening is the wisdom that arises from the analysis of the meaning of the scriptures by one who has gone to a solitary place and is alone.

original: de lta na yang la la the tshom za ste rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i stobs las skyes pa de rigs pa bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang la la the tshom za ste rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i stobs las skyes pa de rigs pa bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom that arises from reflection is the wisdom that arises from the power of inference, etc.

original: de dag gis the tshom gyi rtsa ba phyung bas 'bad pa byed pa las ting nge 'dzin thob pa las bsgoms pa las byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis the tshom gyi rtsa ba phyung bas 'bad pa byed pa las ting nge 'dzin thob pa las bsgoms pa las byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom that arises from meditation is the wisdom that arises from the effort of one who has uprooted the root of doubt and has attained concentration.

original: bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang zhi gnas lhag mthong dag go //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang zhi gnas lhag mthong dag go //
translated: Meditation is threefold: serenity, insight, and their union.

original: zhi gnas rdzogs nas 'jug pa na gang lhan cig spyod par 'gyur ba shes rab lta ba dang rig pa dang blo dang snang ba de lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhi gnas rdzogs nas 'jug pa na gang lhan cig spyod par 'gyur ba shes rab lta ba dang rig pa dang blo dang snang ba de lhag mthong ngo //
translated: When serenity is perfected and one enters into insight, the wisdom that accompanies it, the view, knowledge, intelligence, and insight, is insight.

original: de gnyis ka bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de gnyis ka bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: Both of them are wisdom born of meditation.

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa nyid du dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thams cad rang gi rgyud la 'byung ba las yang dag par 'grub par bya bas shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa ni thar pa'i
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa nyid du dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thams cad rang gi rgyud la 'byung ba las yang dag par 'grub par bya bas shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa ni thar pa'i
translated: Therefore, the wisdom and means of accomplishing all the qualities of a Buddha, such as generosity, through the process of the intuition that perceives the signlessness of all things, is the

original: cha la phan pa'o //
analyzed: cha la phan pa'o //
translated: benefit of the part of liberation.

original: 'dir thar pa ni bral ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: 'dir thar pa ni bral ba'i khyad par te /
translated: Here, liberation is a special separation.

original: de'i cha la phan pa nyid kyi phyir thar pa'i cha la phan zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i cha la phan pa nyid kyi phyir thar pa'i cha la phan zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is the benefit of that part, it is called the benefit of the part of liberation.

original: thog mar rnam pa kun mngon par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thog mar rnam pa kun mngon par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: First, the cause for entering the teaching, which has the nature of the full realization of all aspects, is that which arises from hearing and reflection.

original: de bzhin du yang bcom ldan 'das ma brgyad stong par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bcom ldan 'das ma brgyad stong par gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, the Blessed One said in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines:

original: rab 'byor de'i phyir de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya zhing thabs la mkhas pas 'byung bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de'i phyir de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya zhing thabs la mkhas pas 'byung bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: “Subhūti, for that reason, at that time, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should cultivate the perfection of wisdom and arise through skillful means.”

original: de la byang chub ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab tu gyur par son pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab tu gyur par son pa ste /
translated: Here, enlightenment is the perfection of complete and perfect enlightenment.

original: de la 'di'i sems dpa' mngon par 'dod pa rtogs pa'o zhes pa byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di'i sems dpa' mngon par 'dod pa rtogs pa'o zhes pa byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: In that, the bodhisattva is one who aspires for realization.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mtshog nyid du bya ba'i don du gang mngon par 'dod pa de ni chen po ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mtshog nyid du bya ba'i don du gang mngon par 'dod pa de ni chen po ste /
translated: That which is aspired for by him is the great, for the sake of being the foremost of all sentient beings.

original: chen po nyid de 'di'i yin pas sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po nyid de 'di'i yin pas sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: Since greatness belongs to him, he is a great being.

original: tshig gnyis po 'dis sems bskyed gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig gnyis po 'dis sems bskyed gsungs so //
translated: These two lines teach the generation of the Thought.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @181b ni rnam pa thams cad kyis chos ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @181b ni rnam pa thams cad kyis chos ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the thorough knowledge of all phenomena in every way.

original: thabs ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yul la dad pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa la brtson 'grus dang / dge ba 'dod pa nyid la sogs pa'i dran pa dang / byed pa po dang las dang bya ba mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: thabs ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yul la dad pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa la brtson 'grus dang / dge ba 'dod pa nyid la sogs pa'i dran pa dang / byed pa po dang las dang bya ba mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The method is faith in the object of Buddha, etc., the striving in giving, etc., the mindfulness of the desire for virtue, etc., and the samadhi of the non-apprehension of agent, action, and object.

original: de ltar na dbang po'i don med pa'i phyir dbang po'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsag par bya'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po'i don med pa'i phyir dbang po'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsag par bya'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur
translated: Thus, because the object of the faculties does not exist, one should accumulate the roots of virtue that are in conformity with liberation, which are by nature faith, striving, mindfulness, samadhi, and wisdom that are not the essence of the faculties.

original: ro // de'i phyir shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba las nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ro // de'i phyir shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba las nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one falls to the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels due to being devoid of the skill in wisdom and method.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /🔽mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa / mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽The skill in accomplishing the signless

original: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //🔽rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
analyzed: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni // rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
translated: generosity and so forth🔽is asserted to be conducive to liberation

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
translated: in the realization of all aspects.🔽Faith that focuses on the Buddha and so forth,🔽effort that takes generosity and so forth as its domain,🔽mindfulness that is complete in terms of intention,

original: sangs rgyas sogs dmigs dad pa dang // sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang ; / bsam pa phun tshogs dran pa dang // rnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin dang // chos rnams rnam pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sogs dmigs dad pa dang // sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang ; / bsam pa phun tshogs dran pa dang // rnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin dang // chos rnams rnam pa thams cad kyis //
translated: meditative concentration that is nonconceptual,🔽and wisdom that is the knowledge of phenomena in all aspects

original: shes pa'i shes rab ces rnam lnga //
analyzed: shes pa'i shes rab ces rnam lnga //
translated: are asserted to be the five aspects of the path of accumulation.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnon po yis //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnon po yis //
translated: Those of sharp faculties realize complete enlightenment

original: rtogs sla rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed /
analyzed: rtogs sla rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed /
translated: easily, while those of dull faculties realize it with difficulty.

original: ces so // dad pa la sogs pa'i rim pa yang rigs pa ste ;
analyzed: ces so // dad pa la sogs pa'i rim pa yang rigs pa ste ;
translated: The order of faith and so forth is also reasonable.

original: dad pas ni rab tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa las brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: dad pas ni rab tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa las brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: Through faith, one undertakes with vigor, having taken to mind the things that are delightful.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas ni dran pa nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas ni dran pa nye bar gnas so //
translated: Through the undertaking of vigor, mindfulness is well established.

original: dran pa nye bar gnas pas ni sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas pas ni sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: Through the establishment of mindfulness, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes so //
translated: Through the concentration of the mind, one has knowledge in accordance with reality.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rab tu dga' ba las dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba las dga' ba skye'o //
translated: From delight, joy arises.

original: yid dga' ba las lus shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: yid dga' ba las lus shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: From the joy of mind, there is a fitness of body.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni bde ba myong bar byed do //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni bde ba myong bar byed do //
translated: From the fitness of body, there is a feeling of ease.

original: bde bar gyur pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: bde bar gyur pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: From the feeling of ease, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes so //
translated: From the concentration of the mind, there is knowledge in accordance with reality.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das ma bar mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das ma bar mar gsungs pa /
translated: But the Blessed One has said in the Madhyama Āgama:

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis dmigs su med pa'i phyir 'ga' la yang spyod pa med pa de kho na spyod pa ste go cha la sogs
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis dmigs su med pa'i phyir 'ga' la yang spyod pa med pa de kho na spyod pa ste go cha la sogs
translated: The bodhisattva who does not practice is one who practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa sgrub pa bzhi'i ngo bo yin la /🔽las dang po pa de ci @182a * //
analyzed: pa sgrub pa bzhi'i ngo bo yin la / las dang po pa de ci @182a * //
translated: Since all phenomena are empty and cannot be observed, the very absence of practice is the practice, which is the essence of the four practices of armor and so on.

original: ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ce na /
analyzed: ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ce na /
translated: How does the beginner practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das ma nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Hasn't the Bhagavatī herself taught this?

original: bcom ldan 'das ci ltar las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpas zhes pa la sogs pa zhus pa'i mthar sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung nas chos thams cad la dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci ltar las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpas zhes pa la sogs pa zhus pa'i mthar sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung nas chos thams cad la dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o zhes te /
translated: The Bhagavatī replies, The beginner bodhisattva should train in the perfection of wisdom by not observing any phenomena, beginning from the first production of the thought of awakening.

original: 'dis ni gal te yang las dang po pa la don dam pa'i spyod pa med mod de'i don du bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te yang las dang po pa la don dam pa'i spyod pa med mod de'i don du bslab par bya ste /
translated: This means that although the beginner does not have ultimate practice, he should train for that purpose.

original: slob par byed pa kho na spyod pa'o zhes brjod do zhes bstan to zhes slob dpon dbyig gnyen no //
analyzed: slob par byed pa kho na spyod pa'o zhes brjod do zhes bstan to zhes slob dpon dbyig gnyen no //
translated: The master Vasubandhu has taught that “one who practices is only one who is learning.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di 'dra ba ni las dang po pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa la spyod pa go cha'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di 'dra ba ni las dang po pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa la spyod pa go cha'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the armor practice of the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the six perfections, for a beginner.

original: der 'di'i don du gnyer bya'i don du gnyer bya nyid nye bar ston pa gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa ste /🔽thob pa'i yon tan yongs su bsrung ba'i don gyis mi nyams par byed pa nye bar bzung nas gdams pa'o //
analyzed: der 'di'i don du gnyer bya'i don du gnyer bya nyid nye bar ston pa gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa ste / thob pa'i yon tan yongs su bsrung ba'i don gyis mi nyams par byed pa nye bar bzung nas gdams pa'o //
translated: In that regard, instruction and subsequent instruction are the teaching of the very thing that is to be pursued as the goal of this practice.🔽Instruction is the taking up of the non-degeneration of the qualities that have been attained, for the sake of their preservation.

original: de'i 'og tu ma thob pa'i yon tan thob par byed pa nye bar bzung nas rjes su bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ma thob pa'i yon tan thob par byed pa nye bar bzung nas rjes su bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Subsequent instruction is the taking up of the attainment of the qualities that have not been attained.

original: seng ge bzang po ni rim pa bzhin du nyan pa'i skabs su gzhung 'dzin pa'i ched du slob pa dang sems pa'i gnas skabs bzung ba'i don mi brjed pa'i ched dang / bsgom pa'i gnas skabs su sngar med pa bskyed pa'i ched du gsum po 'di'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: seng ge bzang po ni rim pa bzhin du nyan pa'i skabs su gzhung 'dzin pa'i ched du slob pa dang sems pa'i gnas skabs bzung ba'i don mi brjed pa'i ched dang / bsgom pa'i gnas skabs su sngar med pa bskyed pa'i ched du gsum po 'di'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Haribhadra says that the three are respectively for the purpose of study in order to hold the text when listening, for the purpose of not forgetting the meaning of what is held when reflecting, and for the purpose of generating what has not previously been generated when meditating.🔽In the intermediate version of the Mother,

original: de la bcom ldan 'das ma bar mar /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das ma bar mar /
translated: it says:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la mtshan mar mi byed cing dmigs su med pa ni go cha chen po nyid kyis go cha'i sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do //🔽de bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur zhing de rnams kyi ro myang bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la mtshan mar mi byed cing dmigs su med pa ni go cha chen po nyid kyis go cha'i sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do // de bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur zhing de rnams kyi ro myang bar yang mi byed /
translated: The great armor itself is the practice of armor, which is the nonconceptualization and nonapprehension of the perfections with a mind endowed with omniscience.🔽They will enter into the absorptions and will not experience the taste of those.

original: de rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrog la de rnams kyi dbang gis kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrog la de rnams kyi dbang gis kyang mi skye ste /
translated: They will not be carried away by those and will not be born under their power.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med par mthong bas gnas kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon du mi byed do zhes thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid kyis thabs la mkhas pas yongs su gzung ba
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med par mthong bas gnas kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon du mi byed do zhes thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid kyis thabs la mkhas pas yongs su gzung ba
translated: Thus, by the armor of the perfection of wisdom endowed with skill in means, they are taken hold of by skill in means.

original: chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid do //
translated: They are taken hold of by the Dharma body,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa la sogs pa gsungs pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba chen po nyid @182b do ;
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa la sogs pa gsungs pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba chen po nyid @182b do ;
translated: and by the great taking hold of the spiritual friends praised by the Buddhas of the ten directions and so on.

original: / de la go cha ni ya lad dang srung byed de dbu ma'i sgrub pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad du rnam pa thams cad kyis ji ltar tshad du bya ba ltar pha rol gnon pa'o //
analyzed: / de la go cha ni ya lad dang srung byed de dbu ma'i sgrub pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad du rnam pa thams cad kyis ji ltar tshad du bya ba ltar pha rol gnon pa'o //
translated: Armor is a suit of mail and a defense; it is the perfection of wisdom, the practice of the middle way, the conquest of the opponent in every way, to the extent that it is to be measured.

original: ji ltar rgyal po'i rigs rgyal srid 'dod pa 'ga' zhig de la phan pa'i 'dod pa'i spro bas dang por go gyon no //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po'i rigs rgyal srid 'dod pa 'ga' zhig de la phan pa'i 'dod pa'i spro bas dang por go gyon no //
translated: Just as a king of the warrior caste who desires sovereignty first dons armor with a desire to benefit his kingdom.

original: de nas 'jug ste glang po che la sogs pa'i theg pa zhon no //
analyzed: de nas 'jug ste glang po che la sogs pa'i theg pa zhon no //
translated: Then he sets out, riding an elephant or the like.

original: de'i rjes su dpung gi tshogs sog go //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpung gi tshogs sog go //
translated: After that, he gathers an army.

original: de nas mi mthun phyogs las rgyal nas nges par bgrod bya'i sa rnams su nges par 'gro zhing rgyal srid thob bo //
analyzed: de nas mi mthun phyogs las rgyal nas nges par bgrod bya'i sa rnams su nges par 'gro zhing rgyal srid thob bo //
translated: Then, having conquered his opponents, he definitely proceeds to the lands to be conquered and obtains sovereignty.🔽After that, having accomplished his own purpose, he protects the people as much as possible with compassion.

original: de'i rjes su rang gi don byas pa ni snying rje dang bcas pas ji ltar rigs par skye dgu rnams yongs su skyong ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sgrub pa'i rten chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs
analyzed: de'i rjes su rang gi don byas pa ni snying rje dang bcas pas ji ltar rigs par skye dgu rnams yongs su skyong ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sgrub pa'i rten chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, who has the nature of the realm of reality as the basis for practice, has the lineage of perfect buddhahood.

original: can blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyis dge ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i dmigs pa rnams la ji ltar rigs par dmigs la /
analyzed: can blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyis dge ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i dmigs pa rnams la ji ltar rigs par dmigs la /
translated: He properly takes up the objects of observation for accomplishing virtue and so forth, which are to be adopted and to be rejected, and properly observes them.

original: gzhan gyi don du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa /
translated: For the sake of others, he aspires to perfect complete enlightenment.🔽He generates the spirit of enlightenment that is the essence of emptiness and compassion.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrub pa la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las ma 'das par mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'jug🔽par bya'o zhes gdams pa thob pa ;
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrub pa la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las ma 'das par mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par bya'o zhes gdams pa thob pa ;
translated: He is instructed to engage in the practice of the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of the twenty-two aspects of the spirit of enlightenment, without going beyond the conventional and ultimate truths, by way of non-apprehension.

original: sgrub pa de'i dmigs pa'i ngo bo bden pa shes pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa de'i dmigs pa'i ngo bo bden pa shes pa /
translated: He attains the knowledge of the truths, which is the nature of the object of that practice.

original: rten dkon mchog gsum rig pa /
analyzed: rten dkon mchog gsum rig pa /
translated: He knows the three jewels, which are the support of that practice.

original: khyad par du 'gro bar byed pa ma zhen pa /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro bar byed pa ma zhen pa /
translated: He attains non-attachment, which is what makes it progress.

original: mi ldog pa'i ched du phyogs bcur lta yang yongs su mi ngal ba thob ste /
analyzed: mi ldog pa'i ched du phyogs bcur lta yang yongs su mi ngal ba thob ste /
translated: He attains non-exhaustion, which is for the sake of not turning back, even though he looks in the ten directions.

original: de las 'di theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i ched du lam yongs su 'dzin par yang 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de las 'di theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i ched du lam yongs su 'dzin par yang 'gyur zhing /
translated: For the sake of not going by other vehicles, he also takes hold of the path.

original: ji ltar rigs par spyan lnga dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag kyang ste 'phags pa'i sa yang dag par gnon no zhes pa gdams ngag gi rim pas thob pa'i yon tan ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa rnams 'phel ba'i ched dang ma thob pa
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par spyan lnga dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag kyang ste 'phags pa'i sa yang dag par gnon no zhes pa gdams ngag gi rim pas thob pa'i yon tan ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa rnams 'phel ba'i ched dang ma thob pa
translated: The five eyes and the six kinds of superknowledge, the paths of seeing and meditation, and the noble stages are all conquered in whatever way is appropriate.🔽The qualities obtained through the stages of instruction, such as concentration and wisdom, increase and those not yet obtained are obtained.

original: rnams thob pa'i ched du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis sprod bcug pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi go cha'i sgrub pa re re la thams cad nye bar gnas su bcug pa /
analyzed: rnams thob pa'i ched du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis sprod bcug pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi go cha'i sgrub pa re re la thams cad nye bar gnas su bcug pa /
translated: In order to do this, the perfect buddhas and so on cause the practice of the armor of the six perfections to be applied to each practice.

original: sbyin bya la sogs pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i go cha nyid kyi go gyon te /
analyzed: sbyin bya la sogs pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i go cha nyid kyi go gyon te /
translated: They don the armor of nonapprehending the object of generosity and so on.

original: 'di la bar du gcod pa'i mda' thams cad thogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la bar du gcod pa'i mda' thams cad thogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the arrows of obstacles are stopped.

original: @183a * // de'i rjes su go bgos par byas pa ni rnam pa thams cad sgom pa mngon par sbyor ba las 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: @183a * // de'i rjes su go bgos par byas pa ni rnam pa thams cad sgom pa mngon par sbyor ba las 'jug pa ste /
translated: After that, the armor is applied to the engagement in the cultivation of all aspects.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag la 'dzeg go //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag la 'dzeg go //
translated: One ascends to the entire Dharma of the Great Vehicle, such as the meditative stabilizations and so forth.

original: de nas rgyu mthar thug par 'gro ba'i don du tshogs sog go //
analyzed: de nas rgyu mthar thug par 'gro ba'i don du tshogs sog go //
translated: Then, for the sake of going to the ultimate cause, one accumulates the collections.

original: de nas nges par 'byung bar bya ba rnams su nges par 'byung zhing 'bras bu'i sa mnan pa'i ched du rdo rje lta bu zhes pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam khong du chud pa na byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags
analyzed: de nas nges par 'byung bar bya ba rnams su nges par 'byung zhing 'bras bu'i sa mnan pa'i ched du rdo rje lta bu zhes pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam khong du chud pa na byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags
translated: Then, in order to definitely emerge in the places of definite emergence and to step on the level of fruition, when one comprehends the uninterrupted path called “vajra-like,” the bodhisattva, from abandoning all the aspects of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience that are

original: kyi rnam pa'i mi mthun phyogs ma lus pa spangs pa las gnon zhing /
analyzed: kyi rnam pa'i mi mthun phyogs ma lus pa spangs pa las gnon zhing /
translated: the discordant side of the predispositions,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pa bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin mur thug pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid thob par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pa bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin mur thug pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid thob par byed do //
translated: subdues and attains the fruition nature, the sovereignty of the Dharma that is without end, the realization of the stage of buddhahood, the limit of reality, which is the abandonment of the connection of the predispositions.

original: de la chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa la ni sgrub pa med do /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa la ni sgrub pa med do /
translated: In the realization of the body of attributes, there is no establishment.

original: der 'bras bu nyid kyi bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir te bya ba ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: der 'bras bu nyid kyi bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir te bya ba ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: Because the activity of the effect itself is impossible, since activity is the accomplishment.

original: de'i rjes su dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen pos sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa las dang / gdul bya sems can gyi bsod nams kyi dbang las nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par rgyun mi 'chad par sems can gyi don sgrub par byed de //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen pos sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa las dang / gdul bya sems can gyi bsod nams kyi dbang las nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par rgyun mi 'chad par sems can gyi don sgrub par byed de //
translated: After that, by non-apprehending great compassion, the projection of former aspirations and the power of the merit of sentient beings to be trained, the benefit of sentient beings is accomplished without interruption to the end of space.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la brgyud pas sbyor ba'i rang bzhin tshogs kyis ni go cha'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la brgyud pas sbyor ba'i rang bzhin tshogs kyis ni go cha'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the accumulation of the nature of indirect application on the path of seeing is the accomplishment of armor.

original: dngos su sbyor ba'i rang bzhin mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos su sbyor ba'i rang bzhin mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The stage of practice by belief, which is the nature of direct application, is the accomplishment of engagement.

original: chos mchog chen po ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i gzungs kyi mthar thug pa'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chos mchog chen po ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i gzungs kyi mthar thug pa'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
translated: The great supreme mundane quality is the accomplishment of the accumulation of the end of the dhāraṇī of loving kindness and so on.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni sa rab tu dga' ba'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni sa rab tu dga' ba'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
translated: The nature of the path of seeing is the accomplishment of the accumulation of the ground of joy.

original: khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang gi ngo bo dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang gi ngo bo dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
translated: The essence of the path of meditative development, which is the pervasive factor, is the accomplishment of the accumulations of the spiritual levels such as the stainless etc.

original: khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la khyad par gyi lam gyi gnas skabs rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la gzhag par bya ba'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam
analyzed: khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la khyad par gyi lam gyi gnas skabs rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la gzhag par bya ba'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam
translated: The special state of the path of meditative development, which is the pervasive factor, is to be placed in the state of the special path, i.e. the realization of the summit. The special state of the paths of seeing and meditative development is the accomplishment of the accumulations of counteragents, which are of eight kinds.

original: pa brgyad de khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: pa brgyad de khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The essence of the path of meditative development, which is the pervasive factor, is the accomplishment of the accumulations of counteragents, which are of eight kinds.

original: khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzhi can du gzhag par bya ba lam de gnyis ka'i spyod yul can nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i dngos po ched du bya ba la sogs pa khyad par gyi lam mthar phyin pa'i mthar thug pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge
analyzed: khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzhi can du gzhag par bya ba lam de gnyis ka'i spyod yul can nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i dngos po ched du bya ba la sogs pa khyad par gyi lam mthar phyin pa'i mthar thug pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge
translated: The basis of the path of meditative development, which is the pervasive factor, is to be placed in the state of the special path, i.e. the culmination of the path, which is the vajra-like samadhi. The object of engagement of both these paths is the object of engagement, i.e. the object of activity, which is to be brought forth. The special state of the path is the culmination of the path, which is the vajra-like samadhi.

original: 'dzin ji srid pa dang ni nges par @183b 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ste khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dzin ji srid pa dang ni nges par @183b 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ste khyab byed bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: and the practice of definite emergence, which is the nature of the path of cultivation that pervades all.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ched du bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa bdun po rnams kyis 'bras bu sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa'i ched du /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ched du bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa bdun po rnams kyis 'bras bu sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa'i ched du /
translated: Thus, for the sake of attaining the stage of buddhahood, which is the result of the two kinds of generation of the Thought, by means of the seven aspects beginning with the aim, which culminate in the knowledge of all modes,

original: lam gyi yul can nges 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lam gyi yul can nges 'byung ngo //
translated: the path is the subject of definite emergence.

original: zhes tshig le'ur byas par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes tshig le'ur byas par gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is stated in the verse.

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: And also:

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyis /
translated: The noble Asanga says:

original: de la go cha dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dag grangs ji lta bar brgyud pas dang dngos su sbyor ba'i rang bzhin tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i sa sa bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la go cha dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dag grangs ji lta bar brgyud pas dang dngos su sbyor ba'i rang bzhin tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i sa sa bsdus pa'o //
translated: The armor and practice are the accumulations and the stage of practice through belief, respectively, which are included in the stages, and are the nature of the direct and indirect application.

original: tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni brtse ba nas brtsams nas gzungs kyi mthar thug pa ni dngos su sbyor ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin chos mchog chen pos bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni brtse ba nas brtsams nas gzungs kyi mthar thug pa ni dngos su sbyor ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin chos mchog chen pos bsdus pa'o //
translated: The practice of accumulation, beginning with the stage of devoted interest and ending with the stage of retention, is included in the great stage of the highest mundane experience, which is the nature of the path of preparation.

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The practice of accumulation that is the nature of the stage of the joyous is the path of seeing.

original: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyen po'i bdag nyid kyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa lam gnyis ka'i spyod yul can dang nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzhis so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyen po'i bdag nyid kyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa lam gnyis ka'i spyod yul can dang nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzhis so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The practice of accumulation that is the nature of the stage of the stainless and the rest, which is the antidote, is the domain of both paths and the practice of deliverance is the path of meditation.

original: gang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin rnams go rims bzhin sgrub pa bzhi rnams so zhes rnam par gzhag pa de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin rnams go rims bzhin sgrub pa bzhi rnams so zhes rnam par gzhag pa de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: The four practices are respectively the nature of the aids to penetration, the path of seeing, the path of meditation, and the path of distinctive features.

original: de lta na 'jug pa'i sgrub pa mthong lam gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'jug pa'i sgrub pa mthong lam gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, the practice of engagement would be by nature the path of seeing.

original: 'dun sogs gsum gyi dbye ba las //
analyzed: 'dun sogs gsum gyi dbye ba las //
translated: From the division of the three—aspiration and so on—

original: smon pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: smon pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: the aspirational mind is threefold.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya'i sems rnams ni //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya'i sems rnams ni //
translated: The minds called engagement

original: bcu dgu rnams su 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: bcu dgu rnams su 'dod pa yin //
translated: are asserted to be nineteen in number.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i drod la sogs pa 'jug pa'i sems bskyed kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i drod la sogs pa 'jug pa'i sems bskyed kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, heat and so on would not be by nature the generation of the mind of engagement.

original: seng ge bzang pos 'grel bshad du mjug bsdu ba mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid kho na sa'i tshogs so zhes te /
analyzed: seng ge bzang pos 'grel bshad du mjug bsdu ba mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid kho na sa'i tshogs so zhes te /
translated: Haribhadra’s commentary explains that the collection of grounds is only the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa sa bcu pa ji srid pa kho nar 'gyur gyi bshad pa'i rnam par gzhag par bya ba mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa sa bcu pa ji srid pa kho nar 'gyur gyi bshad pa'i rnam par gzhag par bya ba mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: The practice of the collection of antidotes would be only on the tenth ground, but the presentation of the explanation is not by nature the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa kho na khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa kho na khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the practice of definite emergence is presented as being by nature the special path alone.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pa gsum yang sgrub pa'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur la /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis thar @184a * //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pa gsum yang sgrub pa'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur la / bcom ldan 'das kyis thar @184a * //
translated: The three mental activities of aspiration and so on are not the nature of practice.🔽The Bhagavat also said that they are to be established as conducive to liberation.

original: pa'i cha dang mthun pa sgrub tu bcug pa nyid du'ang gsungs la sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: pa'i cha dang mthun pa sgrub tu bcug pa nyid du'ang gsungs la sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the first generation of the mind of enlightenment,

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang ma bral bas sbyin pa sbyin zhing mtshan mar mi byed ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang ma bral bas sbyin pa sbyin zhing mtshan mar mi byed ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: one gives gifts without being separated from skill in means and without making signs.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa las /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa las /
translated: From the practice of giving and so on,

original: gzhan pa'i sgrub pa'am go cha gzhan med do //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i sgrub pa'am go cha gzhan med do //
translated: there is no other practice or armor.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang gzhung 'grel du go cha chen po bgos pa zhes pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung nas bsam pa rgya che bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang gzhung 'grel du go cha chen po bgos pa zhes pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung nas bsam pa rgya che bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Master Vasubandhu also says in the commentary: “Wearing the great armor” teaches the vast thought from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung nas bdun pa ji srid pa 'bad pa dang bcas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par spyod pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung nas bdun pa ji srid pa 'bad pa dang bcas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par spyod pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase who has set out in the Great Vehicle refers to the stage of action out of faith up to the seventh stage, the stage of Gone Afar, which is the period of practice with effort and with discursive thought.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes pa ni brgyad pa nas bzung ste don dam par spyod pa bstan pa'o //🔽de la go cha chen po rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes pa ni brgyad pa nas bzung ste don dam par spyod pa bstan pa'o // de la go cha chen po rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The phrase who is established in the Great Vehicle refers to the eighth stage on up, which is the stage of practice without discursive thought.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa'i phyir bsam pa rgya che ba las dang / sgrub pa gcig kho nar sgrub pa thams cad rdzogs pas sgrub pa rgya che ba nas ji srid pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi go cha zhes brjod do zhes pa'i mthar thug pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa'i phyir bsam pa rgya che ba las dang / sgrub pa gcig kho nar sgrub pa thams cad rdzogs pas sgrub pa rgya che ba nas ji srid pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi go cha zhes brjod do zhes pa'i mthar thug pa gsungs so //
translated: The great armor is twofold: the vast intention because of striving for the benefit of all sentient beings, and the vast practice because of the perfection of all practices in a single practice. It is said that this is the armor of the six perfections.

original: de bzhin du 'di nyid kyis sa bcu pa'i rnam par bshad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di nyid kyis sa bcu pa'i rnam par bshad par gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, this is stated in the commentary to the Ten Stages:

original: de la go cha ni smon pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de la go cha ni smon pa'o zhes so //
translated: The armor is the aspiration.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang 'phags pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang 'phags pas /
translated: Therefore, the Arya teaches:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar rnams ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir lam gyi tshogs zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa de ni 'di rnams kyi gnas skabs der phal cher 'jig
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar rnams ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir lam gyi tshogs zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa de ni 'di rnams kyi gnas skabs der phal cher 'jig
translated: The applications of mindfulness and so on, up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha, are called the collection of the path because they are included in the path of seeing and so on.

original: rten las 'das pa rnams kho na bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rten las 'das pa rnams kho na bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: This is because they are mostly supramundane states included in that stage.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni phal cher lam la 'jug pa la gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni phal cher lam la 'jug pa la gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: The mundane are mostly included in the path of entry.

original: gal te de lta na tshogs kyi sa'i rten ma gsungs pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na tshogs kyi sa'i rten ma gsungs pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why is the stage of the collection not mentioned?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na ste sems bskyed pa nas brtsams nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams su dang zhes pa la sogs pas so zhes pa sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na ste sems bskyed pa nas brtsams nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams su dang zhes pa la sogs pas so zhes pa sngar brjod zin to //
translated: The Bhagavān said that it is the stage of the collection, beginning with the generation of the enlightenment mind and up to the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug gi //
analyzed: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug gi //
translated: the six topics of realization

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas par /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas par /
translated: are summarized in the verse summary.

original: sems bskyed pa nas brtsams nas zhes rtogs par @184b bya ste ;
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nas brtsams nas zhes rtogs par @184b bya ste ;
translated: The verse summary beginning “having generated the thought of awakening” should be understood as the six topics of realization.

original: mdo'i don thams cad ni de'i rgyan tshig le'ur byas pas bsdus pa med do zhes so //
analyzed: mdo'i don thams cad ni de'i rgyan tshig le'ur byas pas bsdus pa med do zhes so //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is not summarized in the verse summary.

original: drod la sogs pa rnams ni 'jug pa'i sems nyid kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pas bsdus la /🔽smon pa'i sems rnams ma yin te /
analyzed: drod la sogs pa rnams ni 'jug pa'i sems nyid kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pas bsdus la / smon pa'i sems rnams ma yin te /
translated: The verse summary summarizes the heat and so on because they are the main part of the engaged thought of awakening.

original: phal pa nyid kyi phyir drod la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyi shugs kyis 'thob pas bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa rgyas pas chog go //
analyzed: phal pa nyid kyi phyir drod la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyi shugs kyis 'thob pas bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa rgyas pas chog go //
translated: It does not summarize the aspirational thought of awakening because it is ordinary and is summarized by the power of being the cause of heat and so on.🔽This is sufficient explanation.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi nang du 'dus pa kho nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi nang du 'dus pa kho nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, such as the stations of mindfulness, are included only in the enlightenment thought which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, and so are to be cultivated by the bodhisattvas.

original: thun mong gi sgo nas ni sngar bshad pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: thun mong gi sgo nas ni sngar bshad pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: In the common way, they are as explained above.

original: de ni byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis bskor ba bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis bskor ba bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should cultivate the stations of mindfulness, etc., surrounded by the aspects of the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'di lta kho nas 'di rnams byang chub thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs te rjes su mthun pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta kho nas 'di rnams byang chub thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs te rjes su mthun pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they become the factors of enlightenment, the side of omniscience.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag nyi shu lnga par gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag nyi shu lnga par gsungs pa /
translated: In the Twenty-five Thousand:

original: sha ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sha ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Śāriputra, having stood in the perfection of wisdom, one should complete the four stations of mindfulness.”

original: de bzhin du nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la lus la sogs par rjes su lta bas gnas shing lus la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog par rnam par mi rtog la de yang mi dmigs pa'i
analyzed: de bzhin du nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la lus la sogs par rjes su lta bas gnas shing lus la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog par rnam par mi rtog la de yang mi dmigs pa'i
translated: Likewise, one dwells by observing the internal, external, and internal-external bodies, feelings, thoughts, and dharmas, but one does not conceptualize the body, etc., nor does one conceptualize the concepts associated with the body, etc.

original: tshul gyis so zhes so //
analyzed: tshul gyis so zhes so //
translated: And that is by way of not apprehending anything.

original: 'dir nang gi lus ni rang gi mig la sogs pa drug go //
analyzed: 'dir nang gi lus ni rang gi mig la sogs pa drug go //
translated: Here, the internal body is one’s own six, the eyes, etc.

original: phyi ni rang gi lus las phyi rol gyi 'dus byas so //
analyzed: phyi ni rang gi lus las phyi rol gyi 'dus byas so //
translated: The external is the compounded that is external to one’s own body.

original: gnyis ka ni lhag ma'i rang gi lus su gtogs pa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka ni lhag ma'i rang gi lus su gtogs pa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: Both is the remainder, the elements and the element derivatives that belong to one’s own body.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa gsum ni lus rnam pa gsum la dmigs pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa gsum ni lus rnam pa gsum la dmigs pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The three aspects of feelings, etc., are due to the distinctions in their observation of the three bodies.

original: chos ni sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: chos ni sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams so //
translated: Dharmas are the virtuous and nonvirtuous mental factors.

original: lus la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba ni lus la sogs pa'i chos nyid la lta ba'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba ni lus la sogs pa'i chos nyid la lta ba'o //
translated: Observing the body, etc., is observing the reality of the dharmas of the body, etc.

original: lus la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di ni lus so bdag gi lus so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di ni lus so bdag gi lus so //
translated: The conceptualization that has the perception of body, etc. is the thought that this is the body, this is my body,

original: rtag pa'o mi rtag pa'o bde ba'o sdug bsngal ba'o zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa ste de yang rjes su lta ba rnam par mi rtog pa ste mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //🔽mi dmigs pa @185a * //
analyzed: rtag pa'o mi rtag pa'o bde ba'o sdug bsngal ba'o zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa ste de yang rjes su lta ba rnam par mi rtog pa ste mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so // mi dmigs pa @185a * //
translated: it is permanent, it is impermanent, it is happy, it is miserable, and so on. That is also to be contemplated without conceptualization, without apprehending, in the manner previously explained.

original: dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis bsgom par bya ste sngar ji skad brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis bsgom par bya ste sngar ji skad brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: The contemplation of the factors of enlightenment is to be cultivated by the practitioners of the Disciple and Solitary Realizer Vehicles, who are intent on nirvana, as previously explained.

original: 'on na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sgom pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i dpung gnyen can rnams kho na la rigs kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sgom pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i dpung gnyen can rnams kho na la rigs kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ma yin te /
translated: But the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment is not for the Bodhisattvas,

original: ji skad du 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul bstan pa'i mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul bstan pa'i mdor gsungs pa /
translated: as it is taught in the Noble Sūtra of the Teaching of the Miracle of the Supernatural Power of Mañjuśrī:🔽“Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva should not cultivate the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'jam dpal ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge slong rnams 'byung ste de rnams mi gtsang ba las lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag par ston par 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge slong rnams 'byung ste de rnams mi gtsang ba las lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag par ston par 'gyur ba nas /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the future there will be monks who will teach the application of mindfulness of body to be the observation of the body as impure.

original: 'di kho na don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa'i bar du'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di kho na don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa'i bar du'o zhe na /
translated: They will say, “This alone is ultimate truth.”

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad du khong du chud pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyi phyir dang / chos thams cad mchog tu mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir dang sems can la phan pa sgrub pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba la yang mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin yon tan mthong ba mya ngan las 'das pa la yang sems can la phan pa sgrub pa'i🔽rten ma yin pa nyid las 'khor ba bzhin du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad du khong du chud pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyi phyir dang / chos thams cad mchog tu mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir dang sems can la phan pa sgrub pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba la yang mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin yon tan mthong ba mya ngan las 'das pa la yang sems can la phan pa sgrub pa'i rten ma yin pa nyid las 'khor ba bzhin du /
translated: Because bodhisattvas strive to comprehend all phenomena, because they do not observe any phenomenon to be supreme, and because they are the cause for accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings, they see the qualities of cyclic existence to be like nirvana.

original: mi mthun par mthong ba /
analyzed: mi mthun par mthong ba /
translated: They see the qualities of nirvana to be like cyclic existence,🔽in that they are not the basis for accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings.

original: chos nyid tsam nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba rnams kyang dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin so sor rtog pa'i don kho nas byang chub kyi phyogs rnams sgom par byed do //
analyzed: chos nyid tsam nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba rnams kyang dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin so sor rtog pa'i don kho nas byang chub kyi phyogs rnams sgom par byed do //
translated: And those who see the equality of cyclic life and of nirvana, because of the mere suchness of reality, also cultivate the factors of enlightenment, only by the meaning of the individual investigation of the nature of nonapprehension.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgya par gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgya par gsungs pa /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, the Bhagavatī says:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi dmigs pa nyid bzung nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi dmigs pa nyid bzung nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Having apprehended the nonapprehension of the applications of mindfulness,” and so on.

original: mdo de nyid du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdo de nyid du yang gsungs pa /
translated: And in that very sūtra it is also said:

original: 'jam dpal gang gis lus nam mkha' dang mnyam par mthong ba 'di ni lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang gis lus nam mkha' dang mnyam par mthong ba 'di ni lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, one who sees the body as equal to space is the application of mindfulness that observes the body in the body.”

original: gang gis tshor ba dang sems dang dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs zhes pa nas ji srid 'jam dpal de ltar don dam par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams blta bar bya'o de nas ji srid du gang chos thams
analyzed: gang gis tshor ba dang sems dang dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs zhes pa nas ji srid 'jam dpal de ltar don dam par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams blta bar bya'o de nas ji srid du gang chos thams
translated: “By whom the phenomena of feeling, mind, virtue, nonvirtue, and so on are not observed” up to “Mañjuśrī, the four establishments of mindfulness should be seen in this way ultimately.”

original: cad rang bzhin gyis snyoms par zhugs pa dang rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba med par lta ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: cad rang bzhin gyis snyoms par zhugs pa dang rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba med par lta ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: “Then, as long as one sees all phenomena as naturally settled and naturally free from distraction, this is right samādhi.”

original: 'jam dpal gang la la 'di lta bu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag @185b brgyad pa'i bar du yang dag par rjes su lta ba de ni rgal ba pha rol du 'gro bar pa smra'o nas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang la la 'di lta bu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag @185b brgyad pa'i bar du yang dag par rjes su lta ba de ni rgal ba pha rol du 'gro bar pa smra'o nas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog
translated: “Mañjuśrī, I say that whoever views the establishments of mindfulness in this way up to the noble eightfold path in this way has crossed over and gone to the other side.”

original: dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas chos 'di rnams la mos par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas chos 'di rnams la mos par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Therefore, those who wish to fully awaken to the omniscient wisdom that possesses these qualities should aspire to these dharmas.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul bstan pa'i mdor yang /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul bstan pa'i mdor yang /
translated: In the Sūtra Revealing the Inconceivable Sphere of the Buddha,

original: 'jam dpal dbang po lnga rnams ci ltar blta bar bya /
analyzed: 'jam dpal dbang po lnga rnams ci ltar blta bar bya /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Divine son, how should the five faculties be viewed?”

original: smras pa / lha'i bu gang chos thams cad skye ba med par dad par byed pa 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //🔽gang chos thams cad la sems 'phro bar mi byed de ring ba dang nye ba'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir te 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: smras pa / lha'i bu gang chos thams cad skye ba med par dad par byed pa 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po'o // gang chos thams cad la sems 'phro bar mi byed de ring ba dang nye ba'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir te 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: He replied, “Divine son, faith in the nonarising of all phenomena is the faculty of faith.🔽The mind that does not engage with any phenomena, because it is free from the notions of far and near, is the faculty of diligence.

original: gang yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar bral ba med pa 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar bral ba med pa 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The mindfulness that is free from all mental engagements is the faculty of mindfulness.

original: gang chos thams cad sogs pa med pa nas dmigs su med pa ji srid pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad sogs pa med pa nas dmigs su med pa ji srid pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of meditative concentration is the extent to which all phenomena are not grasped and are not objectified.

original: gang chos rnams thams cad skye ba dang bral ba rnam par shes pa dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong ba 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang chos rnams thams cad skye ba dang bral ba rnam par shes pa dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong ba 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o zhes so //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the insight that all phenomena are free from arising, free from consciousness, and empty by nature.

original: de bzhin du stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān also taught the powers, the factors of enlightenment, the limbs of the path, and the foundations of mindfulness in the same way.

original: gal te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis chos thams cad shes na 'o na byang chub kyi phyogs phyi ma thams cad kyis ci dgos she na /
analyzed: gal te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis chos thams cad shes na 'o na byang chub kyi phyogs phyi ma thams cad kyis ci dgos she na /
translated: If all phenomena are known by the foundations of mindfulness, then what is the purpose of all the subsequent factors of awakening?

original: de lta ma yin te de rnams kyi chos nyid du yongs su shes kyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te de rnams kyi chos nyid du yongs su shes kyi /
translated: That is not so. They are fully known as their reality.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But not by the aspects of impermanence and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs la /
translated: Therefore, the listeners focus on the aspects of impermanence, etc.,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: while the bodhisattvas do so in a manner of nonapprehending.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang stong pa nyid kyang 'di rnams kyi yul du 'gyur ro zhes pas nyan thos kyi lam yang chos nyid kyi sgo nas goms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang stong pa nyid kyang 'di rnams kyi yul du 'gyur ro zhes pas nyan thos kyi lam yang chos nyid kyi sgo nas goms par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the aspects of impermanence, etc., and even emptiness are the objects of these bodhisattvas. Thus, even the listeners’ path is cultivated in terms of reality.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs bcu gnyis rnams sems bskyed pa gsum rnams kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs bcu gnyis rnams sems bskyed pa gsum rnams kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, the twelve aspects of enlightenment are included in the three productions of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de ltar tshogs kyi sar dad pa la sogs pa'i dge bas sems yongs su bsgos pa /🔽byang chub kyi sems yang dag par blangs pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba bsags pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis bsod @186a * //
analyzed: de ltar tshogs kyi sar dad pa la sogs pa'i dge bas sems yongs su bsgos pa / byang chub kyi sems yang dag par blangs pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba bsags pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis bsod @186a * //
translated: Thus, on the level of the equipment, the mind is completely imbued with the virtues of faith, etc.🔽Endowed with the perfect acceptance of the thought of enlightenment and the accumulation of the virtues of generosity, etc.,

original: nams kyi tshogs yang dag par rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: nams kyi tshogs yang dag par rdzogs pa ni /
translated: the bodhisattva has perfected the equipment of merit.

original: ye shes tshogs ni sgrub don du //
analyzed: ye shes tshogs ni sgrub don du //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the equipment of intuition,

original: grangs med bskal pas nges 'byung la //🔽mngon shes brtan pa gdams pa yis //
analyzed: grangs med bskal pas nges 'byung la // mngon shes brtan pa gdams pa yis //
translated: And by countless eons, one definitely becomes free.🔽🔽By the firm superknowledges, one is instructed.🔽

original: spyod pa'i sa la rab tu 'jug / ces pas so //
analyzed: spyod pa'i sa la rab tu 'jug / ces pas so //
translated: The stage of action in faith is entered by those who have the firm superknowledges and the instructions, through renunciation for countless eons.

original: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa sbyor pa'i lam 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam nges par byed pa bsten pa la phan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid de 'jug🔽pa'i sgrub pa yang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa sbyor pa'i lam 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam nges par byed pa bsten pa la phan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid de 'jug pa'i sgrub pa yang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The fourth generation of the Thought, the stage of action in faith, is the path of preparation, the mundane path of meditation, the path of meditation with-outflows, the reliance on the aids to penetration, the root of the wholesome which is favorable to it, and the practice of the entry.

original: de la mos pa ni dad pa la sogs pa dmigs pa lnga la yon tan du 'dzin pa pha rol gyi gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa dang 'brel ba yongs su dag pa ste mthar thug par song ba na rang nyid yang dag par zhugs pa nyid
analyzed: de la mos pa ni dad pa la sogs pa dmigs pa lnga la yon tan du 'dzin pa pha rol gyi gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa dang 'brel ba yongs su dag pa ste mthar thug par song ba na rang nyid yang dag par zhugs pa nyid
translated: Faith is the apprehension of the five objects, such as faith, as good qualities, in connection with the instructions and the teachings of others, pure, and having gone to the end.

original: kyis mos pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyis mos pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is said that one has faith in the one who has entered correctly, it is in order to teach faith.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sbyor ba bud shing gzhan khyad par can gyi me bzhin du gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro bar byed pas rab tu gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni rab tu sbyor ba ste bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam shin tu🔽nye bar bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sbyor ba bud shing gzhan khyad par can gyi me bzhin du gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro bar byed pas rab tu gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni rab tu sbyor ba ste bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam shin tu nye bar bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la brten pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la brten pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni mos pa dang bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa rnams so //🔽gang zag pa med pa ni mngon par sgrub pa dang shin tu dag pa dag go zhes 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni mos pa dang bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa rnams so // gang zag pa med pa ni mngon par sgrub pa dang shin tu dag pa dag go zhes 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.🔽It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated practice of the path of seeing.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdor yang /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdor yang /
translated: It is the path of meditation because it is the repeated
