original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rnams dang ldan par 'gyur zhing 'di nyon mongs pa yang kun du spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rnams dang ldan par 'gyur zhing 'di nyon mongs pa yang kun du spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva is endowed with generosity and so on, and he also engages in the afflictions.

original: 'di lta ste mos pas spyod pa'i sa la chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i mos pa la 'jug pa na'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mos pas spyod pa'i sa la chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i mos pa la 'jug pa na'o zhes so //
translated: Thus, when he enters the stage of action from faith, he has small, middling, and great faith.

original: rnam par mi rtog pas 'byed pa ni nges par 'byed pa ste mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pas 'byed pa ni nges par 'byed pa ste mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The clear realization is the path of seeing.

original: de bsten pa ni cha ste thob pa'o //
analyzed: de bsten pa ni cha ste thob pa'o //
translated: The part is the attainment of that.

original: de la phan pa ni nges par 'byed pa bsten pa la phan pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan pa ni nges par 'byed pa bsten pa la phan pa'o //
translated: The benefit is the benefit of the clear realization.

original: la lar gsal ba'i dbye ba las mang po'i tshig ste /
analyzed: la lar gsal ba'i dbye ba las mang po'i tshig ste /
translated: In some cases, the word “many” is used for the classification of the clear realization.

original: drod rnams dang rtse mo rnams dang bzod pa rnams dang chos kyi mchog rnams so zhes so //🔽gyur pa'i sgra ni kha cig tu spyir brjod pa'o //
analyzed: drod rnams dang rtse mo rnams dang bzod pa rnams dang chos kyi mchog rnams so zhes so // gyur pa'i sgra ni kha cig tu spyir brjod pa'o //
translated: The heat, summits, patience, and supreme mundane state.🔽The word “also” is used in some cases to indicate a general statement.

original: gyur pa dang rnam pa dang bye brag rnams don gcig go zhes chur lhung ngo //
analyzed: gyur pa dang rnam pa dang bye brag rnams don gcig go zhes chur lhung ngo //
translated: “Also,” “aspect,” and “distinction” have the same meaning.

original: dro bar gyur pa @186b dang rtse mor gyur pa dang bzod par gyur pa dang chos mchog tu gyur pa'o zhes so //🔽de rnams ni /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa @186b dang rtse mor gyur pa dang bzod par gyur pa dang chos mchog tu gyur pa'o zhes so // de rnams ni /
translated: heat, peak, patience, and the supreme mundane state.

original: nges 'byed yan lag rnams kyang ste //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag rnams kyang ste //
translated: They are the limbs of definite discrimination.

original: nges par byed pa ni nges byed de mtha' gcig tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges par byed pa ni nges byed de mtha' gcig tu nges pa'o //
translated: Definite discrimination is the definite determination of a single aspect.

original: de'i yan lag rnams ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang chen po'i chen po nyid kyis phye ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i yan lag rnams ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang chen po'i chen po nyid kyis phye ba bzhi'o //
translated: Its limbs are four, distinguished by small, medium, great, and greater.

original: drod ni gtsub shing gtsubs pa na me bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: drod ni gtsub shing gtsubs pa na me bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Heat is like the friction of sticks for kindling a fire, because it is the sign of the fire of transcendent wisdom.

original: rtse mo ni ge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtse mo ni ge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The peak is like the peak of a mountain, because it is the peak of the roots of virtue.

original: bzod pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Patience is like the patience of a small child, because it is the patience of the world.

original: chos mchog ni 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mchog ni 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The supreme mundane state is like the supreme king of mountains, because it is the supreme of all mundane states.

original: slar yang drod la sogs pa rnams so sor chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis bcu gnyis su rab tu dbye'o //
analyzed: slar yang drod la sogs pa rnams so sor chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis bcu gnyis su rab tu dbye'o //
translated: Again, heat and so on are each divided into three stages: small, middling, and great, making twelve stages.

original: ji ltar bzod pa chen po skad cig gcig yin pa de bzhin du chos mchog rnams kyang ngo zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rang gi don gyi dbang du byas pas nyan thos rnams kyi yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bzod pa chen po skad cig gcig yin pa de bzhin du chos mchog rnams kyang ngo zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rang gi don gyi dbang du byas pas nyan thos rnams kyi yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma yin te /
translated: It is said that just as the peak of existence is one moment, so too are the supreme mundane state. That is from the perspective of the śrāvakas’ own welfare, but not from the perspective of bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan gyi don la rim pa nyid kyi gnas skabs srid pa'i phyir de dang 'di mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la rim pa nyid kyi gnas skabs srid pa'i phyir de dang 'di mi 'gal lo //
translated: This is not contradictory, because it is possible that the stages of the bodhisattvas’ path of preparation are in the state of the peak of existence.

original: drod la sogs pa 'di ni byang chub gsum thob pa la rgyu ste /
analyzed: drod la sogs pa 'di ni byang chub gsum thob pa la rgyu ste /
translated: These stages of heat and so on are causes for attaining the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: 'ga' zhig gi rigs la sogs pa'i stobs kyis dman pa'i byang chub kyang thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi rigs la sogs pa'i stobs kyis dman pa'i byang chub kyang thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they cause the attainment of the lesser enlightenment of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas through the power of their lineage and so on.

original: de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa dag gi drod la sogs pa ni byang chub mchog nam yang thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa dag gi drod la sogs pa ni byang chub mchog nam yang thob par mi byed do //
translated: Thus, the heat and so on of those in the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas never cause the attainment of supreme enlightenment.

original: de la drod gsum po rim pa ji lta bar chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i mos pa'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: de la drod gsum po rim pa ji lta bar chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i mos pa'i rang bzhin la /
translated: The three types of heat are the natures of the small, medium, and great stages of interest.

original: slar yang chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbyebs  mos pa dgu rnams rang gi don gyi ste /🔽gang rnams kyis rang don kho na sgrub par byed cing gzhan don kyang ched du bya ba'i ngo bos so //🔽rtse mo gsum po de lta bu'i rang bzhin la de lta bu'i mos pa dgu rnams rang gzhan gyi don gyi ste 'dir sbyor ba ni bar chad dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbyebs  mos pa dgu rnams rang gi don gyi ste / gang rnams kyis rang don kho na sgrub par byed cing gzhan don kyang ched du bya ba'i ngo bos so // rtse mo gsum po de lta bu'i rang bzhin la de lta bu'i mos pa dgu rnams rang gzhan gyi don gyi ste 'dir sbyor ba ni bar chad dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The nine types of interest, such as small-small, are the three types of heat.🔽The three types of peak are the natures of the nine types of interest, such as small-small, and are for one’s own benefit.

original: bzod pa gsum de de lta bu'i rang bzhin la de de lta bu'i mos pa dgu rnams gzhan don gyi ste 'dir sbyor ba ni bar chad med pa yin la /
analyzed: bzod pa gsum de de lta bu'i rang bzhin la de de lta bu'i mos pa dgu rnams gzhan don gyi ste 'dir sbyor ba ni bar chad med pa yin la /
translated: The three types of forbearance are the natures of the nine types of interest, such as small-small, and are for the benefit of both oneself and others.🔽The three types of supreme mundane quality are the natures of the nine types of interest, such as small-small, and are for the benefit of others.

original: gang gis na gang rnams kyis gzhan kho na'i don du 'gyur zhing rang gi don 'gog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis na gang rnams kyis gzhan kho na'i don du 'gyur zhing rang gi don 'gog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: How could it be that some would be only for the sake of others and not for one’s own sake?

original: gzhan gyi don dang 'gal ba med pas de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don dang 'gal ba med pas de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction in taking up the welfare of others, one perfects it.

original: de ltar mos pa nyi shu rtsa bdun sgom par byed pa'i @187a * //
analyzed: de ltar mos pa nyi shu rtsa bdun sgom par byed pa'i @187a * //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva cultivates twenty seven kinds of aspiration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spro ba'i ched du sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis mdzad pa'i bstod pa dang bkur pa dang bsngags pa rim pa ji lta bas de lta kho nar nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spro ba'i ched du sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis mdzad pa'i bstod pa dang bkur pa dang bsngags pa rim pa ji lta bas de lta kho nar nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: In order to encourage him, the buddhas praise, honor, and extol him in twenty seven ways, in accordance with the order of the twenty seven aspirations.

original: chos mchog mos pa thams cad rab tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi ni chung ngu'i rnam pa la mos pa yid la byed pa thams cad kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bsod nams byang chub sems dpas bden pa gnyis las ma 'das pas yongs su bsngos nas yang
analyzed: chos mchog mos pa thams cad rab tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi ni chung ngu'i rnam pa la mos pa yid la byed pa thams cad kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bsod nams byang chub sems dpas bden pa gnyis las ma 'das pas yongs su bsngos nas yang
translated: The supreme mundane quality is the nature of the transformation of all aspirations. The merit that is created by all the mental attentions of the small stage of aspiration is dedicated by the bodhisattva who does not transcend the two truths.

original: dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu byed do //🔽'bring gi rnam pa la rang gis yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'phel ba'i don du kun rdzob tu dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dmigs nas rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis don dam par dmigs su med pa nyid du rjes su yi rang bas rang dang
analyzed: dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu byed do // 'bring gi rnam pa la rang gis yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'phel ba'i don du kun rdzob tu dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dmigs nas rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis don dam par dmigs su med pa nyid du rjes su yi rang bas rang dang
translated: It is a factor of perfect enlightenment.🔽In the middling aspect, one's own merit increases manifestly for the sake of the increase of merit through one's own dedication.

original: gzhan gyi bsod nams bya ba nyam pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsod nams bya ba nyam pa nyid thob bo //
translated: Having observed the roots of virtue in the conventional, with a joyful mind, one rejoices in the ultimate non-apprehension, and one attains the excellence of one's own and others' merit-making.

original: res 'ga' rjes su yi rang ba sngon ma can gyis kyang yongs su bsngo zhes pa 'di dgal rim pa nges pa med do //
analyzed: res 'ga' rjes su yi rang ba sngon ma can gyis kyang yongs su bsngo zhes pa 'di dgal rim pa nges pa med do //
translated: Sometimes, one dedicates with a prior rejoicing. There is no fixed order in these.

original: yongs su bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba 'di dag 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams na yang yod de 'on kyang 'dir de la ltos pas rab tu gyur pa dag go zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba 'di dag 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams na yang yod de 'on kyang 'dir de la ltos pas rab tu gyur pa dag go zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: These dedications and rejoicings also exist in the stages of aspiration and so on, but here they are established as supreme because they rely on that.

original: chen po'i rnam pa mos pa thams cad rab tu gyur pa mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin nas bzung nas sems rang dbang du byas pa nyid kyi phyir bdag dang bdag gi bdag du zhen pa med pas sems dul ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gi bdag gir mi 'dud pas nga rgyal ba med pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: chen po'i rnam pa mos pa thams cad rab tu gyur pa mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin nas bzung nas sems rang dbang du byas pa nyid kyi phyir bdag dang bdag gi bdag du zhen pa med pas sems dul ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gi bdag gir mi 'dud pas nga rgyal ba med pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: From the stage of the great aspect of interest, which is the final nature of the complete transformation of all interests, up to the stage of the tathgata, the bodhisattva possesses a disciplined mind, since he has control over his mind and is free of clinging to i and mine.🔽He possesses humility, since he does not bow to i and mine in relation to spiritual masters and so on.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa zil gyis gnon pa dang / bdud la sogs pas byas pa'i nye bar 'che ba'i yul ma yin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub par rung ba dang / rang gi rten gyi yul mchod bya nyid du byed do zhes pa byed par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa zil gyis gnon pa dang / bdud la sogs pas byas pa'i nye bar 'che ba'i yul ma yin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub par rung ba dang / rang gi rten gyi yul mchod bya nyid du byed do zhes pa byed par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: He possesses the conquest of afflictions of self and others, he is not an object of harm created by Mara and so on, he is suitable for accomplishing perfect enlightenment, and he is an object of worship for his own and others' realms.

original: s'anti pas ni sems dul ba nyid la sogs pa byed pa drug po 'di rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyir bshad do //
analyzed: s'anti pas ni sems dul ba nyid la sogs pa byed pa drug po 'di rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyir bshad do //
translated: Santideva explains that these six activities, such as the control of the mind, belong to the supramundane path of meditative development.

original: nges par 'byed pa bsten pa la phan pa 'di rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs kho na'o zhes pas /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa bsten pa la phan pa 'di rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs kho na'o zhes pas /
translated: These benefits of the practice of the penetrating insight are also the afflictions of the bodhisattvas, since it is said that conceptualization is the affliction of the bodhisattvas.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi bsten pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi bsten pa'o //
translated: The practice of the four kinds of conceptualization as afflictions is as follows.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis ni gzung @187b ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis ni gzung @187b ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Of these, the first two are the conceptualization of the apprehended,

original: gzung byar rnam par rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung byar rnam par rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they conceptualize the apprehended.

original: log par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: log par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Erroneous conceptualization is conceptualization,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang / gnyis ka la dmigs pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang / gnyis ka la dmigs pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po la dmigs pa'o //
translated: because it is the apprehension of both the afflictions and the purification, and the apprehension of the antidote.

original: dang po ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i dngos po la dang / phyi ma ni de'i gnyis pa nyan thos la sogs pa la grags pa la ste /
analyzed: dang po ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i dngos po la dang / phyi ma ni de'i gnyis pa nyan thos la sogs pa la grags pa la ste /
translated: The first is in regard to things renowned in the world, and the second is in regard to the two of them renowned to sravakas and so on.

original: go rims bzhin du dang po ni drod rnams la'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du dang po ni drod rnams la'o //
translated: The first is in regard to the stages of heat.

original: gnyis pa ni rtse mo rnams la'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rtse mo rnams la'o //
translated: The second is in regard to the stages of the peak.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste yod pa min pa kho na'i 'dzin pa por rtog par byed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste yod pa min pa kho na'i 'dzin pa por rtog par byed pa'i phyir la /
translated: The two aspects are conceptualizations of grasping, because they cause the conceptualization of grasping that which does not exist at all.

original: skyes bu rdzas su yod pa la dmigs pa dang skyes bu btags par yod pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu rdzas su yod pa la dmigs pa dang skyes bu btags par yod pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: They are the focal object of the substantial existence of a person and the focal object of the imputed existence of a person.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir btags pa rnams te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir btags pa rnams te /
translated: They are imputations because they are by nature illusory.

original: de dag go rims bzhin du bzod pa rnams la dang chos mchog rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du bzod pa rnams la dang chos mchog rnams la'o //
translated: They are in order the stages of acceptance and the supreme mundane state.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyang yul gyi dbye bas so sor dbye ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyang yul gyi dbye bas so sor dbye ba rnams so //
translated: These four conceptualizations are differentiated individually by way of their objects.

original: de la dang po'i gzung bya'i dngos po rnams ni ma rig pa dang phung po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la dang po'i gzung bya'i dngos po rnams ni ma rig pa dang phung po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: In this regard, the first is the objects of apprehension of the four conceptualizations of apprehendeds, which are ignorance, the aggregates and so on.

original: gnyis pa'i phung po dang skye ba'i sgo la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i phung po dang skye ba'i sgo la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The second is the aggregates, the doors of sense-experience, etc.

original: 'dzin pa'i yul dang po ni bdag rang dbang can la sogs pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i yul dang po ni bdag rang dbang can la sogs pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: The first object of apprehension is the self, by way of its nature of being independent, etc.

original: gnyis pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rten gyis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rten gyis so //
translated: The second is the aggregates, etc., by way of their being the basis of the self.

original: 'di rnams kyang rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba mthong ba'i lam la spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba mthong ba'i lam la spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: These are to be eliminated on the path of insight called the Joyous.

original: gang 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes gsungs pa /
translated: As the noble Vimuktasena says,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po rnams kyi gnyen po'i mthong ba'i lam mo zhes so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po rnams kyi gnyen po'i mthong ba'i lam mo zhes so //
translated: The path of insight is the antidote to the four discriminations of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: chos mngon pa kun las btus par chos kyi bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis gzung bar rtogs so //
analyzed: chos mngon pa kun las btus par chos kyi bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis gzung bar rtogs so //
translated: In the Abhidharma-samuccaya, the apprehensions of the apprehended are by means of the knowledges and acceptances of the truth of the Dharma.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyi 'dzin pa rtogs pas so //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyi 'dzin pa rtogs pas so //
translated: The apprehensions of the apprehender are by means of the subsequent acceptances and knowledges.

original: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad la yang mtshan ma med par spyod pa'i rnal 'byor can du rig par bya'o zhes pa /
analyzed: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad la yang mtshan ma med par spyod pa'i rnal 'byor can du rig par bya'o zhes pa /
translated: And in all the acceptances and knowledges, one should know that the yogi practices without signs.

original: 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Here, one realizes the absence of intrinsic reality of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma med par spyod pa nyid de de dag tu sgro ma btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma med par spyod pa nyid de de dag tu sgro ma btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, one practices signlessness, because of the non-superimposition of those two.

original: gang yang mdo sde rgyan du /
analyzed: gang yang mdo sde rgyan du /
translated: Also, in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras,

original: drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos mchog rnams la go rims bzhin 'di rnams spong bar gsungs la de ni chos kyi bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa byas par rig par bya'o //🔽drod la sogs pa bzhi ni mos pa brtan @188a * //
analyzed: drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos mchog rnams la go rims bzhin 'di rnams spong bar gsungs la de ni chos kyi bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa byas par rig par bya'o // drod la sogs pa bzhi ni mos pa brtan @188a * //
translated: it is said that heat, peak, forbearance, and the supreme mundane state abandon those, respectively, and that should be understood as the special faith in the reality of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: pa dang yon tan gyi so sor gnas su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir mos pas spyod pa'i sar brjod do //
analyzed: pa dang yon tan gyi so sor gnas su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir mos pas spyod pa'i sar brjod do //
translated: The four, heat and so on, are called the level of practice through belief because they are the firm belief in the four truths and the individual abodes of good qualities.

original: de ltar ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du sgom pa po gang gi tshe don tha dad par gyur pa'i mngon par zhan pa med pa las /
analyzed: de ltar ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du sgom pa po gang gi tshe don tha dad par gyur pa'i mngon par zhan pa med pa las /
translated: Thus, when one who has equipoised the mind and is meditating on the selflessness of all phenomena is free from the superimposition of the difference of objects,🔽at that time, the superimposition of the difference of the apprehender is also abandoned.

original: ye shes kyi snang ba cung zad gsal bas yid tsam kho nar lta ba de'i tshe 'di'i dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs te de kho na snang ba thob pa zhes pa'i ting nge 'dzin du brjod do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba cung zad gsal bas yid tsam kho nar lta ba de'i tshe 'di'i dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs te de kho na snang ba thob pa zhes pa'i ting nge 'dzin du brjod do //
translated: When the appearance of pristine consciousness is slightly clear, and only a little is seen, that is the stage of heat. It is called the samādhi of attaining the appearance of thatness.

original: de'i rjes su ye shes kyi snang ba 'bring du gsal ba ni rtse mo ste snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su ye shes kyi snang ba 'bring du gsal ba ni rtse mo ste snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: After that, the appearance of pristine consciousness that is moderately clear is the peak. It is the samādhi of the increase of appearance.

original: gang gi tshe sems tsam la gnas pas phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba shin tu gsal ba skye ba de'i tshe bzod pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems tsam la gnas pas phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba shin tu gsal ba skye ba de'i tshe bzod pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: When the appearance of pristine consciousness that is very clear arises by abiding in mind only, without clinging to external objects, that is the stage of acceptance.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa med par zhugs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa med par zhugs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Because the aspect of the apprehended is absent, it is the samādhi that enters one aspect of the meaning of thatness.

original: gang gi tshe yang don 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba rdzogs par gyur par de'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs te de kho na bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang don 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba rdzogs par gyur par de'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs te de kho na bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: When the distraction that apprehends objects is completed by the appearance of non-appearance of wisdom, at that time it is the stage of the supreme mundane quality, and that is the uninterrupted samādhi.

original: de'i de ma thag pa'i skad cig chos thams cad bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa mthong ba'i lam mngon sum pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de'i de ma thag pa'i skad cig chos thams cad bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa mthong ba'i lam mngon sum pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: Immediately after that, the moment of the path of seeing that manifests the reality of the selflessness of all phenomena is the antidote of direct realization.

original: de'i phyir de kho na la thams cad spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na la thams cad spong bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is in that reality that all are abandoned.

original: gang 'dod pa yang /🔽seng ge bzang pos /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa yang / seng ge bzang pos /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi rnams /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi rnams /
translated: The four conceptions of apprehended and apprehender🔽are explained as being abandoned on the paths of seeing and meditation, which are included in the realization of the peak.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pas bsdus pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag kho na la spang bar bya ba'o zhes bshad pa de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pas bsdus pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag kho na la spang bar bya ba'o zhes bshad pa de mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: de'i tshig dang snang ba thob pa la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i tshig dang snang ba thob pa la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: It would contradict the explanation that the words and appearances obtained and so on are to be realized.

original: ci ste gnyen po mthong ba'i lam mo zhes pas bsgom pa'i lam nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste gnyen po mthong ba'i lam mo zhes pas bsgom pa'i lam nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: If you say that the path of seeing is the antidote and the path of meditation is indicated,

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la yang 'phags pas bzhed do zhe na /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la yang 'phags pas bzhed do zhe na /
translated: then the summit would be asserted to be the realization of the āryas.

original: de'i tshe mdo sde rgyan du gsungs pa'i rim pa dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mdo sde rgyan du gsungs pa'i rim pa dang 'gal te /
translated: In that case, it would contradict the order stated in the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras,

original: der ni de ltar bshad zin pa'i dro bar gyur pha la sogs pa rnams nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: der ni de ltar bshad zin pa'i dro bar gyur pha la sogs pa rnams nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: which explains that heat and so on are factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: 'di las pha rol du mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs gnyis las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las pha rol du mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs gnyis las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This text explains that the state of the path of seeing is the two liberations and the wisdom free from subject and object.

original: gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: It is nonconceptual because it is free from the concepts of subject and object.

original: dri ma dang @188b bral ba ste mthong pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma dang @188b bral ba ste mthong pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free from stains, because it has abandoned the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de 'di'i gnas yongs gyur pa ste //
analyzed: de 'di'i gnas yongs gyur pa ste //
translated: That is its transformation of the basis.

original: sa ni dang po yin par 'dod //🔽de 'di'i bskal pa dpag med kyis //
analyzed: sa ni dang po yin par 'dod // de 'di'i bskal pa dpag med kyis //
translated: It is asserted to be the first ground.

original: shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur //
translated: It becomes extremely pure

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: through countless eons.

original: gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i skabs su ni /
analyzed: gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i skabs su ni /
translated: In the context of the accumulation of the antidote,

original: dang po'i gzung bya'i dngos po ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang rmi lam la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dang po'i gzung bya'i dngos po ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang rmi lam la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: the first object of apprehension is suchness and so on, forms and so on, and dreams and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni gzung bya'i gnyen po'i dngos po ni sbyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzung bya'i gnyen po'i dngos po ni sbyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug pa rnams so //
translated: The second is the object of apprehension that is the antidote, which is generosity and so on up to the qualities of a buddha.

original: 'dzin pa yang ste yul dang po ni gang zag rdzas su yod pa rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang ste yul dang po ni gang zag rdzas su yod pa rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second apprehension is the first object, which is the substantially existent person, such as a stream enterer and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa gang zag btags par yod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa gang zag btags par yod pa'o //
translated: The second is the imputedly existent person, such as a stream enterer and so on.

original: mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
translated: The path of seeing and the path of meditation

original: bya ba'i lam ni so so la //🔽rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
analyzed: bya ba'i lam ni so so la // rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
translated: are the individual paths of action.🔽The antidote to the four types of🔽conceptualization

original: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
translated: is the fourfold realization.

original: zhes mdor bstan pa /
analyzed: zhes mdor bstan pa /
translated: This is the brief presentation.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pas bsdus pa'i mthong ba'i lam la dang bsgom pa'i lam la spang bar bya ba 'di'i yang gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ni 'jug pa'i phyogs la brten pa ste /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pas bsdus pa'i mthong ba'i lam la dang bsgom pa'i lam la spang bar bya ba 'di'i yang gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ni 'jug pa'i phyogs la brten pa ste /
translated: The first conceptualization of apprehended objects to be abandoned on the path of seeing and the path of meditation subsumed by the realization of the peak is based on the side of engagement.

original: gang byang chub sems dpas blang bar bya ba de 'di'i 'jug pa'i phyogs te byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nyid dang rigs dang lam yang dag par 'grub pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bya'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpas blang bar bya ba de 'di'i 'jug pa'i phyogs te byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nyid dang rigs dang lam yang dag par 'grub pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bya'o //
translated: That which is to be taken up by the bodhisattva is the side of engagement for him, the generation of the thought of enlightenment itself, the conceptualization of the object of apprehension of the accomplishment of the lineage and the path, and so forth.

original: gnyis pa ni ldog pa'i phyogs la brten pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ldog pa'i phyogs la brten pa ste /
translated: The second is based on the side of cessation.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i spang bar bya ba de rnams 'di'i ldog pa'i phyogs khams gsum gyis bsdus pa'i chos dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos te rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bya'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i spang bar bya ba de rnams 'di'i ldog pa'i phyogs khams gsum gyis bsdus pa'i chos dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos te rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bya'o //
translated: The latter are the dharmas of the three realms, and the dharmas of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, which are the objects of the conceptualization of the apprehended.

original: gsum pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa sems can rdzas su yod pa la brten pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gsum pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa sems can rdzas su yod pa la brten pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The third is the conceptualization of the apprehender, which is based on the substantial existence of sentient beings, and belongs to ordinary beings.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te de rnams kyis spangs pa nyid kyi phyir la mthong bas spang bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te de rnams kyis spangs pa nyid kyi phyir la mthong bas spang bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not belong to the noble ones, because they have abandoned it, and because it is based on the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i chos rnams la so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes yid la byed pa ni lhag par mos pa ste 'dir brjod par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i chos rnams la so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes yid la byed pa ni lhag par mos pa ste 'dir brjod par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mental attention of ordinary beings to these dharmas, all dharmas are without a self, is a mere conviction, and is not what is intended here.

original: 'dzin pa rdzas su yod pa'i chos rnams ni 'dzin pa dang 'dor ba la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa rdzas su yod pa'i chos rnams ni 'dzin pa dang 'dor ba la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The dharmas of the substantial existence of the apprehender are those of the apprehender, the abandoner, and so on.

original: de rnam par rtog pa rnams 'phags pa rnams @189a * //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa rnams 'phags pa rnams @189a * //
translated: Those are the conceptual thoughts of the āryas.🔽

original: kyis spangs pas so //
analyzed: kyis spangs pas so //
translated: because the noble ones have eliminated the conceptualizations.

original: bzhi pa sems can btags par yod pa la brten pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa sems can btags par yod pa la brten pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The fourth is based on the nominal existence of sentient beings, which is the noble ones’

original: de'i dbye ba ched du bya ba ji lta bar nges par mi 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma spangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ched du bya ba ji lta bar nges par mi 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma spangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: because the non-arising of the conceptualizations of the hearers and solitary realizers is not due to their having eliminated the conceptualizations of the hearers and solitary realizers, and because the hearers and solitary realizers have not eliminated the conceptualizations of sentient beings, and because the conceptualizations of sentient beings do not arise for the hearers and solitary realizers when they are in meditative equipoise.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams la ni dang po yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams la ni dang po yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is also present in ordinary beings.

original: gang bdag de'i dus na rma bya'i rgyal po yan lag ma smad pa zhes bya ba der gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung de ni tha snyad pa ste don dam pa pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang bdag de'i dus na rma bya'i rgyal po yan lag ma smad pa zhes bya ba der gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung de ni tha snyad pa ste don dam pa pa ma yin no //
translated: The statements of the Bhagavān, such as “I was at that time the king of peacocks named Viśvarūpa,” are conventional, not ultimate.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni /
translated: On the path of cultivation,

original: dang po'i pha rol tu phyir pa la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyis rgyas pa zhes pa mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa la sogs pa gzung bya'o //
analyzed: dang po'i pha rol tu phyir pa la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyis rgyas pa zhes pa mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa la sogs pa gzung bya'o //
translated: The first is the brief and extensive natures of the suchness and so on of the arhats and so on.

original: gnyis pa'i byang chub kyi sems mi bskyed pa la sogs pa gzung bya'o //🔽gsum pa'i rdzas su yod pa'i 'dzin pa pos sems can rnams gdags par bya ba'o /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i byang chub kyi sems mi bskyed pa la sogs pa gzung bya'o // gsum pa'i rdzas su yod pa'i 'dzin pa pos sems can rnams gdags par bya ba'o /
translated: The second is the brief and extensive natures of the nonarising of the mind of enlightenment and so on.

original: zhes pas sems can btags pa zhes pa la sogs pa yul lo //
analyzed: zhes pas sems can btags pa zhes pa la sogs pa yul lo //
translated: The third is the brief and extensive natures of the designation of sentient beings by the apprehender that exists substantially.

original: bzhi pa'i gdags par bya ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang de'i rgyu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa yul lo //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i gdags par bya ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang de'i rgyu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa yul lo //
translated: The fourth is the brief and extensive natures of the designation of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so on and their causes, such as omniscience.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di rnams kyang blo dman pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das mar so sor rnam pa dgur dbye bar mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di rnams kyang blo dman pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das mar so sor rnam pa dgur dbye bar mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One has divided these conceptualizations into nine types for the sake of understanding by those of lesser intelligence.

original: shes rab rnon po rnams kyis brnyas pa spang ba'i ched du shin tu phye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab rnon po rnams kyis brnyas pa spang ba'i ched du shin tu phye ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not so divided for the sake of those of sharp faculties, in order to avoid their contempt.

original: mdor bsdus nas ni bzhi po kho nas rtogs par sla'o zhes kha cig tu rnam pa dgur yang dbye ba ma byas te /
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas ni bzhi po kho nas rtogs par sla'o zhes kha cig tu rnam pa dgur yang dbye ba ma byas te /
translated: In some places, they are not divided into nine types, for the sake of brevity, by means of just four.

original: de bzhin du kho bos kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du kho bos kyang ngo //
translated: So it is for us.

original: spang bar bya ba 'di rnams las sna tshogs su rab tu phye ba gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs par mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba 'di rnams las sna tshogs su rab tu phye ba gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs par mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: Among these objects of abandonment, the conceptualizations of apprehendeds are divided into various types, to be abandoned during the path of seeing, the stage of preparation.

original: gnyis pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: The conceptualizations of the apprehender are to be abandoned during the path of seeing, the stage of the actual basis.

original: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam gyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam gyi'o //
translated: So it is for the path of meditation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore the Bhagavān says in the Mother of Conquerors:

original: theg pa chen po de gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po de gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: From where will the Mahāyāna be certain to emerge?

original: khams gsum pa las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: It will be certain to emerge from the three realms.

original: bar mar yang /
analyzed: bar mar yang /
translated: And in the middle:

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs @189b med pa'i khams su skye ba ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs @189b med pa'i khams su skye ba ma lags so //
translated: Bhagavān, purity does not arise in the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: sha' ri'i bu khams gsum pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pas so zhes so //
analyzed: sha' ri'i bu khams gsum pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pas so zhes so //
translated: Śāriputra, the nature of the three realms is not observed.

original: 'phags pas kyang rnam par rtog pa 'di brgyad ni khams gsum par 'dod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pas kyang rnam par rtog pa 'di brgyad ni khams gsum par 'dod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: And the Ārya also says, “These eight conceptual thoughts are asserted to be the three realms.”

original: slar yang mthong ba'i lam gyi bzod pa 'di skyes pa na 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam par rtog pa bzhis bsdus pa spong bar byed do zhes so //
analyzed: slar yang mthong ba'i lam gyi bzod pa 'di skyes pa na 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam par rtog pa bzhis bsdus pa spong bar byed do zhes so //
translated: And again, when this patience of the path of seeing arises, the afflictions included in the desire, form, and formless realms, which are included in the four conceptual thoughts, are abandoned by seeing.

original: 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi rnams las so sor rnam pa dgur phye bas sum cu rtsa drug ste khams gsum du grangs brgya rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //🔽'o na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi rnams las so sor rnam pa dgur phye bas sum cu rtsa drug ste khams gsum du grangs brgya rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro // 'o na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis /
translated: Here, there are thirty six by dividing each of the four conceptions of object and apprehender into nine aspects, making one hundred and eight in the three realms.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i lam gnyis la /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i lam gnyis la /
translated: If that is so, then the fifteen aspects of the antidote that are explained to exist on the two paths of the summit,

original: bcu drug pa la sogs pa gnyen po'i rnam pa bco lnga rnams kyis bcu drug pa la sogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa'i dbye ba bco lnga rnams gzugs kyi khams kho nar rnam par rtog pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams spong bar rigs
analyzed: bcu drug pa la sogs pa gnyen po'i rnam pa bco lnga rnams kyis bcu drug pa la sogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa'i dbye ba bco lnga rnams gzugs kyi khams kho nar rnam par rtog pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams spong bar rigs
translated: the sixteenth and so on, would reasonably eliminate the seventy two conceptions that are the fifteen aspects of the opposing factors that are the sixteenth and so on in the form realm alone.

original: kyi / ci ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams brjod ce na /
analyzed: kyi / ci ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams brjod ce na /
translated: But how are the desire and formless realms described?

original: bden te / 'on kyang khams gsum gyis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad ni 'jig rten pa'i nges 'byed cha mthun gyi gnas skabs dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang de 'dir spong ba ste /
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang khams gsum gyis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad ni 'jig rten pa'i nges 'byed cha mthun gyi gnas skabs dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang de 'dir spong ba ste /
translated: That is true, but the afflictions subsumed by the three realms are one hundred and eight, which are relinquished here in the context of the factors conducive to penetrative insight of mundane beings.

original: shugs kyis rnam par rtog pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis kho na'o zhes pa don gyis mi 'gal lo //🔽gang gi phyir ji ltar rnam par rtog par bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa sum cu rtsa drug po khams gsum du brgya du 'gyur ba rtogs par sla ba nyid kyis ma brjod pa rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa
analyzed: shugs kyis rnam par rtog pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis kho na'o zhes pa don gyis mi 'gal lo // gang gi phyir ji ltar rnam par rtog par bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa sum cu rtsa drug po khams gsum du brgya du 'gyur ba rtogs par sla ba nyid kyis ma brjod pa rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa
translated: Thus the meaning of the above passage is not contradictory.🔽Since the fourfold classification of the four conceptions is easy to understand, the thirty six conceptions beginning with ignorance are not mentioned.

original: dag gi rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis phyin ci log pa'i phyir dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo phyin ci log gis bskyed pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i nang du 'dus pa rnams /
analyzed: dag gi rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis phyin ci log pa'i phyir dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo phyin ci log gis bskyed pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i nang du 'dus pa rnams /
translated: They are included in ignorance because they are the cause of the four conceptions and because they are generated by the error of conceiving in the opposite manner to the way things exist, such as conceiving things and nonthings as real.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la ma rig pa spangs pas spong pa de bzhin du brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye ba rnams dang brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la ma rig pa spangs pas spong pa de bzhin du brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye ba rnams dang brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i
translated: So too, on the ground of Perfect Joy, ignorance is abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: dbye ba rnams kyang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa'i khams su gnyen po rnam pa dgu rnams kyis ma rig pa dgu spangs pa kho nas spong la /
analyzed: dbye ba rnams kyang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa'i khams su gnyen po rnam pa dgu rnams kyis ma rig pa dgu spangs pa kho nas spong la /
translated: In the desire realm, the nine aspects of the antidote abandon the nine aspects of ignorance.

original: @190a * // gzugs kyi khams su yang gnyen po rnam pa bco lngas ma rig pa rnam pa bco lnga spangs pa kho nas so //
analyzed: @190a * // gzugs kyi khams su yang gnyen po rnam pa bco lngas ma rig pa rnam pa bco lnga spangs pa kho nas so //
translated: In the form realm, the fifteen aspects of the antidote abandon the fifteen aspects of ignorance.🔽The fifteen aspects of the antidote are taught from the perspective of the disciples, as before.

original: gnyen po'i rnam pa bco lnga rnams kyis ma rig pa'i rnam pa bco lnga rnams ni sngar dang 'dra bar gdul bya'i ngor gsungs pa de bzhin nyid la sogs pa gzung ba dang rdzas su yod pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog
analyzed: gnyen po'i rnam pa bco lnga rnams kyis ma rig pa'i rnam pa bco lnga rnams ni sngar dang 'dra bar gdul bya'i ngor gsungs pa de bzhin nyid la sogs pa gzung ba dang rdzas su yod pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog
translated: The fifteen aspects of ignorance are the concepts of the suchness of the desire realm and so on as objects and of the stream enterer and so on as substantial, continuous subjects.

original: pa'i rab tu dbye ba bdun cu rtsa gnyis spong ngo //
analyzed: pa'i rab tu dbye ba bdun cu rtsa gnyis spong ngo //
translated: The seventy-two types of discrimination are abandoned.

original: ma rig pa'i rnam pa gzhan gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye bar ma gsungs pa rnams ni gnyen po'i rnam pa gzhan rnams kyis spong ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rnam pa gzhan gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye bar ma gsungs pa rnams ni gnyen po'i rnam pa gzhan rnams kyis spong ngo //
translated: The other types of ignorance, which are not mentioned in terms of the discrimination of grasped and grasper, are abandoned by the other types of antidotes.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams su yang gdon mi za bar 'di ltar gdams par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams su yang gdon mi za bar 'di ltar gdams par bya'o //
translated: In the fourth concentration and the formless realm, one should definitely instruct in this way.

original: gzhan du na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam par gzhag pa dang ci ltar mi 'gal /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam par gzhag pa dang ci ltar mi 'gal /
translated: Otherwise, how could it not contradict the presentation that will be explained?

original: 'phags pas mdzad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rnams la phan tshun 'gal ba rmi lam na yang med do zhes pa rgyas pas chog go //
analyzed: 'phags pas mdzad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rnams la phan tshun 'gal ba rmi lam na yang med do zhes pa rgyas pas chog go //
translated: In the presentations made by the noble ones, there is no contradiction even in a dream. This is enough elaboration.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu rnams sngar nyid du spangs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu rnams sngar nyid du spangs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren't these types of discrimination already abandoned?

original: mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is impossible.

original: ci ltar rtogs pa rab tu gyur pa mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs 'di la spang par bstan zhen /
analyzed: ci ltar rtogs pa rab tu gyur pa mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs 'di la spang par bstan zhen /
translated: How is it taught that they are abandoned in this final stage of the perfection of realization?

original: skyon med de gang gi phyir gsang ba phra mo la 'jug pa dang mngon par shes pa chen po'i gegs kyis kun du rmongs pa dag dang de'i sa bon yang sa bcu pa la spong ngo zhes dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa'i mdor gsungs so
analyzed: skyon med de gang gi phyir gsang ba phra mo la 'jug pa dang mngon par shes pa chen po'i gegs kyis kun du rmongs pa dag dang de'i sa bon yang sa bcu pa la spong ngo zhes dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa'i mdor gsungs so
translated: There is no fault, because the Subcommentary on the Elucidation of Intention declares that the obscurations to entering the subtle secrets and to the great superknowledges, and also their seeds, are abandoned on the tenth stage.

original: // yang dgongs pa nges par 'grel par /
analyzed: // yang dgongs pa nges par 'grel par /
translated: Again, the Elucidation of the Intention says:

original: bag la nyal stobs chung ba ni sa drug pa dang bdun pa la nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du spyod pa nyid nye bar bzung nas so ;
analyzed: bag la nyal stobs chung ba ni sa drug pa dang bdun pa la nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du spyod pa nyid nye bar bzung nas so ;
translated: The weak latent states are taken as the subtle actual afflictions on the sixth and seventh stages.

original: / bag la nyal phra mo ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa rnams la thams cad kyis thams cad du nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa med pas shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rten tsam nye bar bzung nas so zhes so //
analyzed: / bag la nyal phra mo ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa rnams la thams cad kyis thams cad du nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa med pas shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rten tsam nye bar bzung nas so zhes so //
translated: The subtle latent states are taken as the mere basis of the objective obscurations on the eighth stage, etc., because there is no occurrence of any afflictions whatsoever.

original: de'i phyir ji skad brjod pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun du rmongs pa'i rgyu chad pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad brjod pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun du rmongs pa'i rgyu chad pas /
translated: Therefore, the cause of the delusion with its habitual tendencies, as described above, is severed.

original: rgyu can rnam pa 'di lta bu'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po rnams rtogs pa rab tu gyur pa mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sa bcu pa dang 'brel pa'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la nges par spong par rtogs par
analyzed: rgyu can rnam pa 'di lta bu'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po rnams rtogs pa rab tu gyur pa mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sa bcu pa dang 'brel pa'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la nges par spong par rtogs par
translated: One should understand that the four conceptual thoughts of apprehendeds and apprehenders of this sort with causes are definitely abandoned in the clear realization of the peak that is connected with the tenth stage by means of the nature of the ultimate transformation of realization.

original: bya ste / gzhan du ni res 'ga' bas spong zhes sngon gyi slob dpon @190b rnams so //
analyzed: bya ste / gzhan du ni res 'ga' bas spong zhes sngon gyi slob dpon @190b rnams so //
translated: The former masters say that elsewhere they are abandoned intermittently.

original: 'dir ni mdor bsdus pa'i don te ji skad brjod pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba kho na ste phyin ci log de ni thog ma med pa'i dus can dngos po la sogs par mngon par🔽zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'dir ni mdor bsdus pa'i don te ji skad brjod pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba kho na ste phyin ci log de ni thog ma med pa'i dus can dngos po la sogs par mngon par🔽zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Here, the meaning in brief is that all conceptual thoughts of apprehendeds and apprehenders as they have been described are only thoroughly generated by error, and that error has the characteristic of being fixated on things and so forth since beginningless time.

original: de'i phyir de las bzlog pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa can nyid kyis de dang 'gal ba rang bzhin me pa'i ye shes las spong bar byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las bzlog pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa can nyid kyis de dang 'gal ba rang bzhin me pa'i ye shes las spong bar byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, by having an object and an aspect that are the opposite of that, it is only the wisdom that is the opposite of that which abandons the view of the transitory collection.

original: de spangs na de'i rtsa ba can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams ci ltar gnas pa thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: de spangs na de'i rtsa ba can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams ci ltar gnas pa thob ces pa'o //
translated: When that is abandoned, the conceptions of apprehendeds and apprehenders that are rooted in that are also abandoned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: mdo 'ga' zhig tu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ma mdzad la /
analyzed: mdo 'ga' zhig tu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ma mdzad la /
translated: in some sūtras the divisions of the conceptions of apprehendeds and apprehenders are not set forth.

original: 'ga' zhig tu 'dod chags la sogs pa bag la nyal dgu rnams kyi yang ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu 'dod chags la sogs pa bag la nyal dgu rnams kyi yang ste /
translated: In some sūtras, the nine dormant states of attachment and so on are set forth.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo ma rig pa spangs pa kho na las de'i rgyu can gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams nges par spong bar mngon par dgongs pas so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo ma rig pa spangs pa kho na las de'i rgyu can gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams nges par spong bar mngon par dgongs pas so //
translated: The thought is that by abandoning ignorance, which is the root of the conceptions of apprehendeds and apprehenders, the conceptions of apprehendeds and apprehenders that are rooted in that are definitely abandoned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: dngos su ma rig pa dang 'gal ba'i byang chub kyi sems kho na thams cad kyis nges par bsgom par bya bar nyan thos dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang gsang sngags kyi tshul thams cad du bstan te /🔽skye med 'jig pa med pa yi //
analyzed: dngos su ma rig pa dang 'gal ba'i byang chub kyi sems kho na thams cad kyis nges par bsgom par bya bar nyan thos dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang gsang sngags kyi tshul thams cad du bstan te / skye med 'jig pa med pa yi //
translated: In fact, all of them should definitely cultivate only the enlightenment mind which is the opposite of ignorance, as is taught in all the ways of the Sravakas, the Perfections, and the Secret Spells.🔽The Dharmadhatu, which is unborn and undestroyed,

original: chos kyi dbyings ni 'gro la snyoms //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni 'gro la snyoms //
translated: is equal in all migrating beings.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa nyan thos kyi mdo la sogs pa rnams su bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa nyan thos kyi mdo la sogs pa rnams su bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught in the Sravaka Sutras, etc.

original: drod la sogs pa rnams dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid du sngar brjod zin la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang ngo //
analyzed: drod la sogs pa rnams dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid du sngar brjod zin la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang ngo //
translated: The heat, etc., have already been mentioned as having the nature of the faculties and the powers, and also as having the nature of the practice of engagement.

original: de yang theg pa chen po la 'jug pa dang de la 'dzeg pa'o //
analyzed: de yang theg pa chen po la 'jug pa dang de la 'dzeg pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the engagement in the Mahayana and the mounting on it.

original: de yang don gcig pa nyid kyis 'jug pa ni theg pa la 'dzeg pa yin la 'dzeg pa yang 'jug pa'o zhes ming la gcig kho na'o zhes 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang don gcig pa nyid kyis 'jug pa ni theg pa la 'dzeg pa yin la 'dzeg pa yang 'jug pa'o zhes ming la gcig kho na'o zhes 'phags pa'o //
translated: And since they have the same meaning, the engagement is the mounting on the vehicle, and the mounting is the engagement. Thus it is only the name that is different.

original: bcom ldan 'das mar yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mar yang /
translated: The Bhagavati Prajnaparamita also says:

original: theg pa chen po la 'dzeg pa zhes so //🔽'dis 'gro ba dang / der 'gro ba'o zhes pas dang por 'jug pa'i sgrub pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis chos la 'jug pa yin la /

original: phyi nas de gong nas gong du khyad par du rtogs pas yang dag par 'dzeg pa'o //🔽zhes pa tshig gnyis so //
analyzed: phyi nas de gong nas gong du khyad par du rtogs pas yang dag par 'dzeg pa'o // zhes pa tshig gnyis so //
translated: It is the vehicle because it is the means of going, and it is great because it is the vehicle for the great, that is, for the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i phyir @191a * //🔽'jug pa ni 'gro bar rtsom pa dang 'gro ba dang gnas nas 'gro ba rnams rim pa ji lta bar mos pa spyod pa'i sa dang / rab tu dga' ba nas bzung ste bdun pa ji srid par dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams la'o zhes slob dpon dbyig gnyen bzheng pa ste sngar brjod do //🔽dang po ni mos pa yin la bdun rnams su 'bad pas 'gro ba yin zhing brgyad pa la sogs pa rnams su lhun gyis grub pa'i theg pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir @191a * //🔽'jug pa ni 'gro bar rtsom pa dang 'gro ba dang gnas nas 'gro ba rnams rim pa ji lta bar mos pa spyod pa'i sa dang / rab tu dga' ba nas bzung ste bdun pa ji srid par dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams la'o zhes slob dpon dbyig gnyen bzheng pa ste sngar brjod do //🔽dang po ni mos pa yin la bdun rnams su 'bad pas 'gro ba yin zhing brgyad pa la sogs pa rnams su lhun gyis grub pa'i theg pa kho na ste /
translated: It is the vehicle because it is the means of going

original: legs par 'byar ba'i shing rta la sogs pas ltar 'di'i 'gro ba rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par 'byar ba'i shing rta la sogs pas ltar 'di'i 'gro ba rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The going of this is to be accomplished just like a well-oiled chariot and so on.

original: de'i phyir dang por byang chub sems dpas theg pa chen po lam gyi rang bzhin la 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por byang chub sems dpas theg pa chen po lam gyi rang bzhin la 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, first the Bodhisattva enters into the nature of the path of the Great Vehicle.

original: de la lam gyi rab tu dbye ba rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dang rnam par thar pa dang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang zad
analyzed: de la lam gyi rab tu dbye ba rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dang rnam par thar pa dang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang zad
translated: Therein, the divisions of the path are the six perfections, the concentrations of the factors of enlightenment, the formless [absorptions], the liberations, the serial absorptions, the overpowerings, the bases of mastery, the totalities, the superknowledges, the liberations, the perception-spheres of mastery, the perception-spheres of totality, the emptiness, signless, and wishless [gates of liberation], and so on.

original: par dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes pa dang dbang po dang ting nge 'dzin dang rjes su dran pa dang tshad med pa dang / nor dang rnam par rtog pa dang spyan dang mngon par shes pa dang gzungs dang dbang po dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: par dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes pa dang dbang po dang ting nge 'dzin dang rjes su dran pa dang tshad med pa dang / nor dang rnam par rtog pa dang spyan dang mngon par shes pa dang gzungs dang dbang po dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: wealth, conceptualization, eyes, superknowledges, retention, faculties, powers, fearlessnesses, correct understandings, and the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: de la bsam gtan rnam bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan rnam bzhi ste /
translated: There are four concentrations:

original: bsam gtan dang po nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang mi ldan pa dang / dngos po dang 'dod pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'dod pa rnams kyis dben pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang mi ldan pa dang / dngos po dang 'dod pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'dod pa rnams kyis dben pa /
translated: The first concentration is free from the desire of affliction and free from the desire of objects, because one does not observe objects and desire.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu can lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa mi dge ba rnams dang bral ba rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i gnyen po rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang ldan pa las te 'dod pa'i
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu can lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa mi dge ba rnams dang bral ba rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i gnyen po rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang ldan pa las te 'dod pa'i
translated: It is free from nonvirtuous misdeeds of body, speech and mind motivated by afflicted desire. It is associated with investigation and analysis because it is the antidote to desire realm since it is the antidote to desire realm

original: don grub pas dang lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pas dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nyams su myong ba'o //🔽gnyis pa ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams sems 'khrug par byed pa nyid kyi skyon du mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don grub pas dang lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pas dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nyams su myong ba'o // gnyis pa ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams sems 'khrug par byed pa nyid kyi skyon du mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: afflictions. It is associated with joy and pleasure because it experiences pliancy of body and mind through accomplishing the purpose of desire realm.🔽The second is associated with internal clarity and is free from investigation and analysis because it is free from all investigation and analysis.🔽It is free from the fault of investigation and analysis disturbing the mind.

original: de rnams la sems bzlog ste ting nge 'dzin par byed pas de rnams thams cad kyis thams cad spangs pa las rtog pa med la dpyod pa med pa nyid kyis nang rab tu dang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la sems bzlog ste ting nge 'dzin par byed pas de rnams thams cad kyis thams cad spangs pa las rtog pa med la dpyod pa med pa nyid kyis nang rab tu dang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: It is associated with internal clarity because it turns the mind away from investigation and analysis and stabilizes it in concentration.

original: gsum pa ni btang snyoms pa ste rtog pa dang dpyod @191b pa bzhin du dga' ba yang rags pa nyid kyis btang snyoms su byed pa'i phyir dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni btang snyoms pa ste rtog pa dang dpyod @191b pa bzhin du dga' ba yang rags pa nyid kyis btang snyoms su byed pa'i phyir dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The third is equanimity, because it is equanimity that is, it is the pacification of joy, since joy is gross, and it is endowed with mindfulness and introspection.

original: dga' ba'i go skabs mi 'byed pa'i ched du de dag gi shes rab mang du byed pa'i phyir dang / gzugs kyi lus dang yid kyi lus ngag tshor ba bde ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba la sbyor ba las bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i go skabs mi 'byed pa'i ched du de dag gi shes rab mang du byed pa'i phyir dang / gzugs kyi lus dang yid kyi lus ngag tshor ba bde ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba la sbyor ba las bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with pleasure, since it is applied to the body of form, the body of mind, and the pleasure of feeling and pliancy, in order to prevent the opportunity for joy.

original: bzhi pa ni bde ba yang med sdug bsngal yang med pa ste sdug bsngal ba dang / yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba sngar spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bde ba yang med sdug bsngal yang med pa ste sdug bsngal ba dang / yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba sngar spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The fourth is neither pleasure nor pain, because it is free of pleasure and pain and free of mental satisfaction and dissatisfaction.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pas ni bde ba yang ngo //🔽btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pas ni bde ba yang ngo // btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The fourth meditation is endowed with pleasure,🔽because it is endowed with the pleasure of equanimity and the pleasure of mindfulness.

original: de dag 'dir shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'dir shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, they attain complete purity.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag rnam lnga ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag rnam lnga ste /
translated: The first meditative absorption has five branches.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gnyen po'i yan lag ste de dag gis 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gnyen po'i yan lag ste de dag gis 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Discursive thought and discursive analysis are the branches of antidotes because they abandon the discursive thoughts of the desire realm, malice and harm.

original: dga' ba dang bde pa dag phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde pa dag phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Joy and pleasure are the branches of benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni de gnyis ka'i rten gyi yan lag ste ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i stobs kyis dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni de gnyis ka'i rten gyi yan lag ste ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i stobs kyis dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One pointedness of mind is the branch that is the basis of both because it is the basis of virtue and so on that engages them through the power of concentration.

original: gnyis pa yan lag bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yan lag bzhi rnams te /
translated: The second has four branches.

original: nang rab tu dang ba gnyis po'i yan lag yin la /
analyzed: nang rab tu dang ba gnyis po'i yan lag yin la /
translated: Inner clarity is the branch of the second.

original: yan lag lhag ma sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma sngar bzhin no //
translated: The remaining branches are as before.

original: gsum pa'i yan lag rnam lnga ste /
analyzed: gsum pa'i yan lag rnam lnga ste /
translated: The third has five branches.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag go / bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go / rten gyi yan lag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag go / bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go / rten gyi yan lag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Equanimity, mindfulness and introspection are the branches of antidotes, pleasure is the branch of benefit and the basis is as before.🔽The fourth has four branches.

original: bzhi pa'i yan lag bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i yan lag bzhi rnams te /
translated: The fourth has four members.

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag go / sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go / rten gyi yan lag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag go / sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go / rten gyi yan lag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The members of counter-agent are: pure equanimity and pure mindfulness. The member of benefit is the sensation that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant. The member of support is as above.

original: de las bsam gtan dang po bsgoms pas tshangs ris kyi lha rnams nas tshangs pa chen po ji srid par dang skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: de las bsam gtan dang po bsgoms pas tshangs ris kyi lha rnams nas tshangs pa chen po ji srid par dang skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
translated: By cultivating the first meditation, one is reborn in the heavens of Brahmakayika, etc., up to Mahabrahma, in accordance with one's fortune.

original: gnyis pas 'od gsal ba rnams ji srid par dang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis pas 'od gsal ba rnams ji srid par dang ngo //
translated: By the second, one is reborn in the heavens of Parittabha, etc.

original: gsum pas dge rgyas pa rnams ji srid par dang ngo //
analyzed: gsum pas dge rgyas pa rnams ji srid par dang ngo //
translated: By the third, one is reborn in the heavens of Apramanasubha, etc.

original: bzhi pas 'bras bu che ba ji srid par dang ngo //
analyzed: bzhi pas 'bras bu che ba ji srid par dang ngo //
translated: By the fourth, one is reborn in the heavens of Vrhatphala, etc.

original: de'i steng du gnas gtsang ma rnams su 'phags pa rnams kho na skye'o //🔽gzugs med pa bzhi rnams kho na @192a * //
analyzed: de'i steng du gnas gtsang ma rnams su 'phags pa rnams kho na skye'o // gzugs med pa bzhi rnams kho na @192a * //
translated: Above that, only the noble ones are reborn in the pure abodes.

original: ni gzugs med pa kho na nyid rnams te /
analyzed: ni gzugs med pa kho na nyid rnams te /
translated: The four formless ones are only in the formless realm.

original: de la sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams dang gyong dang ra ba la sogs pa sgrib pa'i 'du shes rnams dang khang bzangs dang skyed mos tshal dang ri dang chu bo dang / zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa sna tshogs nyid kyi 'du shes rnams la 'dod chags dang bral nas thams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes bsgoms pas /🔽de rnams rnam pa thams cad du snang ba med pa las nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes 'di ltar 'dir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la dmigs pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs bar byas nas gnas so //
analyzed: de la sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams dang gyong dang ra ba la sogs pa sgrib pa'i 'du shes rnams dang khang bzangs dang skyed mos tshal dang ri dang chu bo dang / zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa sna tshogs nyid kyi 'du shes rnams la 'dod chags dang bral nas thams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes bsgoms pas / de rnams rnam pa thams cad du snang ba med pa las nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes 'di ltar 'dir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la dmigs pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs bar byas nas gnas so //
translated: In this context, one is free from the discriminations of form such as blue and yellow, the discriminations of obstruction such as mountains and walls, and the discriminations of variety such as mansions, parks, mountains, rivers, the moon, the sun, and so on.🔽Since one meditates on the discrimination of space in all aspects,🔽one abides in the base of infinite space by focusing on the base of infinite space, having eliminated all those discriminations.

original: de shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas par mos par byas pa de kho na mtha' yas par mos te thams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes bzlog pa las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
analyzed: de shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas par mos par byas pa de kho na mtha' yas par mos te thams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes bzlog pa las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
translated: The base of infinite consciousness is attained by reversing the discrimination of space in all aspects and by focusing on the infinite nature of the consciousness that focuses on infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las gong du bskyod pas dmigs pa ci yang mi mthong ba ci yang med do zhes pa ni ci yang med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las gong du bskyod pas dmigs pa ci yang mi mthong ba ci yang med do zhes pa ni ci yang med pa ste /
translated: Since one has risen above the base of the infinity of consciousness, one does not see any object at all and thinks, “There is nothing at all.”🔽This is the base of nothing at all.

original: de kho na dmigs par byas nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de kho na dmigs par byas nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having taken that as the object, one enters into meditative concentration on the base of nothing at all.

original: ci yang med pa nyid kyis 'du shes la yang chags pa dang bral ba ni de yang zlog par byed la /
analyzed: ci yang med pa nyid kyis 'du shes la yang chags pa dang bral ba ni de yang zlog par byed la /
translated: Since one is free from attachment to the discernment of nothing at all, one turns away from that as well.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched gang yang dag par bsgrubs pas na /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched gang yang dag par bsgrubs pas na /
translated: Since one accomplishes the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment,

original: ci yang gi 'du shes ni sngar kho nar bzlog zin pa de'i phyir 'du shes med cing /
analyzed: ci yang gi 'du shes ni sngar kho nar bzlog zin pa de'i phyir 'du shes med cing /
translated: one has no discernment.

original: 'du shes phra ba ni 'jug pa kho na ste rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes phra ba ni 'jug pa kho na ste rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Since subtle discernment is engaged, it is not complete liberation.
