original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered into meditative concentration on the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment,

original: nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: one experiences it.

original: gzugs med pa nyid 'di rnams la yan lag rnam par gzhag pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa nyid 'di rnams la yan lag rnam par gzhag pa med de /
translated: In these formless states, there is no establishment of branches.

original: zhi gnas su ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas su ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are of one taste in calm abiding.

original: de ltar brgyad po 'di rnams bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa nyid rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar brgyad po 'di rnams bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa nyid rnams te /
translated: Thus, these eight are the meditative stabilizations and formless states.

original: de rnams la byang chub sems dpa' nyi ma so sor snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: de rnams la byang chub sems dpa' nyi ma so sor snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: The bodhisattva enters them every day.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sngon dang rjes la yang nam mkha'i rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams yid la byed do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sngon dang rjes la yang nam mkha'i rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams yid la byed do //
translated: And before and after entering them, he brings to mind the aspects, signs, and marks of space.

original: de la chos 'di rnams thams cad ldan pa ma yin mi ldan pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa nam mkha'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos 'di rnams thams cad ldan pa ma yin mi ldan pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa nam mkha'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Among them, the aspect of space is that all these phenomena are neither conjoined nor disjoined,

original: tha dad dang tha dad med par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad dang tha dad med par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not accepted as either different or not different.🔽The signs of space are that they are formless, cannot be shown, and are unobstructing,

original: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa @192b med pa zhes pa rnams nam mkha'i rtags te de dang chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa @192b med pa zhes pa rnams nam mkha'i rtags te de dang chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar to that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes pa nam mkha'i mtshan ma ste nam mkha' lta bu'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes pa nam mkha'i mtshan ma ste nam mkha' lta bu'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sign of space is the sameness of signlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams la yang snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams la yang snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: He enters the eight liberations.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As the Lord has said:

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams blta'o zhes pa rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams blta'o zhes pa rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is “having form, he sees forms.”

original: nang gzugs can ma yin pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la blta'o zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs can ma yin pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la blta'o zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is “not having internal form, he sees external forms.”

original: sdug pa'o zhes mos par 'gyur ro zhes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'o zhes mos par 'gyur ro zhes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is “he is resolved upon being beautiful.”

original: 'di gsum rnams ni 'di rnams kyis sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar byed pas sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di gsum rnams ni 'di rnams kyis sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar byed pas sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa rnams so //
translated: These three are liberations because they liberate from the obscurations of emanation, since they are the side of the antidote to the obscurations of emanation.

original: de la dang po dag mi sdug pa ste gsum pa sdug pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po dag mi sdug pa ste gsum pa sdug pa'o //
translated: Therein, the first is ugliness, the third is beauty.

original: rnal 'byor pa 'ga' zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog la chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por nang gi sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas de'i de ma thag kho nar phyi rol gyi rnam par bsngos pa
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'ga' zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog la chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por nang gi sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas de'i de ma thag kho nar phyi rol gyi rnam par bsngos pa
translated: Some yogis enter meditative attainment on internal sound and so on as an antidote to attachment to the colors of the desire realm and so on.🔽Immediately after that, they focus on external blue and so on and enter meditative attainment on the first absorption or as an antidote to attachment to the colors of the first absorption level, they enter meditative attainment on the second absorption.

original: la sogs pa la dmigs nas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'am bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kha dog la chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis pa la ste de gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa la dmigs nas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'am bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kha dog la chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis pa la ste de gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: They see form with form should be stated.

original: nang gi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs can zhes brjod la /
analyzed: nang gi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs can zhes brjod la /
translated: They are called those with form because they focus on internal form and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs rnams la lta'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs rnams la lta'o zhes pa ste /
translated: They see form with form should be stated because they focus on external form.

original: mos pas sprul pa rnams yid kyis mthong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mos pas sprul pa rnams yid kyis mthong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: They see emanations with the mental faculty through resolve.

original: kha cig nang gi lam dmigs pa kho nar phyi rol gyi rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa la dmigs nas bsam gtan dang po'am gnyis pa la snga ma bzhin snyoms par 'jug pa de nang gzugs med par 'du shes las phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta'o🔽zhes par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig nang gi lam dmigs pa kho nar phyi rol gyi rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa la dmigs nas bsam gtan dang po'am gnyis pa la snga ma bzhin snyoms par 'jug pa de nang gzugs med par 'du shes las phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta'o zhes par brjod par bya'o //
translated: They are called those who view external form while having the internal discernment of formless states.

original: de bzhin du mi sdug pa bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyud zhum pa dga' bar bya ba'i ched du ci bdag la yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams sdug par yid la byas nas kha dog la chags pa la sogs pa skye ba'am ma yin zhes nyams sad pas yid🔽du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams la dmigs @193a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi sdug pa bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyud zhum pa dga' bar bya ba'i ched du ci bdag la yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams sdug par yid la byas nas kha dog la chags pa la sogs pa skye ba'am ma yin zhes nyams sad pas yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams la dmigs @193a * //
translated: Similarly, those who cultivate the meditation on the unattractive may become discouraged and in order to delight their mindstreams they should think, Is it not the case that when I mentally attend to attractive forms, attachment to color and so on arises?🔽By testing their mind, they should🔽focus on attractive forms and enter meditative attainment on the fourth absorption.

original: nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs bzhin pas sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs rnams sprul te /
analyzed: nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs bzhin pas sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs rnams sprul te /
translated: While in meditative attainment, they emanate attractive and unattractive forms.

original: de rnams la ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pa las rim pa ji lta bar 'bad pa dang mi mthun pa nyid spang ba'i don du sdug pa'o zhes mos par 'gyur ro zhes brjod do ;
analyzed: de rnams la ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pa las rim pa ji lta bar 'bad pa dang mi mthun pa nyid spang ba'i don du sdug pa'o zhes mos par 'gyur ro zhes brjod do ;
translated: They are called “liberations” because one obtains the perception of the sameness of those objects and, in order to abandon the afflictions that are incompatible with effort, one generates the aspiration to attain the liberation that is beautiful.

original: / de ltar gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa rnams so //
analyzed: / de ltar gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa rnams so //
translated: Thus, there are eight liberations that are material.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa lnga rnams te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa lnga rnams te /
translated: There are five liberations that are immaterial.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa nas 'du shes dang tshor ba dang 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa nas 'du shes dang tshor ba dang 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa'i bar ro //
translated: The liberation of the base of infinite space and so on are the five immaterial liberations, up to the liberation of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment and the liberation of the cessation of discernment and sensation.

original: de la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa gzugs med pa bzhi rnams dag pa pa rnams de'i ro myang ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir rnam par thar pa yin la /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa gzugs med pa bzhi rnams dag pa pa rnams de'i ro myang ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir rnam par thar pa yin la /
translated: The four immaterial liberations of the base of infinite space and so on are liberations because they are antidotes to the obscurations that relish their objects.

original: zhi ba'i gnas pa rnams su yang brjod do //
analyzed: zhi ba'i gnas pa rnams su yang brjod do //
translated: They are also called peaceful abodes.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas pa ste /
translated: The liberation of the cessation of discernment and sensation is a state that is compatible with liberation.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la brten nas 'das te ;
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la brten nas 'das te ;
translated: Based on the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, he transcends🔽the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception and enters the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: gang ldang ba las snga rol du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang ldang ba las snga rol du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme, most peaceful abiding, in which mind and mental factors cease prior to arising.

original: de'i sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa rnams so //
translated: The liberations are for the purpose of abandoning the obscurations to that.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa rnams dang gzugs med pa nyid bzhi pa rnams dang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa zhes pa mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa rnams dang gzugs med pa nyid bzhi pa rnams dang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa zhes pa mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: He enters the nine serial absorptions, which are the four dhyanas, the four formless states, and the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: dgu po de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du sdud pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: dgu po de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du sdud pa'i don gyis te /
translated: These nine are included in the supramundane path,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni des thob par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni des thob par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes 'phags pa'o //
translated: because the absorption of cessation is attained by that.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad rnams la yang snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad rnams la yang snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: He also enters the eight spheres of mastery.

original: dmigs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams te sems gnas pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams te sems gnas pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams yin la /
translated: The bases of subjugation are so called because they subjugate objects.

original: de brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: de brgyad po rnams so //
translated: They are the eight liberations.

original: de la rnam par thar pa dang po las gnyis dag mngon par 'grub la /
analyzed: de la rnam par thar pa dang po las gnyis dag mngon par 'grub la /
translated: Two are accomplished from the first liberation.

original: gnyis po las kyang gnyis dag ste /
analyzed: gnyis po las kyang gnyis dag ste /
translated: Two are accomplished from the second.

original: gsum pa las bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa las bzhi rnams so //
translated: Four are accomplished from the third.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said this:

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung du rnams lta zhing /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung du rnams lta zhing /
translated: One who has the internal ideation of form sees small external forms.

original: de rnams zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong la de ltar 'du shes par yang 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de rnams zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong la de ltar 'du shes par yang 'gyur ro /
translated: Subjugating them, one knows and sees and has that ideation.

original: @193b zhes pa dang po'o //
analyzed: @193b zhes pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: de ltar chen po rnams zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chen po rnams zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Large forms are the second.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung du rnams lta zhing de rnams zhes pa la sogs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung du rnams lta zhing de rnams zhes pa la sogs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: One who has the internal ideation of the absence of form sees small external forms and so on is the third.🔽The four bases of subjugation are the four subjugations of form.

original: de ltar chen po rnams zhes pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chen po rnams zhes pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: Thus, the fourth is the great ones.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po rnams lta zhing de rnams zhes pa la sogs pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po rnams lta zhing de rnams zhes pa la sogs pa lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the perception of internal formlessness and the seeing of external forms as blue, and so on.

original: de bzhin du ser po rnams zhes pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ser po rnams zhes pa drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the same for yellow.

original: de bzhin du dmar po rnams zhas pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmar po rnams zhas pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the same for red.

original: de bzhin du dkar po rnams zhes pa brgyad pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po rnams zhes pa brgyad pa'o zhes so //
translated: The eighth is the same for white.

original: de la gzugs chung ngu rnams ni sems can du bgrang ba rnams te tshad chung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzugs chung ngu rnams ni sems can du bgrang ba rnams te tshad chung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Among them, small forms are those that are counted as sentient beings because they are small in size.

original: chen po rnams ni sems can du ba grang ba ma yin pa khyim dang gzhal med khang dang ri la sogs pa rnams te tshad che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po rnams ni sems can du ba grang ba ma yin pa khyim dang gzhal med khang dang ri la sogs pa rnams te tshad che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Great forms are those that are not counted as sentient beings, such as houses, palaces, mountains, and so on, because they are large in size.

original: de rnams ji ltar rigs par rnam par thar pa rnams kyis mos pa zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis zil gyis gnon te yang dang yang nub cing mi mthong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ji ltar rigs par rnam par thar pa rnams kyis mos pa zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis zil gyis gnon te yang dang yang nub cing mi mthong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are overcome by the bases of subjugation, the liberations, as appropriate, because they are repeatedly made to disappear and not seen.

original: zil gyis mnan nas zhi gnas kyis shes shing lhag mthong gis mthong la de ltar 'du shes par 'gyur te mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas zhi gnas kyis shes shing lhag mthong gis mthong la de ltar 'du shes par 'gyur te mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Having overcome them, they are known through serenity and seen through insight, and they are considered in that way because they are free from manifest pride.

original: zad par bcu rnams la yang snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: zad par bcu rnams la yang snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: They also enter the ten totalities.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis zil gyis mnan nas 'di rnams kyis sa la sogs pa rnams mtha' dag par kun nas rgyas par byed pa'i phyir zad par rnams su brjod do //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis zil gyis mnan nas 'di rnams kyis sa la sogs pa rnams mtha' dag par kun nas rgyas par byed pa'i phyir zad par rnams su brjod do //
translated: They are called totalities because they pervade the entire earth and so on, having overcome them through the bases of subjugation.

original: res 'ga' de rnams kho na skye mched rnams so zhes pa zad par gyi skye mched rnams su brjod la /
analyzed: res 'ga' de rnams kho na skye mched rnams so zhes pa zad par gyi skye mched rnams su brjod la /
translated: Sometimes they are called bases of totality because they are just that.

original: res 'ga' ni sa la sogs pa rnams kyis khyad par du byas nas bstan te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sa la sogs pa rnams kyis khyad par du byas nas bstan te /
translated: Sometimes they are taught as distinguished by earth, etc.

original: zad par sa dang zad par chu dang zad par me dang zad par rlung dang zad par sngon po dang zad par ser po dang zad par dmar po dang zad par dkar po dang zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces pa'o //
analyzed: zad par sa dang zad par chu dang zad par me dang zad par rlung dang zad par sngon po dang zad par ser po dang zad par dmar po dang zad par dkar po dang zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces pa'o //
translated: The bases of mastery are the bases of totality.

original: 'di rnams kyang dgongs pa'i don du de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho nas sgom ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang dgongs pa'i don du de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho nas sgom ste /
translated: These are also cultivated by the bodhisattva in the sense of non-reality, i.e., in the sense of unreality, because they are not cultivated in the sense of reality.

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho nas rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'di rnams so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho nas rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'di rnams so sor snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, they appear to the bodhisattvas individually in the sense of non-reality.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum rnams ni rnam par thar pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum rnams ni rnam par thar pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The three samadhis have the nature of liberation.

original: de la chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In them, the own-characteristics of all dharmas are imagined.

original: @194a * // de shin tu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir des de rnams stong par yongs su shes pa'i ched du stong pa nyid chos kyi bdag med pa sgom par byed do zhes pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin te rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid do
analyzed: @194a * // de shin tu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir des de rnams stong par yongs su shes pa'i ched du stong pa nyid chos kyi bdag med pa sgom par byed do zhes pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin te rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid do
translated: Since they are utterly nonexistent, in order to thoroughly know them as empty, one cultivates emptiness, the objective selflessness of phenomena. This is the emptiness meditative stabilization, the emptiness door of meditative stabilization.

original: // rang bzhin med pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin te gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang skyes pa dang bud med dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams dang bral ba nyid kyi brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: // rang bzhin med pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin te gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang skyes pa dang bud med dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams dang bral ba nyid kyi brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The naturelessness that is the perfected nature is the absence of signs because it is inexpressible, being free from the signs of form, sound, smell, taste, texture, male and female, birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on.

original: des na de rnams mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba'i don du sgom par byed do zhes pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: des na de rnams mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba'i don du sgom par byed do zhes pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to actualize the absence of signs, one cultivates. This is the signless meditative stabilization, the signless door of meditative stabilization.

original: khams gsum pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin te /
translated: The three realms are the nature of being dependent on other causes and conditions.

original: gang zag dang chos su mngon par zhen pa phyin ci log gi rtsa ba can yang nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos su mngon par zhen pa phyin ci log gi rtsa ba can yang nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: And the afflictions are the root of the error of the manifest clinging to persons and phenomena.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni spang bar bya ba ste smon par 'os pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni spang bar bya ba ste smon par 'os pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, this is to be abandoned and is not worthy of aspiration.

original: des na smon pa min pa de rnams la smon par mi byed do zhes pa smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des na smon pa min pa de rnams la smon par mi byed do zhes pa smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'o //
translated: Thus, one does not aspire to those that are not worthy of aspiration. This is the concentration of wishlessness, the door of liberation of wishlessness.

original: la lar rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi pa yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: la lar rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi pa yang gsungs pa /
translated: In some places, a fourth door of liberation is taught:

original: nam mkha' rang bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: nam mkha' rang bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes so //
translated: Because of the nature of space, it is naturally luminous, and thus it is unconditioned.

original: shes pa bcu gnyis po sngar brjod pa rnams te de la sdug bsngal phyis skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i shes pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa bcu gnyis po sngar brjod pa rnams te de la sdug bsngal phyis skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i shes pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa'o //
translated: The twelve knowledges are as previously mentioned. Among them, the knowledge that suffering will not arise again is the knowledge of suffering.

original: nyon mongs la sogs pa rnams spangs so zhes shes pa ni kun 'byung ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs la sogs pa rnams spangs so zhes shes pa ni kun 'byung ba shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that the afflictions, etc. have been abandoned is the knowledge of the origin.

original: sdug bsngal 'gags so zhes shes pa ni 'gog pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gags so zhes shes pa ni 'gog pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that suffering has ceased is the knowledge of cessation.

original: lam gang bsgom pas 'gog pa mngon du byed pa de'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: lam gang bsgom pas 'gog pa mngon du byed pa de'i shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path that one cultivates in order to realize cessation.

original: lam 'dis sdug bsngal 'gags so zhes pa lam shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam 'dis sdug bsngal 'gags so zhes pa lam shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that suffering ceases by this path is the knowledge of the path.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa zad par shes pa ni zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa zad par shes pa ni zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that desire, etc. are exhausted is the knowledge of exhaustion.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes shes pa mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes shes pa mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that desire, etc. will not arise again is the knowledge of non-arising.

original: rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that one realizes liberation is the knowledge of the Dharma.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pas de'i rjes su rtog pa ni rjes su shes pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pas de'i rjes su rtog pa ni rjes su shes pa ste /
translated: The subsequent knowledge is the subsequent investigation of that by means of impermanence, etc.

original: sgom pa'i rang bzhin bsgom pa'i 'bras bu bsgoms pas khong du chud par bya ba thob pa dman pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa'i rang bzhin bsgom pa'i 'bras bu bsgoms pas khong du chud par bya ba thob pa dman pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge that is the nature of cultivation, the result of cultivation, and the attainment of what is to be realized by cultivation, which is not inferior.

original: shes pa gang gis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na @194b spyod pa'i rgyun du 'jug pa yang dag par mngon du gyur pa pha rol po rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / gcig tu zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes pa 'di gzhan gyi sems shes par brjod do //
analyzed: shes pa gang gis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na @194b spyod pa'i rgyun du 'jug pa yang dag par mngon du gyur pa pha rol po rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / gcig tu zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes pa 'di gzhan gyi sems shes par brjod do //
translated: The cognition by which the stream of the desire realm and the form realm is correctly manifested, the mind and mental factors of others, and the uncontaminated dharmas are known, this is called the cognition of others' minds.

original: kun rdzob pa'i shes rab ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i shes rab ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
translated: Conventional cognition is cognition of the conventional.

original: lam goms pa ni yongs su 'dres pa shes pa'o zhes pa gang gis lha dang mi dang byol song dang yi dags dang dmyal ba dang sems can rnams thams cad kyi skad thams cad shes pa de sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam goms pa ni yongs su 'dres pa shes pa'o zhes pa gang gis lha dang mi dang byol song dang yi dags dang dmyal ba dang sems can rnams thams cad kyi skad thams cad shes pa de sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa'o //
translated: Cultivation of the path is cognition of thorough differentiation. That by which the languages of all sentient beings, gods, humans, animals, ghosts, hell beings, and all beings are known, that is cognition of the literal.

original: dbang po gsum rnams te rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la lhag par dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po gsum rnams te rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la lhag par dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po rnams so //
translated: The three faculties, because they have supreme control over the purified dharmas, are the faculties.

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed do zhes pa'i dbang po gang yin pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / shes zin pa skyong ba'i dbang po kun nas shes pa srung ba dang ldan pa'i dbang po ste rim pa ji lta bar mthong ba dang /
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed do zhes pa'i dbang po gang yin pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / shes zin pa skyong ba'i dbang po kun nas shes pa srung ba dang ldan pa'i dbang po ste rim pa ji lta bar mthong ba dang /
translated: The faculty of possessing complete knowledge is the faculty of one who protects complete knowledge that has been known.

original: bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams su'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams su'o //
translated: They exist respectively on the paths of seeing,

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i lam du ni mi shes pa kun shes par bya ba'i ched du zhugs la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i lam du ni mi shes pa kun shes par bya ba'i ched du zhugs la /
translated: Why? One enters to know completely that which is not known on the path of seeing.🔽On the path of meditation, one does not know completely that which was not previously known but one knows completely in order to abandon the remaining negative tendencies of that reality.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la sngar med pa'i kun du shes par bya ba med kyi de kho na phra rgyas lhag ma spang ba'i don du kun du shes par byed cing mi slob pa'i lam du ni kun du shes zin zhes rtogs pa kun shes pa srung ba yin
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la sngar med pa'i kun du shes par bya ba med kyi de kho na phra rgyas lhag ma spang ba'i don du kun du shes par byed cing mi slob pa'i lam du ni kun du shes zin zhes rtogs pa kun shes pa srung ba yin
translated: On the path of no learning, one protects complete knowledge that has been known.

original: la de 'di la yod pas srung ba dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: la de 'di la yod pas srung ba dang ldan pa'am /
translated: One who possesses that is one possessing protection.

original: yang na kun shes pa srung ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pa ste zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na kun shes pa srung ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pa ste zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, it is the faculty of one who guards complete knowledge, because it is the state of one who has obtained the knowledge of destruction and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal yongs su shes te slar yongs su shes par byar med do zhes pa de ltar gyur pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa srung ba'i tshul can gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal yongs su shes te slar yongs su shes par byar med do zhes pa de ltar gyur pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa srung ba'i tshul can gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of one who has complete knowledge is the faculty of one who has the state of guarding complete knowledge, because he thinks, “I have completely known suffering and there is no more to be completely known.”

original: dbyer med par rnam par gzhag pas ni lam 'di gsum kho na dbang po gsum mo //
analyzed: dbyer med par rnam par gzhag pas ni lam 'di gsum kho na dbang po gsum mo //
translated: The three faculties are established as being indivisible, because these three paths are the three faculties.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum rnams te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum rnams te /
translated: The three concentrations are

original: rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: with investigation and analysis,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dang rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dang rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'o //
translated: without investigation but with analysis, and without investigation and without analysis.

original: rjes su dran pa rnams bcu ste sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshul khrims dang gtong ba dang lha dang skyo ba dang 'chi ba dang lus su gtogs pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa rnams bcu ste sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshul khrims dang gtong ba dang lha dang skyo ba dang 'chi ba dang lus su gtogs pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'o //
translated: The recollections are ten: of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, of morality, generosity, and the gods, of impermanence, of the body, and of inhalation and exhalation.

original: de la dkon mchog gsum rnams rten no //
analyzed: de la dkon mchog gsum rnams rten no //
translated: The Three Jewels are the support.

original: tshul khrims dang gtong ba dag gzhi'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang gtong ba dag gzhi'o //
translated: Morality and generosity are the basis.

original: lha rnams dbang po'o //
analyzed: lha rnams dbang po'o //
translated: The gods are the lord.

original: skyo ba dang 'chi bdag gis dbugs mi 'byin pa'o //🔽lus su gtogs @195a * //
analyzed: skyo ba dang 'chi bdag gis dbugs mi 'byin pa'o // lus su gtogs @195a * //
translated: Discouragement and death are the exhalted ones.

original: pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dang dran pa dag gis nang du mi brjed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dang dran pa dag gis nang du mi brjed par byed pa'o //
translated: The mindfulness of the body and the mindfulness of breathing are the internal non-forgetting.

original: lha ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams so //
analyzed: lha ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams so //
translated: The gods are the gods of the realm of desire, the gods of the six classes, the stream-enterers, and the non-returners of the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality.

original: gang mdo gzhan du lha'i ris gnyis dag dran par bya ste dga' ldan pa rnams dang gnas gtsang ma rnams so zhes gsungs pa de ni ma 'dres pa'i gang zag la dgongs pa'o zhes 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: gang mdo gzhan du lha'i ris gnyis dag dran par bya ste dga' ldan pa rnams dang gnas gtsang ma rnams so zhes gsungs pa de ni ma 'dres pa'i gang zag la dgongs pa'o zhes 'phags pa'o //
translated: The two classes of gods that are not mentioned in the Sutra are the Tuṣitas and the Śuddhāvāsas.🔽The Sutra mentions only the gods of the realm of desire because the gods of the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality are not susceptible to distraction.

original: thams cad du yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed pas dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pas dran pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed pas dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pas dran pa'o //
translated: In all cases, one should bring to mind the nature of the absence of any real entity.

original: de la nyin mo sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni rgyu bzhi rnams kyis te /
analyzed: de la nyin mo sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni rgyu bzhi rnams kyis te /
translated: The recollection of the Buddha during the day is due to four causes:

original: dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pas mchod pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / rnam pa rjes su dran pas dang / phan 'dogs pa rjes su dran pa las te /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pas mchod pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / rnam pa rjes su dran pas dang / phan 'dogs pa rjes su dran pa las te /
translated: the accomplishment of worship through striving in the virtuous practices, the recollection of his aspects, and the recollection of his benefits.🔽Just as one recollects the Buddha, etc.,

original: ji ltar nyin par sad pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar nyin par sad pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa ltar /
translated: when awake during the day,

original: de goms pas gnyid log pa rnams kyis de bzhin kho nar rmi lam mthong ba las so //
analyzed: de goms pas gnyid log pa rnams kyis de bzhin kho nar rmi lam mthong ba las so //
translated: so also one sees them in dreams through the force of habit.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa la yang phan yon bdun rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa la yang phan yon bdun rnams te /
translated: Thus, the benefits of the recollection of the Buddha, etc., are sevenfold:

original: skye ba dran par 'gyur ba dang / rab tu dang ba mang ba dang / dman pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug pa dang / gzhan rnams la tho mi 'tshams pa dang / gzhan rnams kyang 'di la tho mi 'tshams pa dang 'gyod pa med par dus byed pa dang /
analyzed: skye ba dran par 'gyur ba dang / rab tu dang ba mang ba dang / dman pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug pa dang / gzhan rnams la tho mi 'tshams pa dang / gzhan rnams kyang 'di la tho mi 'tshams pa dang 'gyod pa med par dus byed pa dang /
translated: One will remember one’s former lives, have much faith, not engage in inferior teachings, not harm others, not be harmed by others, and die without regret.

original: lus zhig nas kyang bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams su skye'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lus zhig nas kyang bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams su skye'o zhes pa'o //
translated: And after the body breaks up, one will be born in a happy, divine world.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi rnams so //
translated: The four divine abodes focus on sentient beings in the desire realm.

original: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa ni tshad med pa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa ni tshad med pa bzhi rnams te /
translated: The four immeasurables focus on immeasurable sentient beings.

original: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms so //
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms so //
translated: They are loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de la bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa byams pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa byams pa'o //
translated: Among them, loving kindness is the wish that they have happiness.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa snying rje'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa snying rje'o //
translated: Compassion is the wish that they be free from suffering.

original: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the wish that they never be separated from happiness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'dod pa btang snyoms te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'dod pa btang snyoms te /
translated: Equanimity is the desire to be free from defilement.

original: kye ma ma la sems can thams cad bde ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: kye ma ma la sems can thams cad bde ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: With these aspects, one thinks, “Alas! I must join all sentient beings with happiness.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar bya'o //
translated: I must separate them from suffering.

original: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar bya'o //
translated: I must not separate them from pleasure.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa las grol bar bya'o snyam pa'i rnam pa 'di rnams kyis so zhes pas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa las grol bar bya'o snyam pa'i rnam pa 'di rnams kyis so zhes pas /
translated: I must liberate them from defilement.”

original: bzhi po rnams kyang mos pa spyod pa'i sa la sems can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi po rnams kyang mos pa spyod pa'i sa la sems can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The four immeasurables are the stage of action out of faith, and focus on sentient beings.

original: rab tu dga' ba @195b la sogs pa bdun rnams su chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba @195b la sogs pa bdun rnams su chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The seven, beginning with the Joyous, focus on phenomena.

original: de las gong du dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de las gong du dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Above that, there is no focus.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdor ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdor ni /
translated: The noble Aksayamatinirdesa teaches:🔽“The immeasurables are fourfold: love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa las so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa las so //
translated: Love is the wish that all sentient beings might have happiness.

original: bdag dang gzhan srung ba med pa'i btang snyoms ni bzod pa las so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan srung ba med pa'i btang snyoms ni bzod pa las so //
translated: Equanimity of not protecting oneself or others comes from patience.

original: dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms ni sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims btang snyoms pa las dang / tshul khrims kyi dus su sbyin pa dang / bzod pa'i dus su brtson 'grus dang / brtson 'grus kyi dus su bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi dus su sbyin pa la chags pa dang /
analyzed: dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms ni sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims btang snyoms pa las dang / tshul khrims kyi dus su sbyin pa dang / bzod pa'i dus su brtson 'grus dang / brtson 'grus kyi dus su bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi dus su sbyin pa la chags pa dang /
translated: Equanimity of timely and untimely is when one is equanimous about generosity at the time of ethics, and equanimous about ethics at the time of generosity, equanimous about patience at the time of perseverance, equanimous about perseverance at the time of meditative stabilization, equanimous about attachment to generosity at the time of meditative stabilization,

original: shes rab kyi dus su pha rol tu phyin pa lnga rtsom pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes btang snyoms rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dus su pha rol tu phyin pa lnga rtsom pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes btang snyoms rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
translated: and equanimous about the five perfections at the time of wisdom.

original: dad pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa dang gtong ba dang shes rab dang ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa rnams nang gi nor mchog bdun te /
analyzed: dad pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa dang gtong ba dang shes rab dang ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa rnams nang gi nor mchog bdun te /
translated: Faith, ethics, learning, generosity, wisdom, conscience, and shame are the seven inner riches.

original: 'dir dad pa dang shes rab dag gtso bo'o //
analyzed: 'dir dad pa dang shes rab dag gtso bo'o //
translated: Here, faith and wisdom are the main ones.

original: phyi rol gyi nor ni rin po che dang mu tig la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi nor ni rin po che dang mu tig la sogs pa ste /
translated: Outer riches are jewels, pearls, and so forth.

original: phal cher nyes par spyod pa bskyed pa dang tshim pa med pa dang 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar 'tshe ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: phal cher nyes par spyod pa bskyed pa dang tshim pa med pa dang 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar 'tshe ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It is generally a source of evil conduct, dissatisfaction, fear, and harm.

original: rgyal po dang chu dang me dang chom rkun dang rang gi skye bo las kyang zhes pa thun mong ba lnga nyid las so //
analyzed: rgyal po dang chu dang me dang chom rkun dang rang gi skye bo las kyang zhes pa thun mong ba lnga nyid las so //
translated: It is a source of harm from five common sources: kings, water, fire, thieves, and one’s own people.

original: dus thams cad pa ma yin pa 'dzad pa ni longs spyad pa las te /
analyzed: dus thams cad pa ma yin pa 'dzad pa ni longs spyad pa las te /
translated: It is not inexhaustible at all times, because it is exhausted by enjoyment.

original: nang gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nang gi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not internal.

original: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams ni skabs ji lta bar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams ni skabs ji lta bar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Imagination and so on will be explained in their proper place.

original: tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni chos mchog chen po nas bzung nas rnam par gzhag par bya la /
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni chos mchog chen po nas bzung nas rnam par gzhag par bya la /
translated: The practice of the stores should be understood to begin with the great supreme mundane quality.

original: 'dis byang chub chen po 'dzin pas sam lji ba nyid kyi phyir ram 'gengs pa po ni 'gengs pa yin la /🔽rnam pa thams cad nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'dis byang chub chen po 'dzin pas sam lji ba nyid kyi phyir ram 'gengs pa po ni 'gengs pa yin la / rnam pa thams cad nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is a store because it holds, that is, it accumulates, the great enlightenment.

original: ma lus pa 'gengs pa tshogs so //
analyzed: ma lus pa 'gengs pa tshogs so //
translated: It is a store because it is full of all aspects.🔽It is a store because it fills everything without exception.

original: de yang bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de yang bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: Moreover, they are summarized as two: the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of intuition.

original: gal te yang sngon du yang bsod nams dang ye shes dag yang dag par sogs mod /
analyzed: gal te yang sngon du yang bsod nams dang ye shes dag yang dag par sogs mod /
translated: Even though merit and intuition are indeed accumulated previously,

original: de lta na yang 'di nas bzung nas khyad par du'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di nas bzung nas khyad par du'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: still, they are established as special from this point on.

original: rgyas par rnam pa bcu bdun te /
analyzed: rgyas par rnam pa bcu bdun te /
translated: They are extensive in seventeen aspects,

original: de sgrub par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sgrub par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: which will be explained in the process of establishing them.

original: sems bskyed pa bzhi po 'di rnams brda las byung ba dang kun rdzob pa dang 'jig rten spa'o //🔽de'i gong ma rnams don @196a * //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bzhi po 'di rnams brda las byung ba dang kun rdzob pa dang 'jig rten spa'o // de'i gong ma rnams don @196a * //
translated: These four productions of the Thought are conventional, from signs, and mundane.

original: dam pa pa dang 'jig rten pa las 'das pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dam pa pa dang 'jig rten pa las 'das pa yang ngo //
translated: The ones above that are ultimate, and also transcend the mundane.

original: de la sems bskyed pa lnga pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang de bzhin du kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la yang zhes pa bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa skad cig bcu drug gi bdag nyid chos thams cad rang bzhin med par ma rig pa la sogs pa'i skyon med pa
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa lnga pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang de bzhin du kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la yang zhes pa bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa skad cig bcu drug gi bdag nyid chos thams cad rang bzhin med par ma rig pa la sogs pa'i skyon med pa
translated: The fifth generation of the Thought is the patience which is the understanding of the truth of suffering, the understanding of the truth of suffering, the patience which is the subsequent understanding of the truth of suffering, the subsequent understanding of the truth of suffering, and likewise, the origin, cessation, and path.

original: mngon du byas pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la 'jug pa rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: mngon du byas pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la 'jug pa rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the stage of the Joyful One, the entry into the certainty of reality, which is the nature of the sixteen moments of the focus on the four truths, the non-erroneous state of the absence of inherent existence of all phenomena, the absence of the faults of ignorance, and so on.

original: de yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na /
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na /
translated: Moreover, when the power of the meditation on the absence of inherent existence of all phenomena is complete,🔽the single partless entity

original: cha shas med pa'i ngo bo gcig / rang nyid mngon sum gyur pa la //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i ngo bo gcig / rang nyid mngon sum gyur pa la //
translated: is manifest to oneself.

original: tshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
translated: What is to be examined by the valid cognitions

original: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
translated: is not seen. What other part is there?

original: ces pa'i rigs pa las rang gi ngo bo rnam pa thams cad so sor rtog par byed pa'i shes pa zag pa med pa chos thams cad kyi yul can skye ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa'i rigs pa las rang gi ngo bo rnam pa thams cad so sor rtog par byed pa'i shes pa zag pa med pa chos thams cad kyi yul can skye ba'o //
translated: The knowledge that discerns the individual natures of all phenomena is the uncontaminated knowledge that arises as the object of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir so sor rtog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor rtog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the moment of realization is the path of seeing, which has the nature of the realization of discernment.🔽In the Sūtra Elaborating the Inconceivable Secrets of the Tathāgatas, it says:

original: de skad du yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rgyas par bstan pa'i mdor gsungs pa 'jam dpal 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams ci ltar lags /🔽lha'i bu 'dir gang gis 'dus byas rnams thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang ma skyes par mthong ba des sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
analyzed: de skad du yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rgyas par bstan pa'i mdor gsungs pa 'jam dpal 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams ci ltar lags / lha'i bu 'dir gang gis 'dus byas rnams thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang ma skyes par mthong ba des sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, what are the four noble truths?🔽Divine son, whoever sees all conditioned things as essenceless and unborn fully understands suffering.

original: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu yang dag par chad pa med par mthong ba des kun 'byung yang spangs so //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu yang dag par chad pa med par mthong ba des kun 'byung yang spangs so //
translated: Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly unceased has abandoned the origin of suffering.

original: gang gis chos rnams thams cad shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba des 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: gang gis chos rnams thams cad shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba des 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly nirvāṇa has realized cessation.

original: gang gis chos thams cad rang gi ngo bo skyes pa med pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu stong par mthong ba des lam bsgom pa byas so zhes so //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad rang gi ngo bo skyes pa med pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu stong par mthong ba des lam bsgom pa byas so zhes so //
translated: Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly empty because of the non-arising of their own entities has cultivated the path.

original: 'dir bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa thams cad pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i de kho na nyid ni stong pa nyid kho nar gsungs la /
analyzed: 'dir bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa thams cad pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i de kho na nyid ni stong pa nyid kho nar gsungs la /
translated: Here the reality of the nature of all aspects of the four truths is said to be emptiness alone.

original: de yang mngon par rtogs par bya ba lan cig kho nar rigs kyi rim gyis ma yin te de la cha shas med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mngon par rtogs par bya ba lan cig kho nar rigs kyi rim gyis ma yin te de la cha shas med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is to be realized only once, not gradually, because it is partless.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: Ārya Nāgārjuna also says:

original: ma rig rkyen las skyes pa la //
analyzed: ma rig rkyen las skyes pa la //
translated: That which arises from the condition of ignorance

original: yang @196b dag shes pas gzigs pa na //
analyzed: yang @196b dag shes pas gzigs pa na //
translated: is seen by correct knowledge🔽as neither arisen nor ceased

original: skye ba'am 'on te 'gag pa'ang rung //
analyzed: skye ba'am 'on te 'gag pa'ang rung //
translated: and also as neither annihilated nor eternal.🔽That which is seen as empty

original: ci yang dmigs su yod min te //
analyzed: ci yang dmigs su yod min te //
translated: is not perceived by the mind.🔽That which is not perceived by the mind🔽is said to be non-arisen and unceasing.🔽That which is non-arisen and unceasing🔽is not perceived in the three times.🔽That which is not perceived in the three times

original: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan 'das //
translated: is said to be nirvāṇa in this life.

original: de nyid bya ba byas pa yang //
analyzed: de nyid bya ba byas pa yang //
translated: That itself is the performance of action.

original: zhes so // chos kyi sgra ni 'dir mya ngan las 'das par rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // chos kyi sgra ni 'dir mya ngan las 'das par rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: The term “Dharma” here refers to nirvana.

original: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: And that is not separate from the nature of dependent origination.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ste /
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ste /
translated: Whoever sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyang mthong ngo zhes so //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyang mthong ngo zhes so //
translated: And because it is not separate from the nature of the Dharma, one also sees the Buddha.

original: de yongs su gcod pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de chos shes pa ste chos kyi yul can gyi shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gcod pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de chos shes pa ste chos kyi yul can gyi shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that fully discerns that is the knowledge of the Dharma. Knowledge that has the Dharma as its object is the knowledge of the Dharma.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Here, it is by nature the acceptance of the knowledge of the Dharma with regard to suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gyis skyes pa med la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gyis skyes pa med la /
translated: Because suffering is dependent origination, it is by nature unborn.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa de kho na mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa de kho na mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: That which is not intrinsically produced is just nirvana.

original: gnyis ka dag kyang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka dag kyang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because both are not intrinsically produced.

original: de ltar yang dbu ma rtsa bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang dbu ma rtsa bar gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Mulamadhyamakakarika:

original: mya ngan las 'das 'khor ba la //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das 'khor ba la //
translated: Between nirvana and cyclic existence

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //🔽'khor ba las kyang mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin // 'khor ba las kyang mya ngan 'das //
translated: Not the slightest difference is there.🔽And also, nirvana is not the slightest bit different

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: From cyclic existence.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin //
translated: Whatever is the limit of nirvana,

original: 'khor ba yi yang mtha' yin te //🔽de la khyad par cung zad ni //
analyzed: 'khor ba yi yang mtha' yin te // de la khyad par cung zad ni //
translated: That is the limit of cyclic existence.🔽Between the two, not the slightest

original: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Difference is there.

original: zhes so // 'dir mtha'i sgra ni rab tu gyur pa brjod la /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir mtha'i sgra ni rab tu gyur pa brjod la /
translated: Here, the term “limit” expresses a transformation.

original: rab tu gyur pa zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: rab tu gyur pa zhes bya ba yang /
translated: And a “transformation” is

original: mthong bar gnas pa byis pa'i skye bo'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong bar gnas pa byis pa'i skye bo'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: A nature that is not the domain of the intellect of a naive being who remains in the view.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang de'i rang bzhin nyid du rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir dang ; gnyis ka yang skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang de'i rang bzhin nyid du rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir dang ; gnyis ka yang skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because nirvana is realized to be of the same nature as samsara, and because both are of the nature of non-arising.

original: rang bzhin skye ba med par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin skye ba med par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, samsara and nirvana are the same in being essentially non-arising.

original: de ltar bden pa bzhi po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa bzhi po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la /
translated: Thus, in the four noble truths, which are dependently arisen,

original: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par dmigs pa'i chos gcig shes pas mthong ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par dmigs pa'i chos gcig shes pas mthong ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa gcig kho na'o //
translated: there is only one realization, because one sees them by knowing one phenomenon, which is observed to be essentially non-arising and non-ceasing.

original: de ltar ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i shes pas /
analyzed: de ltar ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i shes pas /
translated: Thus, by knowing one phenomenon that is observed in the four noble truths, which are dependently arisen,🔽one sees them all, because one sees them by knowing one phenomenon, which is observed to be essentially non-arising and non-ceasing.🔽The suffering that is the same in being non-arising and non-ceasing is fully understood.

original: gang sdug bsngal skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par yongs su gcig pa de'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o //🔽gang las dang nyon mongs pa @197a * //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par yongs su gcig pa de'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o //🔽gang las dang nyon mongs pa @197a * //
translated: The origin that is the same in being non-arising and non-ceasing is abandoned.

original: dag skye ba med pa dag 'gag pa med par yongs su gcod pa 'di ni kun 'byung yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: dag skye ba med pa dag 'gag pa med par yongs su gcod pa 'di ni kun 'byung yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: This is the thorough knowledge of the origin.

original: gang 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa de 'gog pa yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa de 'gog pa yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of cessation is the thorough knowledge of the non-arising and non-ceasing of that which is by nature dependently arisen.

original: lam yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: lam yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The path is also dependently arisen.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par yongs su gcod pa de lam shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par yongs su gcod pa de lam shes pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the path is the thorough knowledge of the non-arising and non-ceasing of that which is by nature dependently arisen.

original: de ltar chos shes pas skad cig gcig la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba'i lam 'di'i mthong bar bya ba sngar med pa gzhan mi srid kyi /
analyzed: de ltar chos shes pas skad cig gcig la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba'i lam 'di'i mthong bar bya ba sngar med pa gzhan mi srid kyi /
translated: Thus, through the knowledge of phenomena, in one moment, there is no other object of seeing that is not included in the dependent origination that is seen in this path of seeing.

original: ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don te kho na rim gyis so //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don te kho na rim gyis so //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination, which has the characteristic of being seen just as it is, is gradual.

original: goms par byas nas ma rig pa'i lhag ma 'gags pa las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin la dmigs pa'i ye shes la gnas pa po ni mthong ba'i chos la yang /
analyzed: goms par byas nas ma rig pa'i lhag ma 'gags pa las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin la dmigs pa'i ye shes la gnas pa po ni mthong ba'i chos la yang /
translated: and having become familiar with it, they abide in the gnosis that focuses on the nature of dependent origination, which is the cessation of the remainder of ignorance.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang bya ba byas pa nyid du rnam par gzhag gi gzhan du na ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang bya ba byas pa nyid du rnam par gzhag gi gzhan du na ma yin no //
translated: They are posited as having attained nirvana and having completed their task in this life, but not otherwise.

original: gal te skad cig gcig la de kho na nyid mthong na ci ltar mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig gcig la de kho na nyid mthong na ci ltar mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If reality is seen in one instant, how is the path of seeing posited as sixteen moments?

original: ngo  bo gcig pa'i ye shes de kho na la cha rnams rnam par phye nas skad cig bcu drug rnams su rnam par gzhag par bya ste rnam pa de lta bus gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo la nye bar bstan pa las rjes su 'dzin pa'i phyir
analyzed: ngo  bo gcig pa'i ye shes de kho na la cha rnams rnam par phye nas skad cig bcu drug rnams su rnam par gzhag par bya ste rnam pa de lta bus gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo la nye bar bstan pa las rjes su 'dzin pa'i phyir
translated: That gnosis of a single nature is posited as sixteen moments by dividing it into parts.

original: ro // gal te de lta na ci ltar rnam pa bcu drug tu lam sgom zhe na /
analyzed: ro // gal te de lta na ci ltar rnam pa bcu drug tu lam sgom zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is the path cultivated in sixteen aspects?

original: 'di yang thar pa 'dod pa rnams rnam pa gzhan gyis de kho na nyid shes pa la gzhug pa'i don du yongs su brtags nas rnam par gzhag gi /
analyzed: 'di yang thar pa 'dod pa rnams rnam pa gzhan gyis de kho na nyid shes pa la gzhug pa'i don du yongs su brtags nas rnam par gzhag gi /
translated: This is also posited as a thorough examination for the sake of introducing those who desire liberation to the understanding of reality in another way.

original: de kho na nyid ni gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni gcig kho na'o //
translated: Reality is only one.

original: 'o na rnam par rtog pa rnams lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa rnams rtog pa de'i tshe kun 'byung gi rnam pa rnams ma yin la phyis kyang yul med pa'i rtog pa yin no zhe na
analyzed: 'o na rnam par rtog pa rnams lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa rnams rtog pa de'i tshe kun 'byung gi rnam pa rnams ma yin la phyis kyang yul med pa'i rtog pa yin no zhe na
translated: Well, since the conceptual thoughts do not occur simultaneously, when the aspects of suffering are conceptualized, the aspects of origination are not, and later on there is no object for conceptualization.

original: / 'di bden mod bden pa re re la'ang rnam pa bzhir rnam par rtog pa dus gcig pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: / 'di bden mod bden pa re re la'ang rnam pa bzhir rnam par rtog pa dus gcig pa can ma yin no //
translated: This is true, but the conceptualization of the four aspects of each truth does not occur simultaneously.

original: 'di lta bu'i skyon cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i skyon cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is not even the slightest fault in this.

original: gang gi phyir 'dzin pa zhes pa'i khyad par kho na rnam pa thams cad gsal bar gyur pa mngon du byed pa po yin la gang las rnam par rtog pa rigs mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres par mngon @197b par 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rim gyis🔽gsal bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dzin pa zhes pa'i khyad par kho na rnam pa thams cad gsal bar gyur pa mngon du byed pa po yin la gang las rnam par rtog pa rigs mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres par mngon @197b par 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rim gyis gsal bar 'byung ste /
translated: making evident the conceptual thought that is asserted to be unmixed with dissimilar types.

original: dper na sngon po dang g-yo ba dang kha bye ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi autpala mthong ba'i skye bo'i de'i yul gyi rnam pa thams cad mngon sum du bya ba la rnam par rtog pa'i rim pas gnod pa med pa /
analyzed: dper na sngon po dang g-yo ba dang kha bye ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi autpala mthong ba'i skye bo'i de'i yul gyi rnam pa thams cad mngon sum du bya ba la rnam par rtog pa'i rim pas gnod pa med pa /
translated: For example, when a person sees a lotus that has the specific features of being blue, moving, and blooming, all the aspects of its object are made evident without being harmed by the sequence of conceptual thought.

original: de bzhin du skabs su yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs su yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood in this context.

original: skad cig ma phan tshun rnams kyang de bzhin kho nar nyams su myong ba gzhan dang gzhan rnams kyis mngon du bya ba /
analyzed: skad cig ma phan tshun rnams kyang de bzhin kho nar nyams su myong ba gzhan dang gzhan rnams kyis mngon du bya ba /
translated: Also, the mutual instants are just like that, made evident by other experiences.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzung zin pa rjes su mtshams sbyor ba'i ngo bo rnams kyang ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa ltar rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzung zin pa rjes su mtshams sbyor ba'i ngo bo rnams kyang ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa ltar rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Also, the nature of the subsequent connection of already apprehended conceptuality operates as one wishes.

original: rigs pa'i 'dren pas gang gsungs pa //🔽blo gros che rnams mthong nyid las //
analyzed: rigs pa'i 'dren pas gang gsungs pa // blo gros che rnams mthong nyid las //
translated: The one who leads through reasoning said:🔽The great intellects are liberated

original: rnam pa thams cad nges par 'byed //🔽ces so // 'o na de ltar na mthong ba'i lam du bden pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad nges par 'byed // ces so // 'o na de ltar na mthong ba'i lam du bden pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis /
translated: from all aspects through seeing itself.

original: sgom pa gzhan ma bskyed pa'i phyir zhugs pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgom pa gzhan ma bskyed pa'i phyir zhugs pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then since other aspects of the truths are not generated in the path of seeing, the classifications of entry and so on would be untenable.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: nya phyis la dngul du sgro 'dogs pa bzhin du 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa gzhan du sgro btags pa yod la /
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul du sgro 'dogs pa bzhin du 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa gzhan du sgro btags pa yod la /
translated: Like the imputation of silver in nacre, there is the superimposition of other aspects through some mistaken reason.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log pa nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rtsa ba nas dbyung ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan gyis sgom pa gzhan srid pa'i phyir brgyad pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log pa nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rtsa ba nas dbyung ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan gyis sgom pa gzhan srid pa'i phyir brgyad pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, in order to eradicate the root of the afflictions, which are erroneous, there is the possibility of other meditations with other aspects, and thus the eighth and so on are posited.

original: dgongs pa 'di kho nas rigs pa'i stobs las mthong ba'i lam skad cig gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa yin yang skad cig bcu drug gi mngon par rtogs pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di kho nas rigs pa'i stobs las mthong ba'i lam skad cig gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa yin yang skad cig bcu drug gi mngon par rtogs pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: By this very intention, although the path of seeing is realized in one instant by the power of reasoning, it is taught that it is realized in sixteen instants.

original: de'i phyir yang rnam par shes pas rang gi ngo bo'i rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa nyid na yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rnam par shes pas rang gi ngo bo'i rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa nyid na yang /
translated: Therefore, even though consciousness does grasp all aspects of its own nature,

original: cha gang goms pa gsal ba nyid la sogs pas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa sel bar nus pa de kho na la de'i gegs kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin gyi gzhan la ma yin te skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: cha gang goms pa gsal ba nyid la sogs pas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa sel bar nus pa de kho na la de'i gegs kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin gyi gzhan la ma yin te skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: it is valid cognition only in regard to that aspect which is familiar, such as clarity, and is able to eliminate superimpositions, because it abandons the obscurations that are its obstacles in regard to that, but not in regard to others, like momentariness and so on.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa rnams so so'i skye bo rnams las khyad par ci yod ces kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa rnams so so'i skye bo rnams las khyad par ci yod ces kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: In that case, one should not say, “What is the difference between the noble ones and ordinary beings?”

original: rnam pa ci tsam zhig bsal bar byas na de rnams kyi shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bral ba de tsam gyis de rnams khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ci tsam zhig bsal bar byas na de rnams kyi shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bral ba de tsam gyis de rnams khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, to the extent that they are cleared away, the consciousnesses of those beings are free from the causes of error, and to that extent they are superior.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: gang gi tshe cha shas med pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbyings bdag nyid thams cad kyis rtogs na yang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe cha shas med pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbyings bdag nyid thams cad kyis rtogs na yang /
translated: When, because of being partless, the dharma-dhātu is realized in all its aspects,

original: nges pa bskyed pa la ltos @198a * //
analyzed: nges pa bskyed pa la ltos @198a * //
translated: in dependence on the generation of certainty,

original: nas ; kun du 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa las /
analyzed: nas ; kun du 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa las /
translated: from the realization of the meaning of omnipresence,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du mngon du byed pa'i shes pa shin tu gsal ba skyes pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpas mthong ba'i lam thob po zhes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du mngon du byed pa'i shes pa shin tu gsal ba skyes pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpas mthong ba'i lam thob po zhes so //
translated: the very clear consciousness that manifests all phenomena as essenceless arises. At that time, the bodhisattva has attained the path of seeing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang sa rab tu dga' bar dang po gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdod ma nas skye ba med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ngo bo shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin zung du 'brel pa brjod pa med
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang sa rab tu dga' bar dang po gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdod ma nas skye ba med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ngo bo shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin zung du 'brel pa brjod pa med
translated: Therefore, on the first ground, Joyful, one initially realizes that forms and so on are primordially unborn.🔽The path of seeing is the instant of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, which is the union of wisdom and concentration that is the nature of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering that is unstated and unutterable.🔽The path of meditation is Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on.

original: pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig kho na la mthong ba'i lam dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes brjod par bya ba de ni so sor rtog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las skad cig gcig po mngon par rtogs par bya bas mngon par rtogs pa mthong ba'i lam ste /🔽ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i 'khor ba brgyud pa thog ma med pa rnams su /
analyzed: pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig kho na la mthong ba'i lam dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes brjod par bya ba de ni so sor rtog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las skad cig gcig po mngon par rtogs par bya bas mngon par rtogs pa mthong ba'i lam ste / ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i 'khor ba brgyud pa thog ma med pa rnams su /
translated: This is the path of seeing that is the realization of the single instant of realization that is the realization of the individual knowledge of the doctrine.

original: ma mthong ba'i de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyis na gtso bo zhes rtogs pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyis na gtso bo zhes rtogs pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is the principal path because it is the first instant of realization of the truth of the noble ones that has not been seen in the beginningless cyclic existence that is accompanied by ignorance.🔽It is the principal path because it is the first instant of realization of the truth of the noble ones that has not been seen in the beginningless cyclic existence that is accompanied by ignorance.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgro btags pa'i rnam pa phyin ci log las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rtsad nas 'byin par byed pa nyid kyis ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa skad cig bco lnga po rnams kyang mthong ba'i lam mo zhes pa ni
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgro btags pa'i rnam pa phyin ci log las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rtsad nas 'byin par byed pa nyid kyis ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa skad cig bco lnga po rnams kyang mthong ba'i lam mo zhes pa ni
