translated: The fifteen moments such as the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering are the path of seeing because they eliminate afflictions that arise from distorted aspects superimposed by the cause of error.

original: tha snyad bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: tha snyad bya ba kho na'o //
translated: This is merely a conventional designation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam du gsungs pas kyang 'di rnams mthong ba'i lam btags pa'o zhes gsal bar byas so //🔽gzhan du na shing rta chen po rnams kyis theg pa chen por mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug po zhes mang du bstan pa dang ci ltar mi 'gal gang rnams yang rgyu ma tshang ba med par spang bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal mthong
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam du gsungs pas kyang 'di rnams mthong ba'i lam btags pa'o zhes gsal bar byas so // gzhan du na shing rta chen po rnams kyis theg pa chen por mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug po zhes mang du bstan pa dang ci ltar mi 'gal gang rnams yang rgyu ma tshang ba med par spang bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal mthong
translated: The statement that they are the path of meditation clearly indicates that they are designated as the path of seeing.🔽Otherwise, how could it not contradict the many statements in the great treatises that the path of seeing is the sixteenth moment in the Mahayana?

original: bas spang ba'i dus su kun 'byung spong ngo //
analyzed: bas spang ba'i dus su kun 'byung spong ngo //
translated: Since they are unable to abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing without the causes being incomplete, they abandon the origin at the time of abandoning objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing suffering.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: Therefore they manifest cessation.

original: de yang gzhan du na mi 'thad pas lam bsgoms so //🔽kun 'byung ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin no zhes pas 'bras bu'i mngon par rtogs pa las theg pa chen por mthong ba'i lam skad cig gis mngon par rtogs par blta bar bya la /
analyzed: de yang gzhan du na mi 'thad pas lam bsgoms so // kun 'byung ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin no zhes pas 'bras bu'i mngon par rtogs pa las theg pa chen por mthong ba'i lam skad cig gis mngon par rtogs par blta bar bya la /
translated: Since it is not tenable that it is otherwise, it is cultivated on the path.🔽The same is true of the origin and so on.🔽Thus the Mahayana path of seeing is to be viewed as the realization of the result, and the realization of the individual truths is to be viewed as the realization of the sixteen moments, since the four aspects of each truth are individually distinguished.

original: bden pa so so la slar yang phyin ci log gsal bas so sor rtog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las skad cig bcu drug kho nas mngon par rtogs par bya ste de'i phyir zhugs pa nyid la sogs pa las rnam par gzhag pa legs par gnas so zhes🔽zer @198b ba'i de'i lugs kyis skad cig bcu drug rnams kyang gtso bo'i mthong ba'i lam mo zhes gsal lo //
analyzed: bden pa so so la slar yang phyin ci log gsal bas so sor rtog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las skad cig bcu drug kho nas mngon par rtogs par bya ste de'i phyir zhugs pa nyid la sogs pa las rnam par gzhag pa legs par gnas so zhes zer @198b ba'i de'i lugs kyis skad cig bcu drug rnams kyang gtso bo'i mthong ba'i lam mo zhes gsal lo //
translated: Therefore the presentation of the approachers and so on is well established.🔽Thus the sixteen moments are the Mahayana path of seeing.

original: de ltar na bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid mthong ba de mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug ni sa rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid mthong ba de mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug ni sa rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The seeing of the reality of the four truths is the path of seeing of sixteen moments, which is the ground of Supreme Joy.

original: sems kyi skad cig ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po dbye ba dang bcas pa rnams su yang tha snyad pa'i dus kyi khyad par bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can shes bya la shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa ji srid par rig par
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po dbye ba dang bcas pa rnams su yang tha snyad pa'i dus kyi khyad par bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can shes bya la shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa ji srid par rig par
translated: The moment of mind is also to be understood as the conventional time period in which the twenty-two productions of mind, together with their divisions, are completely fulfilled.

original: bya ste / dper na mi khom pa brgyad la sogs pa'i ksha na bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ste / dper na mi khom pa brgyad la sogs pa'i ksha na bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the moment of the eight inopportune states.

original: dus kyi mtha' shin tu thung ba'i dus ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' shin tu thung ba'i dus ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a time of extremely short duration,

original: de ni phra ba nyid kyis tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phra ba nyid kyis tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that is not a conventional expression due to its subtlety.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa gang gis yongs su sbyong bar gyur pa'i chos gang rnams yongs su ma rdzogs pa ji srid dus yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa gang gis yongs su sbyong bar gyur pa'i chos gang rnams yongs su ma rdzogs pa ji srid dus yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is time for as long as any phenomena that are being purified by a certain stage are not completely fulfilled,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni sa gzhan du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni sa gzhan du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and it is established as another stage when they are completely fulfilled.

original: de la nyon mongs spong ba'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba brgyad rnams bzod pa rnams zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs spong ba'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba brgyad rnams bzod pa rnams zhes brjod la /
translated: The eight types of perseverance, such as perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, are called perseverance because they are the nature of the uninterrupted path that abandons afflictions.🔽The eight types of knowledge, such as Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, are the actual antidotes that abandon the afflictions.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid nyon mongs pa dang bral ba mngon du byed pa rnams ni shes pa brgyad rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid nyon mongs pa dang bral ba mngon du byed pa rnams ni shes pa brgyad rnams te /
translated: They are the eight types of knowledge that are the nature of the liberated path that manifests freedom from the afflictions.

original: chos dang rjes su shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su shes pa rnams so //
translated: They are Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge.

original: de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i nges pa'i shes pa yang brgyad rnams so //🔽de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtogs pa nges par byed pa'i shes pa bzhi rnams so zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i nges pa'i shes pa yang brgyad rnams so // de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtogs pa nges par byed pa'i shes pa bzhi rnams so zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The eight types of subsequent perseverance and the eight types of subsequent knowledge that are concomitant with them are also the eight types of subsequent knowledge.🔽The four types of subsequent perseverance for Dharma knowledge are subsequent perseverance.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa'i rtogs pa nges par byed pa'i shes pa rnams rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa'i rtogs pa nges par byed pa'i shes pa rnams rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams so zhes pa'o //
translated: The four types of subsequent knowledge that are the decisive factor for the realization of subsequent perseverance are subsequent knowledge.

original: 'o na seng ge bzang po'i dgongs pa shes pa gang gis bzod pa'i mjug thogs su rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa de sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o zhes dang / rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas kyang /
analyzed: 'o na seng ge bzang po'i dgongs pa shes pa gang gis bzod pa'i mjug thogs su rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa de sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o zhes dang / rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas kyang /
translated: But if you know the intention of Haribhadra, then the knowledge that manifests liberation immediately after perseverance for Dharma knowledge is Dharma knowledge.🔽Ratnakarasanti also says:

original: rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that manifests liberation is Dharma knowledge.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par de'i rjes su rtogs pa de ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o zhes te ;
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par de'i rjes su rtogs pa de ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o zhes te ;
translated: The subsequent knowledge that subsequently realizes impermanence and so on is subsequent knowledge.

original: chos shes pa'i bzod pa nges par byed pa'i shes pa rnams kyang chos shes pa'o zhes pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i bzod pa nges par byed pa'i shes pa rnams kyang chos shes pa'o zhes pa ni ma yin na /
translated: But if perseverance for Dharma knowledge and the subsequent knowledge that ascertains it are not Dharma knowledge,

original: de ci ltar mi 'gal zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ci ltar mi 'gal zhe na ma yin te /
translated: how is this not contradictory?

original: gang gi phyir goms pa phul du byung ba ma yin pa'i gnas skabs 'dir shin tu gsal ba med pa na so sor snang ba dang lhag par zhen pa dag gis bzod @199a * //🔽pas de kho na nyid mngon du byas so zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir goms pa phul du byung ba ma yin pa'i gnas skabs 'dir shin tu gsal ba med pa na so sor snang ba dang lhag par zhen pa dag gis bzod @199a * //🔽pas de kho na nyid mngon du byas so zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is not contradictory because at this stage, when there is no superior cultivation, there is no very clear appearance, but perseverance for Dharma knowledge manifests reality by means of individual appearance and special adherence.

original: de'i phyir bzod pa'i rjes thogs su nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid kyis nges par byed pa'i shes pa yang mngon sum du byed pas bshad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzod pa'i rjes thogs su nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid kyis nges par byed pa'i shes pa yang mngon sum du byed pas bshad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the subsequent perseverance for Dharma knowledge is the perseverance for subsequent knowledge, since it is the perseverance that is concomitant with the knowledge that manifests liberation from affliction.

original: chos shes pa'i bzod pa des par 'dzin par mi dgongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i bzod pa des par 'dzin par mi dgongs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is not considered to be perseverance for subsequent knowledge.🔽For that reason, the Abhidharma Synthesis declares:

original: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis na shes pa gang gis rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i bzod pa nges par 'dzin pa de sdug bsngal rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'o zhes chos mngon pa kun las btus par gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis na shes pa gang gis rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i bzod pa nges par 'dzin pa de sdug bsngal rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'o zhes chos mngon pa kun las btus par gsungs so //
translated: The perseverance for subsequent knowledge that is ascertained by any knowledge is the knowledge that is subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: ci ste de bzhin du de dag gis dgongs pa ma yin na de'i tshe chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams la nges par 'dzin pa yod dam /
analyzed: ci ste de bzhin du de dag gis dgongs pa ma yin na de'i tshe chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams la nges par 'dzin pa yod dam /
translated: If that is not their intention, then do the perseverances for Dharma knowledge definitely possess perseverance?

original: 'on te med /
analyzed: 'on te med /
translated: Or do they not?

original: gal te yod pa nyid na chos shes pa nyid kyis ma yin pas gang gis yin pa ston cig / med pa nyid ni mngon du byas so zhes pa'i tha snyad ci ltar yin /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid na chos shes pa nyid kyis ma yin pas gang gis yin pa ston cig / med pa nyid ni mngon du byas so zhes pa'i tha snyad ci ltar yin /
translated: And how can one say that nonexistence is manifested?

original: shin tu gsal ba nyid kyi phyir bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis so zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba nyid kyi phyir bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is manifested by the patiences and knowledges because it is very clear,

original: 'o na rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyang mngon du byed pa por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyang mngon du byed pa por 'gyur gyi /
translated: then the subsequent knowledge would be the manifester,

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid can rnams su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid can rnams su ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the nature of ascertainment.

original: gzhan yang shin tu gsal ba nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: gzhan yang shin tu gsal ba nyid du khas len na /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that it is very clear,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med pa'i phyir da ltar kho na rtogs pa thams cad rdzogs pas na sangs rgyas nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med pa'i phyir da ltar kho na rtogs pa thams cad rdzogs pas na sangs rgyas nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because it is free from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, which are by nature conceptual thoughts, then all realizations are complete right now, and so buddhahood would be realized.

original: ci ste 'dir shin tu gsal ba la yang nges pa yang yod cing /
analyzed: ci ste 'dir shin tu gsal ba la yang nges pa yang yod cing /
translated: But if you say that even though it is very clear, there is ascertainment,

original: de yang bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis ma bstan na ni rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa nges par 'dzin pa yang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa nyid kyis ma bstan pas na skad cig bcu gnyis nyid 'ongs pa yin no //🔽dper na ma mthong ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir tha ma lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i skad cig tha ma mthong ba'i lam yin pas skad cig bco lnga mthong ba'i lam du brjod pa ltar sngar med pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa shes
analyzed: de yang bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis ma bstan na ni rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa nges par 'dzin pa yang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa nyid kyis ma bstan pas na skad cig bcu gnyis nyid 'ongs pa yin no // dper na ma mthong ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir tha ma lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i skad cig tha ma mthong ba'i lam yin pas skad cig bco lnga mthong ba'i lam du brjod pa ltar sngar med pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa shes
translated: If perseverance and knowledge are not taught, then subsequent perseverance for Dharma knowledge would not be taught by subsequent knowledge itself. Therefore it is correct that there are twelve moments.🔽For example, because nonseeing is not seeing, the final moment of the path of seeing is the final moment of subsequent realization.

original: pa'i skad cig ma rnams mthong ba'i lam ma yin zhes pas skad cig ma bcu gnyis nyid du thal lo //
analyzed: pa'i skad cig ma rnams mthong ba'i lam ma yin zhes pas skad cig ma bcu gnyis nyid du thal lo //
translated: Since the moments of subsequent knowledge are not seeing because they do not see what was not seen before, it is correct that there are twelve moments.

original: chos bstan na yang nges par 'dzin pa gzhan yang chos shes pa nyid du ston cig ces pa gzhan gyi lugs bsam pas chog go //
analyzed: chos bstan na yang nges par 'dzin pa gzhan yang chos shes pa nyid du ston cig ces pa gzhan gyi lugs bsam pas chog go //
translated: If Dharma knowledge is taught, then subsequent perseverance for Dharma knowledge would be taught by subsequent knowledge itself.

original: 'di ni 'dir man ngag ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir man ngag ste /
translated: This is the instruction here.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdod ma nas @199b skye ba med par so sor rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdod ma nas @199b skye ba med par so sor rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of discerning the non-arising of form, etc. from the beginning,

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma 'di mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes brjod par bya la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma 'di mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes brjod par bya la /
translated: the non-apprehension of the characteristic of suffering, i.e. the moment of acquiescence in the knowledge of the teaching concerning suffering, is called acquiescence in the dharmas which are not produced.

original: de 'di yang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin zung du 'brel pa brjod pa med pa'i skad cig ma'o//
analyzed: de 'di yang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin zung du 'brel pa brjod pa med pa'i skad cig ma'o//
translated: And this is also the union of wisdom and meditative concentration, the moment free from verbal description.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de'i rjes la thob pa rang gi rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i shes rab skyes pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de'i rjes la thob pa rang gi rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i shes rab skyes pa /
translated: After that supramundane direct intuition, the wisdom which arises from the ascertainment of one's own understanding,

original: gang gis chos 'di rnams stong pa kho na'o zhes stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bos mngon par brjod pa de sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos 'di rnams stong pa kho na'o zhes stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bos mngon par brjod pa de sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: by which one describes these dharmas as empty alone, through the pure nature of the characteristic of emptiness, is the knowledge of the teaching concerning suffering.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo de dang 'di yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes rab tu shes pa las slar yang brjod pa med pa'i 'jig rten
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo de dang 'di yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes rab tu shes pa las slar yang brjod pa med pa'i 'jig rten
translated: And he knows that the emptiness of form, etc., whose nature is the purity of the characteristics, is also inexpressible by things and non-things.

original: las 'das pa'i shes rab skye ba de rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: las 'das pa'i shes rab skye ba de rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: From that, again, there is the arising of the supramundane wisdom which is inexpressible. That is the acquiescence in subsequent realization of knowledge.

original: de'i tshe yang khams gsum pa'i chos rnams brjod du med pa nyid du so sor rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang khams gsum pa'i chos rnams brjod du med pa nyid du so sor rtogs par byed de /
translated: At that time, he causes the dharmas of the three realms to be realized as inexpressible.

original: skad cig ma gnyis las thob pas shes rab mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis las thob pas shes rab mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the attainment from two moments, there is the supreme wisdom.

original: sngon ma ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal shin tu gcod pa nyid kyi phyir dang shes rab phul du byung ba med pa'i phyir der rtog pa kho na'i chos rnams bdag med pa nyid du rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: sngon ma ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal shin tu gcod pa nyid kyi phyir dang shes rab phul du byung ba med pa'i phyir der rtog pa kho na'i chos rnams bdag med pa nyid du rtogs par byed do //
translated: The former, because of the complete cutting off of the suffering of the desire realm, and because of the absence of the highest wisdom, causes the dharmas of the realm of speculation to be realized as selfless.

original: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs pa nyid kyis dang de'i rgyu can nyid kyis dang de shes pa'i don can nyid kyis na de'i rjes su rtogs pas bzod par gyur pa ni rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i bzod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs pa nyid kyis dang de'i rgyu can nyid kyis dang de shes pa'i don can nyid kyis na de'i rjes su rtogs pas bzod par gyur pa ni rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i bzod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because it is similar to that, because it is caused by that, and because it has the meaning of knowing that, the acceptance that arises from subsequent understanding is called the acceptance that arises from the subsequent understanding of that.

original: de nas de kho na ltar shes rab skye ba chos thams cad brjod du med pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'i de kho na nyid mngon par brjod pa ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nas de kho na ltar shes rab skye ba chos thams cad brjod du med pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'i de kho na nyid mngon par brjod pa ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Then, just as that, the knowledge that arises from subsequent understanding is called the subsequent understanding of that.

original: 'phags pa rdo rje gcod par yang gsungs pa /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos su 'du shes pa mi 'jug la /
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje gcod par yang gsungs pa / byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos su 'du shes pa mi 'jug la /
translated: The noble Diamond Cutter Sutra also says,🔽Bodhisattvas do not engage with the idea of the Dharma.

original: ches ma yin par 'du shes pa ma yin /🔽'du shes pa la ma yin /
analyzed: ches ma yin par 'du shes pa ma yin / 'du shes pa la ma yin /
translated: They do not engage with the idea of the non-Dharma.🔽They do not engage with the idea of the Dharma and the non-Dharma.

original: 'du shes pa med pa ma yin no zhes te //
analyzed: 'du shes pa med pa ma yin no zhes te //
translated: They do not engage with the idea of neither the Dharma nor the non-Dharma.

original: go rims ji lta bar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo'i chos thams cad mtshan nyid ji ltar bar med pa'i phyir dang / gnyis dang bral bas gnyis su med pa'i ngo bos kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu brjod @200a * //
analyzed: go rims ji lta bar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo'i chos thams cad mtshan nyid ji ltar bar med pa'i phyir dang / gnyis dang bral bas gnyis su med pa'i ngo bos kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu brjod @200a * //
translated: Because all phenomena, in the order in which they are grasped and grasped, do not exist as they are characterized, because they exist conventionally by the nature of non-duality, free from duality, and because the nature of non-duality is not even described as entity and non-entity,

original: par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / tha snyad tsam gyis brjod du med pa yang brjod par bya bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / tha snyad tsam gyis brjod du med pa yang brjod par bya bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the inexpressible is also applied to the expressible by mere convention.

original: de ltar chos su 'du shes pa mi 'jug ces pa la sogs pas mtha' bzhi las rnam par grol ba dbu ma'i lam du mngon par dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos su 'du shes pa mi 'jug ces pa la sogs pas mtha' bzhi las rnam par grol ba dbu ma'i lam du mngon par dgongs pa ste /
translated: Thus, “the perception of phenomena does not engage” and so on, clearly intends the middle way, free from the four extremes,

original: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rnams gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir dang g-yo ba thams cad nub par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rnams gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir dang g-yo ba thams cad nub par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence, non-existence, and so on are only the aspects of the grasped, and because all movements have subsided.

original: gang rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'i dmigs pa yod do zhes 'dod pa de'i lus la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs par 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes pas /
analyzed: gang rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'i dmigs pa yod do zhes 'dod pa de'i lus la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs par 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes pas /
translated: Whoever asserts that the object of the nature of purity exists, for him the conceptualization of apprehending a body will be abandoned.

original: ma mthong ba kho nar 'gyur gyis mthong ba'i lam ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba kho nar 'gyur gyis mthong ba'i lam ma yin no //
translated: It will be seen only as not seen, not as the path of seeing.

original: 'o na rab tu gsal ba tsam mam sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rang rig pa'i ngo bo 'di ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rab tu gsal ba tsam mam sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rang rig pa'i ngo bo 'di ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Well then, isn’t this the nature of self-awareness, which is just clear and of various aspects?🔽When it is conceived in that way, it is not at all realized.

original: de de ltar rtog pa na rab tu rtogs pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes legs par gsungs te /
analyzed: de de ltar rtog pa na rab tu rtogs pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes legs par gsungs te /
translated: It is well said:

original: 'di ni rnam rig tsam kho na //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam rig tsam kho na //
translated: This is mere awareness.

original: zhes pa nye bar dmigs pa las //
analyzed: zhes pa nye bar dmigs pa las //
translated: In the Upāyahṛdayas it says:

original: cung zad mdun du 'jog byed pa ;
analyzed: cung zad mdun du 'jog byed pa ;
translated: Placing it a little in front,

original: / de ni tsam la mi gnas so //🔽zhes so // de kho na ma yin dgag gi tshul gyi rang rig par mthong ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: / de ni tsam la mi gnas so // zhes so // de kho na ma yin dgag gi tshul gyi rang rig par mthong ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ma mthong ba ste /
translated: it does not rest on mere appearance.

original: de kho na mthong ba'i lam mo zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba'i lam mo zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the path of seeing is the seeing of self-awareness in the manner of an external negation, the nonseeing of the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: 'di yang da lta mi rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang da lta mi rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa ste /
translated: This is also a current misconception.

original: dbyig gnyen la sogs rnams kyi ni /
analyzed: dbyig gnyen la sogs rnams kyi ni /
translated: Vasubandhu and others

original: de brjod du med pa kho nar gsungs so //
analyzed: de brjod du med pa kho nar gsungs so //
translated: have said that it is inexpressible.

original: log pa kun rdzob tu ni rnam par ma dag pa'i ngo bo dang / gzhan du rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo zhes pa 'di ltar smra la de la dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa dag gi go skabs med do zhes kyang ngo //
analyzed: log pa kun rdzob tu ni rnam par ma dag pa'i ngo bo dang / gzhan du rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo zhes pa 'di ltar smra la de la dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa dag gi go skabs med do zhes kyang ngo //
translated: The false is said to be the impure reality in the relative and the pure reality in the ultimate. In this way, there is no opportunity for the conceptualization of things and nonthings.

original: de ltar gyur du chug mod de de lta na'ang ci 'di tsam gyis 'di bsgom par bya ba nyid bstan nam /
analyzed: de ltar gyur du chug mod de de lta na'ang ci 'di tsam gyis 'di bsgom par bya ba nyid bstan nam /
translated: Even if that were so, is this meditation taught by just that much?

original: de ltar ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is,

original: de'i tshe ring ste lam yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ring ste lam yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: then it is too long, and the path is completely lost.

original: de ltar bsgom pa 'di dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las 'da' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa 'di dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las 'da' ba ma yin no //
translated: This meditation is not beyond the nature of things.

original: de lta bu ni rab tu byed pa rnams su mthong ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni rab tu byed pa rnams su mthong ba med do //
translated: Such a thing is not seen in the treatises.

original: 'o na mthong ba'i don ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mthong ba'i don ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the meaning of seeing?

original: yul de la shes pa mi skye ba'i don te mthong ba med pa kho na'i bsgom pa ni mthong ba'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yul de la shes pa mi skye ba'i don te mthong ba med pa kho na'i bsgom pa ni mthong ba'o zhes brjod do //
translated: It means that consciousness does not arise in regard to that object.🔽The meditation that is only non-seeing is called seeing.

original: shes pa'i skad cig rnams de'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i skad cig rnams de'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'o //
translated: Because the moments of consciousness follow it, it is seeing.

original: de ltar na de rnams ga las skye zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na de rnams ga las skye zhe na /
translated: In that case, how do they arise?

original: rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa las kun rdzob tu rjod par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa las kun rdzob tu rjod par byed do //
translated: They are said to be conventional because they arise from the transformation of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang @200b lam rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang @200b lam rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the truths of origination, cessation, and the path.

original: de la bzod pa brgyad rnams ni nyon mongs pa spong ba la rkun po 'byin par byed pa'i tshul gyis bya ba can no //
analyzed: de la bzod pa brgyad rnams ni nyon mongs pa spong ba la rkun po 'byin par byed pa'i tshul gyis bya ba can no //
translated: Among them, the eight forbearances function like a thief who expels the afflictions.

original: shes pa brgyad po rnams ni sgo 'phar gcod pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad po rnams ni sgo 'phar gcod pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The eight knowledges function like a doorkeeper.

original: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi po la /
analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi po la /
translated: Among them, the four forbearances of Dharma knowledge

original: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / khong khro dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / khong khro dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi ste /
translated: Desire realm view is the four views, except for the view of the self and extreme view.

original: so sor bcu'o zhes pa bzhi bcu'o //
analyzed: so sor bcu'o zhes pa bzhi bcu'o //
translated: Thus there are forty.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi la ni de rnams kho na khong khro ba por ba rnams te /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi la ni de rnams kho na khong khro ba por ba rnams te /
translated: The four acceptances of subsequent knowledge realize those same afflictions, except for anger.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi rtogs pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis so zhes pa nyon mongs pa bcu gnyis lhag pa'i brgya rnams mthong bas spang bar bya ba ste rab tu spang bar bya bas na'o zhes pa'o /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi rtogs pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis so zhes pa nyon mongs pa bcu gnyis lhag pa'i brgya rnams mthong bas spang bar bya ba ste rab tu spang bar bya bas na'o zhes pa'o /
translated: Thus there are seventy two realizations of the four absorptions and four formless realm states.

original: sems bcu drug po 'di ni bden pa mngon par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sems bcu drug po 'di ni bden pa mngon par rtog pa ste /
translated: These sixteen moments of mind are the realization of the four truths.

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang de rnams su gang zag de dang de'i dbang du mdzad de gsung pa /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang de rnams su gang zag de dang de'i dbang du mdzad de gsung pa /
translated: The Bhagavat spoke in this and that sutra from the perspective of this and that person.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rngul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so zhes so //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rngul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so zhes so //
translated: The eye of Dharma with respect to phenomena arose, free from dust, free from impurity.

original: de bzhin du chos mthong ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mthong ba /
translated: Similarly, one sees phenomena,

original: chos thob pa /🔽chos rig pa /
analyzed: chos thob pa / chos rig pa /
translated: one obtains phenomena,🔽one knows phenomena,

original: cho rtogs pa /🔽som nyi las brgal ba /
analyzed: cho rtogs pa / som nyi las brgal ba /
translated: one penetrates phenomena,🔽one crosses over doubt,

original: the tshom las brgal ba /
analyzed: the tshom las brgal ba /
translated: one crosses over uncertainty,

original: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa /
translated: one is not led by others,

original: ston pa'i bstan pa la gzhan gyis bkrir mi btub pa chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa la gzhan gyis bkrir mi btub pa chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa'o zhes so //
translated: one is not swayed by others with respect to the Teacher’s teachings, and one obtains fearlessness with respect to phenomena.

original: thog mar bden pa rnams la 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi spyan gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir chos rnams la chos kyi mig go ;
analyzed: thog mar bden pa rnams la 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi spyan gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir chos rnams la chos kyi mig go ;
translated: First, with respect to the truths, the eye of Dharma with respect to phenomena is the nature of the eye of arya wisdom.

original: / de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis rdul dang bral te de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa'i rdul spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis rdul dang bral te de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa'i rdul spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With respect to that, the eye of Dharma is free from dust through the forbearances for Dharma knowledge because they abandon the dust of affliction.

original: chos shes pa rnams kyis dri ma dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa rnams kyis dri ma dang bral ba ste /
translated: Those who know dharmas are free from stains,

original: de rnams de'i sgrib pa spong ba'i gnas su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams de'i sgrib pa spong ba'i gnas su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are born in the stage that abandons the obscurations to that.

original: chos la bzod pa rnams kyis chos mthor ba ste /
analyzed: chos la bzod pa rnams kyis chos mthor ba ste /
translated: Those who have patience with dharmas are exalted in dharmas,

original: de rnams kyis de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they realize thatness.

original: chos shes pa rnams kyis chos thob pa ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa rnams kyis chos thob pa ste /
translated: Those who know dharmas attain dharmas,

original: de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they manifest liberation from affliction.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis chos rig pa ste /🔽de rnams kyis 'phags pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba 'di'o zhes de gnyis ka @201a * //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis chos rig pa ste / de rnams kyis 'phags pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba 'di'o zhes de gnyis ka @201a * //
translated: Those who have subsequent patience know dharmas,

original: yang dag par rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they know both of those, thinking, “This is the subsequent conformity to the dharmas of the aryas.”

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis chos rtogs te /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis chos rtogs te /
translated: Those who have subsequent knowledge realize dharmas,

original: de rnams kyis shes bya ji snyed pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis shes bya ji snyed pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they complete the objects of knowledge.

original: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad kyis som nyi las brgal te /
analyzed: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad kyis som nyi las brgal te /
translated: All of the patiences and knowledges are beyond doubt.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thob par gyur pa na yun ring po nas 'dod par byas pa'i rang gi rtog pa la som nyi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thob par gyur pa na yun ring po nas 'dod par byas pa'i rang gi rtog pa la som nyi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one obtains the result of the supramundane path, one is free of doubt with regard to one's own thought, which one has desired for a long time.

original: thams cad gzhan gyis thob pa la the tshom las brgal te /
analyzed: thams cad gzhan gyis thob pa la the tshom las brgal te /
translated: One is free of doubt with regard to the attainment of all others.

original: de'i gnas skabs pa gzhan rnams kyi yang khyad par rtogs pa la so sor the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs pa gzhan rnams kyi yang khyad par rtogs pa la so sor the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is free of doubt with regard to the realization of the distinctions of all others who are in the same situation as oneself.

original: lam bsgom pa'i ched du gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog ste /
analyzed: lam bsgom pa'i ched du gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog ste /
translated: One is not dependent on others for the purpose of cultivating the path.

original: gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa med par yang rang nyid mkhas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa med par yang rang nyid mkhas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: One is not dependent on the teaching of others, because one is wise by oneself.

original: gzhan gyis bkrir mi btub pa ni shes nas dad pa thob pas ston pa'i bstan pa las gzhan mu stegs pa rnams kyis skye ba gzhan du yang mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkrir mi btub pa ni shes nas dad pa thob pas ston pa'i bstan pa las gzhan mu stegs pa rnams kyis skye ba gzhan du yang mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is not led by others, because one is not carried away by other tīrthikas, even in another life, due to having attained faith that arises from wisdom.

original: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa ni khong du chud pa las brtsams nas so sor 'dri ba dang lung du bstan pa'i chos rnams las /
analyzed: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa ni khong du chud pa las brtsams nas so sor 'dri ba dang lung du bstan pa'i chos rnams las /
translated: The attainment of fearlessness with regard to all things is due to the realization of the Dharma, because one is not discouraged by the Dharma of questions and answers that one has understood.

original: sdig pa 'dod pa dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bzhin du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa 'dod pa dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bzhin du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not like the case of one who desires sin or one who is arrogant.

original: slar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: don shes shing chos shes nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: don shes shing chos shes nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs par 'gyur la /
translated: One comes to understand the meaning and the Dharma, and one enters into the Dharma that accords with the Dharma.

original: mthun par zhugs shing chos dang rjes su mthun par spyod pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par zhugs shing chos dang rjes su mthun par spyod pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One enters into accord and practices in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs su chos thams cad kyi don thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yongs su shes nas mdo la sogs pa rnams gzings lta bur shes pa ni thos pa tsam gyis ngoms pa spangs pa'i ched du ste /
analyzed: de ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs su chos thams cad kyi don thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yongs su shes nas mdo la sogs pa rnams gzings lta bur shes pa ni thos pa tsam gyis ngoms pa spangs pa'i ched du ste /
translated: In the state of an ordinary being, one understands all things through the knowledge that arises from hearing the meaning of all things. Knowing that the sūtras and so forth are like rafts, one abandons the satisfaction of mere hearing.

original: des na chos shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na chos shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus one comes to know the Dharma.

original: shes pa de yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du sgrub bzhin pa ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa de yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du sgrub bzhin pa ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos la 'jug pa ste /
translated: The practice of the concordant Dharma is the practice of the bodhisattva who is perfecting that knowledge.

original: de la rab tu dga' ba'i sa la /
analyzed: de la rab tu dga' ba'i sa la /
translated: On the ground of Supreme Joy,

original: sa de pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mthun pa ste mnyam pa nyid la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa de pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mthun pa ste mnyam pa nyid la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the bodhisattva enters into the sameness that is concordant with the bodhisattvas of that ground.

original: de nas dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa rnams la chos kyi rjes su mthun par spyod pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa rnams la chos kyi rjes su mthun par spyod pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, on the Stainless and other grounds, he practices in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de la skad cig ma bco lnga pa byang chub sems dpa' rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa brgyad pa ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la skad cig ma bco lnga pa byang chub sems dpa' rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa brgyad pa ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: On the fifteenth instant, the bodhisattva enters the result of stream enterer and is on the eighth level.

original: dang po dbang po rtul po ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: dang po dbang po rtul po ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: The first, the one of duller faculties, is the one who follows by faith.

original: dad pas de'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pas de'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he follows the path by faith.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: @201b sh'a ri'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' gang mi rnams nas shi 'phos nas mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye ste /
analyzed: @201b sh'a ri'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' gang mi rnams nas shi 'phos nas mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye ste /
translated: Śāriputra, the bodhisattva who dies as a human and is reborn with the fortune of a human

original: de phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par dbang po rtul po rnams su 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par dbang po rtul po rnams su 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are of dull faculties, except for irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: gnyis pa phyir mi ldog pa dbang po rnon po chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba mthong bas thob pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa phyir mi ldog pa dbang po rnon po chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba mthong bas thob pa ste /
translated: The second is the irreversible one of sharp faculty who is a Dharma follower and who obtains results by insight.

original: chos dang mthong ba ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: chos dang mthong ba ni shes rab ste /
translated: Dharma and insight are wisdom.

original: des de'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he follows that path.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu yang byang chub sems dpa' gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan rnams dang dga' ldan gyi lha rnams nas shi 'phos te 'dir skye zhing /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu yang byang chub sems dpa' gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan rnams dang dga' ldan gyi lha rnams nas shi 'phos te 'dir skye zhing /
translated: “Also, Shariputra, a bodhisattva who dies in other buddhafields or among the Tushita gods and is reborn here

original: de'i dbang po rnams rno bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang po rnams rno bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: has sharp faculties.”

original: skad cig bcu drug pa la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig bcu drug pa la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
translated: On the sixteenth moment, he is a stream enterer.

original: 'o na rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam kho nar srid pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam kho nar srid pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: But if he is a stream enterer on the path of seeing alone, he will not have rebirth in existence.

original: 'jigs tshogs pa la lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'jigs tshogs pa la lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir la /
translated: Because they are free from the view of the perishing aggregates.🔽And why?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because it is explained:

original: gti mug nyes pa'i rtsa ba ste //🔽de yang sems can 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: gti mug nyes pa'i rtsa ba ste // de yang sems can 'dzin pa yin //
translated: The root of all faults is delusion,

original: zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas so //
translated: and that is the apprehension of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir lam gzhan don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lam gzhan don med par 'gyur ro zhe na / de lta ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, other paths would be pointless.

original: bden pa mthong ba tsam ni mthong ba'i lam yin la mthong bas kyang mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa rtsa ba med pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir spong ngo //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba tsam ni mthong ba'i lam yin la mthong bas kyang mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa rtsa ba med pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir spong ngo //
translated: That is not so, because the mere seeing of the truths is the path of seeing and seeing also eliminates the apprehension of a self that arises from manifest karmic maturation, since it is a root affliction.

original: de ni nye bar bstan pa las byung ba'i bdag tu lta ba ste /
analyzed: de ni nye bar bstan pa las byung ba'i bdag tu lta ba ste /
translated: That is the view of the self that arises from teaching,

original: phyin ci log pa ni thong ba tsam kho nas spong ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa ni thong ba tsam kho nas spong ba'o //
translated: but the distorted view is eliminated merely by seeing.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ni yun ring po nas zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i phyir gnyen po sgom pa'i lam kho nas spong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ni yun ring po nas zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i phyir gnyen po sgom pa'i lam kho nas spong ngo //
translated: The innate view of the perishing aggregates is eliminated by the path of meditation alone because it is cultivated from beginningless time, since it has long been engaged.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i sems can du lta ba thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang las byung ba yang nga'o zhes pa'i blos sgrub po //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i sems can du lta ba thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang las byung ba yang nga'o zhes pa'i blos sgrub po //
translated: The view of sentient beings that is innate arises from the power of beginningless predispositions. It is established by the thought “I am.”

original: de'i phyir sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa yod pa'i phyir lam dang po kho nar 'khor ba med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa yod pa'i phyir lam dang po kho nar 'khor ba med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the innate view of sentient beings exists, cyclic existence does not cease at the very beginning of the path.

original: sems can du lta ba mtha' dag ma spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: sems can du lta ba mtha' dag ma spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The point is that it is because the entire view of sentient beings has not been eliminated.

original: de ltar yang tshad ma rnam 'grel du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang tshad ma rnam 'grel du gsungs pa /
translated: Dharmakīrti’s Exposition of Valid Knowledge says:

original: gal te 'jig tshogs lta bral phyir //
analyzed: gal te 'jig tshogs lta bral phyir //
translated: If, because of being free from the view of the transitory collection,

original: lam dang por ni srid med 'gyur //
analyzed: lam dang por ni srid med 'gyur //
translated: there were no existence in the first stage of the path,

original: ma yin lhan skyes ma spangs phyir //
analyzed: ma yin lhan skyes ma spangs phyir //
translated: it would not be so, because the innate has not been eliminated.

original: spangs na yang srid ga la yod //
analyzed: spangs na yang srid ga la yod //
translated: If it were eliminated, how could there be existence?

original: bde bar 'gyur ba 'am sdug bsngal bar //🔽ma gyur cig ces sred pa yi //
analyzed: bde bar 'gyur ba 'am sdug bsngal bar // ma gyur cig ces sred pa yi //
translated: The craving that thinks, “May I be happy or sad”

original: nga'o snyam pa'i blo gang ste //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i blo gang ste //
translated: is the thought “I am.”🔽The innate view of

original: sems can lta zhes lhan @202a * //
analyzed: sems can lta zhes lhan @202a * //
translated: sentient beings is

original: cig skyes // nga zhes mthong ba med par ni //
analyzed: cig skyes // nga zhes mthong ba med par ni //
translated: the thought “I am.”

original: 'ga' yang bdag la chags pa min //
analyzed: 'ga' yang bdag la chags pa min //
translated: No one is attached to the self.

original: bdag la chags pa med par yang //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa med par yang //
translated: And even if there were attachment to the self,

original: bde bar 'dod pa mngon rgyug yin //
analyzed: bde bar 'dod pa mngon rgyug yin //
translated: it would not be the cause of the desire for pleasure.

original: zhes so // 'o na bdag zhen pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes so // 'o na bdag zhen pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin la /
translated: Now, the clinging to the self is the false view of the transitory composite.

original: de yang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: And that is associated with nescience.

original: de'i phyir lta ba'i sgo nas ma rig pa brjod do zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba'i sgo nas ma rig pa brjod do zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that nescience is mentioned by way of the false view.

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not occur without that.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba kho na ma rig pa'o zhes pa ni ma yin no //🔽gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni gti mug gi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa yin la gti mug ni nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gi rjes su song ba yang dag par brtags pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can nam rnam pa gzhan yang rung ste de ci
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba kho na ma rig pa'o zhes pa ni ma yin no // gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni gti mug gi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa yin la gti mug ni nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gi rjes su song ba yang dag par brtags pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can nam rnam pa gzhan yang rung ste de ci
translated: But it is not that the false view of the transitory composite is nescience.🔽Moreover, the false view of the transitory composite is a part of delusion, and delusion is the characteristic of the non-examination of all the defilements, or it is something else.

original: ltar 'jig tshogs la lta bar brjod de /
analyzed: ltar 'jig tshogs la lta bar brjod de /
translated: How can it be called the false view of the transitory composite?

original: khyad par gyi sgra la spyi'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra la spyi'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of the general is not in the word for the particular.

original: de bzhin du gal te lta ba kho na ma rig pa yin na de'i tshe lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma rig pa'o zhes mtshungs par ldan pa'i don du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te lta ba kho na ma rig pa yin na de'i tshe lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma rig pa'o zhes mtshungs par ldan pa'i don du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, if only view is ignorance, then at that time ignorance would not be the meaning of being concomitant with view, because it would be concomitant with just that.

original: de de kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mang do zhe na /
analyzed: de de kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mang do zhe na /
translated: But it is concomitant with many things other than that.

original: rtsod pa 'di ni yongs su spong ba rnam 'grel mdzad pa nyid kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di ni yongs su spong ba rnam 'grel mdzad pa nyid kyis gsungs pa /
translated: This dispute is completely abandoned by the statement of the author of the Pramānﬁ avārtika:

original: 'gal ba gang yin 'dir bshad bya //
analyzed: 'gal ba gang yin 'dir bshad bya //
translated: Here, the contradiction is explained.

original: stong nyid lta dang de 'gal phyir //🔽de las byung ba'i nyes kun dang // 'gal bar rab tu grub pa yin ;
analyzed: stong nyid lta dang de 'gal phyir // de las byung ba'i nyes kun dang // 'gal bar rab tu grub pa yin ;
translated: Because it contradicts the view of emptiness,

original: / zhes so //
analyzed: / zhes so //
translated: It is well established as contradictory with all the faults that arise from that.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po yongs su brtags pa sa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po yongs su brtags pa sa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of being concomitant is ascertained by the examination of the general and particular entities.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: pa l'a sha dang ldan pa'i nags zhes pa bzhin /
analyzed: pa l'a sha dang ldan pa'i nags zhes pa bzhin /
translated: a forest endowed with palasha trees.

original: don dam par pa l'a sha'i rang bzhin nyid kho na brjod par byas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam par pa l'a sha'i rang bzhin nyid kho na brjod par byas pa bzhin no //
translated: Ultimately, it is the nature of palasha trees that is expressed.

original: de ltar khyad par mngon par brjod pas de'i rang bzhin ma rig pa rgyur gyur pa gtso bor nges par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar khyad par mngon par brjod pas de'i rang bzhin ma rig pa rgyur gyur pa gtso bor nges par bstan to //
translated: Thus, through the expression of this distinction, the nature of that ignorance, which is the cause, is taught to be the root.

original: gang gi phyir bdag tu lta ba ni ma rig pa yin pa de'i phyir de'i rtsa ba can gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad ni bdag med pa nyid mthong bas rtsa ba chad par byed cing rtsa ba chad pa las rgyun gcod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag tu lta ba ni ma rig pa yin pa de'i phyir de'i rtsa ba can gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad ni bdag med pa nyid mthong bas rtsa ba chad par byed cing rtsa ba chad pa las rgyun gcod do //
translated: Since the view of self is ignorance, therefore all the afflictions that have that as their root are eliminated by seeing selflessness. When the root is cut, the continuum is severed.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa mtha' dag dang 'gal ba bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ste de yang rnal 'byor pa rnams dang mi 'bral lo zhes pas slar nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa mtha' dag dang 'gal ba bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ste de yang rnal 'byor pa rnams dang mi 'bral lo zhes pas slar nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the view of selflessness is incompatible with all the afflictions, and since the yogis and yoginis do not separate from it, the afflictions do not arise again.

original: 'o na skyon dang ldan pa la yon tan sbyor ba ji ltar ba de bzhin du yon tan ldan pa la skyon sbyor bas 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na skyon dang ldan pa la yon tan sbyor ba ji ltar ba de bzhin du yon tan ldan pa la skyon sbyor bas 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba med do zhe na /
translated: Well, just as faults are ascribed to those who have good qualities, so good qualities are ascribed to those who have faults. Therefore, there is no definite emergence from cyclic existence.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: skyon rnams la @202b yon tan yang dag par 'byung bas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon rnams la @202b yon tan yang dag par 'byung bas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faults are harmful, since they are the source of the appearance of the virtues.

original: ci'i phyir bzlog par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bzlog par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is there no reversal?

original: yon tan rnams dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang skyon rnams ni phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang skyon rnams ni phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the virtues are the intrinsic nature of things, and the faults are erroneous.

original: gang gi phyir sems can 'di rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can 'di rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Because this sentient being is naturally luminous,

original: gzhan las byung ba'i phyir dang ma rig pas nye bar bslad pa'i phyir dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las byung ba'i phyir dang ma rig pas nye bar bslad pa'i phyir dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba'o //
translated: the defilements are adventitious, because they arise from another and because they are contaminated by ignorance.

original: yod pa ma yin par gyur pa sgro 'dogs pa ni rtsa ba med pa can nyid kyi phyir don dam par ni chos thams cad dngos po nyid du 'ga' zhig na yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin par gyur pa sgro 'dogs pa ni rtsa ba med pa can nyid kyi phyir don dam par ni chos thams cad dngos po nyid du 'ga' zhig na yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the superimposition of what does not exist is groundless, in the ultimate sense, no entity whatsoever of any phenomenon exists.

original: de'i phyir rnam par dpyad na stong pa nyid kyi phyir dri ma rnams glo bur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par dpyad na stong pa nyid kyi phyir dri ma rnams glo bur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, when analyzed, the defilements are adventitious because of emptiness.

original: de phyir sngar yang nus med rnams //
analyzed: de phyir sngar yang nus med rnams //
translated: Therefore, previously they were powerless,

original: de bdag gyur la phyis nus med //
analyzed: de bdag gyur la phyis nus med //
translated: and later they are powerless with respect to the self.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la skyon skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la skyon skye ba ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that a fault arises in the nature of that .

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: Thus,

original: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
translated: Non-violence and the right meaning,

original: rang bzhin la ni phyin log gis //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni phyin log gis //
translated: By the inversion of the nature,

original: 'bad pa ldan yang gnod med de //
analyzed: 'bad pa ldan yang gnod med de //
translated: Even with effort, there is no harm,

original: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind grasps that side.

original: rang bzhin ni 'bad pa dang bral bas bzlog par nus pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni 'bad pa dang bral bas bzlog par nus pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The nature is not able to be turned away by effort, which is free from exertion.

original: 'bad pa yang yon tan rnams la skyon mthong ba dang skyon rnams la yon tan mthong ba las 'jug na /
analyzed: 'bad pa yang yon tan rnams la skyon mthong ba dang skyon rnams la yon tan mthong ba las 'jug na /
translated: And effort engages from seeing faults in virtues and seeing virtues in faults.

original: chos thams cad bdag med par mthong ba de'i tshe bdag nyid du gyur pa la /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par mthong ba de'i tshe bdag nyid du gyur pa la /
translated: When one sees all phenomena as selfless, at that time, having become one’s own nature,

original: skyon rnams la yon tan mthong ba dang / yon tan rnams la skyon mthong ba'am /
analyzed: skyon rnams la yon tan mthong ba dang / yon tan rnams la skyon mthong ba'am /
translated: one sees faults as virtues and virtues as faults,

original: yon tan rnams la mi mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan rnams la mi mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: or one does not see virtues.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba las nye bar 'tshe ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba las nye bar 'tshe ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no harm from seeing selflessness.

original: de phyir rang bzhin bdag gyur pa //
analyzed: de phyir rang bzhin bdag gyur pa //
translated: Therefore, the nature, having become one’s own nature,

original: nyer 'tshe med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nyer 'tshe med pa kho na'o //
translated: is only non-harmful.

original: sems dang ldan pa rnams kyis de //
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa rnams kyis de //
translated: How can those who have minds

original: yongs btang bya bar ci ltar nus //
analyzed: yongs btang bya bar ci ltar nus //
translated: give up that path?

original: de'i phyir yang nye bar 'tshe ba dang bcas pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don can rang bzhin ma yin pa'i skyon rnams kyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i lam /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang nye bar 'tshe ba dang bcas pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don can rang bzhin ma yin pa'i skyon rnams kyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i lam /
translated: Therefore, the path that is of the nature of those faults, which are associated with harm, are not real, and are not intrinsic, does not cease.

original: skyon rnams zil gyis mnan nas skye ba'i mtshan nyid can la mi gnod do //
analyzed: skyon rnams zil gyis mnan nas skye ba'i mtshan nyid can la mi gnod do //
translated: The faults do not harm the path that is of the nature of the arising of the non-arising of the faults.

original: lam de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa la skyon bskyed pa'i ched du 'bad pa mi srid pa kho na mod /
analyzed: lam de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa la skyon bskyed pa'i ched du 'bad pa mi srid pa kho na mod /
translated: It is not possible to strive to generate faults in the path that is of the nature of the non-arising of faults.

original: de ltar na yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Even so, we will respond to this assertion.

original: skyon skyes pa las 'bad pa ldan du zin kyang mi gnod do //
analyzed: skyon skyes pa las 'bad pa ldan du zin kyang mi gnod do //
translated: Even if one strives to generate faults, they do not harm the path.

original: skyon skye ba'i rtsol ba bzlog nas chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid kyi lam yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyogs su ltung bas na skyon zad par byed pa kho na la 'bad pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon skye ba'i rtsol ba bzlog nas chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid kyi lam yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyogs su ltung bas na skyon zad par byed pa kho na la 'bad pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one turns away from the effort to generate faults and falls to the side of the path of the selflessness of all phenomena, which is endowed with good qualities, one strives only to eliminate faults.

original: gal te dngos po ma lus pa'i rang bzhin la yongs su lta bar nus pa la yang skyon @203a * //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma lus pa'i rang bzhin la yongs su lta bar nus pa la yang skyon @203a * //
translated: Even if one were to allow that it is possible to see the nature of all things,

original: skyer chug mod /
analyzed: skyer chug mod /
translated: still,

original: de lta na yang 'di ni ded dpon dam pas spangs pa'i 'gron po ltar shugs dang yang dag par ldan pas las lam kho na la 'bad pas rtsom ste yon tan gyi phyogs su lhung ba'i phyir la skyon la dga' ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ni ded dpon dam pas spangs pa'i 'gron po ltar shugs dang yang dag par ldan pas las lam kho na la 'bad pas rtsom ste yon tan gyi phyogs su lhung ba'i phyir la skyon la dga' ba ni ma yin no //
translated: one should strive only in the path of action, like a traveler who has been abandoned by his caravan and who must proceed alone, with great effort, because one has fallen into the position of having good qualities, not because one delights in faults.

original: gang gi phyir brtse ba dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtse ba dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Because of compassion,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal spang ba'i ched du 'bad pa 'byung zhing /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal spang ba'i ched du 'bad pa 'byung zhing /
translated: one strives to eliminate the suffering of self and others.

original: rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa med par gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar mi nus la de'i phyir rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa mngon du bya ba dang / dngos po thams cad mngon sum du bya ba la mngon par brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa med par gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar mi nus la de'i phyir rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa mngon du bya ba dang / dngos po thams cad mngon sum du bya ba la mngon par brtson par bya'o //
translated: One cannot eliminate the suffering of others without eliminating one's own suffering, and therefore one should strive to eliminate one's own suffering and to eliminate the suffering of others.

original: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur pas //
analyzed: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur pas //
translated: The means of eliminating suffering is a hidden phenomenon.

original: de 'chad pa ni dka' ba yin //
analyzed: de 'chad pa ni dka' ba yin //
translated: It is difficult to explain that.

original: gang mtho ris dang byang grol gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu mngon du byas pa med pa des /
analyzed: gang mtho ris dang byang grol gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu mngon du byas pa med pa des /
translated: One who does not have the cause and effect of heaven and liberation manifest,

original: pha rol po rnams la de 'chad pa dka' ste /
analyzed: pha rol po rnams la de 'chad pa dka' ste /
translated: it is difficult for him to explain that to others.

original: gang gi phyir de ni de la nus pa med la /🔽de'i phyir lus can rnams kyi yon tan skyon //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni de la nus pa med la / de'i phyir lus can rnams kyi yon tan skyon //
translated: Because he is not capable of that.🔽Therefore, all the virtues and faults of embodied beings

original: thams cad goms pa'i rtsa ba can ;
analyzed: thams cad goms pa'i rtsa ba can ;
translated: are rooted in habituation.

original: / bdag nyid dbang gyur goms de yang //
analyzed: / bdag nyid dbang gyur goms de yang //
translated: And that habituation is mastered by oneself,

original: yon tan nyid las mchog tu byed //
analyzed: yon tan nyid las mchog tu byed //
translated: and that is made supreme by virtue itself.

original: ces pa zhar la byung ba rgya che bas chog go //
analyzed: ces pa zhar la byung ba rgya che bas chog go //
translated: Since the digression is extensive, it is sufficient.

original: dkyus ma brjod par dka'/
analyzed: dkyus ma brjod par dka'/
translated: It is difficult to state the main point.

original: drug pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bco lnga rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: drug pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bco lnga rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The fifteen generations of the mind beginning with the sixth are the supramundane path of cultivation.

original: gal te yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ngo bo gcig pa nyid kyis na phan tshun tha dad par gdags par mi nus pa bzhin du ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i dngos po las tha mi dad pa la dmigs
analyzed: gal te yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ngo bo gcig pa nyid kyis na phan tshun tha dad par gdags par mi nus pa bzhin du ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i dngos po las tha mi dad pa la dmigs
translated: If conditioned and unconditioned states are the same entity, then they cannot be designated as mutually different.🔽In the same way, because the path of meditation focuses on objects that are not different from objects directly perceived by the path of seeing, the path of seeing and the path of meditation would not be different.

original: pa'i phyir / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag tha dad du gyur pa med do zhes pas bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid pa rnam par gzhag pa med kyi /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag tha dad du gyur pa med do zhes pas bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid pa rnam par gzhag pa med kyi /
translated: Therefore, the path of meditation would not be established as a real entity.

original: 'on kyang de ni des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: However, the path of meditation is cultivated by the reality of dependent origination as the antidote to the objects abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba kho na rgyun du shes pa sgom pa yin la de kho na lam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba kho na rgyun du shes pa sgom pa yin la de kho na lam mo //
translated: Therefore the continuity of seeing is meditation and that is the path.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa rnams dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang log par lta ba dag ste /
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa rnams dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang log par lta ba dag ste /
translated: are concomitant with the five views.

original: chos mngon pa kun las btus su ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba gsungs mod /
analyzed: chos mngon pa kun las btus su ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba gsungs mod /
translated: The Abhidharma Samuccaya mentions the extreme view, but

original: 'di ni log lta'i bye brag yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni log lta'i bye brag yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: it is a specific type of wrong view.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir dngos po la yang dag pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pas phyin ci log tu lta ba log @203b ltar gzung gi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir dngos po la yang dag pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pas phyin ci log tu lta ba log @203b ltar gzung gi /
translated: Because it is said that wrong view is grasping the opposite of the view that things are real,🔽it is not the denial of cause and effect, as was previously stated.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa ni ma yin zhes sngar brjod zin to zhes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa de rnams kho na zhe sdang dor ba bcu rnams so zhes pa nyon mongs bcu drug rim gyis spang par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa ni ma yin zhes sngar brjod zin to zhes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa de rnams kho na zhe sdang dor ba bcu rnams so zhes pa nyon mongs bcu drug rim gyis spang par bya'o //
translated: The six that operate in the desire realm and the ten that operate in the form and formless realms, excluding anger, are the sixteen afflictions that are gradually abandoned.

original: bag la nyal yin gyi mngon du rgyu rab tu gyur pa ni ma yin te sngon kho nar bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal yin gyi mngon du rgyu rab tu gyur pa ni ma yin te sngon kho nar bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a latent state, not a manifest state, because it is already previously abandoned.

original: de la nyon mongs pa gcig la chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i dbye ba rnam pa gsum ste slar yang chen po'i chen po la sogs par phye bas rnam pa dgu dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med bzhir gtogs pa nyid kyi brgyad cu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa gcig la chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i dbye ba rnam pa gsum ste slar yang chen po'i chen po la sogs par phye bas rnam pa dgu dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med bzhir gtogs pa nyid kyi brgyad cu rtsa gcig go //
translated: Therein, each of the afflictions is divided into three types: great, medium, and small. Each of these is again divided into great-great, etc., making nine types. There are eighty-one afflictions belonging to the desire realm, the four meditations, and the four formless realms.

original: de bzhin du de'i gnyen po skyon skye bar 'dod pa 'joms pa'i phyir skyon dang 'gal ba bshad ma thag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i gnyen po skyon skye bar 'dod pa 'joms pa'i phyir skyon dang 'gal ba bshad ma thag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: Similarly, the path of cultivation that was just explained is the antidote to those afflictions, because it destroys the arising of faults.

original: bsgoms pas btsal bar bya ba nyid kyis na bsgom pa'i lam shin tu ba yang sems bskyed pa tha ma gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bsgoms pas btsal bar bya ba nyid kyis na bsgom pa'i lam shin tu ba yang sems bskyed pa tha ma gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The path of cultivation is so called because it is to be sought through cultivation. It is the final two moments of the generation of the resolve.

original: 'on kyang chung du dang 'bring dang chen po rnams /
analyzed: 'on kyang chung du dang 'bring dang chen po rnams /
translated: However, the small, medium, and great afflictions🔽are abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: slar yang chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: slar yang chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig go //
translated: Again, it is divided into eighty-one types, such as small, and so on.

original: 'di kho na'i 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du brgyad cu rtsa gcig chen po'i rnam pa gcig ni shin tu ba'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'di kho na'i 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du brgyad cu rtsa gcig chen po'i rnam pa gcig ni shin tu ba'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: This very sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the path of cultivation of the extremely subtle, the one type of great.

original: de bshad pa /
analyzed: de bshad pa /
translated: This is explained:

original: ji skad bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha'i skad cig ni gnyen po mtha' dag gis ngo bo nyid do zhes pa rnam par dag pa shin tu ba dngos sangs rgyas kyi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha'i skad cig ni gnyen po mtha' dag gis ngo bo nyid do zhes pa rnam par dag pa shin tu ba dngos sangs rgyas kyi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The final moment of the path of cultivation as taught is the nature of the totality of antidotes. That is the extremely pure, the actual stage of the Buddha.

original: gnyen po rtogs pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu pa rdo rje lta bu zhes bya bar chad med pa'i lam gyis rkun po phyung ba bzhin du bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa las /
analyzed: gnyen po rtogs pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu pa rdo rje lta bu zhes bya bar chad med pa'i lam gyis rkun po phyung ba bzhin du bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa las /
translated: The vajra-like samadhi, which is the realization of the totality of antidotes, is the uninterrupted path. It is like a thief who has been expelled, having abandoned the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience together with their propensities.

original: de ma thag tu sgo 'phar gcod pa bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin gnyen po'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa ste shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas dngos po'i mtha' las 'das pa'i phyir dang rtag pa'i chos kyi sku thob pas na dus
analyzed: de ma thag tu sgo 'phar gcod pa bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin gnyen po'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa ste shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas dngos po'i mtha' las 'das pa'i phyir dang rtag pa'i chos kyi sku thob pas na dus
translated: Immediately after that, like a door being closed, the nature of the path of complete freedom is the eighty-one aspects of the antidote. Since the obscurations to knowledge have been eliminated, one has transcended the limitations of entities and, since one has attained the dharmakaya of permanence, one is endowed with the quality of the dharmakaya.🔽🔽

original: kyi mtha' las 'das pa'i phyir shin tu ni chos kyi dbyings yin la /
analyzed: kyi mtha' las 'das pa'i phyir shin tu ni chos kyi dbyings yin la /
translated: Immediately, like a door closing, the nature of the path of liberation is the eighty-one antidotes. Since the obscurations to omniscience are abandoned, it is beyond the limit of entities. Since the dharmakāya of permanence is obtained, it is beyond the limit of time.🔽Therefore, it is the utterly pure dharmadhātu.

original: de la yod pa ni shin tu ba'i rnam par dag pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi'o //
