analyzed: de la yod pa ni shin tu ba'i rnam par dag pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi'o //
translated: The existence of that is the utterly pure perfect buddhahood.

original: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gang 'di rnams ni lam gyi rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig po 'di rnams te /🔽nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa re re spang bar bya ba la so sor bar chad @204a * //
analyzed: gang 'di rnams ni lam gyi rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig po 'di rnams te / nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa re re spang bar bya ba la so sor bar chad @204a * //
translated: “These are the eighty-one aspects of the path.

original: med pa nyid dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin rnams so zhes so //
analyzed: med pa nyid dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin rnams so zhes so //
translated: For each aspect of the afflictions to be abandoned, there are the uninterrupted paths and the liberated paths.”

original: bar chad med pa nyid 'dis btsal bar bya bas na lam ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa nyid 'dis btsal bar bya bas na lam ste /
translated: Since this uninterrupted path is to be sought, it is the path.

original: rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis pa'i rgyu'o zhes pa bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis pa'i rgyu'o zhes pa bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The cause of the second aspect of realization is the uninterrupted path.

original: de kho na nyid nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skad cig gis nus pa med pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de kho na nyid nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skad cig gis nus pa med pa'i phyir ;
translated: Since the reality of the arising of the afflictions is powerless,

original: mi skye bar gyur pa na rnam par grol bar bya bas rnam par grol ba yin la rtogs pa snga mas btsal bar byas pas na lam yang ngo zhes pa rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: mi skye bar gyur pa na rnam par grol bar bya bas rnam par grol ba yin la rtogs pa snga mas btsal bar byas pas na lam yang ngo zhes pa rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: when it does not arise, it is liberated, and since it is sought by the previous realization, it is the path. This is the path of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba nyid kyi phyir gnyen po ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba nyid kyi phyir gnyen po ste /
translated: It is an antidote because of being liberation itself,

original: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid las rab tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid las rab tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is completely abandoned due to the nature of the nonarising of the afflictions.

original: de ltar yang chos mngon pa kun las btus par gnyen po'i rnam pa skyes pa dang nyo mongs pa bskyed pa'i nus pa'i bag chags shes bya'i gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa 'gag pa dus mnyam ste snang ba dang mun pa skye ba dang 'gag pa bzhin no
analyzed: de ltar yang chos mngon pa kun las btus par gnyen po'i rnam pa skyes pa dang nyo mongs pa bskyed pa'i nus pa'i bag chags shes bya'i gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa 'gag pa dus mnyam ste snang ba dang mun pa skye ba dang 'gag pa bzhin no
translated: Thus in the Compendium of Abhidharma it is said: The arising of the aspect of the antidote and the cessation of the aspect of the negative tendencies that are the latent tendencies that generate the afflictions are simultaneous, like the arising and cessation of light and darkness.

original: // de 'gags pa las ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gnas par byed pa de ni spangs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: // de 'gags pa las ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gnas par byed pa de ni spangs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The future affliction does not arise due to the cessation of that, and it abides in the reality of non-arising. That is abandonment.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang so sor bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang so sor bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Similarly, the aspects of realization of the second and subsequent moments are the nature of the uninterrupted and liberated paths, respectively.

original: rtogs pa'i rnam pa tha ma ni rnam par grol ba'i lam kho na yin gyi bar chad med pa'i lam ni ma yin te 'bras bu'i rtogs pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnam pa tha ma ni rnam par grol ba'i lam kho na yin gyi bar chad med pa'i lam ni ma yin te 'bras bu'i rtogs pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The final aspect of realization is only the liberated path, not the uninterrupted path, because it lacks the aspect of realization as a result.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam la /
translated: Similarly, in the path of seeing,

original: so sor de lta bu'i lam gnyis kyi ngo bo ste skad cig ma tha ma yang bsgom pa'i lam rtogs pa'i rnam pa dang po'i bar chad med pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: so sor de lta bu'i lam gnyis kyi ngo bo ste skad cig ma tha ma yang bsgom pa'i lam rtogs pa'i rnam pa dang po'i bar chad med pa'i lam ste /
translated: each of those paths has the nature of the uninterrupted and liberated paths. The final moment is the uninterrupted path of the first aspect of realization of the path of cultivation.

original: dang po rnam par grol ba'i lam yang ngo //
analyzed: dang po rnam par grol ba'i lam yang ngo //
translated: It is also the first liberated path.

original: de skad du yang chos mngon pa kun las btus par 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog ni de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin sbyor ba'i lam ste gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: de skad du yang chos mngon pa kun las btus par 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog ni de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin sbyor ba'i lam ste gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
translated: Thus, the Compendium of Higher Knowledge says, “The supreme mundane quality is the path of preparation for the meditative stabilization immediately preceding it, by which one abandons the afflictions.

original: de'i de ma thag pa'i dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mthong ba'i lam mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag pa'i dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mthong ba'i lam mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The meditative stabilization that is its object immediately after that is the path of seeing.”

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams su rnam pa dang po dgu rnams ni sgrub pa'i bsgom lam gyi ngo bo sems bskyed pa drug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa dgu rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams su rnam pa dang po dgu rnams ni sgrub pa'i bsgom lam gyi ngo bo sems bskyed pa drug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa dgu rnams so //
translated: In that regard, the first nine aspects in the desire realm are the essence of the path of meditation of practice, the nature of the sixth generation of the mind of enlightenment and so forth, the nine stainless stages and so forth.

original: khyad par gyi lam gyi rnam pa rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam shin tu ba rnam par dag pa las dang / rab tu gyur pa'i rgyud dang bcas pa nyid las dang sgrub pa la ltos nas shin tu rnam par dag pa las bsgom pa'i @204b lam rnam par dag pa shin tu bar lam shes pa nyid la gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam gyi rnam pa rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam shin tu ba rnam par dag pa las dang / rab tu gyur pa'i rgyud dang bcas pa nyid las dang sgrub pa la ltos nas shin tu rnam par dag pa las bsgom pa'i @204b lam rnam par dag pa shin tu bar lam shes pa nyid la gsungs so //
translated: The aspects of the path of distinctive progress are the path of meditation of very pure progress, and the path of knowledge of the path of very pure progress is taught from the very pure path of meditation in dependence on the continuum of transformation and in dependence on practice and accomplishment.

original: de la dri ma med pa dang dod byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang shin tu sbyang dka' ba'i sa'i ngo bo rnam pa dang po bzhi khong du chud pas na rgyun du zhugs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de la dri ma med pa dang dod byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang shin tu sbyang dka' ba'i sa'i ngo bo rnam pa dang po bzhi khong du chud pas na rgyun du zhugs pa kho na ste /
translated: The first four aspects of the nature of the stages of the stainless, the radiant, the shining, and the very difficult to conquer are the stream-enterer.

original: mi dang lha'i rigs su skye ba nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mi dang lha'i rigs su skye ba nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two kinds, by reason of birth in the family of men and gods.

original: de la dang po ni thabs la mkhas pas ni rnams su rgyal rigs dang bram ze dang khyim bdag shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs su skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni thabs la mkhas pas ni rnams su rgyal rigs dang bram ze dang khyim bdag shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs su skyed pa'o //
translated: The first is born in the families of kings, priests, and wealthy householders, like the great Sāla tree, by skill in means.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa drug po rnams su'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa drug po rnams su'o //
translated: The second is in the six desire heavens.

original: rnam pa lnga pa sa la mngon du gyur pa'i ngo bo la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga pa sa la mngon du gyur pa'i ngo bo la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The one who has entered the result of once-returner is on the stage of the manifest, which is the nature of the fifth aspect.

original: drug pa sa ring du song ba'i rang bzhin la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: drug pa sa ring du song ba'i rang bzhin la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: The once-returner is on the stage of far-reaching, which is the nature of the sixth aspect.

original: de kho na gzhan bar chad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na gzhan bar chad gcig pa'o //
translated: That is the single-interval one.

original: rnam pa bdun pa mi g-yo ba'i sa'i ngo bo rtogs pa na dang / brgyad pa sa legs pa'i blo gros kyi rang gi ngo bo la ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun pa mi g-yo ba'i sa'i ngo bo rtogs pa na dang / brgyad pa sa legs pa'i blo gros kyi rang gi ngo bo la ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o //
translated: When one realizes the nature of the eighth stage, the stage of Excellent Wisdom, one enters the result of non-returner.🔽When one realizes the nature of the ninth stage, the stage of Cloud of Dharma, one is a non-returner who attains nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: dgu pa chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i rang bzhin la ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnam pa dgu'o zhes pa 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhabs kyis /
analyzed: dgu pa chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i rang bzhin la ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnam pa dgu'o zhes pa 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhabs kyis /
translated: The noble Vimuktasena explains:🔽From the complete exhaustion of the six aspects of desire

original: 'dod pa'i rnam pa drug pa dang // dgu pa'ang yang dag zad pa las /🔽lan cig phyir 'ong phyir mi 'ong //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam pa drug pa dang // dgu pa'ang yang dag zad pa las / lan cig phyir 'ong phyir mi 'ong //
translated: And of the ninth,🔽The individuals of once-returner and non-returner

original: gang zag dag ni skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zag dag ni skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Are born.

original: srid rtse'i mtha' zad dgar bcom ste //
analyzed: srid rtse'i mtha' zad dgar bcom ste //
translated: Having destroyed the peak of existence,

original: de rnams lam la yang dag gnas //🔽de yi sbyor ba la gnas bzhi /
analyzed: de rnams lam la yang dag gnas // de yi sbyor ba la gnas bzhi /
translated: They abide in the path.🔽Abiding in its application,

original: rnams su bshad //
analyzed: rnams su bshad //
translated: They are explained as four.

original: dgra bcom mi slob pa yin la //
analyzed: dgra bcom mi slob pa yin la //
translated: They are arhats, non-learners,

original: bdun gzhan zad par slob phyir ro //
analyzed: bdun gzhan zad par slob phyir ro //
translated: And the seven others are learners.

original: zhes nyan thos kyi theg pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pa dang ; / mdo sde rgyan du /
analyzed: zhes nyan thos kyi theg pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pa dang ; / mdo sde rgyan du /
translated: The Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras says:🔽The family of the tathāgatas, birth, obtaining,

original: de bzhin gshegs rigs skye thob dang // lung bstan pa dang dbang bskur dang // byang chub rab tu thob pa yang //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rigs skye thob dang // lung bstan pa dang dbang bskur dang // byang chub rab tu thob pa yang //
translated: prophecies, empowerment, and full enlightenment

original: ngo mtshar che ba yin par 'dod //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che ba yin par 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be the most amazing.

original: ces 'di bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ces 'di bshad pa ni /
translated: This explains

original: 'bras bu ngo mtshar che ba gsungs te /🔽bzhi rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo mtshar che ba gsungs te / bzhi rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: the amazing result.🔽The four are the results of the bodhisattva: the three results of training in the first, eighth, and tenth levels and the supreme, the fourth result of no more training on the level of buddhahood.

original: dang po dang brgyad pa dang bcu pa la slob pa'i 'bras bu gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi slob pa'i 'bras bu bzhi pa mchog yin no zhes pa de ni brgyad pa mi g-yo ba'i sa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba mthar phyin pa'i dbang du byas nas lung bstan pa thob pa'i 'bras bu rjod par byed pa'i yi ge'o
analyzed: dang po dang brgyad pa dang bcu pa la slob pa'i 'bras bu gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi slob pa'i 'bras bu bzhi pa mchog yin no zhes pa de ni brgyad pa mi g-yo ba'i sa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba mthar phyin pa'i dbang du byas nas lung bstan pa thob pa'i 'bras bu rjod par byed pa'i yi ge'o
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the once-returner who has completed the eighth level, the immovable.

original: zhes pas 'gal ba @205a * //
analyzed: zhes pas 'gal ba @205a * //
translated: This is contradictory.

original: med do ; / de nyid kyi phyir des dge 'dun dkon mchog la gdams pa'i rnam par bshad par /
analyzed: med do ; / de nyid kyi phyir des dge 'dun dkon mchog la gdams pa'i rnam par bshad par /
translated: Therefore, it is explained in the commentary on the Jewel of the Saṅgha:🔽“One who is a once returner is one who has one interruption.”

original: gang kho na lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bshad pa de kho na bar chad gcig pa ste gsungs pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams yod de nas /
analyzed: gang kho na lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bshad pa de kho na bar chad gcig pa ste gsungs pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams yod de nas /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who, having abandoned seven or eight afflictions, are obstructed by one birth.

original: ji srid du skye ba gcig gis thogs par rig par bya'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: ji srid du skye ba gcig gis thogs par rig par bya'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: One should know that they are once returners.”

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs pas dang / de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pas dang ba bskyed pa gcig lhag mar lus pa'i phyir lan cig car phyir 'ong ba'i khyad par can no zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs pas dang / de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pas dang ba bskyed pa gcig lhag mar lus pa'i phyir lan cig car phyir 'ong ba'i khyad par can no zhes byas nas so //
translated: They are special once returners because they abandon seven or eight afflictions and they generate the faculty of obtaining that is their antidote, but they leave one type of generation remaining.🔽“One who is a nonreturner is one who abandons nine afflictions.”

original: gang 'di nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spangs pa las phyir mi 'ong ba'o zhes bshad la de yang rnam pa lnga ste de nas ji srid du gang 'di phyir mi 'ong zhes bshad pa de /
analyzed: gang 'di nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spangs pa las phyir mi 'ong ba'o zhes bshad la de yang rnam pa lnga ste de nas ji srid du gang 'di phyir mi 'ong zhes bshad pa de /

original: gal te srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam pa brgyad spangs par gyur na de las 'di dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o zhes pa'i mthar thug pas dang / sems can gyi don gyi nges 'byung gi rnam par bshad par yang /

analyzed: sa dang po la sems can la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams mthong ba'i lam gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir //

original: gnyis pa la lam chung ngu'i chung dus rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chen po spangs par gyur pa na sems can la sogs pa rnams dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas sa bcu pa la rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i gnyen pa

original: la chen po ni nam mkha' ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba tsam du bstan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i mthar thug pas shin tu yang rnam par gzhag par mdzad do //

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung du grangs yod pa dang gzhal du yod pa dang / tshad yod pa rtogs pas bsdus pa /

analyzed: bskal pa bzang po 'di kho nal bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o zhes pa'i bar ro //

original: ji srid du dga' ldan gyi gnas su tshe ji srid par gnas nas de nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa yang dag par bstan nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par🔽sangs rgya'o zhes so //
analyzed: ji srid du dga' ldan gyi gnas su tshe ji srid par gnas nas de nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa yang dag par bstan nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o zhes so //
translated: He demonstrates that he abides in the Tusita heaven for the remainder of his life, then passes away and is reborn here, and then he demonstrates that he attains supreme enlightenment in various buddha fields.

original: de rnams 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i dbang du byas nas /

original: sh'a ri'i byang chub sems dpa' gang bsam gtan bzhi rnams nas ji srid du 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi bar du thob cing de rnams mngon sum du mi byed pa rnams yod de /

translated: From the tenth stage on, all bodhisattvas are skilled in means and have sharp faculties.

original: de la phyir mi 'ong ba'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la phyir mi 'ong ba'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: The Buddha spoke from the perspective of nonreturners:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa drug thob pa gang rnams 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams su mi skye ba yod de /

original: 'on kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o snyam nas ji srid du gang dang gang du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'byung ba de dang der skye'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o snyam nas ji srid du gang dang gang du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'byung ba de dang der skye'o zhes pa'i bar ro //

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni nam yang skye ba'i skye mched de kho nar skye ba gnyis pa mngon par 'grub par byed de khyad par du 'phags par 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de'i rnam pa lnga rnams kyi dang po bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste de ni tshangs ris pa rnams nas brtsams nas 'og min ji srid pa zhes pa 'dir bar ma do ste /

analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o zhes pa'i bar ro //

analyzed: 'dir sems can gyi don la rab tu brtson pa nyid ni mngon par 'du byed pa'o //

analyzed: bzhi pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni gang gsungs pa /

analyzed: ji srid sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dang gzhan rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon @207a * // par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes pa'i bar ro //

analyzed: de yang mngon par brtson pa med par thob pa'i lam can no zhes byas nas so //

translated: Here, one who attains manifest perfect enlightenment in a very short time through little effort due to the specific type of lineage is one who attains nirvana without exertion.

analyzed: lnga pa gong du 'pho ba ni gong du 'gro ba'i gong du skyes pa de kho nar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa'o //

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: de la gcig ni 'og min gyi mthar thug pa ste /

original: gang gsungs pa /

original: sems can rnams la bde ba'i yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub pa rnams yod do nas ji srid du dge ba bcu rnams la sems can rnams so sor bkod nas tshangs ris pa rnams nas 'og min ji srid pa'i lha rnams su skye ste /

translated: They provide all the necessities for the happiness of sentient beings and they establish sentient beings in the ten virtues and they are born as gods from Brahmakāyika to Akaniṣṭha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: and in various buddha-fields, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de 'di'i 'og min gyi mthar thug pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de 'di'i 'og min gyi mthar thug pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The highest limit of Akaniṣṭha is threefold:

analyzed: 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba'o //
translated: leaping, half-leaping, and death in all abodes.

original: de la 'phar ba ni gang bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams pas bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs nas tshangs ris pa rnams su skye ste sngon gyi goms pa'i dbang las bsam gtan bzhi pa bskyed nas de nas shi 'phos te 'og min gyi lha rnams su skye
analyzed: de la 'phar ba ni gang bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams pas bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs nas tshangs ris pa rnams su skye ste sngon gyi goms pa'i dbang las bsam gtan bzhi pa bskyed nas de nas shi 'phos te 'og min gyi lha rnams su skye

original: ba'o // de ni bsam gtan las nges par rgyal ba'i phyir 'phags pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ba'o // de ni bsam gtan las nges par rgyal ba'i phyir 'phags pa zhes brjod do //

translated: Half-leapers are those who die from the Brahma group and are born in the Pure Abodes, skipping over one intermediate stage and entering Akaniṣṭha.

analyzed: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba ni gang gnas gzhan thams cad du yang dag par brgyus nas 'og min du 'jug pa'o ;
translated: Full-leapers are those who skip over all the other stages and enter Akaniṣṭha.

original: / gang gsungs pa ;

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dga' ldan gyi gnas sbyangs nas tshangs ris pa rnams nas 'og min gyi bar rnams su skye ste thabs la mkhas pas dmyal ba pa dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston
translated: With skillful means they teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells, animal realms, and worlds of the Lord of Death.

analyzed: par byed cing phyogs bcu @207b rnams su sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: They go from buddhafield to buddhafield in the ten directions, serving the lord buddhas.

analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: They also bring sentient beings to full maturity.🔽They also establish unsurpassed buddha-fields.

analyzed: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyang yongs su sgrub par byed pa rnams yod do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: gong du 'pho ba gnyis pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The second type of upward bound one reaches the peak of existence as their limit.

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan rnams bsgrubs shing gnas gzhan thams cad du skyes nas gnas gtsang mar ma zhugs pa kho nar gzugs med par rim gyis skyes shing srid pa'i rtse mor son nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnams su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan rnams bsgrubs shing gnas gzhan thams cad du skyes nas gnas gtsang mar ma zhugs pa kho nar gzugs med par rim gyis skyes shing srid pa'i rtse mor son nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnams su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o
translated: Having accomplished other meditative attainments, they are born in all other abodes, and without entering the pure abodes, they are born in the formless realm in sequence, reach the peak of existence, and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood in various buddha-fields.

original: // gang yang gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba de ni 'di nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: // gang yang gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba de ni 'di nas shi 'phos te /

original: gzugs med pa rnams su skyes nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnams su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams su skyes nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnams su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //

original: mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang gsungs pa /🔽sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams yod de gang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i lus can rnams te nas /🔽ji srid du tshe dpag du med pa dang ldan zhing 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong phrag du ma rnams yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang gsungs pa / sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams yod de gang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i lus can rnams te nas / ji srid du tshe dpag du med pa dang ldan zhing 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong phrag du ma rnams yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: The one who is said to attain nirvana in this life🔽is the bodhisattva who has a body adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.🔽He attains the lifespan of immeasurable eons and rules over many hundreds of thousands of universal monarchs.🔽

original: de la gnas pas kyang sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma rnams bsnyen bkur nas phyis 'di kho nar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pas kyang sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma rnams bsnyen bkur nas phyis 'di kho nar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The one who attains nirvana in this life is mentioned in the sutra:🔽“

original: skye ba thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par mthong ba ste sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos la mngon par yang dag par byang chub par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba de ni lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Those who attain the meditative attainment of cessation are called “those who attain nirvāṇa physically” because they attain nirvāṇa through the body.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i chos lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i chos lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: They are called “those who attain nirvāṇa physically” because they attain nirvāṇa through the body.🔽How do they attain nirvāṇa through the body? They attain nirvāṇa through the body because the body arises in dependence on the mind.

original: / ji ltar lus kyis mngon sum du byed ce na sems med pa las lus la brten pas de skye ba'i phyir ro zhes phyir mi ldog pa 'khor lo'i mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: / ji ltar lus kyis mngon sum du byed ce na sems med pa las lus la brten pas de skye ba'i phyir ro zhes phyir mi ldog pa 'khor lo'i mdor gsungs pa /

original: lus ni rten te de gnas gyur pas lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ni lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus ni rten te de gnas gyur pas lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ni lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa'o //

original: dper na 'phags pa byams pa lta @208a * //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa byams pa lta @208a * //

analyzed: bu ste ; snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir chos kyi sku mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par dag pa mthar thug pas sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku mngon sum du bya bas so //🔽seng ge bzang pos kyang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa phyir mi 'ong ba 'gog pa thob par lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa de bzhin du /

translated: Because the Buddhas have perfected the purification of the Dharma Body.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la zhugs pa nyid kyis 'phags pa byams pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed par gsal bar bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la zhugs pa nyid kyis 'phags pa byams pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed par gsal bar bshad do //
translated: Subhūti also clearly explained that the noble Maitreya, by his very entry into Buddhahood, actualizes with his body the attainment of the Arhat fruit, the nonreturner’s cessation.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord has also said:

translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom and who play with the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions.

original: de rnams bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de rnams bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Having arisen from that, they enter into the base of the infinity of consciousness.🔽Having arisen from that, they enter into the base of nothingness.🔽Having arisen from that, they enter into the base of neither perception nor nonperception.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang slob dpon zla ba grags pas phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Having arisen from that, they enter into the base of the infinity of space.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sa la skyes pa med pa 'gag pa med pa shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba chos kyi sku ni rnam pa thams cad du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa las de'i yul can rnams 'jug
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sa la skyes pa med pa 'gag pa med pa shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba chos kyi sku ni rnam pa thams cad du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa las de'i yul can rnams 'jug
translated: The dharmakāya, which is the buddhafield, is free from the elaborations of knower and knowable and so on. It is the cessation of all aspects of mind and mental factors. It is not an object of engagement for the mind that is the subject of that.

original: pa med pa'i phyir lus kho nas mngon sum du byed par kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: pa med pa'i phyir lus kho nas mngon sum du byed par kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag la /

original: lus gang gis chos kyi de kho na nyid 'di mngon sum du byed pa de yang zhi ba'i rang bzhin du 'dod de sems dang sems las byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes dbu ma la 'jug par gsungs pa de ni /

translated: The body by which this suchness of dharmatā is manifested is also asserted to be of the nature of peace because it is free from mind and mental factors.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa gnyis kyi rten rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i lam sems bskyed pa'i skad cig gis yongs mthar gnas gyur pa tsam 'gog pa ste mun pa med pa nyid kyis 'od gsal ba'i chos kyi sku'i dbang du
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa gnyis kyi rten rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i lam sems bskyed pa'i skad cig gis yongs mthar gnas gyur pa tsam 'gog pa ste mun pa med pa nyid kyis 'od gsal ba'i chos kyi sku'i dbang du
translated: The support of the two obstructions together with their traces is called “vajra-like,” and is the uninterrupted path. The cessation of the mere transformation of the mind of the instant of the generation of the resolve is the absence of darkness, and from the perspective of the luminous body of truth,

original: byas nas so //
analyzed: byas nas so //
translated: it is peace.

original: de'i tshe ni lus kyang @208b sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin du gnas gyur pa 'gag pa'o zhes pa zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni lus kyang @208b sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin du gnas gyur pa 'gag pa'o zhes pa zhi ba'o //
translated: At that time, the body also ceases, just like the mind and mental factors.

original: de'i mthar ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las bzhin du 'gog pa las langs pa sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'i rang gi ngo bo snying rje chen po dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung du 'jug pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i
analyzed: de'i mthar ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las bzhin du 'gog pa las langs pa sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'i rang gi ngo bo snying rje chen po dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung du 'jug pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i
translated: At the end of that, just like rising from the meditative attainment of cessation, the rising from cessation is the nature of the twenty-first generation of the mind of enlightenment, which is the union of great compassion and the perfection of wisdom, the nature of the body of perfect enjoyment.

original: bdag nyid du 'di mngon par dgongs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid du 'di mngon par dgongs pa kho na'o //

analyzed: bag chags mtha' dag dang bral ba 'khor ba'i bar du 'jug pa'i ye shes ni mthar phyin pa ste /
translated: The pristine wisdom that engages samsara, free from all habitual tendencies, is the consummate.

translated: Since the qualities of buddhahood are all accumulated, it is the mind and so on. This is the definitive meaning explained by means of the six parameters in the commentary.

original: gang sngon po'i rnam pa 'dzin par skye bzhin pa'i shes pa ni sngon po shes so zhes tha snyad byed pa bzhin du de kho na nyid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa ni kho na nyid shes so //

translated: Just as it is said that the consciousness that is arising and apprehending the aspect of blue knows blue, the consciousness that is arising in the aspect of suchness knows suchness.

analyzed: nye bar btags pa las de kho na nyid rtogs so zhes rnam par gzhag pa ste /

analyzed: chos nyid sangs rgyas blta bar bya //

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //

original: chos nyid rnam par shes bya min //
analyzed: chos nyid rnam par shes bya min //

analyzed: de ni rnam par shes mi nus //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /

original: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs dang bcas pas lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam skad cig gcig dang / sbyor ba'i gnas skabs dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu zhes pa rnam pa sum cu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs dang bcas pas lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam skad cig gcig dang / sbyor ba'i gnas skabs dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu zhes pa rnam pa sum cu'o //
translated: The path of meditation is nine aspects, together with the state of preparation.

original: 'dir ni lam gnyis kyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni /
analyzed: 'dir ni lam gnyis kyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni /
translated: Here, the two aspects of the two paths, which are the nature of the two states of preparation,

original: skad cig gcig kyang rnam pa gnyis kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig kyang rnam pa gnyis kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: are the nature of two aspects in one moment.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam pa gnyis dgu rnams ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por ro zhes gsungs pas na gnyen po rnam pa brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam pa gnyis dgu rnams ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por ro zhes gsungs pas na gnyen po rnam pa brgyad rnams so //
translated: The nine aspects of the path of meditation are the eight aspects that are the antidote to the conception of the apprehended and the conception of the apprehender.

original: bstan bcos kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyang /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge also says:

original: mthong @209b dang go mas pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: mthong @209b dang go mas pa'i lam dag la //
translated: On the paths of seeing and meditation,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog brgyad //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog brgyad //
translated: there are eight conceptions of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to pacify them,

original: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
translated: there are eight aspects that are their antidotes.

original: zhes so // gal te yang 'di'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dngos su gsungs pa med mod /
analyzed: zhes so // gal te yang 'di'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dngos su gsungs pa med mod /
translated: Although it is not explicitly stated that this is the path of preparation,

original: de lta na yang mngon par rtogs pa snga ma rnams dang phyi mar yang bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs ba las shugs kyis rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang mngon par rtogs pa snga ma rnams dang phyi mar yang bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs ba las shugs kyis rtogs par bya ste /
translated: nevertheless, it should be understood implicitly from the fact that it is taught as a prior clear realization and a subsequent clear realization.

original: de med par nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without it, there would be no clear realization of the factors that contribute to enlightenment and so on.

original: 'dir bsgom pa'i lam gyi dgra zla'i rnam pa rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis spong ngo //
analyzed: 'dir bsgom pa'i lam gyi dgra zla'i rnam pa rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis spong ngo //
translated: Here, the path of meditation abandons the two types of conceptual thought that are its adversaries.

original: rnam pa tha ma dang de'i phyi ma'i rnam pa rdo rje lta bu'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bar ni sangs rgyas nyid rtogs pa'i bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam pa tha ma dang de'i phyi ma'i rnam pa rdo rje lta bu'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bar ni sangs rgyas nyid rtogs pa'i bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The final aspect and the aspect that follows it, up to the vajra-like uninterrupted path, are posited as the uninterrupted samādhi that realizes buddhahood.

original: 'ga' zhig tu mngon par rtogs pa 'di yang mthar phyin pa'i lam du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu mngon par rtogs pa 'di yang mthar phyin pa'i lam du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In some cases, this clear realization should be described as the path of completion.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni mthar phyin pa'i lam ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi de ma thag tu zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni mthar phyin pa'i lam ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi de ma thag tu zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o zhes so //
translated: In some places, the path of culmination is the cognition of elimination and nonarising that is immediate to the vajra like concentration.

original: seng ge bzang pos sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa'o zhes smra ba ni 'khrul pa che ste /
analyzed: seng ge bzang pos sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa'o zhes smra ba ni 'khrul pa che ste /
translated: Haribhadra’s statement that it is included in the perseverance for the knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering is a great error.

original: sbyin pa la sogs re rer ni //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs re rer ni //
translated: Each of generosity and so on

original: de rnams phan tshun bsdus pa gang //🔽skad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis //
analyzed: de rnams phan tshun bsdus pa gang // skad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis //
translated: includes the others.🔽The path of seeing is included

original: bsdus pa 'di 'dir mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: bsdus pa 'di 'dir mthong ba'i lam //
translated: in the perseverance for the knowledge of the factors of a single moment.

original: zhes pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ni //
analyzed: zhes pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ni //
translated: The Ornament of Clear Realization says:🔽Because each of the six perfections includes the others, the six perfections are the path of seeing.

original: re res drug po rnams kyang bsdus pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa drug pa rnams kho na mthong ba'i lam mo zhes pa'i don rtogs par byed pa dang / de bzhin du bar mar yang ste pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams lam gyi bden pas bsdus kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pas ma yin no ;
analyzed: re res drug po rnams kyang bsdus pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa drug pa rnams kho na mthong ba'i lam mo zhes pa'i don rtogs par byed pa dang / de bzhin du bar mar yang ste pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams lam gyi bden pas bsdus kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pas ma yin no ;
translated: The meaning of this is understood in the same way for the middle, that is, the six perfections are included in the truth of the path, but not in the truth of suffering.

original: / ji skad du mdor bsdus par gsungs pa /
analyzed: / ji skad du mdor bsdus par gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in brief:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni lam mo zhes so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni lam mo zhes so //
translated: The six perfections are the path.

original: 'dir chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skabs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skabs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not the occasion for the acceptance of the knowledge of the doctrine,

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa rnams sngar spangs pa nyid kyi phyir khams gong ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'thad do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa rnams sngar spangs pa nyid kyi phyir khams gong ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'thad do zhes pa ste /
translated: because the aspects of the afflictions of the desire realm have already been abandoned. It is tenable that the acceptance of the knowledge of the subsequent stage is the essence of the knowledge that realizes the antidotes to the afflictions of the higher realms.

original: bdag cag pha rol gyi skyon rab tu gsal bar byas pas ci zhig / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs 'di kho nar snying rje chen po la sogs pa mngon du gyur par byed pa las /
analyzed: bdag cag pha rol gyi skyon rab tu gsal bar byas pas ci zhig / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs 'di kho nar snying rje chen po la sogs pa mngon du gyur par byed pa las /
translated: What is the point of us revealing the faults of others? In this very nonconceptual state, we should manifest great compassion and so forth.

original: yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs @210a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs @210a * //
translated: Through the power of authentic skill in means,

original: kyis ; byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du mthong ba'i lam la seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: kyis ; byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du mthong ba'i lam la seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: The bodhisattva, for the sake of sentient beings, enters into the meditative absorption of the lion's majestic posture on the path of seeing in the following way.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //🔽yang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang / gzugs med pa dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yang ste /

translated: He enters into the first concentration.🔽He also enters into the second, third, and fourth concentrations, and into the first, second, third, and fourth formless absorptions, and into the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs nas gzugs med pa bzhi pa dang gsum pa dang gnyis pa dang dang po dang bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gsum pa dang gnyis pa dang dang po la yang snyoms par 'jug go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs nas gzugs med pa bzhi pa dang gsum pa dang gnyis pa dang dang po dang bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gsum pa dang gnyis pa dang dang po la yang snyoms par 'jug go zhes pa'o //
translated: Having arisen from the meditative absorption of cessation, he also enters into the fourth, third, second, and first formless absorptions, and into the fourth, third, second, and first concentrations.

original: de'i rjes su ma rig pa'i rkyen can 'du byed nas ji srid du skye ba'i rkyen can rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa'i bar rnams 'byung ngo zhes lugs 'byung dang / ma rig pa 'gags pa las 'du byed 'gag ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su ma rig pa'i rkyen can 'du byed nas ji srid du skye ba'i rkyen can rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa'i bar rnams 'byung ngo zhes lugs 'byung dang / ma rig pa 'gags pa las 'du byed 'gag ste /
translated: Then, he sees dependent origination in forward order, from the condition of ignorance, the formations, and so on, up to the condition of birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and turmoil.

original: ji srid du skye pa 'gags pa las rga shi la sogs pa rnams 'gag go zhes lugs las bzlog par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la lta'o //
analyzed: ji srid du skye pa 'gags pa las rga shi la sogs pa rnams 'gag go zhes lugs las bzlog par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la lta'o //
translated: Then, he sees dependent origination in reverse order, from the cessation of ignorance, the cessation of the formations, and so on, up to the cessation of birth, the cessation of aging and death.

original: de'i rjes su bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i rjes su bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: After that, he enters the meditative absorption of alternating meditative development, which has the nature of the path of meditative development.

translated: This is as follows:

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go ;
