original: 'ong ba la ni bco brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: 'ong ba la ni bco brgyad rnams so //
translated: In the coming, there are eighteen.

original: 'di las rnam pa gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa ni seng ge bzang po la sogs pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'di las rnam pa gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa ni seng ge bzang po la sogs pa'i ste /
translated: The other way of positing these is that of Haribhadra and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i dgongs pa dang mi 'grig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dgongs pa dang mi 'grig go //
translated: This does not agree with the purport of the Holy Ones.

original: thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin na ;
analyzed: thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin na ;
translated: If this is a samadhi of alternating meditative attainment,

original: de mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems la ci ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: de mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems la ci ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: how is it not contradictory to be in a nonconcentrated state of mind?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa las 'pho ba snyoms par 'jug pa btags pa'o zhes pas 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa las 'pho ba snyoms par 'jug pa btags pa'o zhes pas 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: There is no contradiction, because it is said that the meditative attainment of alternating meditative attainment is a designation for the transition from meditative attainment.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i las ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i las ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The function of this samadhi will be explained.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: This samadhi is the path of meditation on the realization of the peak.🔽The disciples do not have such skill in means.🔽What is the use of such skill in means?🔽The bodhisattvas who have such skill in means can

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi ni thabs la mi mkhas pa'i 'di lta bu ma yin no zhes pa ste des ci zhig /'di lta bur gyur pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bskal pa grangs med pa bye ba
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi ni thabs la mi mkhas pa'i 'di lta bu ma yin no zhes pa ste des ci zhig /'di lta bur gyur pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bskal pa grangs med pa bye ba
translated: countless eons as one day.

original: khrag khrig brgya stong phrag gis 'jug pa dang sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la bsnyen bkur ba'i rgyu chen po nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khrag khrig brgya stong phrag gis 'jug pa dang sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la bsnyen bkur ba'i rgyu chen po nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of meditation is superior due to the continuity of its great causes of entering into the hundreds of thousands of millions of concentrations and of revering limitless buddhas.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis po 'di las phyi ma nas bzung nas sems bskyed pa nyi shu pa'i bar ni nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis po 'di las phyi ma nas bzung nas sems bskyed pa nyi shu pa'i bar ni nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ste /
translated: From the latter of these two paths of seeing and meditation up to the twentieth generation of the enlightenment mind, it is the practice of definite emergence.

original: 'dis ma rgyal ba rgyal ba thob cing nges par 'byung ba las 'bras bu mthar thug pa gnon to zhes pa ste rgyas par sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'dis ma rgyal ba rgyal ba thob cing nges par 'byung ba las 'bras bu mthar thug pa gnon to zhes pa ste rgyas par sngar brjod zin to //
translated: By this, one attains victory over what has not been conquered and presses on to the final result of definite emergence. This has been explained extensively above.

original: gsum pa'i rnam pa bcu gnyis rnams dang sems bskyed pa bzhi pa dang lnga pa ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa'i rnam pa bcu gnyis rnams dang sems bskyed pa bzhi pa dang lnga pa ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The four aspects of the third and the four aspects of the fourth generation of the enlightenment mind are the clear realization of the serial.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsum dang / sngar bzhin du nges par @211a * //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsum dang / sngar bzhin du nges par @211a * //
translated: The three conducive to liberation and the three conducive to penetrative insight are the serial clear realization.

original: 'byed pa'i cha dang ma thun pa'i rnam pa bcu gnyis rnams dang / mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug dang / bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu zhes pa rnam pa bzhi bcu'o //
analyzed: 'byed pa'i cha dang ma thun pa'i rnam pa bcu gnyis rnams dang / mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug dang / bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu zhes pa rnam pa bzhi bcu'o //
translated: The four are the twelve aspects of the truths, the twelve aspects of the differentiation, the sixteen moments of the path of seeing, and the nine aspects of the path of meditation.

original: gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / sangs rgyas dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun dang tshul khrims dang gtong ba dang / lha rjes su dran pa rnams dang chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / sangs rgyas dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun dang tshul khrims dang gtong ba dang / lha rjes su dran pa rnams dang chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa ste /
translated: The thirteen are the six perfections, the realization of the Buddha, the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral dharmas, the irreversible Saṅgha of bodhisattvas, morality, generosity, and the recollection of the deity, and the realization that all dharmas are the nature of nonentity.

original: rnam pa bcu gsum gsungs pa de rnams ni mthar gyis pa'i rtogs pa'i rnam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gsum gsungs pa de rnams ni mthar gyis pa'i rtogs pa'i rnam pa ma yin te /
translated: These thirteen are not the aspects of the realization of the serial [approach].

original: rtogs pa'i rnam pa re re la yang /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnam pa re re la yang /
translated: Because each of the aspects of realization

original: bcu gsum po 'di rnams srid pas so //
analyzed: bcu gsum po 'di rnams srid pas so //
translated: can be any of these thirteen.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te 'di ltar rtogs pa'i chos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar rtogs pa'i chos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: If this Dharma that is realized is the non-entityness of entities,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na mthar gyis bgyi ba dang mthar gyis bslab pa dang mthar gyis sgrub par ci ltar gdags par bgyi zhes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na mthar gyis bgyi ba dang mthar gyis bslab pa dang mthar gyis sgrub par ci ltar gdags par bgyi zhes so //
translated: Blessed One, how should we designate the bodhisattva’s serial activity, serial training, and serial practice when they practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: 'dir 'phags pas bgyi ba gzung bas sems bskyed par shes par byas so //🔽bslab pa gzung bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pas bgyi ba gzung bas sems bskyed par shes par byas so // bslab pa gzung bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Here, the noble Asanga explains that the generation of the enlightenment mind is understood through taking up the activity.🔽The serial training is through taking up the training.

original: sgrub pa gzung bas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ngag go //
analyzed: sgrub pa gzung bas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ngag go //
translated: The serial practice is through taking up the practice.

original: gsum ka gzung bas ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar gyis pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsum ka gzung bas ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar gyis pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: And taking up all three is the serial realization.

original: de bzhin du rtogs pa mthar gyis pa rtogs par byas pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtogs pa mthar gyis pa rtogs par byas pas /
translated: Thus, through taking up the serial realization,

original: cig car skye ba dgag pa'i ched du gdags par bya bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: cig car skye ba dgag pa'i ched du gdags par bya bzhin pa'o //
translated: the instantaneous generation of the enlightenment mind is refuted.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa sngon du song ba'i des par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam dang /🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rang bzhin bsgom pa'i lam ste rnam pa gsum po'i byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi mthar thug pa chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas don dam par dran pa
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa sngon du song ba'i des par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rang bzhin bsgom pa'i lam ste rnam pa gsum po'i byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi mthar thug pa chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas don dam par dran pa
translated: The path of seeing has the nature of the seven aspects of enlightenment and the path of meditation has the nature of the eightfold noble path.🔽The ultimate Buddha is the dharmakaya, which is the culmination of the wisdom of omniscience, the aspects of enlightenment and so on.

original: med pa kho nar rjes sangs rgyas don dam par dran pa med pa kho nar rjes su dran pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o zhes shes par bya ba'i ched du gsungs so //
analyzed: med pa kho nar rjes sangs rgyas don dam par dran pa med pa kho nar rjes su dran pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o zhes shes par bya ba'i ched du gsungs so //
translated: The ultimate recollection of the Buddha is to recollect the ultimate Buddha alone, who is devoid of memory.

original: sems bskyed pa dang nges par 'byed ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang / dran pa nyi @211b bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs pas mthong ba'i lam dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar yongs su rdzogs pas bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes pa 'di ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang nges par 'byed ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang / dran pa nyi @211b bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs pas mthong ba'i lam dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar yongs su rdzogs pas bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes pa 'di ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang /
translated: The path of seeing is the complete perfection of the generation of the mind of enlightenment, the factors conducive to penetration, and the complete perfection of the factors of enlightenment such as the establishment of mindfulness and so on. The path of meditation is the complete perfection of the gnosis of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mthar gyis bya ba la sogs pa shes par byed pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par rig par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis bya ba la sogs pa shes par byed pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par rig par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, although it is the nature of nonentity, it is to be understood that the cultivation of the recollection of the Buddha is the cause of the knowledge of the sequential and so on.

original: sems bskyed pa drug pa ni rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la bar chad med pa'i lam skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa mngon par rtogs pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa drug pa ni rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la bar chad med pa'i lam skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa mngon par rtogs pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The sixth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the seventh clear realization, the complete enlightenment in a single moment of the uninterrupted path on the level of the Buddha, which has seventy-one aspects.

original: bar du gcod cing gegs byed par nus pa ni bar chad yin la /
analyzed: bar du gcod cing gegs byed par nus pa ni bar chad yin la /
translated: An obstruction is that which is able to interrupt and obstruct.

original: bar chad med pa ni bar chad med pa ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa ni bar chad med pa ste /
translated: The uninterrupted is the uninterrupted.

original: rang gi don la aan te bar chad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi don la aan te bar chad med pa nyid do //
translated: It is uninterrupted in its own aim.

original: thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na /
analyzed: thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na /
translated: Since all phenomena are of the nature of the dharmadhatu,

original: zag pa med pa'i chos gcig mngon par byang chub pa na dus gcig la chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa las dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'i rnam par smin pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang / rmi lam bzhin du rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos gcig mngon par byang chub pa na dus gcig la chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa las dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'i rnam par smin pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang / rmi lam bzhin du rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang /
translated: when one uncontaminated phenomenon is fully enlightened, all phenomena are fully enlightened at the same time, because it is realized that the antidote is cultivated and fully matured, because it is realized that they are essenceless like a dream,

original: gnyis kyis bag chags rtsa ba med pa nyid kyis na gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid kyis ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir ldog pa bzhi'i bdag nyid do ;
analyzed: gnyis kyis bag chags rtsa ba med pa nyid kyis na gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid kyis ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir ldog pa bzhi'i bdag nyid do ;
translated: and because it is realized that they are the nature of nondual suchness, since the habitual tendencies of the two are rootless.

original: /'dir byang chub sems dpa'i zhing gi bkod pa dpag tu med pa rnams pa thams cad rdzogs nas /
analyzed: /'dir byang chub sems dpa'i zhing gi bkod pa dpag tu med pa rnams pa thams cad rdzogs nas /
translated: Here, the bodhisattvas' inconceivable array of the realm of phenomena is complete in every way.

original: chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid skad cig gcig kho na la mngon par byang chub pa ni dper na skyes bu rdog thabs gcig gis bskul ba'i zo chun gyi rgyud thams cad lan cig 'gul ba de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems gcig rab
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid skad cig gcig kho na la mngon par byang chub pa ni dper na skyes bu rdog thabs gcig gis bskul ba'i zo chun gyi rgyud thams cad lan cig 'gul ba de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems gcig rab
translated: The reality of all phenomena is manifestly enlightened in a single instant.

original: tu ldan par mngon du byed pa na zag pa med pa'i ye shes thams cad 'gugs shing rtogs par byed de sngon gyi bsgom pa'i 'phen pa'i shugs las so //
analyzed: tu ldan par mngon du byed pa na zag pa med pa'i ye shes thams cad 'gugs shing rtogs par byed de sngon gyi bsgom pa'i 'phen pa'i shugs las so //
translated: Just as when a person kicks a waterwheel with a single foot, the entire wheel turns, in the same way, when a single thought of generosity and so on is actualized, all uncontaminated transcendent wisdom is attracted and realized, due to the force of previous cultivation.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang 'phrul dbang byed pa'i lha rnams kyi yo byad thams cad yid kyis bsams pa kho nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang 'phrul dbang byed pa'i lha rnams kyi yo byad thams cad yid kyis bsams pa kho nas 'byung ngo //
translated: all the resources of the gods who control the enjoyments created by others appear merely through their mental wish.🔽In the same way, the perfections are perfected merely through the bodhisattva's mental wish.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyis bsams pa kho nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyis bsams pa kho nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: sa bcu par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: sa bcu par yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in the Ten Grounds:

original: de'i sems kyi skad cig re re la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu @212a * //
analyzed: de'i sems kyi skad cig re re la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu @212a * //
translated: In each moment of mind, he perfects the ten perfections.

original: rnams kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: rnams kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs can te rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid rang bzhin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs can te rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid rang bzhin te /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is also the state of the reality of evolutionary development, the reality of evolutionary development being its nature.

original: lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa 'di'i gnas skabs yin zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa 'di'i gnas skabs yin zhes byas nas so //
translated: This is its state of spontaneous accomplishment.

original: 'dir ni zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad cig car de ltar kho nar mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad cig car de ltar kho nar mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Here, all uncontaminated and contaminated phenomena are simultaneously and just thus fully enlightened.

original: gnas skabs de yang sa brgyad pa nas bzung ste 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gnas skabs de yang sa brgyad pa nas bzung ste 'gyur mod /
translated: This state is also present from the eighth stage on,

original: 'dir rab kyi mthar thug pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rab kyi mthar thug pa thob pa'o //
translated: but here it is attained to the highest degree.

original: bcom ldan 'das mar ji skad du pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mar ji skad du pa /
translated: As the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā says,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes so //
translated: “One perfects the perfection of wisdom by the method of signlessness.”

original: mtshan nyid med pa ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: The absence of a defining characteristic is like a dream.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:🔽Subhūti, a bodhisattva who is established in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream gives a gift.

original: rab 'byor 'di byang chub sems dpa' rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la gnas nas sbyin pa gtong ngo zhes bya ba na sa brtsams te ji srid du chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par shes so zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di byang chub sems dpa' rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la gnas nas sbyin pa gtong ngo zhes bya ba na sa brtsams te ji srid du chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par shes so zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the beginning. Up to: he knows that all phenomena are without a defining characteristic.

original: 'dir rmi lam lta bu rnams la ste rmi lam gyi rang bzhin rnams la mtshan nyid med pa ste rang bzhin med par ro //
analyzed: 'dir rmi lam lta bu rnams la ste rmi lam gyi rang bzhin rnams la mtshan nyid med pa ste rang bzhin med par ro //
translated: Here, in regard to those that are like a dream, in regard to those that have the nature of a dream, he knows that they are without a defining characteristic, that they are without a nature.

original: de ltar na gang chos mthun pa ni dpe'i don yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na gang chos mthun pa ni dpe'i don yin la /
translated: Thus, the similarity is the meaning of the example.

original: de ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dus su bar dang bcas pa dang bar med par stong pa nyid yid la byed pa lhag par spyod pa las tshogs nye bar mkho ba nyid nyams su myong nas rtogs pa'i gnas skabs su chos nyid dang / ro gcig pa nyid pas /
analyzed: de ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dus su bar dang bcas pa dang bar med par stong pa nyid yid la byed pa lhag par spyod pa las tshogs nye bar mkho ba nyid nyams su myong nas rtogs pa'i gnas skabs su chos nyid dang / ro gcig pa nyid pas /
translated: That is, when one experiences the necessity of the collection through the practice of the superior mental attention to emptiness that is interrupted and uninterrupted at the time of generosity and so forth, then in the state of realization, since the reality of the object and the mind are of one taste,

original: dbyer med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi don yang dag par 'grub ste /
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi don yang dag par 'grub ste /
translated: Because of their inseparability, the meaning of reality is perfectly accomplished.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: srid mo phung po rnams ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: srid mo phung po rnams ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: The sister aggregates are like a dream,

original: shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'o //
translated: not at all really existent.

original: byang chub kyang rmi lam gyi rang bzhin te shin tu mngon par ma grub bo //🔽de ltar mi dang glang po che dang rta la sogs pa'i rmi lam dang de mthong ba'i bdag nyid la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi tshul du mi mthong ba ltar chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid skad cig gcig
analyzed: byang chub kyang rmi lam gyi rang bzhin te shin tu mngon par ma grub bo // de ltar mi dang glang po che dang rta la sogs pa'i rmi lam dang de mthong ba'i bdag nyid la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi tshul du mi mthong ba ltar chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid skad cig gcig
translated: Enlightenment also has the nature of a dream, not at all really existent.

original: kho nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: kho nas mthong ngo //
translated: Just as in a dream, a man, an elephant, a horse, and so on, and the self who sees them are not seen in the manner of a duality of grasped and grasper, in the same way, in a single moment, one sees the reality of all phenomena, which is nonduality.

original: kha cig ni rim gyis skye bar nges par skad cig bzhi'i ngo bo ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni rim gyis skye bar nges par skad cig bzhi'i ngo bo ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is certain that one is born gradually, and that the nature of the four moments is the realization in a single moment.

original: gzhan rnams ni de bsam par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni de bsam par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Others say that this should be contemplated.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i don sgom @212b pa rab kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs ta gnas ngan len thams cad 'jig pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i don sgom @212b pa rab kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs ta gnas ngan len thams cad 'jig pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu yang ngo //
translated: Thus, this generation of the thought is the ultimate stage of the meditation on the perfect meaning, and it is also like a diamond, because it destroys all the bad habits.

original: gang rtogs pa'i rnam pa bdun ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas so sor phigs par dka' ba'i phyir brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin so so rang gis rig par ba ba rdo rje lta bur gsungs pa dang / 'di nang du 'dus te /
analyzed: gang rtogs pa'i rnam pa bdun ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas so sor phigs par dka' ba'i phyir brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin so so rang gis rig par ba ba rdo rje lta bur gsungs pa dang / 'di nang du 'dus te /
translated: The seven realizations are said to be like a diamond, because they are difficult to penetrate by the knowledge that comes from listening and reflection, and because they are the inexpressible nature, which is the self-awareness.🔽They are included in this,

original: 'dir rnam pa bdun po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa bdun po ni ma yin no //
translated: but here there are not seven realizations.

original: de ltar ni theg pa chen po rgyud bla mar /
analyzed: de ltar ni theg pa chen po rgyud bla mar /
translated: Thus, in the Mahāyāna Uttaratantra🔽the Buddha, the Dharma, the community, the element, enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas chos tshogs khams dang byang chub dang // yon tan sangs rgyas phrin las tha ma ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos tshogs khams dang byang chub dang // yon tan sangs rgyas phrin las tha ma ste //
translated: the qualities, and the activity of the Buddha are the last.

original: bstan bcos kun gyi lus ni mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: bstan bcos kun gyi lus ni mdor bsdu na //
translated: The body of all the treatises is summarized

original: rdo rje'i gnas ni bdun po 'di rnams so ;🔽/ zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gnas ni bdun po 'di rnams so ;🔽/ zhes gsungs so //
translated: in these seven vajra points.

original: de la dkon mchog gsum ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de la dkon mchog gsum ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The Three Jewels are the effect.

original: khams ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: khams ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The element is the substantial cause.

original: byang chub dang yon tan phrin las rnams lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: byang chub dang yon tan phrin las rnams lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen no //
translated: Enlightenment, qualities, and activity are the cooperative conditions.

original: dkon mchog gsum yang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum yang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ste /
translated: The Three Jewels are also the mutual cause and effect of each other.

original: de nyid du gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid du gang gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the same text:

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog las chos dkon mchog 'byung zhes pa dang / theg pa chen po'i chos dkon mchog 'di las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs 'byung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog las chos dkon mchog 'byung zhes pa dang / theg pa chen po'i chos dkon mchog 'di las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs 'byung ngo zhes so //
translated: “The Jewel of the Buddha produces the Jewel of the Dharma,” and “From this Jewel of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, the assembly of irreversible bodhisattvas is produced.”

original: gsum po de yang bzhi po rnams kyi 'bras bur de nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsum po de yang bzhi po rnams kyi 'bras bur de nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: And in the same text, it is stated that these three are the effect of the four:

original: dri bcas de bzhin nyid dang dri ma med //
analyzed: dri bcas de bzhin nyid dang dri ma med //
translated: The stained suchness, the stainless,

original: dri bral sangs rgyas yon tan rgyal ba'i mdzad //
analyzed: dri bral sangs rgyas yon tan rgyal ba'i mdzad //
translated: The freedom from stains, the qualities of the Buddha, and the deeds of the Victorious One,

original: gang las dkon mchog dge ba gsum 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang las dkon mchog dge ba gsum 'byung ba //
translated: From which the three jewels of virtue arise,

original: don dam gzigs pa rnams kyi yul nyid do //
analyzed: don dam gzigs pa rnams kyi yul nyid do //
translated: Are the very object of those who see the ultimate.

original: slar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang gsungs pa /
translated: And again it is stated:

original: de la gnas bzhi po 'di rnams kyi dang po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sa bon nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la gnas bzhi po 'di rnams kyi dang po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sa bon nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Of these four topics, the first is the seed of supramundane dharmas.

original: so so rang nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten pas de rnam par dag pa bzung nas dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba'i rgyur rtogs par bya'o zhes pas gcig rgyu'o //
analyzed: so so rang nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten pas de rnam par dag pa bzung nas dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba'i rgyur rtogs par bya'o zhes pas gcig rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause of the three jewels, since it is the support for proper attention and, when purified, is the cause of the three jewels.

original: ci ltar gsum rnams rkyen yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar gsum rnams rkyen yin zhe na /
translated: How are the three jewels conditions?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: The Tathāgata, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment,

original: stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis mdzad pa na /
analyzed: stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis mdzad pa na /
translated: performs the thirty-two deeds of a tathāgata through the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha.

original: gzhan gyi sgra la brten pas de rnam par dag pa bzung nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra la brten pas de rnam par dag pa bzung nas /
translated: When he does so, he takes up the purification of that, which is based on the words of others.

original: dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba'i rkyen du rtogs pa bya'o zhes pa de ltar gsum rnams rkyen no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba'i rkyen du rtogs pa bya'o zhes pa de ltar gsum rnams rkyen no //
translated: One should understand that the three jewels are the conditions for the arising of the three jewels.
Some say:

original: cig ni ; sangs rgyas las chos chos las 'phags pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: cig ni ; sangs rgyas las chos chos las 'phags pa'i tshogs //
translated: From the Buddha comes the Dharma, from the Dharma the noble assembly,

original: tshogs las snying po ye shes khams thob mtha' //
analyzed: tshogs las snying po ye shes khams thob mtha' //
translated: from the assembly comes the attainment of the essence, the element of wisdom,

original: ye shes de thob byang chub mchog stobs sogs //
analyzed: ye shes de thob byang chub mchog stobs sogs //
translated: from the attainment of that wisdom comes supreme enlightenment, the powers, and so on,

original: sems can kun don byed chos rnams ldan pa //
analyzed: sems can kun don byed chos rnams ldan pa //
translated: and from that comes the performance of the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: zhes pa 'dis dkon mchog gsum lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis dkon mchog gsum lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: This passage explains that the three jewels are coemergent causes.

original: khams de bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: khams de bzhin kho na'o //
translated: The element is just as it is.

original: byang chub dang yon tan dang phrin las rnams 'bras bu'o zhes kyang rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: byang chub dang yon tan dang phrin las rnams 'bras bu'o zhes kyang rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
translated: Enlightenment, qualities, and activity are the result.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis kyang sngar brjod pa'i don kho nar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis kyang sngar brjod pa'i don kho nar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This verse should be applied to the meaning already explained.

original: don rnam pa gnyis su 'byung na yang sngar brjod pa'i don kho na theg pa chen po rgyud bla mar brjod par bzhed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: don rnam pa gnyis su 'byung na yang sngar brjod pa'i don kho na theg pa chen po rgyud bla mar brjod par bzhed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gzhan rnams so //
translated: Although the meaning is twofold, others say that it is only the meaning stated previously that is intended in the Uttaratantra of the Mahayana.

original: de ltar dri ma med pa byang chub la bar chad med pa'i sems bskyed pa 'di ni chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog dag gi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: de ltar dri ma med pa byang chub la bar chad med pa'i sems bskyed pa 'di ni chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog dag gi nang du 'dus so //
translated: Thus, this generation of the uninterrupted mind for stainless enlightenment is included within the Jewels of Dharma and Sangha.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa drug gis rang bzhin khyad par gyi lam rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig rtogs pa na byang chub sems dpa' dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs par rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa drug gis rang bzhin khyad par gyi lam rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig rtogs pa na byang chub sems dpa' dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs par rnam par gzhag la /
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattva realizes the seventy-one aspects of the distinctive path of the nature through the six generations of the mind of enlightenment, he is posited as having entered the result of an arhat.

original: smon lam rang sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo can yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smon lam rang sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo can yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste /
translated: The aspiration that has the nature of a pratyekabuddha is also that of a bodhisattva.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang sangs rgyas mi bzhugs shing nyan thos med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su so so gcig pu byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba rnams yod de /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang sangs rgyas mi bzhugs shing nyan thos med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su so so gcig pu byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba rnams yod de /
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who fully awaken to enlightenment alone, by themselves, in world systems where there are no buddhas and no śrāvakas.

original: de rnams thabs la mkhas pas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po rnams theg pa gsum rnams la yongs su smin par byas nas /
analyzed: de rnams thabs la mkhas pas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po rnams theg pa gsum rnams la yongs su smin par byas nas /
translated: Through their skill in means, they bring many hundreds of thousands of living beings to maturity in the three vehicles.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes so //
translated: Then they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: 'di ni bdag nyid gcig pu rang nyid so sor sangs rgyas pas rang 'byung dang sgra med par chos ston pa ste rang sangs rgyas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag nyid gcig pu rang nyid so sor sangs rgyas pas rang 'byung dang sgra med par chos ston pa ste rang sangs rgyas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: These are the two kinds of pratyekabuddhas: those who awaken by themselves, because they awaken by themselves alone, and those who teach the Dharma without speaking, because they teach the Dharma without speaking.

original: de dang chos mthun pa las gcig ni bdag dang gzhan rnams la yang thos pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos snang bar byed pa'i phyir dang / gzhan ni rang sangs rgyas kyi cha lugs su yang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa las gcig ni bdag dang gzhan rnams la yang thos pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos snang bar byed pa'i phyir dang / gzhan ni rang sangs rgyas kyi cha lugs su yang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One of these is similar to the first, because it causes the Dharma of the Buddha to shine forth for oneself and others without study. The other is similar to the second, because it causes the Dharma of the pratyekabuddhas to shine forth.

original: ci ltar na chos ston pa dang tha snyad byed pa med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na chos ston pa dang tha snyad byed pa med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are without teaching the Dharma and without verbal expression?

original: chos ston pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ston pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause for attaining the result of teaching the Dharma.

original: de ltar ni tshig smra ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni tshig smra ba ni /
translated: Thus, with regard to speaking words,

original: @213b rnam par ma brtags nas ma yin /
analyzed: @213b rnam par ma brtags nas ma yin /
translated: it is not without analysis,🔽it is not without examination.

original: rnam par ma dpyad nas ma yin no zhes pas brjod pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i ched du pa yin la de yang rgyud 'khrug par byed do zhes pas byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: rnam par ma dpyad nas ma yin no zhes pas brjod pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i ched du pa yin la de yang rgyud 'khrug par byed do zhes pas byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar smon lam btab ste /
translated: This is said to be for the sake of distraction, and that also disturbs the mindstream. The bodhisattva makes this aspiration:

original: sangs rgyas su gyur nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du brjod pa med par yang sems can gyi don bya ba nus par gyur cig ces so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su gyur nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du brjod pa med par yang sems can gyi don bya ba nus par gyur cig ces so //
translated: Having become a Buddha, may I be able to work for the welfare of sentient beings without effort, like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: des na sangs rgyas nyid dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas nyid dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is like Buddhahood itself,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs na yang smon lam la sogs pa'i mthu nyid kyis gang zhig don gang la la rnam pa gang gis nyan 'dod pa de'i rnam par shes pa la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs na yang smon lam la sogs pa'i mthu nyid kyis gang zhig don gang la la rnam pa gang gis nyan 'dod pa de'i rnam par shes pa la /
translated: even in the state of a Pratyekabuddha, by the power of his prayers, etc., whatever meaning he wishes to teach, in whatever way, to whomever,

original: rnam pa de kho nas sgra med par bya ba'i chos gdul ba'i rgyud la bskrun pa ni ston pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam pa de kho nas sgra med par bya ba'i chos gdul ba'i rgyud la bskrun pa ni ston pa zhes brjod do //
translated: in that very form, without words, he plants the Dharma in the mindstream of the disciple to be tamed. This is called “teaching.”

original: ji skad du mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du mdor gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the sutra:

original: yid kyis brgya byin la tshigs su bcad pas lan btab bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis brgya byin la tshigs su bcad pas lan btab bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “With his mind, he replied to Sakra with a verse.”

original: de ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang /
translated: Thus, there are seven types of individuals: those who have entered the result of stream enterer, stream enterers, those who have entered the result of once returner, once returners, those who have entered the result of nonreturner,🔽nonreturners and those who have entered the result of an arhat.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes pa gang zag bdun rnams rab tu dbye ba las bcu dgu ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes pa gang zag bdun rnams rab tu dbye ba las bcu dgu ste /
translated: These seven are divided into nineteen.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa nyi shu ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa nyi shu ni /
translated: Together with pratyekabuddhas, there are twenty.

original: slob pa tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun te /
analyzed: slob pa tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun te /
translated: The assembly of noble irreversible bodhisattvas is the assembly of learners.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las lha dang bcas shing bdud dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis dang / dman pa'i byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyis dang mi dge ba rnams kyis kyang dbyer med cing mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las lha dang bcas shing bdud dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis dang / dman pa'i byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyis dang mi dge ba rnams kyis kyang dbyer med cing mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: They are not divided or disturbed by the world with its gods, humans and asuras, by the dharmas that accomplish lesser enlightenment or by nonvirtue.

original: la lar ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems ni mi slob rnam par grol ba sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar chad med pa'i lam yin pa nyid kyi phyir mi slob par gsungs so //
analyzed: la lar ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems ni mi slob rnam par grol ba sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar chad med pa'i lam yin pa nyid kyi phyir mi slob par gsungs so //
translated: In some places, the diamond-like thought is said to be the path without obstacles of the stage of Buddha, the thought of liberation of the adept.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams ni slob pa yin yang slob pa nyams pa yang yin zhes pas slob par yang brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams ni slob pa yin yang slob pa nyams pa yang yin zhes pas slob par yang brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though ordinary worldlings are adepts, they are not said to be adepts, because they are fallen adepts.

original: 'o na ci 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar byung ba'i sems rnam par grol zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar byung ba'i sems rnam par grol zhe na /
translated: Is the thought liberated of the past, of the present, or of the future?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems skye bzhin pa mi slob pa sgrib pa rnams las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems skye bzhin pa mi slob pa sgrib pa rnams las rnam par grol lo //
translated: The future thought, in the process of arising, is liberated from the obscurations of the adept.

original: skyes pa sgrib pa spong ba'i lam ni gnas skabs ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: skyes pa sgrib pa spong ba'i lam ni gnas skabs ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the state of the path of abandoning the obscurations of the thought that has arisen?

original: 'gag bzhin pa nyid kyis na da ltar ba'o //🔽'o na @214a * //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa nyid kyis na da ltar ba'o // 'o na @214a * //
translated: It is the present, because it is in the process of perishing.

original: brgyad las phyir mi ldog par gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: brgyad las phyir mi ldog par gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not said in the Astasahasrikā that there is no regression for the irreversible bodhisattva?

original: ci nam / ci ltar thams cad yin zhe na de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: ci nam / ci ltar thams cad yin zhe na de ltar ma yin te /
translated: What does that mean?

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rnon po ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pas so so skye bo'i gnas skabs na mos pa spyod pa'i sa las snod du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges pa las dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa las tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byed pa la rtag tu brtson zhing 'dun pa dang phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rnon po ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pas so so skye bo'i gnas skabs na mos pa spyod pa'i sa las snod du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges pa las dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa las tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byed pa la rtag tu brtson zhing 'dun pa dang phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Because the bodhisattva of sharp faculties, by cultivating serenity and insight, is known as a vessel even in the stage of an ordinary being, in the stage of action in faith, in the perfection of wisdom, in the great compassion, in the perfection of the two stores, in the constant striving, in the aspiration, and in the irreversibility.

original: dbang po 'bring ni rab tu dga' bar phyir mi ldog ste /
analyzed: dbang po 'bring ni rab tu dga' bar phyir mi ldog ste /
translated: The one of medium faculties is irreversible in the Joyous.

original: de ni sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pas /
analyzed: de ni sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pas /
translated: He, having previously cultivated serenity and insight,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor yang dag par skyes kyang ji srid du sa rab tu dga' ba ma thob kyi bar nges pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor yang dag par skyes kyang ji srid du sa rab tu dga' ba ma thob kyi bar nges pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: although he has correctly generated the yoga of the nondual perfection of wisdom, is not endowed with certainty as long as he has not attained the Joyous ground.

original: de'i phyir 'di nges pa pa'i rgyu mtshan snying rje chen po med pas tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba la shin tu mngon par brtson par 'dun pa ma yin na //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nges pa pa'i rgyu mtshan snying rje chen po med pas tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba la shin tu mngon par brtson par 'dun pa ma yin na //
translated: Therefore, he is not intent on striving to complete the two collections, because he lacks the reason for that, great compassion.

original: dbang po rtul po ni sa mi g-yo ba la phyir mi ldog ste /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po ni sa mi g-yo ba la phyir mi ldog ste /
translated: The dull-facultied one is not irreversible on the Immovable ground.

original: de ni sngon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges pa dang ldan pa med pa des na /
analyzed: de ni sngon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges pa dang ldan pa med pa des na /
translated: Because he previously lacked the possession of the certainty of the perfection of wisdom,

original: de'i rgyu mtshan snying rje chen po med pas /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan snying rje chen po med pas /
translated: he lacks the reason for that, great compassion.

original: tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba la mngon par brtson par 'dod pa shin tu dman pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba la mngon par brtson par 'dod pa shin tu dman pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, his desire to strive to complete the two collections is very weak.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo rnams su sa brgyad pa la thams cad nges pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo rnams su sa brgyad pa la thams cad nges pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: For that very reason, in the sutras, on the eighth ground, irreversibility is presented as certainty in everything.

original: ring du song ba la thams cad phyir mi ldog pa nyid do zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: ring du song ba la thams cad phyir mi ldog pa nyid do zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say: On the Gone Afar ground, everything is irreversible.

original: 'o na gal te so so'i skye bo nyid la yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis yang dag pa'i ye shes skye na ci ltar ma nges pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na gal te so so'i skye bo nyid la yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis yang dag pa'i ye shes skye na ci ltar ma nges pa yin /
translated: Well, if right wisdom arises from serenity and insight even in ordinary beings, how can it be uncertain?

original: ci ltar yang bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon du byas na yang nges pa med pa tsam las phyir ldog par dogs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar yang bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon du byas na yang nges pa med pa tsam las phyir ldog par dogs she na /
translated: How can it be that even when the unsurpassed reality is realized, one turns back from it, merely because it is uncertain?

original: de kho na nyid mngon du ma byas pa ni 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mngon du ma byas pa ni 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: There is no one who does not realize reality.

original: de las bzlog pa'i nges pa tsam las 'khor ba bar ma brjod do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i nges pa tsam las 'khor ba bar ma brjod do //
translated: The intermediate state of cyclic existence is said to be merely the opposite of that certainty.

original: de'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis yang dag pa'i ye shes bskyed pa na de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis yang dag pa'i ye shes bskyed pa na de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: Therefore, when right wisdom is generated by serenity and insight, it is a conventional term that accords with that.

original: gal te thams cad thams cad kyi tshe kho nar de kho na nyid mngon du byed na yang dag pa'i ye shes bskyed pa 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad thams cad kyi tshe kho nar de kho na nyid mngon du byed na yang dag pa'i ye shes bskyed pa 'di ci zhe na /
translated: If one realizes reality at all times, what is the generation of right wisdom?

original: 'di ni gang de dang rjes su bkyed pa'i 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni gang de dang rjes su bkyed pa'i 'di ci zhe na /
translated: This is what accords with that.

original: 'di ni gang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni gang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i pa'o zhe na /
translated: This is the diamond-like thought, which is the thought that is in accord with that.

original: de lta ma yin te brtan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te brtan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because it is not stable.

original: gang gi @214b phyir nges pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems so //
analyzed: gang gi @214b phyir nges pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems so //
translated: For the diamond-like thought is the thought of certainty.

original: de'i tshe ci ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa skye zhe na /
translated: At that time, how can the factors conducive to insight, etc., arise?

original: de srid tsam pa kho na nyid la mos pa las so zhes de kho na nyid rig pa'o //
analyzed: de srid tsam pa kho na nyid la mos pa las so zhes de kho na nyid rig pa'o //
translated: They arise from the mere conviction in reality, as it is.

original: gang yang ci ltar phyir ldog par dogs so zhes brjod pa de ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems med pa kho na las so zhes smra'o /🔽'di nyid la dgongs nas 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par /
analyzed: gang yang ci ltar phyir ldog par dogs so zhes brjod pa de ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems med pa kho na las so zhes smra'o / 'di nyid la dgongs nas 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par /
translated: And as for the fear of backsliding, that is said to come only from the absence of the diamond-like thought.

original: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs dang rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa'i gnas skabs na yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang ldan par rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs dang rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa'i gnas skabs na yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang ldan par rgyas par bstan to //
translated: With this in mind, the noble Perfection of Wisdom teaches at length that even in the stage of ordinary beings and in the stage of the Joyous, etc., the bodhisattvas have the signs of irreversibility.

original: 'phags pa byams pas kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas kyang /
translated: And the noble Maitreya says:

original: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung nas //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung nas //
translated: From the branches of penetration

original: mthong dang goms pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang goms pa'i lam dag la //
translated: on the paths of seeing and cultivation,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang rnams gnas //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang rnams gnas //
translated: the bodhisattvas abide.

original: de 'di phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽phyir ldog pa'i ched du 'byung ba ni phyir ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs // zhes gsungs so // phyir ldog pa'i ched du 'byung ba ni phyir ldog pa'o //
translated: They are the assembly of the irreversible.🔽The meaning of “irreversible” is that they do not turn back.

original: de lta bu ma yin pas na phyir mi ldog pa dang phyir ldog par 'os pa ma yin pa zhes pa don gcig go //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin pas na phyir mi ldog pa dang phyir ldog par 'os pa ma yin pa zhes pa don gcig go //
translated: They are not suitable to turn back, and so they are said to be irreversible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang sems dpa' chen po rnams su yang brjod de chen po nyid rnam pa dgu yis so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang sems dpa' chen po rnams su yang brjod de chen po nyid rnam pa dgu yis so //
translated: Those bodhisattvas are also called “great beings” because of their nine kinds of greatness.

original: brtson 'grub chen po nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i ched du chen po'i gnas la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtson 'grub chen po nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i ched du chen po'i gnas la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of their great diligence, they are great beings, since they are engaged in the great state of protecting all sentient beings.

original: chen po rnams kyi gnas theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po rnams kyi gnas theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The great state is the Great Vehicle.

original: rgyu chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa chen po'i chos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa chen po'i chos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By its greatness of cause, because it is the cause of the great result of Buddhahood.

original: dmigs pa chen po nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pas byams pa chen po la sogs pa dang mnyam pa ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa chen po nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pas byams pa chen po la sogs pa dang mnyam pa ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By its greatness of object, because it is endowed with great love, etc., by attaining the sameness of self and others with regard to all beings.

original: dus chen po nyid kyis ni dus thams cad la skad cig gcig bzhin du 'jug pas na bskal pa dang bskal pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dus chen po nyid kyis ni dus thams cad la skad cig gcig bzhin du 'jug pas na bskal pa dang bskal pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: By its greatness of time, because it is the cause of the attainment of the great result of Buddhahood in a short time, in one lifetime, etc.

original: /'dod pa med pa chen po nyid kyis ni yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad spangs pa nyid kyis bdud thams cad nges par 'joms pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: /'dod pa med pa chen po nyid kyis ni yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad spangs pa nyid kyis bdud thams cad nges par 'joms pa'i phyir te /
translated: By its greatness of non-desire, because it is the cause of the destruction of all demons by the abandonment of all grasping.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad la don du mi gnyer par 'gyur pa de'i tshe so sor don du gnyer @215a * //🔽pa'i bdud bcom par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad la don du mi gnyer par 'gyur pa de'i tshe so sor don du gnyer @215a * // pa'i bdud bcom par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: O Sāgaramati, when bodhisattvas no longer pursue any possessions, then they have conquered the demon of pursuing individual goals.

original: yid la byed pa chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa ring du gyur pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa ring du gyur pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the greatness of their attention, they eliminate the attention of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: nye bar ston pa chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi bcud kyi dga' ba dang bde bar nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar ston pa chen po nyid kyis ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi bcud kyi dga' ba dang bde bar nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the greatness of their teaching, they teach the joy and happiness of the essence of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle.

original: yongs su dag pa chen po nyid kyis ni las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa chen po nyid kyis ni las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pas /
translated: By the greatness of their purity, they have the three kinds of purity of action.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir te /
translated: They have completely transcended all fears,

original: ngan 'gro la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'i rgyu tshul khrims 'chal ba nyid la sogs pa'i med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gro la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'i rgyu tshul khrims 'chal ba nyid la sogs pa'i med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have no immorality and so on, which are the causes of fear of miserable realms and so on.

original: 'jigs pa rnams ni lnga pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa rnams ni lnga pa ste /
translated: The five fears are:

original: 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / grags pa ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang / ngan song gi 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyis bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / grags pa ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang / ngan song gi 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyis bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa'o //
translated: fear of not gaining a livelihood, fear of disrepute, fear of death, fear of bad rebirths, and fear of the boldness of the assembly.

original: rtogs pa chen po nyid kyis ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du lung bstan pa'i sa brgyad pa thob pa las bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa chen po nyid kyis ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du lung bstan pa'i sa brgyad pa thob pa las bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa ste /
translated: By the greatness of realization, he attains the eighth stage, the stage of the prediction of omniscience, and becomes one of the certain.

original: de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bgrod par byas pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bgrod par byas pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has attained the path to be traversed by other bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyis yang /
analyzed: de rnams kyis yang /
translated: By these,

original: gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhing padma rgyas pa bzhin //
analyzed: gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhing padma rgyas pa bzhin //
translated: like gold that is beaten, like a blossoming lotus,

original: bkres pas nyan pa g-yos legs kha zas bzang za 'dra //
analyzed: bkres pas nyan pa g-yos legs kha zas bzang za 'dra //
translated: like a hungry man who hears of delicious food,

original: phrin yig legs par rig 'dra rin chen sgro ma phye ltar //
analyzed: phrin yig legs par rig 'dra rin chen sgro ma phye ltar //
translated: like one who reads good news in a letter, like one who opens a casket of jewels,

original: chos de 'dir bshad pas kyang dga' ba'i mchog bskyed do //
analyzed: chos de 'dir bshad pas kyang dga' ba'i mchog bskyed do //
translated: the supreme joy is generated by this explanation of the Dharma.

original: de rtogs pa'i don byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ; yongs su grub pa zhes pa rnam pa lnga /
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i don byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ; yongs su grub pa zhes pa rnam pa lnga /
translated: The Dharma that is the nature of the factors of enlightenment and so on, which is the object of that realization, is to be accomplished, specifically known, contemplated, inconceivable and fully accomplished.

original: dpe lnga rnams kyis mdo sde rgyan du rgyas par bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe lnga rnams kyis mdo sde rgyan du rgyas par bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: These five aspects should be understood to be extensively taught in the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras by means of the five examples.🔽With regard to that, the Mahayana that is the perfect lineage is the cause of the arising of the knowledge that arises from hearing and so on.

original: de la rigs phun sum tshogs pa'i theg pa chen po thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i rim gyis phyin ci log thams cad bsal te /
analyzed: de la rigs phun sum tshogs pa'i theg pa chen po thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i rim gyis phyin ci log thams cad bsal te /
translated: Through the stages of eliminating all errors,

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la brten nas /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la brten nas /
translated: one takes refuge in the Three Jewels

original: sgrib pa spangs pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan 'phags pa'i nor la longs spyod pa'i rgyu nyid du rtogs nas bdun pa la sogs pa'i sems sgrub pas /
analyzed: sgrib pa spangs pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan 'phags pa'i nor la longs spyod pa'i rgyu nyid du rtogs nas bdun pa la sogs pa'i sems sgrub pas /
translated: and realizes that the special qualities of the aryas, such as the superknowledges that eliminate obscurations, are the cause of enjoying the wealth of the aryas.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i bar la sgrub pa'i sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo'i chos ni @215b gser bzhin du dga' ba mchog skyed par byed pa'o //🔽rab tu dga' ba lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas dben pa'i khyad par du skyes pa mngon sum du byas shing bye brag tu shes par byas pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo'i chos ni padma rgyas
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i bar la sgrub pa'i sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo'i chos ni @215b gser bzhin du dga' ba mchog skyed par byed pa'o // rab tu dga' ba lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas dben pa'i khyad par du skyes pa mngon sum du byas shing bye brag tu shes par byas pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo'i chos ni padma rgyas
translated: The Dharma of the essence of the generation of the will to be a Bodhisattva up to the stage of action through faith is like gold, which produces the highest joy.

original: pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa bzhin no //
translated: The Dharma of the essence of reality, which is the direct realization and special knowledge of the stage of pure superior intention, which is isolated from the addictions to be abandoned by the path of vision, is like a full-blown lotus.

original: de kho na dri ma med pa la sogs pa 'bad rtsol dang bcas shing mtshan ma med par gnas pa'i sa drug rnams su bsam par bya ba tshogs gnyis kyis mthu dang ldan pa ni g-yos legs kha zas bzang po bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na dri ma med pa la sogs pa 'bad rtsol dang bcas shing mtshan ma med par gnas pa'i sa drug rnams su bsam par bya ba tshogs gnyis kyis mthu dang ldan pa ni g-yos legs kha zas bzang po bzhin no //
translated: The Dharma of the essence of the reality of the six stages, which are the stages of striving with the stainless reality, etc., and which are the stages of the signless, is like a well-cooked dish, which is the most powerful of all the dishes.

original: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med par gnas pa'i sa gsum rnams la sngon gyi 'du byed yongs su smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa phrin yig legs po rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med par gnas pa'i sa gsum rnams la sngon gyi 'du byed yongs su smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa phrin yig legs po rig pa bzhin no //
translated: On the three grounds of the Immovable and so on, which are spontaneously present and free of signs, the previous formative actions are inconceivable and fully ripened, like a well-written letter.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la yang yongs su grub pa byang chub kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la yang yongs su grub pa byang chub kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: And on the ground of buddhahood, the fully present reality is by nature enlightenment,

original: sgrib pa kun gyis dri med pa'i //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun gyis dri med pa'i //
translated: uncontaminated by any obscurations.
